author: Nick Russell
title: Wiitastic
content: The Wii is a wonderful system that has gotten my wife (Who is deeply obverse to Video games) to sit down with me and have some fun.  The system is not for hardcore gamers, who can spout poly-count statistics in their sleep. The Graphics are nowhere near the capabilities of the Xbox 360 (Which I own, and enjoy immensely) that being said graphics are far from everything. The game play and ability to pull non gamers into the mix makes the Wii well worth the purchase price. If you are a Gamer I would recommend the Wii as a secondary system that you pull out when friends or family want to enjoy some time together.

author: Daniel
title: Nice System
content:
This was purchased as a gift for my little sister and she enjoys it.

I've played on it a few times and while I'm not sure if I'll get used to the controller system ever, it does have a nice look and navigation set up in general. Also, some of the games are really great.

Personally, I'm just more of an Xbox person.

author: Gale Clark
title: Wii
content: Prompt delivery. Arrived in wonderful condition.  Have had a total blast with the whole family joining in on the games that are included with the purchase!

author: Ordinary Joe
title: Awesome (speechless)
content:
Before I start the review, I do own an HDTV and I do have the component cables on order for Nintendo.

Graphics-They are much better than a lot of people give them credit before. They are not just right above the Gamecube or PS2, but just under that of the 360 and PS3. This is with the Standard Def cables on an HDTV.

Gameplay-The controller at first glance when I read about the system threw me as something that could be difficult and frustrating. After hooking it up and using them, I wonder how I ever managed without them. Easy to use and get a handle on, nothing complicated. You become a part of the game, finally. This controller makes the Wii a true NEXTGEN console.

Net connection-TBD (As Nintendo is currently working on these features, the 'Live' connection has a lot of potential to be just as good as XBOX Live and compete with the PS3 connection.) We'll see what Nintendo does with this feature over the up and coming year.

Price-No it doesn't have blueray, 1080p, or a compatiable HD drive, but it does have great gameplay, graphics that can compete with the 360/PS3 if need be, all for a fraction of the 360 and PS3. A true must buy, Nintendo has offically won me back after all these years away.

author: jaqnel
title: Very happy!
content: The wii came with all cords, sensor bar and 1 remote, as advertized. I have only been using the wii for one week and it works well. I am very pleased with my purchase, the prompt secure packaging and the quick delivery. Thank you!

author: Judy Bodmer
title: Arrived in good condition and with all the parts as advertised
content: Arrived in good condition and with all the parts as advertised. It took as a little while to get the controller to connect, but once we took care of that, device worked as advertised.

author: Kita E. Champion
title: I love it
content: Look I'm an ex- everquest player, and I hadn't touched a regular video game since the 1st Sega Genenis came out and the arcades went out.  I ordered the Wii for a family present and the people playing it today range in age from 4 to 57  (4, 18, 19, 28, 35, and 57 actually played and loved it) and we all love it so far.  I got several of the games but the wii sports alone that came with it is just really fun.  I have no time to look up game codes and cheats and learn 102 game control combinations to win something but I can have fun with the wii simply because I can use a remote control.  It's just tight :-)

author: D. Penland
title: Wiiness
content:
Let me start off by saying that trying to get one of this things wasn't very easy. i looked for about 3 weeks for onr and I looked everywhere. I didn't realize how high this things were in demand.

Anyways I was amazed at how small and compact the system was. Its very sleek and pure white giving it the modern look. The only problem I had at first was the sensor bar. But that was because my living room is kind of small and I needed to stand further back. Moved a little and it was fine.

 Now it comes with wiisports which is one of the funest games for the wii. Which is cool and sad at the same time. There arn't many great games for the wii. The ones that are fun are cartoony and childish. And there isn't any news of any good titles coming out soon. But the saving grace would have to be super smash bros. Its very fun and you can have 3 of yours friends playing with you. Oh, and you can play with the gamecube controlers if you please.

So I would recommend the wii to families, children, or as a sweet little party machine. But for the adults or more serious gamers i would go for the 360 as it has the best selection of games out of all the systems( just make sure to get extended warrenty as I'm on xbox #4 and havn't even owned as a xbox for barely a year).

author: Amazon Customer
title: Wii love our Wii
content: We love our Wii! With all the family friendly games, easy controls and versatility, its a must have.  The only reason I don't have five stars is because this is our THIRD console in 8 years. The hard drives are not very sturdy. However, for the price of a gently used or refurbished unit, it's well worth paying for to have a family gaming system.

author: Bonnie
title: Wii is GREAT!
content:
I purchased this a week ago.  I have owned many game systems and I love this one.  It is fun for everyone.  I like that fact that you can play the older games also.  Even my 3 year old grandson can play this. (he bowled a strike).  I do not think we will grow tired of this system.  I am anxious for more items available on the menu and shopping.

One word of advice, if you can purchase this, get an extra remote while they're in the stores.

author: Adam R. Stevens
title: Fun for Adults and Children
content:
Having a 3 and 6 year old I was looking for a gaming system that would have games they could play as well as ones that I would enjoy.

Although the major consoles all have games for children as well as adults, the Wii allowed a more physically active engagement. For this reason, and specifically the Wii Fit product, I decided to go with the Wii.

While I am very pleased with the Nintendo Wii and the games I have gotten so far, I have been a little disappointed with the graphics. I am not one that usually cares too much what the graphics look like as long as the game play is good, but I was expecting the games on the Wii to at least look considerably better than games on the GameCube. So far I have not found this to be the case. In most of the games I have played, the graphics were pretty similar to the GameCube or only slightly better.

Overall the Wii is a very fun system and great to have for a family, but don't expect the games to look that great, even compared to the prior GameCube system.

author: A. Murad
title: WII!WII!WII
content: This console is targeted for family gamers and casual gamers. I rated this 5 stars because of the new games coming out super smash brawl, mario galaxy, and dance remix. We is the most affordable and best choice of the lot!

author: Richard Nguyen
title: Four Stars
content: Item is used, and works perfectly. Wear on the top panel, but at least it works. It doesn't come with any games, but functioning 100% perfectly.

author: Leebuddy
title: More hard ware Wii.
content: The hardware was very nice.

author: Juan Pablo
title: Like it
content: My cousin is happy with the console. He likes it and plays all day until your arms get tired OK

author: Adam Larson
title: My wife actually plays games now
content:
The Wii has definitely redefined the gaming market.  The only major problem is the lack of games, which is slowly starting to change.  As a game developer myself, I am excited about the possibilities with this system.  The best thing is my 4 year old and my wife will both play the Wii with me.  Wii Sports is an awesome game to be packaged with the Wii.  So far I've played Zelda, Wii Sports, Wii Play, Excite Truck, and Resident Evil 4.

Don't wait as soon as these are available pick one up.  I bought one for my father-in-law and they love it as well.

author: kc
title: Even this "non-gamer" loves it!
content: My family and I are not big "gamers", but this one has all ALL hooked!  My kids played Wii at a friend's house, then saved up their money to buy their own.  I was a skeptical mom at first, but within minutes I was up, grabbing the wiimote out of their hands and insisting it was my turn!  I won't go into all the "hows" of the game, but will just say that this is a great interactive, "get-your-butt-off-the-sofa"  game!! In fact, I'm now saving MY money to buy some games! :o)

author: J. Kowalewski
title: Wii - one of Nintendo's best
content:
The Wii is 250 fifty dollars, comes with a brand new controller dubbed the 'Wiimote', doesn't support HD-DVD/Blu-ray, HD, and has graphics of a lesser quality then it's competiters.

In my opinion though, the only thing that matters is the cheap price and the Wiimote.

We got this system on launch day along with Excite Truck and an extra controller.

All I can say is that it is simply amazing. The controller in Wii Sports is very pricese...it really feels like you're playing tennis/bowling/baseball!

It is very easy to use...within minutes I got both of my parents to play...now they're addicted! They're always challenging me or each other to a match on Wii Sports Tennis!

Excite Truck is quite a fine game too. You use the controller to steer like a while and it is a great experience.

The Wii Channels are superb. The Mii channel lets you create little 'avatars' of yourself to use in Wii Sports, the Photo Channel lets you interact with photos: we even put together a touching slideshow from one of our vacations!

The Wii Shop Channel is quite well, as you can download games from past Nintendo systems. I downloaded two and they both work perfectly.

There are also the Weather and News channels, which are coming in January. I hear they will be quite good.

But to top it off, Wii is truly an amazing system and my whole family loves it. It doesn't matter that it doesn't have the best graphics, the controller is great and just plain fun.

If you see one in a store, be sure to buy it, along with another controller!

Afterall, the Wii IS the best console Nintendo has ever made.

author: Gil
title: Great Console
content:
I haven't bought a game console since Pong, so this purchase was a bit out of character for me. But I wanted to find something that would motivate me to be more active. The concept behind Wii was just what I needed.

I order the Wii and Wii Fit Plus with a Balance Board a few days ago, and both came within a matter of days. I will review Wii Fit Plus in another review, but I wanted to review the Wii and say how please I am with the game console. The Wii comes with some simple games that I would say do more to demo the console than to be serious games, but they are still fun (at least those that I played.

The hook up is simple: attach the power cord, audio video cable and the infrared "sensor." The remote is already synced with the console. (New remotes require an extra sync process, but it's not difficult.)

The only disappointment is that the games are not very costomizable. Tennis can be played with one to four real players, but playing with one real player still results in a doubles game with three automated players. It looks like the real player in this case always gets the ball to return, so it's a little like playing a singles game, but the automated partner still swings occasionally (and misses) and that is a little distracting.

It was still fun, however, and a good cardio workout.

The Wii will let you cheat, and some have given the console low marks for that account. For example instead of swinging with your arm while playing tennis, you can make gentle wrist snaps, and the Wii won't be the wiser. But this is just a game after all, and it requires a little imagination. Forget about the cheats, and play it right, and you will be a lot more active than you were when watching your favorite soap.

author: Jamie Gilman
title: I love Wii!
content:
I'll be perfectly honest, I am not a gamer and I am not a techie.  I don't care about the complexity of the graphics, the machine specs or what games are available.  I am simply enjoy playing the Wii because it is fun!!  We have six games and the Wii Fit, but we use the system frequently and enjoy every minute of it.  (We just aren't the type of people to spend money on dozens of video games.)

We were very disappointed that when we opened it Christmas morning, the drive did not work and we could not use it.  Naturally, because it was Christmas, it took SEVERAL days to get through to Nintendo Customer Service.  The gentlemen I spoke to was very nice and expedited shipping for us.  Once I sent the machine off, we had it back in 8 days.

I strongly recommend that if you are giving this item to your kids as a holiday gift, make sure it works first because you do not want to see the same sad faces I did on Christmas morning.

author: SMS
title: Delayed Gratification
content: As I read the posts on this product, I am struck by our generations inability to delay gratification.  We've lived without this product our whole lives: Amazon says they will be shipping throughout the holiday season: I think we need to be patient. That said, I am really mad for the kid that waited in line, only to have all the adults take the tickets.

author: C. Shaffer
title: Wii Purchase
content: I have been a faithful amazon purchaser now for a couple of years.  Recently I purchased the Nintendo Wii in September 09. I am 100% happy with it.  Not only did I get the Wii at a great reduced price.  But amazon also offered me a $25.00 gift card with the purchase.  Which even after paying the shipping my price was still lower than what I would have paid at a department store. Thank you again Amazon for selling quality products at great prices.

author: Music Fan
title: Wii fit exercise program
content: You really need a balance board to fully enjoy this game.  It offers a full exercise plan. Keeps track of your exercises, and calorie loss. I like it.

author: Hiawhatha
title: Fun for my whole family
content:
Why not add one more review to the mix, no?

I have a husband and a 5 yr old girl. They play together a lot. The Wii has just given them more things to do and I love it. They play mini golf, tennis, bowling and various other playground games. I like to play Littlest Pet Shop with her.

After she goes to bed, my husband and I play Wii Fit by challenging each other to beat scores. We also battle at tennis and mini golf. I kick his butt in fishing.

I would recommend this to families that just want the 2000's version of board game night. Probably not for the individual player or professional gamer.

author: Maddi
title: One Star
content: Didn't work

author: D. Friend
title: Simply Incredible
content:
The Wii system is simply (matter of opinion) the best next generation console to hit the market. It easily overpasses the xbox360 console, and also the Playstation 3 console. Nintendo Wii has pleanty of features including:

~ Plays both Wii and Gamecube Discs

~ Create your own character in the mii channel with pleanty of costomisable options

~ Store Pictures and Play with them in the photo channel, including jigsaw puzzles, doodling, and bright/dark toggles etc.

~ Explore the wide world of the internet right on your TV! Easy to browse and explore in the Internet channel.

~ Veiw your current weather forcast in your specific area in the forcast channel (supported by weathernerws)

~ Get the news from all around the globe in the News channel, where you can  search through a quantity of news reports from all across america and from other countries also!

~ Buy old school Nintendo games from the wii shop channel. The games included are a multitude of games from: Nintendo Entertainment System (NES), Super Nintendo Entertainment System (SNES), Sega Genesis (GEN), Turbografix16 (tgfx), and Nintendo 64 (N64). Also from the Wii shop channel, you can buy new channels for new updated fun!

~ Vote in a poll taken across America on the Everybody Votes Channel! Vote for two answer questions and predict which one america will vote for! Also, there are some questions taken all over the world!

~ WiiConnect24 connects you to the internet, ready for updates even while the system is off! WiiConnect24 is always running (unless turned option turned off) so that you can get the latest updates anytime during the day!

~Great games for wii include: The Legend of Zelda-Twilight Princess, Warioware-Smooth Moves, Mario Party 8, Wii Play, Prince of Persia-Rival Swords, and much much more!

~ The Wii takes an incredible step foreward in gaming by introducing motion control technology, enabling you to swing your wii remote, move it foreward and back, rotate, move horivotally and vertically, and even more! The revolutionary controller includes rumble feature, and has a speaker built into the remote itself for indepth gameplay!

The Nintendo Wii is a marvel of gaming, and a definite buy from anywhere you see it.

author: shannon
title: Great seller!
content: Exactly as described. Great seller!

author: Danita Dover
title: GREAT FUN
content:
Excellent shipping, great for entire family, children love it,
couldnt have picked a better Xmas gift.  Love it!!!!

author: Chris
title: Wii
content: The package arrived and we were excited. The only issue I had with it is the joysticks weren’t being recognized by the Wii game system and the accessory door that hides where you can have multiple players was broken off. We bought a few other controllers and it has been working fine. It came at a good price and I expected it not to be in superb quality. Overall, I am pleased with the purchase.

author: J. Crabb
title: Wii Review
content: The Wii console was delivered on time. It worked well and is excellent fun. It was hard to hook up to our existing TV system and there were no specific instructions for the TV brand by Wii, or for from the manufacturer for a Wii hookup. I achieved a successful hook up based on Wii instructions however. The system worked as advertised and is excellent fun.

author: Cyndy Call Uncapher
title: nintendo wii
content: This is the third Wii our family has purchased. We have one at the lake, one for the house and I purchased one for the kids den. It is always fun and something the adults and kids can do together.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Very pleased with my purchase
content: Had no issue. Very pleased with my purchase. Will purchase from them again.

author: jayla bug
title: YIPPIE!!!!!
content: Had absolutely no problems with this buy. My kids are so siked about their new gameroom toy. THANKS SOOOOOO MUCH...AWESOME!!!!!

author: JerBear
title: The Wii
content: We received our Wii bundle from [...] yesterday and can't get enough. We love it! I'm 51 and love it and I am not one for "video" games. My teenage girls think it's great. We are waiting for the delivery of the Wii fit. It worked right out of the box and between my 17yo and I we had it up and running in no time. Well worth what I paid for it(which was a great price for I received).

author: Suzanne Bouchard
title: Black & White? Why
content: Black and white! Game are not coming in color! Disappointed

author: Amy
title: Missing pieces
content:
The product works great and I have had no problems with it.
However, I did not receive all the wires that should have come with it.  It was missing the tri-colored cord that connects it to my TV?  I haven't been able to find one yet??

author: tattoocarl69
title: Great Deal!
content: I bought this as a gift for my adult daughter and her kids. They love it. I am very happy with it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: good and bad..greatest games like ps2 quality and yet radiation worries me a bit
content: i love the games..and yet..too bad i heard there is radiaition on these i heard after buying it..and i bought wired controller if this helps but many games still use only the radiation controller..so i would say not best console ever because of this..but is kind of sometimes some of best graphics..although playstation 2 is great also for if want alternative to this because it doesn't have radiation and has many great grated kids or adult too likable games i think they are both great for having most games . radiation?! too bad they had to make the system have this issue, though. not sure how bad it is but i liked earlier systems better in a way even though some had too hard of games/bad graphics on some and or didn't save like these great albeit radiaition system ones like this have..too bad can't have it all sometimes..silicon i heard helps thats why they cover the wii mote with it i guess so they won't get sued for trying a bit oh well

author: WorknMan
title: Hardcore gamers just don't get it
content:
I used to have an Xbox 360, but sold it and bought a Wii.

I know a lot of hardcore gamers are sitting around scratching their heads, wondering how anyone in their right mind could pass up a masterpiece like Mass Effect or GTA4 and settle for games as simplistic Boom Blox or Wii Sports. Well, some of us get to a point where we either feel like games are getting way too complex, or we decide that playing video games for 4-5 hours a day is just not a healthy lifestyle choice and/or something we no longer have time for. In my case, it was a little bit of both.

The Wii has the kind of games that I can pick up and play for a couple of hours, put it down, then pick it back up a few weeks later and not have to try and remember how the controls work, or having to backtrack because I forgot the storyline. And I don't have to watch 3 hours of cut scenes in between levels either. It is perfect for when I occasionally just want to kill and hour or two on a Saturday afternoon, as most of the games don't require a huge time commitment to get into them. Contrast that with something like GTA4, where you literally have to play for hours just to be introduced to all the game mechanics. Why go through all that when I can just throw in Geometry Wars and start having fun immediately?

When I had my 360, the only retail game I was playing was Guitar Hero... the rest were XBLA titles. That is when I decided that the Wii was probably a better fit for me, and I have not been disappointed Sure, the graphics aren't all that impressive and the online capabilities aren't as good, but I can live with that.

A really big plus with the Wii is that I can get my non-gaming friends to play with me when they come over. They wouldn't go anywhere near the 360 controller, but the Wii is much more accessible in that regard.

I think the biggest thing I appreciate about the Wii though is how QUIET it is! The 360 sounds like a dying calf in a snowstorm when it's turned on; the only time I hear anything from my Wii is when a disc is spinning up. But even then, it's quieter than the 360 was when it was idling.

UPDATE: I have since re-purchased a 360 and sold my Wii, primarily because my TV died and I decided not to replace it, and I could hook the 360 to my PC monitor via the HDMI port. (The Wii has neither an HDMI port or a VGA adapter.) Plus Geometry Wars 2 was calling my name :)

But the other reason for this is because 95% of the 3rd party offerings for the Wii are crap, and Nintendo doesn't seem interested in catering to casual gamers over the age of 12. I'm not the kind of person who requires blood and gore to make me happy (in fact, I don't really like that sort of thing), but I got tired of playing games with furry characters and pastel colors. I'm not saying those are bad, but it just gets old after awhile.

author: Stephen L. Noe
title: It's fun and entertaining, as it should be.
content: You can not go wrong with the Wii.  It's fun, it's entertaining and it promotes family time.  There are games to suit anyone's gaming style.  Nintendo has knocked the ball out of the park with this gaming system.

author: A. Allsman
title: Great for the family
content: We just got this and we LOVE it. We have three young boys and are having so much fun playing as a family. I love that we can get up off the couch and be active with it. We are very happy!

author: G. Sims
title: A Great Experience! Wii Parties Rock!
content:
I'd never heard of a Wii Party before, but since we bought a Wii 4 months ago, We've hosted several. I initially got hooked on the Wii when I played Guitar Hero III for the first time last Christmas at a family get together. I spent the next few months trying to find one. After I did, I came to realize how much fun it really was. My kids (ages 3 and 6) have just as much fun as us big kids playing it. Even my 70 year old mom got in on the act - she and I play 9 holes of golf on it every once in awhile.

My last video game system was an early 90's Sega Genesis. I grew up playing video games, but haven't owned a system of my own since the 3D0 (anyone remember this one?). At any rate, VERY hard core gamers may not like the Wii, but it is perfect for those of us who like video games but cannot devote hours on end to playing them.

My 2 cents

author: SunLal
title: Amazing! Fabulous fun for whole family
content: I am not much of a gamer & only play video games occasionally so never having owned any game console before, I went for the Wii because of it's physical activity based games.  I have only had it for about 10 days & I have to say I absolutely love it! It is so much fun to play especially with multiple players.  Before the Wii, whenever we had guests we'd sort of sit around watch TV but with the Wii, everyone gets engaged in playing it.  I especially enjoy the boxing & bowling among others - Tennis, Golf & baseball are quite a lot of fun as well.  I just bought the Wii fit for my wife & I am sure I'll end up using it as well - not a replacement for going to the gym but atleast you can work out at home & being that it is so interactive it's much more fun than using a piece of some dumb equipment.  So why 4 stars & not 5? Because, as in everything in life, there's always room for improvement & I feel that Wii has just scratched the surface of it's full potential.  To me, the Wii is the iPod of video games.

author: Lola
title: Five Stars
content: gift

author: drayona
title: Missing parts
content: I didn't receive a composite hdmi cord so I can't plug it into the tv.

author: H N
title: Good but not great
content:
I am writing this review from the prospective of having this system since the day it came out and being an avid gamer for over 20 years(I had the original NES..loved it).

The Wii is very well designed, and compact.  It's got some great features.  The remote is definitey innovative and games like bowling and tennis on Wii Sports is really fun, especially if you're with a group of friends.  Other features like the internet browser, weather channel, and ability to buy older games is cool too.

The biggest problem is that there aren't many games and the ones that are out aren't too diverse.  Most of the games appear to be aimed at younger gamers or party-style games.  I'm 30 so it's hard for me to get all excited about games like Happy Feet and Cooking Mama.  Also, yes I know innovation is a big part of fun, but why not at least TRY to push the graphic power of the Wii?  Most of the games look about Gamecube quality or Xbox quality.  I'm positive the Wii can push more in the graphic department if the developers tried.  In addition, I am not sure where Nintendo is going with the online gaming aspect.  I think that's going to be a HUGE part of next-gen gaming yet they seem to have no solid infrastructure for that.  I had tons of fun on my PS2 playing games like Socom online w/other people, which also in effect increased replay value.

I'm not writing this to bash the Wii.  I genuinely like what is is and the idea behind it.  I just wish that there were more games and more TYPES of games out.  The gamecube suffered from lack of software, and to be honest I feel the Wii is so far running the same track.  I just bought RE4 yesterday as that is the only game at the local store that looked fun for me.  I'm not sure I like having to wait another half year for the next killer app title for Wii. If you like shooters, RPGs, or action games, the Wii probably isn't the system for you.

author: T.B.L.U.H.P
title: Go nintendo go...
content: This system was worth a late Christmas gift to me from me thanks to a scammer. I like how you can use the internet though the WII and play old school games even SEGA games can be played. IF you are a nintendo fan I advice you to buy it no matter what.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Three Stars
content: No instructions

author: S. Makula
title: Something New
content: This is the only console worth buying if you're a PC gamer. All other consoles are just weak PCs which bring nothing new to the table the PC can't already do *and* do better.  Nintendo Wii is actually a novel idea in the arena that brings it a nice fresh breath of new life.  The only caveat, as with many games, get some friends to play with you.  Playing with a group of people is far more fun than playing alone.

author: Ron Doyle
title: Five Stars
content: Sister in law loved it it was a present

author: R. Hook
title: Excellent, it should have been named 'Revolution'.
content:
I just purchased this today from a local gamestore. I have to say that even though i was exposed to all the intense hype i am very impressed by the Wii. Other people have written huge reviews so i will just keep mine short.

- The size of the unit is pleasantly small. Its about the size of a desktop computer CD/ DVD drive. Its unobtrusive and doesn't fight for space with my DVD player or Satellite TV decoder.

- Its very quiet. Even when the disc drive is in use loading a game. There are no loud fans to cool the system.

- The Wii Remote is great! I don't know why nobody thought of this years ago. When you point at a button on the screen it Rumbles, sometimes it makes a sound. These little bits of feedback and the motion tracking function make control of a complicated computer in the living room possible and easy.

- The networking function is very good. Full WiFi security functions are supported.

- The Opera browser (now available via free download) is absolutely amazing. You can view pretty much any webpage on the Wii that you can view on your PC. Google video and Youtube work perfectly. You dont have to strain your eyes on text either because it includes a 'smart' zoom and scrolling function.

PS: One thing though...i really recommend you have a high speed internet connection along with a WiFi router to use the coolest features on the Wii (The Opera Browser and Wii shop).

PS2: Its fun!

author: GCGordon
title: Four Stars
content: It was a gift for my wife to help in her workouts...no complaints.

author: Nathan M. Rose
title: What can I say?
content: What can I say that already hasn't been. The Wii is simply amazing! This is the next step in gaming and the company that started it all is back full force. The only downfall is that the system can not support next gen graphics (I am sure wii 2.0 will fix this) However the fun factor makes you forget this flaw in a second. Don't walk..run to purchase this now!

author: Nonya
title: Amazing.
content:
My fiance got me the Wii as a birthday present. I love it. I play it every day, at least for an hour or two. I love the tennis on wii sports, I was first hooked on the bowling, now I've moved on to tennis. It's great fun for everyone - I will soon be getting Boogie + Big Brain Academy: Wii Degree.

I love it. Everytime I am stressed from all the college work, I go straight to my wii and it washes my stress away. Seriously, it does. I recommend this to anyone! I love it, fun and entertainment for the whole family guaranteed!

author: Anonymous
title: Five Stars
content: Great system. Perfect for friends and family! 100% recommended

author: Gabriel Reyes
title: Its loads of fun!!!
content: I would recommend the WII to anyone who likes games and interaction.  The WII lets you be in the game! I like that it is small and compact, not to bulky! I hadnt had so much fun with a system in a very long time!

author: David Jacobson
title: Non-Gamer Loves the Wii
content: I have never really been that into video games but since we got a Wii this Christmas, all of that has changed.  It is a blast and you actually move more than your fingers!  The Wii Sports games that are included are especially fun when we have company over.  Everyone seems to love bowling.  I am personally addicted to tennis.  You can play 1 position or all 4, it is mind boggling.  We also just recently got Wii Resort and Wii Fit and they take the games to an even higher participation level.  Our whole family also had fun setting up our avitars (Miis).  Very clever.  I highly recommend this product for older folks like me (48 years old) weither you have kids or not.  Unlike other games, it can be a social tool vs. something that isolates you.  It is easy to set up and to use and you can play old GameCube games as well as the new motion activated ones.  Fun for the whole family and a bargain.  My only warning would be to gamers who like total realism, like my XBox addicted son.  The sports games have pretty simple cartoonish graphics.  They are a different kind of thing, not better, not worse, just very different.

author: this app is very hard but fun
title: One Star
content: No I sent it back  it was not what I expected

author: ATUL SAINI
title: Good Wii
content: I love this product, however it is expensive. The Wii sports CD did not last long time and now does now the system does not read it. I bought a new one and again same problem. Nintendo needs to work on the CD since they are expensive and customer should not be expected to continue to pay for replacement.

author: Odie Colonie
title: fun for all, at home !!
content: recieved Wii quickly, all of us soon got right into it !! sooo much fun for all...

author: David J. Waterhouse Jr.
title: Great
content: I am enjoying the Wii. I am having fun with the family and over all this system is the better system for young kids. Not many violent games for this system, which I think is great. Thank you.

author: Unknown, Captain
title: If you are on the fence with this one...
content: OK, I have two kids ones is an active and outdoor person. The other has to be forced outside. We finally picked this game up at Best Buy after waiting in line for two hours in the cold and rain. It was totally worth it. They are both sweating playing this game, it's an exercise machine too. If you are just thinking about this or are on the fence on whether or not to get it, I have to say you need to take the plunge. My son is finally getting some exercise, and my other son is finally learning to interact with computers. It was win/win for me...

author: Peter Benton
title: Well worth the wait!
content:
Like many people, it took me awhile to finally obtain a Wii.  But let me tell you, it was well worth the wait!  I got mine on the day after Christmas.  Setup was a breeze, and everyrhing worked right out of the box.  It took me a little while to get connected to my wireless network, but that was my fault (I was using the wrong password :O().

For any parents who are planning on purchasing this, let me give you some advice.  Wii Sports which comes with it will provide many hours of enjoyment.  In fact, I bought Rayman's Rabbits for the minigames, since my youngest (6) likes those alot.  In reality, in the four days we have had it, we have been playing only Wii Sports.  While none of the games is really indepth, they are easy to pick up and play.  We have probably had the most fun bowling.  Hats off to Nintendo for such a great included game, and showing the possibilities of the system.

I also purchased Zelda for myself, and already put in 4+ hours.  Having played all the Zelda's on the various systems, this one was a must have.  I am really enjoying it.

One other point - creating the Miis is a blast.  We spent about a half hour as a family creating all our Miis.  And it is cool how they show up in the various Wii Sports games, even if they are not actually the ones playing.

All in all, Nintendo has finally created a game system for the whole family.  No, it doesn't have cutting edge graphics, but it is a lot of fun to play.  Even my wife enjoys bowling, and she is definitely not a "gamer".  And what other system can make you sore the next morning (aka Boxing).

Get one for yourself as soon as you can.  You will not be disappointed!

author: Cheryl
title: Love my WII
content: I use this WII for the exercise part with the walking, running, and other active things in WII fit.  It has helped me improve my balance too.

author: Metro
title: Four Stars
content: it's a wii

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great order
content: Very well packaged shipped fast and works well would buy again

author: Hi-Tech, Inc
title: A Great Tool to Keep fit and Have Fun
content: The Nintendo Wii competes favorably with Microsoft's Xbox 360 and Sony's PlayStation 3. The design is quite straightforward offering ease of operation. The remotes have been designed to reduce slipping out from the hands and damaging the remote or other objects that may be neraby, such as the TV. This protection is increased as the players use the attachable wrist strap. The Wii is popular for its concept of helping to keep the body moving, working and buring the calories, while playing games. This has been a great selling feature. However, as a parent, I noticed that my kids will play the sports games while I am around, but resort to the fingers-only games when I am away. So, it will be unrealistic for consumers to think that the Nintendo Wii will magically solve their exercise problems. They will need the same amount of self-determination that they will need in going to the gym on a regular basis[Nwankama Nwankama]

author: NE Happy
title: Best overall family gaming system available
content: Nintendo has truly scored with the Wii.  It is fun for all the family from junior to Grandma.  And, the wide assortment of games available give it broad appeal.  It makes you get up and move as well as strategize on some of the adventure games.  The Wii sports that comes with the unit is still one of the most played games.  It will be a mainstay in my home for years to come.  As a gamer that goes back to the old Atari Pong days, the Wii is certainly a treasure.  Yes, the graphics aren't at the PS3 level.  But do you really need that for everything.  They are fine for the games available.  When was the last time you had the 5yr to 85yr old playing the same game on a PS3?  It happens on the Wii and all ages in between.

author: Matthew rudolph
title: Did not work. Would not read disks.
content: Did not work. Would not read disks. Went and bought a wii from the store and it read the disks immediately

author: Jerry W
title: Wii for the Disabled
content: Got the Wii console for my wife who is disabled with multilpe sclerosis.  She is able to play Wii Sports from her wheelchair. Good exercise and helps with hand/eye coordination.

author: Dan Goriaynov
title: The best (and first :) ) thing I have bought on amazon
content:
Thanks for making my dream come true.
I do really want to by Wii for last 6 years.
But in Ukraine it's so expensive and there is no way to by any accessories for reasonable prices.

Got some troubles when adjusting Wii to my region and PAL Television format.
But now all works great, picture is color and I'm happy.

Thanks.

author: SM
title: Great Product
content: The Wii is a great activity for family and friends. It's hard not to call it a game, because it feels like so much more. I've already tried talking my parents into getting one as my wife and I are having a great time with it! There were not any surprises with the purchase as I read other reviews and talked to a couple friends who had them before making a purchase. I do wish it came with two remotes and nunchuks though.

author: Donna70
title: Pleased
content: Everyone is our family is enjoying the Wii.  After church on Sunday, everyone from the greatgrandmother to the youngest greatgrandchild entered into the fun.

author: JStone
title: I Was Very Sore the Next Day
content: I think that says it all. The Wii is an amazing system, and it turns basic gameplay into something so much more, and so much fun. Everyone can get into this system... it was fun seeing my dad standing there like he was Derek Jeter or something. And he's a guy that's only played Super Mario Bros a couple times way back when. Way to get Nintendo, you really hit a home run.

author: Brent K. Ethington
title: Wii is tons of family fun!
content:
We bought this Wii as a gift for our children this Christmas.  We thought the kids would love it and they did!  What we weren't prepared for was how much we (the parents) love to play it!  We can't wait for the kids to go to bed so we can get some playtime in.
Amazon was fantastic!  I ordered it, and it was delivered super fast in plenty of time for the holidays.

author: Henry Wolford
title: Best fitness club membership I ever bought
content: What a blast to play and what a surprising workout you can get even with the simplest game.  Instead of sitting around in the evenings watching TV, my wife and I now play different sports, use the different sports skill builder games, and get a reasonable workout in the privacy of our own home.  Money well spent.

author: Andrew Ellsom
title: The ultimate party game
content:
The Wii is a social game, unlike PS3 or Xbox360 playing the Wii on your own is not really much fun.  It really comes into its own when you have a friend or friends over and everyone takes turns on the sports and other games.

I think we paid for the Wii in the number of bowling games we've had out of it alone.

author: Chris Moyer
title: WII,  So?  I found out.
content:
This is an amazing product.  The time passes like seconds.

I bought  this for exercise and did it ever deliver.

The interaction is so well done you feel like you are on the beach or running thru the woods.  It forces you to focus.

There is no "age" on this,  it is for 2 to 99.

Best Purchase!

author: Teng Mi Ping
title: leaves alot to the imagination
content:
there's been alot of discrimination against the wii. and that's ok. who wants to hear some lunatic going on and on about how about their stupid praise. reviews should be bring out some dark side.

i own a 360 and from a design stand point, it is better. one thing i hate is that you need to plop down extra money to control older games. the wii controller works best on the tv if it's on a high surface. i love the way this thing controls. they're creating some funky controls for 360 but none comes even close to matching this thing's comfort level.currently the web browser is out dated. by the time you buy this you'll already be aware of all its positive points if not all of its points. to be honest, i cant bring myself to write a bad review for this. and yes, graphics matter in the gaming buisness. take that pc dorks!

author: Brandon Fryman
title: Five Stars
content: thank you, just as described.

author: Haluk Karamete
title: This is absolutely a remarkable entertainment device!
content:
After I received mine, after a while later, I took the unit to my office, kept it there for a week and let people experience with it.

The result is 2 people ordered their own set and the management decided to get one for the entire office. What an easy sell for such an expensive unit? Yes, xbox or playStation may offer superior graphics or games, but they won't get you moving. It's this "exercise aspect" that would cause you to fell in love with this.

Here is another way to look at it. If the following does not sum it up, I don't know whatelse will.

My 4 and 6 year old daughters enjoy it, I (40) enjoy it and everybody else I know of enjoy it.

Bottom line is go for it. Once you get it & you get good at it, you'll probably would get a [...] account to sample games without buying them. Some games are better than others and it is a personal choice.

Good luck!

author: T. Vue
title: Best gaming console I've bought
content: Bought the Wii last week, and it has been the most fun my family has had together for awhile.  We usually do other things that keep us individually occupied, but we play together when we turn on the Wii.  Wii sports and mario kart wii have been a blast, and I'm thinking of buying more multiplayer games for the family.

author: Tree Decorator
title: Still fun
content: Still having fun bought one in 2006 and a second one just recently to use in the basement workout room.

author: Ali
title: Nintendo Wii : Kickin' A** and Takin' Names
content:
The Nintendo Wii has been bashed again and again by so called gaming purists as a gimick and a joke.  There have been jokes about how you look while you play it, jokes about accidentally throwing the controller, and jokes about everyone who owns one being a bit of a puss.

Next gen purists have sadly lost sight of what gaming was all about in the first place - fun.  The Nintendo Wii is anything but a joke, the controller makes it a sort of side-show attraction for non-gamers and a loveable oddity for avid gamers.  in addition, it is somewhat of a link to the past for those of us who grew up on the original NES.

The graphics aren't that much better than the Gamecube.  So what??  They're games.  What do you want them to look like?  Nintendo and gameplay have always gone hand in hand, no matter what the competition was doing.  There is no doubt of the fact that they left a lot of the polished graphics aspect behind in order to do something more important.

Although the controller is a bit of a reach for a lot of gamers, I found it a welcome change with most games that I played.  It is slightly physical, but who has time to make fun of you when there are games to play?

Nintendo has always been a company full of geniouses, but what they've done this time is beyond compare.  They took their main markets of loyal oldskool fans, children, and general fans of Nintendo platformers (esp. Zelda and Mario), and played to all of them.  They seem to have left out 18-24 year old males, the main demographic of the gaming industry, but it was apparent that they would not win that battle anyway.  In their place, they took up a whole new market, that of the non-gamer.  Games like Wii Sports enable you to hand a wiimote to any of your non-gaming friends and have them playing a game within a few minutes.

The Wii is an incredible system and it has not EVER given me any problems since I got it at launch.  Soon enough there will be a whole new batch of games coming out for it and it will become even better.

This system is highly reccomended for Nintendo purists, fans of oldskool gaming, people who want to get their kid a new system (but want to play the same system themselves), and really just for any gamer.  At least make it your second system.  You won't regret it.

author: Brian Owens
title: the wii is a homerun!
content: Never before have i made a purchase that i was so happy about. For children and adults, the nintendo wii provides unending enjoyment.

author: Amanda Richards
title: Oh, my achin' agin' anteriors!!
content:
Santa dropped this off at our house the other day, and I'm pretty sure he had a smile on his ruddy face when he did it.  "I'll teach those bleedin' couch potatoes", he said with a laugh.  "Ho Ho Ho", and off the old jelly belly flew, with his sleigh full of Wii related accoutrements for sedentary families around the world.

Having the good fortune to have a semi-geek in the house, the Wii thing was soon set up in the kid's bedroom, and after 5 hours I thought I should check on the adult kid and the little kid - just in case.

Santa had sadistically included an extra controller and nunchuk with the package, so added to the pair that comes with the set, a full scale 2 kid war was in progress, covering bragging rights for five included games - boxing (little kid leading), bowling (big kid ahead), baseball (no clear advantage - but then we don't play baseball here, because it's just not cricket), tennis (neither will see Wimbledon) and golf (Tiger's safe for now)

They had set up a Mii (avatar) for each member of the family (self included), and looking at the body shape they chose for me, I immediately remembered that I should make a New Year resolution to lose weight.

Soon enough a challenge was issued, and hours later I emerged as the household bowling champion, but threatening to sue for physical abuse for my boxing loss.  (I think they made it personal)

All these games have an aerobic and physical element, and if you don't get yer lazy azz in gear, nothing much happens.  Bowling for instance, requires you to swing the controller like you would a bowling ball (making sure that you secure it around your wrist first so you don't put a hole in your TV), and after hours of unaccustomed exercise, your muscles can really feel the burn.  And it's not only your arm muscles.  One does not bowl without the correct body language after all.

Oh the pain!!

Now they're looking at all the other doo-dads and wing-dings to further their Wii experience, and making strong birthday and father's day hints.  IMHO they should drop off their requests to the fat man in the red suit, and get HIM to come over and play some games.

Off to review some Icy Hot and Radian B, and make a massage appointment.

Amanda Richards, December 28, 2008

author: M. Luther
title: Great Family Fun!!
content: I was so pleased to be able to get a wii for my family for christmas.  I have an 8 and an 11 year old and it is honestly something we can all play together.  I'm "old" and not usually very good at video games but the wii sports offered a good mix of games that even I could play with my kids.  We've since added a remote and a numchuck controller plus a couple of games and are still enjoying it months later! It's cool that it gets you up off the couch and moving around while you play.  Definitely, a fun family game!

author: Sean M. Quinn
title: Love this game!!!
content: As far as the game goes it is great and fun to play.  A bit on the easy side and wish the AI was a bit better but all and all a great game and must buy for any NHL fan.

author: Vivian
content: the wii didnt come with the games that was suppose to be included, selling takes for ever to write back. price keeps changing.

author: Misty Albaugh
title: Wii well worth it..
content: I'm a nintindo kid.. always have been always will be.. (I have the other systems.. but only my husband plays them) Last week I said I would never buy a Wii.. I loved my GC. This was just another way for them to make money. and the remote sounded stupid to me.. Well.. I got one earlie for Xmas.. and ended up staying up all night laughing. This is the coolest video game console I have ever played.. My GC now just seems so boring.. This is deffinatly worth it.. and a must have for the Nintindo fan..

author: HaJeKiHo
title: The first of its kind really
content: They're have been other products like this, but this is probably the best aimed. The Wii is cool, its fun especially for all ages, for me though it just doesn't last as long as other consoles - the fun I mean, it doesn't seem like you're in control as much as you should be when playing the games. It will get better, definitely worth buying though. I've never met a person that hasn't liked it, and thats been like 3 years.

author: nicksjamin
title: What are you thinking, Nintendo???
content:
I really love this system and everything about it.  I just (finally!) got it today, and I'm going to go back to playing with it when I'm done here.

My one question here, and it's the reason it got 4 stars from me and not five...is "what is Nintendo thinking??"

A revolutionary gaming console.  That has some neat games and the power of Mario/Zelda/etc behind it.  AND has the ability to connect you with all the favorites that you played as a kid.

And Nintendo makes barely any.  Did they think that it was going to flop?

I went to 10 stores across three states to get this thing.  When I finally got it, the salesperson wouldn't tell me how many he had, and fielded 5 phone calls in the 10 minutes I was there, asking if he had any.  One person in the store bought one just off of my excitement.  He didn't even plan on getting one.

Why, Nintendo, are you putting your salespeople and your gamers through this?  I heard that it was only going to get worse with the upcoming holiday season, because Wiis are going to virtually run out in some areas before Christmas.  Between Metroid and Mario Galaxy, this thing is going to be impossible to get in major cities.

Awesome console!  Great idea!  But your marketing team, specifically whoever so limited production, should be canned.

author: C. Henke
title: so much fun---but some reliability issues
content:
I've had my Wii for a few weeks now and am having a blast.  Ordered from Amazon in one of those tiny windows where they actually had them in stock.  Also ordered Zelda, Wii Play, and some extra controllers.  Wii Sports is still my favorite---this game is a lot deeper than many give it credit for.  I have been playing a lot of tennis and have enjoyed increasing my rank against the CPU players.  The Wii remotes are incredible---they really respond to subtle movements, making a complex game like tennis seem so real.  My 5-year-old daughter has also enjoyed creating many Miis and has done well with bowling---even scoring a turkey in the tenth frame of her very first game (pure luck...I think).

With that said, I have also had some reliability issues with my Wii.  The first console gave me consistent disc read errors on all three of my games, so I called Nintendo about it.  After talking to/persuading a CSA to send me another console, I got a new one (it's actually refurbished I think---had a sticker on it that implied it wasn't new).  My second console has worked fine, except that I still get a lot of error messages when playing Wii Sports.  So now Nintendo is sending me another Wii Sports disc, and I'm hoping that will work better.  I will update my review when I test it.

In addition to these issues, I bought some Wii Points through the internet connection on my first console, and the CSA I spoke with the first time said that I would be able to transfer them to my replacement console.  Well, then another call to Nintendo after the replacement console arrived, and I am told that I can NOT transfer the points (worth $30) to the new console.  I end up having to speak to a supervisor, be put on hold many times, get a call back a few days later, etc---before they finally relented and put the points on my new console.  Bottom line: be really careful about buying stuff through your console, because if it dies, your stuff is lost (exception: games you have previously downloaded should be download-able again).

All in all, I love my Wii and have had mostly good experiences with Nintendo's customer service.  Good luck finding a Wii, and have fun.

EDIT (10/15/2007): My second Wii Sports disc seems to be working better---not getting the error messages on the second console now.

author: angie holman
title: WII
content: The Wii that we ordered did not work. We tried switching out remotes and the sensor but nothing helped. My son was so disappointed as this was his birthday gift. I have returned it, but I am still waiting on Credit in order to get him another one.

author: geoffrey
title: the wii mote is hard to use when you play ...
content: the wii mote is hard to use when you play a shooter game you cant hit anything the motion does not respond to games

author: L. Jackson
title: a christmas hit
content: Amazon rocks! No sales tax and a speedy free shipping, i could not beat this. I bought it for my two sons for christmas. Im sure its going to be a big hit. i cant wait til christmas so i can play it too. Buy the wii, u wont regret this purchase

author: Marlene Barrett
title: Wii
content:
I found this item to be the BEST invention in a long time!

 My husband had quadruple bypass surgery and suffered from a stroke, so he needs constant activity to stay healthy and keep alert.This game does all that and more!

I get such a cardio workout from the boxing and tennis game that all my anxiety and frustrations completely melt away! This game is perfect for anyone at any age!
LOVE it..Love it...love it!!!!!!!!!!

Wii

author: Amazon Customer
title: Only came with the console! No power cords, ...
content: Only came with the console! No power cords, sensor bar, or remote! Not how it was pictured in the ad.

author: kay
title: Two Stars
content: The system is fine, but my package did not contain any controllers.

author: Jglaubman
title: The best system out there!!!
content: I was finally able to get a Wii after months of wanting one, and it lives up to its hype.  It is so much fun.  Wii Sports is great, and really shows you how the Wii Remote works.  Also, the game isn't as shallow as people think.  There are practice modes, fitness tests, trying to become a pro, the game is actually pretty deep.  Videogames aren't only about graphics anymore, it is about gameplay.  That is why the Wii is selling so well.  That is why the Wii is the best.

author: Terrie Lynn Erwin
title: disappointing Christmas present
content: True rating: ZERO!  This was sad.  I never buy used equipment, but my mom has and has good luck.  My son is six and we don't own a game system.  I wanted to get one for around $100 but all new ones were much more.  So I ran acrossed this wii and it sounded good.  I got it for my son for Christmas.  We hooked it up, that was pretty smooth.  But when we tried to put the disk in, it wouldn't go.  So we tried a different disk and then another.  It didn't work.  My son cried! Now I remember why I don't buy used electronic!

author: J. Dawson
title: Great for groups
content: I ordered this for my family for Christmas. Shipping was quick, no problems. Everything worked perfect out of the box. Also ordered 3 extras remotes and nunchucks so we could play 4-man games. Hooked it up as soon as possible and played it for the rest of the day. Everyone (ages ranging from 54 to 13) enjoyed it.

author: Lizzy
title: One Star
content: The Wii I received did not work.

author: Zen
title: Wii - The right console for great fun with family and friends!
content:
Wii introduced me to the world of video gaming. I'd never been a video game player growing up and I even sucked at playing games on early systems like Atari. I was afraid of pitting myself against other kids at video game arcades during my teenage...as everyone always beat me hollow! I watched my friends play the XBox and the PS2 a couple of years ago but never felt confident enough to pick up the controller. Then came the Wii in 2006 and it changed my definition of a video game console.

Wii is truly innovative as it allowed people like me to play video games for the first time. Wii Sports - the game that comes with the console -makes great use of the wireless remote. All of a sudden, I can golf or box or bat away in my living room. It simulates the game really well and you feel like you're really playing the game. Of course, it's not really the same thing as playing outdoors but then how many times do I get the chance to play the real game anyway! It's really fun to play the games available for the Wii with friends and family, and share some great times together. Wii seems to have the best collection of family friendly games.

With games like Wii Fit, Dance Dance Revolution, Hannah Montana World Tour, Jillian's 30 day shred the Wii has become a great way to exercise. With games like Guitar Hero and Wii Music we can rock out. With Wii Sports, Wii Play, Wii Ski, Mario Kart we can simulate some fun sports right in our living room. And of course, there are Zelda and Metroid Prime type games available if you're into "real" gaming.

I see XBox and PS3 more as the hard core gamer consoles, especially given the choice of games available for them. On the other hand, Wii really shines as a family console which can be played by ages 5 to 99. It seems like the best console for a night with family and friends, even people like me who still suck at the hard core video games can have fun with this one.

author: stormyweather books
title: Wii!!!!
content: the Wii is amazing and the controls are really cool.  Some people say the graphics are just like gamecube but thats is just not true if you play metroid prime 3 you can clearly see the graphics are beyond gamecube or any last gen systems graphics.  The controller is awesome once you get used to(wich took me about 3/4 of a single level of call of duty for me) the controls you'll never want to use dual analog again.  There is a shortage of good games for the Wii right now but seeing as its easily outselling ps3 and xbox360 that will and has already started to change.  Overall a great system and well worth buying!

author: sweethunnie
title: THE ABSOLUTE BEST SYSTEM EVER PLAYED!
content: I would recomend this system to everyone, even if you have never owned a game system before. This system is great for all ages. My four year old daughter loves playing the sports games. She is able to play them with no difficulty at all. My wife who really doesnt like playing video games even is amazed about the Wii. I was surprised to see her actually playing the bowling games. Rather than sitting on your butt you are able to stand and get into the action of the games. Using the remote and nunchuck allows you swing a golf club, punch your opponent in boxing, bowl, swing a bat in baseball, etc. . I give this game an A+, it is a one of a kind system that I think competitors with try to make a similar system.

author: Victoria Timm
title: Decent
content: high quality and the best price in town, for any family on a fixed income this was really great for us.

author: Cherie Little
title: A revolution in gaming experience!!!
content: Sony and Microsoft will definitely have their hands full trying to keep up with the Wii. This console, for once,  will bring non-gamers and gamers alike together. I've only played it for a couple of hours and I am estatic with the motion controller. The graphics are just fine. One can only take graphics so far which is what Xbox and Sony are trying to do. They recycle the same games with a few more fps and that gets old after a while. The Wii is amazing and actually requires one to get up off of their butts and play. It's the common cure for the "couch potato" gamer. Family board games will be replaced with the Wii as the entire family can play this and have fun without doing too much strategy play like other consoles. I was an avid Playstation fan but they really disappointed me and Wii has officially taken it's place. THANK YOU Nintendo for bringing something new to gaming.

author: Carol Marquering
title: WII station
content: We had a WII game with all the 'goodies' and it was stolen, so we just had to replace it.  I play the games on it for about 7 hours a day, and recommend it to everyone. A friend comes over and we play with it every day. It is SO MUCH FUN!!!

author: The Video Game Geek
title: Great, Superb, Awesome console!
content:
What is the newest Nintendo console? The awesome Wii ofcourse! This console is top-notch and this review will tell you ALL you need to know!

The Nintendo Wii has motion sensing technology, which allows you to move the wireless Wii Remote, and everything you do with the Wii Remote goes on the television screen, with the sensor bar that goes under or above your tv, movements will immediatly be recorded and performed on the television screen!

The features on the Wii are as follows:

Mii: The Mii feature gets all the fans of Nintendo brand systems back in the stores again, and this time not only because the motion sensing technology, but the Mii World feature. The Mii feature allows you to create your very own, cartoonish character. This character can be used on Wii Sports and Wii Play, and can be of you, family, or friends!

Photo Channel: Photo Channel allows you to load on any photos from your digital camera, or cell phone by an insert located by the disc slot and power button on the front plate of the Wii console. With this you can color on your pictures and make them funny, and you can put pre-made items on your photos!

News Channel: News Channel allows you to catch up on all the news from your Wii console. By setting up connections, you can learn everything straight from your Game Room with the new Nintendo Wii Console.

Internet: The internet connection on here is not wireless, you must have an internet connection in the room you have set up the Wii, this allows you to surf the web and do anything on the internet with the right settings, so you can go on the net without going to your computer, or laptop!

GameCube Connection: You can even store GameCube memory cards, play GameCube games, and plug in your GameCube contollers on your Wii Console! Now this feature is cool too!

Review: Now this console is brand new, just came out the November of 2006! So order your console right now! Because this console rocks!

author: bob
title: Three Stars
content: Awesome

author: Bernice M. Noble
title: wii purchase at Amazon
content: I am very pleased with the Wii GAME console that I received from Amazon.com. It is easy to operate and easy to understand and lots of fun even for older folks.

author: Evan
title: Unique Console
content: The Nintendo Wii is a very good console. The gameplay is unique and fun. It is smartly priced. This console really gets you off your couch and move around to interact. The game selection is good. My only complaint is that Nintendo has really only focused on the fun, family type of games. I would have liked to see more hardcore games. Other than that, an excellent console.

author: R. Eckenrod
title: Who needs PS3?
content:
Two words too describe the Wii:  Fun and versatile!  Obviously, this console is not about the graphics, but about the revolutionary game play and I must say, it works for us!  I've been through a dozen consoles during my lifetime (I still remember playing the real old school "Breakout" back in the day), Ataris, Colecovisions, Nintendos, Playstations, etc...and in terms of just plain old fun, the Wii really outpaces them all because it really is a family-oriented unit.

Needless to say, I really put myself through the paces prior to buying this simply becasue I wasn't too sure what the next gaming step for our family would be.  We own a PS2 and I've been loyal to the Sony brand since the days of the PS1, but honestly, putting out $600 for a new gaming system seemed, well....just outrageous to me.  Enter the Wii.  Moderately priced at $250 (assuming you can get one at retail), it delivers a punch for the price.  Not only are the Wii games fun and interactive (our whole family plays now), but I love the Virtual Console aspect of it as well which allows me to go "retro" now and again and play some of my favs from the day.  Just recently, we purchased Super Marios Brothers for the old NES and I'm hooked all over again!!

The Wii sports game that comes with the console is a great introduction to the Wiimote and addictive to play.  I never thought I'd have myself an in-house bowling league, but my wife and daughters play just about every night.  Obviously, Wii sports is only an sampling of what you can do with the system and I can't wait to get into some of the other games available, but we are hooked.

Even if I could stop the review there, it would be enough...but add in the wi-fi capabilities of this unit and its future potential to connect with the DS games, and I have an all around entertainment unit for our household.

In short, we love it and I am extremely happy with our purchase!

author: Ladystanley
title: Wii - view
content: I bought this product because it was the only video game where you have to stand to play it. We have had two family get togethers since. We have had so much fun with the bowling!! And kids of any age can do it with alittle help, they catch on fast. The best money I have spent in awhile. I am addicted to the tennis and it's great exercize. The guys love the boxing!

author: Rmcdaniel
title: great price
content: great to have fun with family..

author: Anthony Spears
title: Controller Learnings of Nintendo Wii for Make Benefit Your Fitness
content:
Setting up the Wii was simple, and it comes with a guide for quick installation.

The game play is both very fun and very physical... so physical that I would recommend stretching before playing. I'm 26 years old, and I thought my physical health was good. Not true, according to a fitness training feature in Wii Sports. After going through a round of physically strenuous challenges, I found out I have a fitness age of 71. That is both sad and hilarious. Fortunately, Wii Sports is going to work with me on lowering my fitness age, but I may not show up for the appointment. If you want to find out your fitness age this way, I recommended stretching because I didn't stretch before fitness training, and as of right now, I'm sore... too sore even for a round of Wii bowling or golf.

The controls don't take too long to get used to, and motion detection is... well, any way you move it, works (so to speak): Up-down, left-right, thrusting, twisting, swinging, thrust between legs, etc. I say "so to speak," because the controls didn't work quite as flawlessly I expected. At times, getting my character to recognize a swing was a little choppy, i.e.: the character swung the baseball bat and golf club as I was pulling the controller back in preparation to swing. NOTE: I have not yet done any troubleshooting, and the problem was minor.

The system as a whole (so far) is great. It really is a lot of fun. Only time will tell if the novelty will ware off. Meanwhile, I already feel like I got my money's worth. Other family members, who face hurdles in the hand-eye coordination department, were hooked immediately and even beat my record in bowling. The controls may take some getting used to, and may not be the best fit for every game (or perhaps not put to their best use in every game), but they really change the gaming experience for the better.

Having said that, I was a little disappointed in using the remote as a sword when playing Zelda. Don't get me wrong, it's much more fun than button-smashing, and I like the fact that my wife and I can control Link in tandem (she uses the nunchuk, as I use the wii-mote). What I was disappointed in was the fact that the direction I swing the controller is not directly translated in the game -- one of the perks I thought I was getting with the Wii. Yes, moving the controller does affect control of the sword and other medieval weaponry, but only certain gestures affect the type of sword movement in-game. You can't just stab with the wii-mote to stab in-game, you have to target-lock and thrust forward while pressing A. So, no manual controls for making custom combos. With credentials such as a yellow-tip in Hapkido issued by the Park District back in '85, plus a fitness age of 71... it's probably for the best.

Regardless of my issues with some aspects of the controls, I think the folks at Nintendo are geniuses, and they have definitely struck gold. I'm sure it is nothing like the PS3 or 360, and I don't want it to be.

author: Brian L Anthony
title: Wow, very impressed
content:
My wife and I purchased this console almost completely because of Wii Sports, watching the videos of people.  It looked so different and so fun that we decided to give it a shot.

My wife does not play video games, she knows I like them, but has very poor hand-eye coordination and is horrible at video games.  That being said, she has had a blast playing Wii sports and has spent a few hours playing Zelda.  She loves that you actually move to interact with the game.  She doesn't care about graphics or about HD capable, next generation or any of that stuff.  She cares aboutt having fun.  That is what the Wii is, FUN.

I love the system.  I play it too much, but it is so addicting.  Sure the controls are not pin point accurate, but you get used to it, and it really is fun.  The graphics are not crystal clear, but they are good enough.  I enjoy them greatly.

It really is a fun system.  I own PC games and sometimes would feel bad, because my wife had no interest in them.  Now she suggests we play the Wii.

Very fun

Product has given everything it promised. Lots of fun. Easy setup.

author: Sandra K. Ramey

author: Amie Tooley
title: AWESOME! - a few "must haves" for HD
content: The Wii took mere minutes to install in order to play.  If you have an HD TV, make sure you get the Wii HD Link Component Cable so you can have the HD experience you paid for with your TV.  Also, the Wii Wireless Sensor Bar is a must have.  We were able to put the sensor bar anywhere in our den and play without any problem!  Make sure you check out the Virtual Console once you hook up your Wii!  My first purchase was the old Super Mario Bros. that I played as a kid on my Nintendo.

author: Luis Mercader
title: Best Ever!!!!
content: Nothing can beat the Wii, I first played it at EB games and I loved it, Knowing I had one coming from Wall Mart that week, I got even more exited about getting it. I had already played the PS3 an Xbox 360 at EB games, the Wii is better then both of them. I love everything about it, the sleek style the motion sensitive controllers, the great game lineup, and the fact that you can buy old games from older systems such as the NES, I just can't stop playing it! If you buy one off Ebay for 600$ it is tottaly worth it, but don't buy it for that much. My suggestion is to wait until after Christmas when it is in lower demand and you can get it more easily. If by chance get one, get the games The Legand Of Zelda The Twilight Princess, Need For Speed Carbon, and Exite Truck.

author: 3jdsinjackson
title: Wii Review
content: My son and husband love the wii.  Only problem we have had so far is one of the remotes doesn't work as well as the other.

author: Abel Soto
title: Very Useful
content: I needed a replacement console and this was what I needed.  It works great, thanks.

author: P. Sherman
title: Finally a reason to GET UP and leave the computer!
content:
I'm a 50+ woman who has always liked video games. I can sit for hours and play an EA sims game. That's the problem--sitting for hours.

Our Wii is new. My arm is very sore from playing tennis for the same hours I used to sit nearly motionless with a computer game. This is a good thing for someone my age. Finally! Something to do with my retirement when it's rainy and windy and cold and I am stuck inside! I love it. We only have the sports game now but I am going to look into others. Anything that is best played standing up and moving around!

I have no complaints. I know that the novelty will wear off eventually, but that's true for almost everything in life. We were on the fence about buying this system for a long time--if you are as well, just do it. You will be glad you did.

author: Dennis D
title: Five Stars
content: grandkids love it

author: German Chatsky
title: Wrong Item!!!
content:
Unfortunately this is not the item that will be shipped to you.  There are 2 versions of the Nintendo Wii.  The original Wii is capable of playing Game Cube games.  The new one is not!!  The easiest way to tell the difference is the picture on the box.  If the picture shows the Wii standing upright on a stand, it is the original.  If the Wii is laying flat in the picture, it is the new Wii.
I ordered this item twice, which shows the original Wii, however I was shipped the new Wii both times.  Even in the product description, it states that it is backwards compatible.  Do not fall for this, because they will not be sending you the original Wii.  After speaking with several local retailers, I found out that the original Wii is no longer in production.
I begged Amazon to ship me the correct item, and despite their promises, they shipped the wrong item twice on two separate orders.
In the end, I purchased a used Wii at a local retailer for under $100.  I was very much against purchasing it used.  But, I did get what I wanted, I spent half of what I was prepared to spend on a new console, and the used item came with a 2 year warranty.
For serious gamers, this is really deceiving, because there are clear and substantial differences between the two Wii models.
