content:
Arrived super quick everything works great.
Very pleased

author: Aaron Demner
title: Does not play GameCube games.
content: Note that this version does NOT play GameCube games. Apart from that, it's a Wii. It plays Wii games, and there are a bunch of them.

author: Samuel Franks
title: The Wii changes everything
content:
I love the whole concept behind the Wii. I read in a magazine about that Reggie guy, everything he gets his hand behind turns to gold. And looks like he's struck gold again.

Anyway, the Wii is so much fun. The Wiimote is so resposive. Like seriously responsive. I was playing the golf game at a friends house and I was testing each position of my backstroke from pointing down, diagonal, all the way up to the top and it followed my movements perfectly. It's like having those lights on you to capture your movements.

The real reason I'm most happy about the Wii is because this system will make me buy games I never thought I would ever buy. Like I am really looking forward to a Tiger Woods title. And golf bores me. Well watching it. I'm not really into first shooters either, but I'm very much looking forward to the Metroid games and other shooters.

It may take a while for developers to make games that really fit the Wii, but I have high hopes for this system.

author: Adam Wilson
title: Misguided From The Word "Go"
content:
So my wife and I plugged in the ‪‎Nintendo‬ ‪‎Wii‬ again after probably 2 years of not touching the thing, and I have now remembered something. While it's generally fine in terms of library and certainly did well in sales, I think it may be one of the worst consoles ever made from a hardware design and implementation standpoint. At the very least, if I made a list of successful video game consoles and handhelds, the Wii would most certainly be the worst of the bunch.

Its primary problem is very simply the control. Broken controls happen in games, but in a Wii game, it's basically guaranteed. The only Wii games that have decent controls are the games that use a standard, non-Wii control scheme. Of course, even those games are hindered by the easily discernible delay between input and response, a problem the 360 never had. To top that all off, I've always had problems with the battery pack on the back of the Wii-motes coming loose and disabling the controller. Other controllers have had this problem too, but none that I have noticed are as poor as the Wii-mote; one wonders why the battery packs cannot be encased in a rigid plastic shell to prevent this kind of thing.

In hindsight, it is actually kind of amazing that a 1-star console like the Wii did so well. It really should be used in video game and hardware design courses as an example of misguided design but very successful marketing.

author: Wes
title: wii
content: We love the WII game system so much.  Watching less tv and playing more.

author: Geoff M.
title: who knew a console could be fun and give you a work out
content: my girlfriend got a wii for christmas...and its been at my house since it was taken out of the box...after the first night of playing wii boxing i was sore all the next day...and then kept playing until the soreness went away...that amazed me...i had heard that this console was intense in that regard but had never experienced it first hand...aside from that it is soooo much fun...my gf, best friend and i play it non stop...and the crazy thing is...she got wii play and mario party 8 along with it...and we have only played each of those once...the game that comes with the wii...wii sports...is all you need...bowling, tenis, baseball, boxing, and golf....all of which challenge you and are addicting like no other game...especially since it tracks each persons records and rates you on how well you do...aside from that we get the weather, news feeds, and once we buy some wii points...will be able to surf the web with the wii on our tv...it has a wifi card in it so that you dont have to hardwire it to your router...which is very nice...i also love it that it has a nice sized harddrive and you can expand the memory...which will come in handy when you go online to wii shopping and buy all the old games that you (when i say you i mean anyone over about 18) grew up playing on sega, NES, SNES, etc...and much to my surprise, creating and playing with the Mii's is also a lot of fun...i used to think that this system was only for little kids...mainly b/c of the lack of 1st person shooters and adult action type games...but as it turns out...you dont need halo, socom, etc type games to have fun with this console... my only complaints about this console is that it only outputs in 480 (for SDTV =(...) and it doesn't play dvds....other than that A+

author: Mary Ellen
title: Worth every cent!
content:
After watching my son sit like a sack of potatoes for hours on end playing video games, I couldn't wait to purchase the Wii for him.  Finally, a system that involves movement!  The sports game that comes with the system is loads of fun for everyone in our family.  We also have Zelda (I highly recommend), Call of Duty 3 (took my son a little while to get used to the controls, but he loves it), and Madden 07 (he just started that one).

Before the Wii came out, my son was asking for an Xbox 360 and I had a big problem spending so much money on a system for nothing much more than better graphics.  The Wii was inexpensive, completely different, and loads of fun.  I'd give it 6 stars if I could.

author: Romina Wilcox
title: Awesome machine for Game and Workout
content: I got this for my son, but the whole family enjoys it. Its not only for game, I also use it for working out.  I love boxing on Wii because I can really get a good workout. Its a brilliant idea that the remote can be strap on your wrist in order for it to avoid flying.  It's not bulky, and rather "sexy" so I got one for my friend's son too for Christmas.  He loves it as well. Cold Eyes

author: Samm
title: Good console, but not for hardcore gamers
content:
Pros:
Casual games
Free online service
Large game library

Cons:
Does not use DVD or Blu ray, but a custom disk, so can't be used as DVD or Blu ray player
Can't do 1080p
No HDMI
Controller is kind of temperamental.

It's a nice console, is more of a family console, than a PS3 or Xbox 360, which are for more hardcore gamers.

author: MANDS
title: Great for "non-Gamers"
content:
This will be great for non gamers if you are looking to play a few games here and there and not get totally wrapped up in a more advanced game system. Xbox and 360 are great, but this is just as fun.

Hooked up in 5 min. and we were playing right away. My kids ages 7 1/2 and 4 both have no problems with the remote or games.

It only came with 1 remote and nunchuck, so you may want to pick up an additional one at the same time.

author: kidnugget
title: Another Glowing Review
content:
In many ways, the the Wii is the most fun of the current generation of consoles.  I've played Zelda, sports, and wario ware, and all of them are great fun and entirely fresh gaming experiences.  The remote is truly awesome, and swinging Link's sword or my baseball bat or golf club are all really sensitive and rewarding.

My wife, who only enjoys puzzle games, can play wii sports for hours at a time and truly enjoys Zelda!  Indeed, I suspect that a great many "non-gamers" are going to get addicted to the game play here.  My friend played boxing so long, he broke a sweat and his arms hurt the next day.  No more couch potato gaming with wii sports.  There are more fun titles at launch then there were for the 360 or the PS3, and its price point can't be beat.

A lot of the "channels" and online stuff are great fun, too.  The beta version of the web browser bring a farily functinal net browser to my HDTV (I watched youtube videos on it for about an hour the other day).  I've had nothing but trouble getting my 360 to work with my router, but the Wii has been trouble free.  The online weather and news channels are great.  The photo channel is cool and can even play .mov videos.  The Mii channel is kind of fun because as you create little "Mii" characters, they begin to populate the games you play.  It's just a nice touch.

Also, I have to rave for a second about their true backwards compatability with the Game Cube (memory cards, disks, even joysticks).  I'm visiting Resident Evil 4 in high def now.  If you never had a cube, this is a great way to explore the library.  I also have to thank Nintendo for using a standard scan disk memory card for the memory.  You can pull one out of your pda, phone, or camera and save $50 for a system-only memory card.

The one downside I have is that you have to upgrade to high def and buy a component cable on your own.  Then again, anyone shopping for graphics should look at the other two systems and get over it.  (If you do buy a component cable, but the mad catz, it's only $20 on Amazon, and it works great!)

I'm not going to go in to any great depth here (there are plenty of lengthy reviews abounding about the wii, just scroll down).  I just want to add my 5 star rating to the mob. If you can find one, this is a superb system.  It's small, it doesn't overheat, and you're going to have some truly unique gaming experiences with this one (and Mario isn't even out yet!).

author: Carol White
title: Best Fitness equipment I ever bought!
content: I bought this Item for the fitness program,and it is the greatest thing ever! Doesn't feel like a "work out" at all. More like a "play out"!

author: Jacquie Earle-Coppola
title: For Great Family Fun with some actual physical movement.
content: I ordered the Nintendo Wii from Amazon.com and received it in less than 72 hours, which was great.  We hooked it up within minutes and we were playing baseball and bowling. It is a lot of fun, and the kids love it and actually want to play with their "old Mom."  I suggest this game system to everyone from ages 7 to 100 plus, there is a game for everyone.

author: SGMVIDEO
title: Keep In Shape With Wii
content: With the recent price drop, free shipping and Amazon's $25.00 gift certificate, this is one great deal. The interaction using the Wii remote is awesome and much fun. I used the $25 Amazon gift certificate to purchase the new Wii Resorts which comes with the new add-on for the Wii remote for more accurate interaction movements for the Resort games. My guess is that new games for the Wii will have the ability to use the remote add-on to it's full advantage. While the graphics are not true HD, you can purchase a component cable for the Wii console which will give you a screen resolution of 420p. Other games, such as Blazing Angels, play well and graphically are excellent with the component cable. All in all, this is a purchase well worth the price.

author: DAVISION INC.

content: Broken.  Wont find Internet, wobbly controllers.

author: Wg21
title: Fun
content: Amazing game set for all ages.

author: sun lover
title: only if you are 7 years old
content: The Nintedo Wii is not a terrible product, but it is nothing special. The vast majority of the games are made for people under the age of 7. This is not bad if you are looking for a family console but it only does just that. When we got our wii several of the games we got with it didn't work well, not that the games were broken but they were unresponsive even after we adjusted the receiver. It is very hard to play shooter games because of the way the controls are made, like in Call of Duty: World at War, you have to press down B and twist counter-clockwise to throw a fragment grenade. Because you are twisting it is impossible to aim and therefore nearly impossible to use (Whenever I try the grenade ends up blowing my squad to pieces). It is also harder to snipe than on other consoles. Half the time in the middle of an online match you will move to try and find your enemy and it will spazz out for 3-6 seconds, enough time to get shot. If you are going to play shooter games get something else (I play MOH on my gamecube more). Mario Cart however is good. it is great for parties and fun to play contact racing where you can push the person sitting next to you. Sometimes the controller wants you to go another way and no matter how you turn you will go straight into a wall. Wii play is also pretty fun, but I only play tanks, cow racing, target practice, and the fishing game. Im am actually saving to buy an xbox 360 because of better games and graphics. If Your looking for young person/entire family entertainment look no further, but if you want to play shooter games, get an xbox or ps3.

author: CaPtaiN eYeSaNo
title: It is what I thought it was.
content:
This console is fantastic. My only minor gripe with it is that it is only 480P...especially since my TV is 61 inches! Oh well, the Xbox 360 is for hardcore gaming.  This gripe aside, this system really gets your blood pumping and your sweat dripping! The Wii Sports that accompanies this system along with the Wii Fit game/board really offers an alternative to traditional gaming.

Highly recommended!

author: Koki Surf
title: JUST FUN!!!!!!!!!!
content:
Well, where to start, this have to be the most out-of-the-box experience I have with my whole family regarding home entertainment, it's a bliss of possibilities, well enough with the included Wii Sports.
I have a feeling all those negative reviews are from individuals being paid by Billy Gates, since in every single field that Microsoft it's involved shows lack of creativity, to put together a box with top of the line video cards, it's not new, you are just taking advantage of today's standars, while the Wii have change the enjoyment of playing this totally replace board games, something it was hard to from the collective experience, i don't need top of the line graphics to have fun, and the quality of the games is totally up to the developers, the potential of the Wii rest on that, if you want a shooting experience looking at pretty pictures buy the Xbox, if you want to have fun and share a good time with family and friends or by yourself get a Wii.

author: Ben JB
title: A Welcome Change in Gaming
content:
As an ex-hardcore gamer, (I have kids now!) I was first planning on getting a PS3 since I have a Sony PS2, but the rediculous and outrageous price deterred me, so I thought I would look at the Wii a little closer, and became intrigued with the new controller and all of its possibilities(not to mention the much cheaper price!)so I decided to go with a Wii.

This system blew all of my high expectations away. The graphics are pretty good, not PS3 caliber, but not shabby, either-and they will only get better, since basically all of the games available right now for the Wii were made for the graphically inferior gamecube, or didn't have much time in development to "polish up" and fully utilize the wii's new hardware. In my opinion, when you are having as much fun as we are with this system, who cares if the graphics aren't so awesome that you could see the blood vessels in Link or Mario's eyes? My point is,you don't stop to notice the graphics when you are having this much fun playing. I've played a lot of horrible games with awesome graphics, and a lot of great games with mediocre graphics.

It was a breeze to set up, everything seems to have a quality feel to them,(the Wii is a beautiful machine!)and once you get over a relatively painless learning curve, the games are a blast. Wii sports does not have mind-blowing visuals, it was meant to be fun-which it does quite well. My 45 yr. old parents were hooked after a few minutes of bowling, I haven't seen them have this much fun with videogames since Super Mario back in the eighties! This system has been a hit with everyone it has encountered-and with the price, innovation,past and present game lineup, Nintendo quality,and the all-out fun factor-the Wii makes an extremely strong case for your purchase. You won't regret it. It is truly a fresh and welcome gaming revolution.

author: Michael C. Combs
title: A much needed change in consoles.
content: This system may not have the graphics of its competition, but its fun factor is a step above. Even the simplest game of tennis is new, refreshing, and most importantly, completely entertaining. Whether you are a non-gamer or a hardcore gamer there is something here for everyone. Plus, if you are a parent worried about your child wasting away in front of the TV, this will help at least get them up and moving, even if it won't get them outside.

content: I bought the Wii on the first day it was available and while it was enjoyable for awhile, a year and a half later it has lost most of it's fun.  Underpowered, terrible online, and lack of great games, all plague the system.  Occasionally a jewel like Super Mario Galaxy comes along but it is usually preceded by 6 months of low quality bargain bin games.  If you searching for a girlfriend/family friendly gaming system the wii is an excellent choice but I've found much more enjoyment and use in my other gaming systems.

author: J. Byers

author: Timbo108
title: Great Game- Best Thing Since the Playstation!!
content:
I love it! I got it recently, at Target. But don't go looking there- when i was there, there were only 5 Wiis left! They even had them at retail price: $[...]! (Yes, the Wii is supposed to be $[...] in America, no more, no less.)
Anyway, the Wii is great! It's a game that really gets you up on your feet, really moving, instead of sitting on the couch all day as previous systems did! It even does more than just play games- it lets you make your own little virtual person (called a Mii), edit photos, check the weather, update on the news, and download games from N64, SNES, NES, and I think some Sega systems, too.
Although, if you buy games for excellent, mind-blowing graphics, don't even look in the Wii's direction. Not that the graphics are bad, but... they aren't great, either. But trust me, if you like playing games on your feet, you probably won't care about graphics that much.

author: Marla Bell
title: Said it was in Good condition. Non working should not be comsidered good ...
content: Product didn't work. Would not read discs. Said it was in Good condition. Non working should not be comsidered good condition.

author: Xanatos
title: Wii is fun
content: I know the wii u is out now and that's the new buzz, but this used wii was perfect. It was in great condition and it plays awesome. I still prefer the PS3, but this wii is fun. If for some reason you go ahead and buy one, be aware, the wii doesn't support HD so it won't look great in your HD TV. the best image quality you can get is with a component cable

author: Amy
title: XBOX is MUCH better
content: I was really anxious and anticipating a lot of fun times with Wii but unfortuneately I have played with an XBOX first.  There is NO comparison.  It just isn't as life like.  The characters movements are choppy, the sensitivity to your movements isn't as detailed and the set up is lengthy and boring. Sorry I bought it.  However, if you have never done either one, I'm sure you'd like it.

author: Andrew Broadfoot
title: Loads of Fun!
content: Took a while to get a hold of one of these but it was well worth the wait. Graphics are not perfect but that is not why I bought the wii. The motion chucks with the sports games are an absolute blast especially with someone else. The ability to download some of my favourite titles is a just a bonus along the the many other wii online features. Setting it up and connecting to the internet via wireless was a sinch. Ability to play gamecube games with the original gamecube controllers is a very nice feature. Now just got to wait for smash brothers melee to come out.

author: L. E. Salisbury
title: Fun for the whole family
content: What can I say, but "Wow!"  I haven't bought a game system since Playstation 2, so I'm a little behind the times.  I've seen the graphics, etc. offered by the PS3 and 360, but they don't offer the interactivity that the Wii does.  I'm married and have two children still at home (5 and 3) and we all enjoy playing the various games.  We also own the Wii Fit Balance Board, so that adds another level of fun and interactivity.  Our favorite games are Baseball (it's so easy, my little ones can play), bowling (very realistic and just a frustrating as the real game!), "Ski Jump" (one of the balance games on the Wii Fit DVD) and "Soccer Header" (where you "head" soccer balls and avoid cleats and panda heads...don't ask, but it's hilarious!).  Even my 20 year old son joins in the fun when he stops by.  We end up laughing and having quality family time every time we turn it on.  My 5 year old is often upset when it is time to turn it off.  I highly recommend this system for any family looking for clean family fun that gets you off the couch.  Also, pick up the Wii Fit with Balance Board to add another level of fun and interactivity.  It's also great if you want to do a "real" workout (the push-up activity is a killer!).

author: vik
title: Got caught in the hype to buy it
content:
I am a sports and outdoor guy and thought Wii would be a good companion & pass time after I moved to a new city and had few weeks, before I returned to new job. The unit came in a nice compact packing. The unit itself is sleek,  stylish, compact and portable. Took 10 minutes to set it up to my LCD monitor. I loaded the complimentary games CD that arrived with it. It has 5 games : Bowling, Golf, Boxing, Lawn Tennis, Baseball
The only reason I returned it is due to making my brain getting used to a VIRTUAL gaming console. The response times were nowhere realistic. The only game I kind of felt OK was Bowling. It was hard to adjust to other games.
Other Wii specific gripes:
1- No DVD or Music Playing capability
2- No HDMI
3- No Disk Storage
I cannot imagine what catches the fancy of so many million users of Virtual Gaming Consoles for Real Sports like Bowling, Golf, Soccer etc. There is no way they can ever emulate the real world conditions, feel, response times etc. Probably this unit (or any other gaming console) is good for other games that one cannot do in real life for [...] ex: sit in a room and shoot people in war, race in lamborghinis, sing along etc. Also, i think real fun of these gaming consoles is in groups or parties rather than sports that doesn't need a group of people like swimming, golf, bowling.
I got caught in the hype owning a Virtual Gaming Console but couldn't adjust my brain to use it for fun. I guess I am becoming a dinosaur and lagging behind in the evolution (if the theory is right..) in this fast changing world of Gaming, Social Networking sites etc. It is becoming a institution like marriage where the only way to engage with others is to become part of that system/institution; otherwise you are not welcome.

author: Vicki Bajkowsky
title: great used wii
content: Kids were really happy with this wii and Parents were really happy with the price. Had the capability of playing gameboy games.

author: Basketball 10
title: A lot of fun!
content: I like the Wii. I like how it gives you entertainment along with a workout. If you want your kids or yourself to get some physical activity while playing video games, the Wii is a good fit for you. You can get your whole family involved with a game like Mario Cart or Will Bowling. When you purchase a Wii you get a free game. On that game is Will bowling, baseball, tennis, and boxing. You can get a lot of physical activity in just one game. The Wii is a fun gaming console at a cheap price. I would recommend it for everyone.

author: Faye Stevens
title: Five Stars
content: use it

author: Anthony Boucher
title: Kids love it
content: Kids are 9 and 6. Was very easy to install and connect to the internet. the 9 y.o. can handle loading, setting up and resuming a game no problem. These seems like the right variety of games for their age level. Just limit their daily use on it....;-)

author: Jennifer Miller
title: Love my wii!
content: I've had my wii for about 3-4 months now and everything is great. I haven't had any issues at all. It's a great system for all ages. My 11 year old nephew loves it as does my 58 year old father in law. I highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for an interactive gaming experience.

author: Hugo Price
title: Wii Review
content:
Overall, it is a very fun, family oriented game console. It is a very compact easy to carry system. It only has 3 cords (which I found convinent!) Wii sports is a video game that comes free with the system, And I would rate it a 5-star review. The only flaw I found with the wii is the wirless wii sensor bar connection. For Example, If you are using the internet channel, (which you can buy at the wii shop channel) The hand cursor shakes rapidly as you enter your URL (Entry.)If you have an HDTV, You must order a HDMI cord from Nintendo.com. Otherwise, you will have to use a standard AV output/input cord. There are five mini-games on Wii sports: Tennis, Bowling, Golf, Boxing and Baseball. They are all very entertaining! WARNING: There is a wii fitness option on Wii sports. If you play not to there expectations, You will be rated a Wii Fitness Age. EX: You miss two pitches on baseball, You Hit 10 out of 20 Tennis Balls On Tennis, You hit 109 Pins on bowling. Average wii age:...78 How do I know? I Did Exactly That. Same thing goes for Wii Fit When you weigh in and it "Think's" You are overweight or even obese, The talking Wii balence board will get mean. (He is located on your TV Screen.)
Overall, This is a very entertaining system! I strongly reccomend you perchase it!

author: RONALD EHRENFELD
title: Good game for kids and adults
content: Almost 4 years old now and still going strong. Just bought 2 more games for it for our 7 year old grand-daughter. Only downside seems to be shorter battery life in the remote than you would expect,even with alkaline batteries.

author: CR Davis
title: Wii Misses Some Marks, But Hits Most of Then
content:
The Wii is overall a good console. It has a few flaws, but it's pretty good
Pros
good games including
The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess  100% (rotten tomatoes)
Wario Ware: Smooth Moves  100% (rotten tomatoes)
Trauma Center: Second Opinion  90% (rotten tomatoes)
Madden NFL 07  88% (rotten tomatoes),
innovate controllers, virtual console and Gamecube backwards compatibility  making it like having every Nintendo console to date, built in Wi-Fi

Cons
Weak Graphics and Sound, No Hard drive, no HD, 2nd Rate Online Service, sold for a profit (the 360 and the PS3 both sell at a loss)

I really like the Wii, it's fun it's cheap, it's pretty easy to play.  It may not be suitable for hardcore gamers, but for gamers that just want to have fun the Wii hits just the spot.

author: Beth
title: Five Stars
content: Awesome deal

author: Heidi
title: the wii is fun
content: i am not a gamer, i bought this for my husband.  i was drawn in and played the sports games that came with the wii on a dare.  to my surprise, i had fun.  i still prefer to watch others play but of all the systems out there, this is the only one that got me up, enjoying and wanting to play, and having fun.

author: Sistertex
title: Crazy fun.
content:
There is just something about getting into the game as much as you do with some of the Wii games that can bring out the craziness in people. Lots of laughing is usually involved. We have had the Wii for many months now and the games never seem to get boring. What is great about it is that it can be enjoyed by nearly all ages due to the fact that it can work with minimal effort or you can expend a lot of effort to play the games. I think does a lot for helping develope coordination of hand and eye (and sometimes even feet). It comes with the Sports Game and there are many things you can select to play off of that particular game that will keep you going for a long time. Boxing, Baseball, Bowling, Tennis - all fun. You start by making up your own character (Miis) and this is pretty easy to do. You have all sorts of features to select from to make your character (who will play all these games) look just like yourself.
The system has held up well for us and the controllers are very durable, nothing has broken so far even on one or two occasions where the controller has left a hand and flow across the room (use those wrist straps!) they have continued to work very well. Lots of fun with as much exercise power as you wish to expend on some of the games.

author: carlos
title: Five Stars
content: I love it

author: JK
title: The console and Wii Sports are great; beyond that, meh.
content:
I've had a Wii long enough now to give it a serious review.

Overall, it is a nice console with more promise than real entertainment value. The user interface for the system menus and functions is intuitive. I have fun flailing the Wiimote around; it is a refreshing change from the thumb-wiggling on the Playstation 2, XBox, and Playstation Portable.

However, the Wiimote can be very touchy and it can be quite hard to keep the cursor on the screen, let alone pointed at a specific target. I've gone through all the configuration and calibration menus with no real improvement, and have seen the same problem on friends' Wiis, so I know this isn't a fluke but is a systemic problem. This issue implies that games that do not rely on aiming tend to be much more fun than ones that do. It also means that navigating menus can be a frustrating chore.

I currently own five games: Wii Sports, Wii Play, Red Steel, Metroid Prime 3, and Raving Rabbids. Wii Sports, the game that comes with the Wii console, is a keeper. Notably, almost all the sub-games in Wii Sports don't involve aiming. The Tennis, Golf, and Bowling sub-games are very enjoyable.

Beyond Sports, however, none of the other games are ones I'd consider great, or even above-par. They all suffer from aiming problems and in addition simply don't keep my interest. Compared to titles coming out for the XBox 360 and PS3, they feel very outdated. Even compared to PS2 and XBox games, they're nothing special. Worse still, they're not FUN, and that's what I expect from Wii games. I'm not looking for the storyline of Halo or Half-Life, or the sprawling playground of Grand Theft Auto. I'm just looking for a pleasant diversion, and an excuse to jump and flail around like a fool. The current Wii games that I own don't deliver on that.

I bought most of these games based on glowing 5-star reviews I read on Amazon, and I have to say that the reviews really led me astray. I've rarely had this problem when buying games for the PS2, XBox, or PSP; generally the Amazon reviews of games for these platforms are quite helpful.

I was thinking about buying the latest Mario title, which also gets 5-star reviews, but now I'm wary of spending more money on Wii games without testing them myself first, which means that it will probably be quite a while before I buy another one.

I hope that the game developers figure out how to work with the Wiimote and nunchuk more effectively. I can't help but feel that the basic Wii interface idea is a good one, but it still needs polish.

author: Juana Bido
title: Incredible!
content: I never thought this game console was going to be so great! I've had a lot fun with it very much, and my family is really enjoying every part of it.

author: B Card
title: Great family game!
content:
This is great for the entire family.

Brings them together gets a little exercise, and lots of laughing.

author: M. Kooiman
title: Wii need another controller
content:
Back in the late 70's/early 80's when Space Invaders was all the rage, I lived to play video games.  I had an Atari and life was good.  However, the games started getting more and more complicated and less of the mindless entertainment you got from playing Q-Bert and PacMan.  I tried to get interested in the XBOX games.  My kids LOVED them but there were too many different buttons to push and I would quickly get bored.

I bought a Wii for my son's 17th birthday and invited his friends over for a surprise Wii party.  The other kids brought their controllers and in 15 minutes the Wii was set up and they were ready to play.  For games, he had the Sports package that comes with the console, Zelda Twilight Princess and Rampage.  Rampage was the first game tried out and in a few minutes buildings were being smashed and cars tossed through the air.  Video games were fun again!

The controller that comes with the game is easy to hold and quite intuitive.  I was able to bowl (Sports Package) and play tennis like a pro in no time at all.  It was a little challenging to figure out how to get muli-player to work but once it was setup it worked perfectly.  The kids at the Wii party boxed and bowled and played tennis and had a great time.

The only problem with the Wii is availability.  I had to sign up for a service that told me when it was available at local stores and was lucky to be next door to a store when they got 6 units in stock.  I only have one controller right now and am waiting (impatiently) for the stores to get some in stock so more than one family member can play.  Otherwise, we have to invite the "friends with controllers" over. :)

If you loved playing in the arcades in the early 80s, buy a Wii and enjoy video games again.

author: G. McMillen
title: Wii
content: Whee!  This is a fun system, easy to use and with nice interaction programs.  I'm just getting started using it and am really enjoying what I've done with it so far.

author: Colleen Gilger
title: ... to complete his Wii set up and it works great, he's very happy with it
content: I ordered this for a friend to complete his Wii set up and it works great, he's very happy with it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Wii - Fun for the Family
content:
Some of my wife's friends had a Wii and they told her that they really enjoyed them.  At my wife's insistence, I bought her a Wii (along with Wii Fit) for our anniversary.  Little did she realize that she would have to wait in line to use it along with her 19 year old daughter and her 57 year old husband.  The whole family is having a blast with it.

I'm actually a pretty hardcore gamer (PS3 all the way!), but, there's something about those endearing little Mii's that get you hooked and keep you coming back.  For the first month that we've had the Wii, we've focused on using Wii Fit, but we may expand into other games in the future.

I'm sure that my wife will agree that it's the best anniversary present that I've ever given her.

author: MJGA
title: Wii is a good investment
content:
As you surely know by now, there are hundreds of "Excellent" reviews for the Wii.  Well, they're mostly right and already explain most all of the positive features ad nauseam.

I'll just tell you that I purchased 2 units for Christmas last year for the game room and for the family room.  The kids love it; the games we've played are mostly "Very Good" to "Excellent".

The units come in handy for family gatherings as well.  Everyone can play the Wii-Sports games and several other party-game titles.  It's the modern version of playing charades.

The other cool feature we like is the Wii acts like a computer.  You connect your Wii to your home's Wi-Fi signal and you can send & receive email, surf the net, send memos, send Wii points as gifts, send & receive photos, as well as participate in Voting Polls (national and international).

It's a seriously fun unit and worth the $250.00.

author: Yogi
title: Good value for money but adults will get bored
content: The Wii console and games are good value for the money. However my personal experience is that after the initial excitement is gone adults in the family will get bored of this. The reasoning that this will help you stay fit and provide exercise doesn't motivate you so much. If you are a family with young kids this is great to keep them engaged but a family of adults with busy routines will get bored in some time so please avoid impulse purchase.

author: Michael
title: Bringing back the FUN to gaming
content: I have only one word to describe this system, and its wow. I own a X-box and love it to bits, and I've always been somewhat, anti-nintendo. But this first system is a blast! I've had so much fun playing it, I don't even know why I'm writing this review. Only thing that gets annoying is the speaker in the controller, but its not enough to take down a star. Long live the Wii!

author: connie roffi
title: Five Stars
content: Love it

author: Anton
title: Awesome Purchase
content: I bought a used Wii and got a used Wii in excellent condition! It even came with an adult card with some games on it. Now obviously that may not happen to everyone with a used system but I also received the system earlier than expected. Wonderful deal!

author: Tinka
title: Go ahead and buy it!
content: They used this in PT after I had back surgery in FEB.  I bought it and I am using the other exercises also trying to get stronger.  The games often makes me LOL.  This was a good investment for me.  vc

author: monin cedano
title: terrible person
content: Terrible ..controllers are dirty and pink controllermissing back cover,sensor bar is huge wireless the bonus games dont play at all they are very scratched up,terrible condition

author: Ashley
title: Mom tested...kid approved
content: Arrived on time...as advertised. Very competitive price. The kid loved it. Nintendo is way better as far as kid friendly games and formatting goes.

author: l. adams
title: Four Stars
content: satisfactory

author: Kor
title: Awesome!
content: I had to purchase a new wii because we would leave our other one on its side and wouldnt shut it off..just put it in sleep mode and would never take the discs out so eventually it wore away the disc holder, but that was the only way it would fit in our entertainment unit.  The only way to fix it would have been to send it back to Nintendo and god knows how much that would have costed.  So we bought this "new" one and aside from a few light scratches on the sides it works better that our other one and we got it so it could stand up straight.  This was definitely a WINNNING purchase!

author: alb304
title: great console
content: I can't think of anything to complain about. For those who like intense gaming this might not be the right console for you. Fun console that actually uses your movements as part of the game. No more laying in the couch doing games. This time you're upright. Most people would be satisfied with this because this console is meant for everyone. A great Christmas gift because the whole family can play with it.

author: ME
title: Five Stars
content: All Good

author: Melvin L. Glover Jr.
title: I finally got one through a connection
content: Hmm the connection.... lets just say its a good idea to have a friend in the Video game Store business especially when that person can tell you the date and time shipments come in,  but this is a great system, I have many plans for it, sometimes its just best to be patient and let opportunities like this come to YOU!

author: L. Jordon
title: Believe it -- this is the best thing to happen to home video games since the Atari 2600
content:
For YEARS, my console gaming experience has fundamentally been about sitting around and twiddling my thumbs.

Now, to be fair, I don't have a setup for a steering wheel for my PS2, and I never owned an NES along with its light gun, Power Pad, Power Glove, and whatever else it used.

That's the point, though.  All of those devices were extra.  Game developers can't assume that a console owner is going to own some specific peripheral, so they either had to include one with a game or write the game to handle the standard controller.  So, you ended up either with a bunch of peripheral devices that only worked on a couple games apiece, or you made do with standard controllers.

Because every single Wii comes with the new controller and its do-anything capabilities, developers don't have to worry about creating & selling new hardware of their own.  They can focus instead on trying new things, and they'll know that gamers will get the right experience.

When someone picks up, say, Wii Sports for the first time and play the bowling game, they ask how to put spin on the ball.  I tell them, "Just spin it," and much to their surprise, it works.  Three frames later, they're bowling as easily as they do in real life.  It's just that easy, and it makes that much sense.

Brief rundown of a few of the games I've got:

Wii Sports: It's a keeper.  Work on your backspin & topspin in Tennis, score 300 in Bowling, etc.  It's got a lot of depth, and it relies on your skills as a player.

Resident Evil 4 - Wii Edition:  Holy cow.  Aim, shoot, aim, shoot.  It's much faster and more accurate than wiggling conventional controller sticks.  Playing a RE game on any other console just doesn't make sense anymore.  If you're a fan AT ALL of the RE franchise, and even if you already have this game for the Gamecube or PS2, get the Wii version; you'll never touch the older versions again.

Wario Ware - Smooth Moves:  A lot of story & dialogue -- a lot more than gameplay -- but it really is a kick.  So many of the tasks are so silly that you'll laugh out loud, even while playing alone.

The Godfather: Yes.  Yes, yes, yes.  If this is indicative of where Grand Theft Auto-style gaming is going, we're in for a treat.  The first time I engaged in an in-game fight (as opposed to a tutorial), I reflexively started pressing buttons.  After a couple seconds, I remembered to just punch with the controller, and my character started beating up on the guy.  Bingo; that's how it should be done.  Grab a guy by his collar and throw him against a wall; grab him again and start punching him in the face... it's so much more satisfying to use hand motions than mere button combinations.

Need For Speed Carbon: I got this one strictly as an experiment -- I have it for the PS2, and I wanted to see what the new control scheme is really like while playing a game I already know.  I have to say that it's very, very nice.  Again, I don't have a wheel for the PS2; but after a few minutes of getting used to the steering response of the Wii controller, it makes an awful lot of sense.  Mid-corner corrections respond well, countersteering works, on and on and on.  Despite not having force feedback like a conventional wheel controller, it becomes second nature, and it's easy to "steer where you look", as they say in car racing.  Plus, because no extra attachments are needed (although an inexpensive clip-on wheel is nice to have) and you don't have to bolt anything to a table or sit on a wheel base, it's very, very convenient.

Trauma Center - Second Opinion: Definitely a niche game, but it's gotten reviews that favor it versus the original Trauma Center for the DS, and it's quite a lot of fun.  You really start to feel the pressure as you work to save patients, and the Wii controller is perfect for the job.

The Legend Of Zelda - Twilight Princess:  Get it.  Wonderful game.  If you're a Zelda fan, you already know that this is one of the best ever; if you're not a fan, this one just might win you over.

BOTTOM LINE:  This is it, the next big thing in home video games.  It's still out of stock everywhere because it really is that good.  Expect even better things to come along as the online network gets underway and game developers refine their use of the controller.

author: S. Clarke
title: loads of fun and good for you too!
content: I recently purchased the Wii system- specifically to run Wii Fit.  Both have proved more than satisfactory.  Wii Fit has done a great job so far (I've only had it for about a month) in toning my legs and thighs.  And the balance games are fun.  Just wish there were more variations of the step aerobics and balance games.  Love the boxing too!  It's a good basic system- look forward to the upgrade.  Wii Sports came with the Wii system, and I love the bowling!

author: Shari L. Salisbury
title: Awesome
content: I love this game. We have actually lost weight playing a video game, how awesome is that. Some of the games are a little pricey but you can also find cheap ones. I think it is better than the other video games you just sit there with.

author: life student
title: fun, but quickly collects dust
content: I was excited to get the Wii.  My daughter and others have been raving about it.  Its fun to play, but you really need someone to play with you.  After you've bowled 10 times, its boring.  the addiction is buying new games for the wii.  Its a money pit.

author: Robert L. Holesha
title: Can't get enough
content: I purchased our Wii on 12-21-07 and had it delivered on 12-24-07 just in time for Christmas. It was the number one gift on my sons'(ages 6 & 8) Santa lists. They both have had the opportunity to play Wii at some of their friends homes and couldn't say enough good things about it. I have to admit that I am having as much fun playing as they are. Even better, they are always inviting my wife and me to play along. They just get so excited every time they set a new personal record. The second I get in the door from work they are waiting to update me on their latest achievement. The graphics are realistic while, at the same time, fun. Nintendo really hit the bulls eye with this product!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: More fun than expected
content: I bought this and the Wii Fit, hoping to find a fun, convenient way to get some exercise. I was not disappointed and looked forward to daily sessions with my personal trainer and my encouraging new little friends.  After a few weeks we had some adult relatives visiting and decided to try out the sports games that came with the Wii. What fun! Best of all, my husband, who is in a wheelchair, was able to join in the fun.

author: Danielle S
title: Five Stars
content: Great system for a great price.

author: John T. Thompson
title: Innovative & fun.
content:
The Wii certainly lags behind the other current-generation consoles in graphics capabilities, but surpasses them in the simple enjoyability of the game play.  Getting to play one at my in-laws' house is what brought me back to console gaming after 13 or 14 years (I went exclusively to PC games after the Sega Genesis era).  Surprisingly, the Wii Sports games that come with the console are still among the best games for the Wii that I've played.  The "fun" factor is outstanding for the Wii, especially if you have other people around to play with.  The ability to download old cartridge games via Virtual Console is also a big plus.

My greatest complaint with the Wii is not with the system, but the games available for it.  I wish that more games made better use of the excellent motion-sensing capabilities of the Wii remote (as opposed to, say, multi-platform games where the remote functions get shoehorned in after the fact); there are too many games -- including very good ones like Super Paper Mario -- where you mostly end up using the remote turned sideways just like an old-fashioned console controller.  Also (and I realize this is not an issue for 98% of gamers), I wish that there were not so many games that require the use of both the Wiimote and the nunchuk -- I have limited use of my left hand, so I can't play most of these.  I mention that mainly because marketing for the Wii focused largely on the use of the remote, its simplicity & accessibility to non-gamers, but the need to use the nunchuk needlessly complicates things.  Greater ability in games to re-map functions to different buttons would also be a plus.

author: V.A. Payne
title: I Love This!
content: I am still most impressed about how well this game was kept. I am still using it. In fact, my practicing on it helped me to make 2- 300 Bowling games in two weeks for my Team. Thank you! Thank you!

author: Rick
title: Five Stars
content: One of my great investment

author: mcswaindar
title: Great Buy
content: The Wii I purchased from this seller was in excellent shape. It works like a brand new one. I am very satisfied with this purchase and would recommend this seller.

author: Paige
title: Four Stars
content: It good

author: HM
title: Used Wii, works very well
content:
The Wii works very well, so far I have no problems.
To be used, this is good.

author: Dawn
title: Five Stars
content: Absolutely wonderful!  Amazon is great; was not able to buy the Wii anywhere else at the time.

author: Noelia Berman
title: Absolutely satisfied
content: was shipped extremely fast as promised in 1 day delivery. Item arrived in perfect conditions and at a good price. Would definitely buy again from Amazon.

author: Aba Brenenson
title: Fair deal, I'd consider buying from him again
content: It arrived promptly, even quicker than promised, and was a pretty good deal considering that two remotes and one nunchuck came with it, I would have given it 5 stars, but I felt it should have been more clearly stated that one of the remotes was not wii plus and the battery contacts were a bit corroded. After I cleaned the contacts it works for some of the simpler features but I'll have to purchase a wii plus attachment for two people to play simultaniously on the newer sports games.

author: Ruppert Parts
title: it is annoying in how this machine doesn't have LAN built in
content:
It's been 10 years since the release of the Wii.  With the time passed, is it worth the money to invest in one?  Brand new--NO.  I would say, just based off of what is in the box, it is worth 30 dollars.  Compared to it's peers, hardware specs alone, it is inferior.  I understand that Nintendo is in the business to make money and that Nintendo is catering to a specific niche of players:  casual.  Setting up the console is a pain if you can't download the latest patch, that is needed to access the Wii Store.  As an individual that is tech savvy, it is annoying in how this machine doesn't have LAN built in!  Yes, a LAN adapter is around 10 dollars, but why do I need to buy a LAN adapter when having it built into the console is standard with Sony and Microsoft.

If you're interested in playing retro games just use an emulator.  1st party games have always been great for Nintendo, but the gold standard ones are few and rare.  3rd party support is here, but for triple A games?  Rare.  Pay the extra money and get either a PS3 or Xbox 360.  You're not missing much with the little machine that Nintendon't.

author: SlumericanBorn
title: Great for Netflix, nothing else.
content: Unfortunately I was away when the package arrived and my lady recieved it, so now I'm unable to return it. When I removed it from the box, it looked great. Turned on just fine, all pieces linked up fine. However, does not recognize any disks I put in. No Wii games are recognized on the "very good condition" system, sort of defeating the purpose of buying it.

author: Average Guy
title: Fun. Makes for more social play.
content: I really got hooked on the simple freebe tennis that comes with it. It's cute, it's really fun. It's $250. It isn't perfect and neither will be one or two of your more uncoordinated friends who, when they can't hit the ball will blame the system. Compare it to the $500-700 systems if you want but why? It's a whole other fun thing. I liked bowling and Raving Rabids.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: Didn’t come with the motion piece so you have to buy that separate but other then that it’s almost

author: MFF
title: great system for the whole family
content: i didnt understand how fun this game system was until i owned it. i am not a big "gamer" but the wii has several games available to be enjoyed by beginners, all skill levels and ages.

author: Danielle Abel
title: Exercise while having fun!
content:
My husband and I have joined several gyms looking for the satisfactory workout at the lowest cost. It is not always easy to attend with the challenge of fitting the workout into our busy work schedule, machines that are not always available at the times we go, and with today's economy it is hard to afford the membership fees. On top of that, my husband is into boxing and not many gyms have equipment to satisfy that.

My husband and I are both gamers and would rather play than suffer through watching the timer on a workout machine. As for the gym equipment, my husband desires boxing, I've pulled or overworked muscles many times, and with an added foot injury I require minimal impact movements as well. So we decided to try out the Wii. My husband can box using the controllers and simply move his arms as if throwing a punch or a jab. As for me, I can play tennis, baseball, bowling, and even golf with appropriate motions for each.

With the Wii, my husband and I can play games TOGETHER while having a workout snuck in as well. All our needs are satisfied and believe me, you will feel it the next day if you really get into it! (I have a few friends who have shed pounds while playing!)

This game console is excellent for parents with lazy kids, and for those who hate to exercise, or like me, would rather just play!

author: R. Monick
title: Wow!
content:
I have to admit, I was Skeptical Joe when Nintendo first released this system.  A controller with just 2 main buttons?  Pshaw.  You could never build a system on just motion sensing controls!

Well, I was certainly wrong.  After waiting in line for 5 hours at my local Gamestop, a shipment of Wiis arrived and I took mine home.  I opened it up, put in Wii Sports (bundled with the console) and was amazed at just how spectacular this system is.

Firstly, an overview of the system seems appropriate.  The Wii is the Ugly Duckling of the three new next gen systems; it's graphics are fairly bad, but after a while you realize just how awesome it is.  The opening menu after turning on the system has 6 elements.  One takes you to the game you put in, GC or Wii.  The second is the "Mii" channel, which lets you design characters for fun and for use in the games.  My younger sister loves this channel, and it is in fact greatly entertaining.  The third channel is the photo channel, which I have not yet used because the Wii only takes SD memory cards.  The fourth channel is the Virtual Console channel, which shares a lot of parallels with the iTunes store: you buy a card at the store, click and download for a fee.  I haven't yet downloaded a game, but have heard good things from friends.  The fifth and sixth channels are the News and Forecast channels.  The news channels alerts you to top global and local (you type in your zip code) stories.  The forecast channel shows you not only the weather predictions for your area but anywhere on the globe.  Both are very easy and quick to use.

The Wii has excellent game play, despite the prejudice that it would only produce novelty games.  Hence far my favorite is Super Paper Mario, a sequel to the popular games featured on N64 and GameCube.  My favorite that uses the motion sensing controls is Mario Party 8.  While retaining similarities from its seven predecessors, it integrates new facets of the Wii experience very enjoyably.

If I were to give one warning about the Wii, it would be to stay away from this console if you dislike moving during your video games.  For example, during the Mini-Games in Mario Party often times you find yourself standing up so you can better take advantage of movement.  One game involves shaking your arm as fast as you can for a good 10 seconds.  It defies the traditional image of slothfulness as a factor in video games, but if you're an old fashioned button-presser and the only thing you like to move while playing is your thumb, I would not recommend the Wii to you.

The Wii countered and changed the standards of video gaming when no one expected that it could.  Nintendo did the same thing with the DS a few years ago, and it's a similar revolutionary gaming experience when you pick up the Wii remote for the first time.

author: tom
title: One Star
content: does not work a waste of money

author: Matthew Porter
title: TOO much fun
content: I have to say I'm an xbox fanboy having supported that console since the originals inception. I love my 360 and when Halo 3 comes out I dont expect to be touching anything else for quite sometime. I picked up the Wii system on a trip to NYC just because they had them available at the Nintendo store, and I had read a lot of positive reviews. I still love my 360 but I am in pure 100% high school puppy dog love with the Wii...and so is my wife!! This thing makes the living room a blast for families and guests and has some extremely handy functionality right out of the box like weather reports and customizable news. You will really enjoy making your Mii's (funny little characters that you can make look like anyone in the world, and use in games) and the controls are absolutely fantastic. If you have the $, I highly suggest getting one. This thing is amazing fun and very nonobtrusive. Itll look great on a shelf with your wallmounted LCD or Plasma hiding all the wires. Get off your but for a change and get a Wii...very family friendly.

author: Preston E Fuller

The Mario Kart is also a huge hit with the entire family.  We have Wii game night every Friday and we look forward to it every week.  This is truly a game system for the entire family, young, old.  No matter if you are experienced at gaming or not you can easly pick up and get the hang of just about any of the games.  I cannot say enough good about this system.  If you are in doubt dont be and buy the Wii.wii

author: Ice Cream Man
title: Wii
content:
Just bought my Wii within the last six months.  So it's still new to me.  The main things I like about this console are:

*Reliability.  You don't hear much about Console failures (360's Red ring of Death)

*Virtual Console.  I'm a big fan of games from the 90's.  So being able to download NES,SNES, & Genesis games is awesome.  Although they need to increase the library, it's not very expansive.  But I hear they're going to be adding Chrono Trigger in 2011! :-D

*Netflix.  Being able to stream movies through the Wii to the TV is great!  The picture quality is a lot better than i would have expected.  It looks flawless to me.  (BTW..I do own a PS3 ...and the picture quality & main page Layout are inferior compared to Wii)

*Exclusive Titles.  I know PS3 & 360 outdue the wii by far with their variety of games.  But like i said before, i love the 90's games....so to be able to play games like Mario Galaxy, DKC Returns, kirby, ect is great.

Glad i purchased the system.  My only complaint really is that the Virtual Console needs a lot more titles.  They're missing out on some easy revenue by keeping it limited to where it's at.  They'd bring in TONS of dough by releasing Earthbound alone!  Cmon nintnendo!

author: Visa

content: We ordered the wii to try the cardio games, my wife and I are in our 60's and love the games that give us time to spend with our grandchildren

author: Dominique
title: Good stuff...
content: I got one of these back in November and was very excited to play it.  At the moment it's kind of collecting dust but I thought I would write a review because it's a lot of fun to play with friends and family and the games are pretty cool.  I like the fact that I can download older games as well.  I can only give it 4 stars though because sometimes it has issues connecting to my high speed internet and carrying out its downloads.  Also, the screen looks a little streched out with camecube and downloaded games since I have a widescreen TV, you would think that because most people have HD now that the software and hardware would be tailored for these types TVs.  Perhaps that will be the next step.  Also, the fact that this does not double as a DVD player is a negative, but overall it's a great system with fun games coming out all the time.  Enjoy!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Wii Love it
content: My bf recently bought a wii on a whim at target last weekend. We now have 7 games and are totally addicted. I don't know how people could go back to playing the ps3 and xbox 360 (which we also have) after playing with the sensor controls. The graphics may not be there, but its really not that big of a deal once its hooked up correctly. I think everyone looking for a new gaming system should definetly look into this.

author: Ray Ray
title: A Classic
content:
There are children's toys that are so good, they remain popular forever.  The Big Wheel, Barbie, Rubix Cube, The Whiffle Ball.  Nintendo Wii is one of these toys.  It's the best video game ever made for kids.

No violence.
Easy to play.
Great colorful graphics.
Remotes that you have to swing and jump around with, getting a bit of exercise on winter days.

No the people don't look real, but the genius of the Wii programmers is that they don't attempt to.  On other video units like Xbox or Playstation, those attempts just create creepy looking dummies.  Wii knows it's just a game for kids and like Twister, has fun with the kitsch.

I don't like video games and would rather everyone be outside. But in January or pouring rain, when the homework is done and the books are read, I feel ok with breaking out some wii.  We all jump around and actually can work up a bit of a sweat - as opposed to sitting on the floor with control pads.  Also some of the Mario games have so many levels, it could take years to get to them all.  The creativity of the designers is incredible.

It has wifi where you can play people online with certain games, but there's no interaction between the players which I like.  It's simply playing them.  I lose almost every time.

You can also watch netflix on it and some other apps can be downloaded, but they are mostly just useless fluff.  This is pretty much just a gaming console - but it's the best one ever made for kids.  Hopefully kids will be playing it for 50 years.

author: sarah
title: Love it
content: Came quicker than expected, very satisfied with everything in the box! Works perfectly

author: Jason Simon
title: Fun for the whole family ... even >80 year olds!
content:
I know that people are going to be saying the same thing I am, but I have to put in a review for this game system. I'm not much of a console game person -- I tend to like the PC games more than the Playstations and XBoxes of the world -- but when I got the Wii as a gift, I was surprised by how fun it is.

The system comes with one remote, a nunchuck, and WiiSports. When I read the review in a PC Magazine of John Dvorak -- a noted curmudgeon -- loving this system, I was intrigued. I got the system as a gift, and I told my mom who is an avid bowler how Dvorak mentioned that the system does an honest representation of Bowling. We played it this weekend, and the whole family, from ages 6 to 87, bowled on this thing. We had a great time! The great part is that we did this in the living room, and there were no sixteen-pound balls to lug around, so we were able to play again and again.

I cannot emphasize how much fun this is. And when Mario Party comes out for it, let the games begin!

author: Michael S. Andrews
title: Buy only if you want to keep up with the Jones'
content: I bought a Wii last year and I have have played it about maybe only about 100-130 hours. It's an ok system if you don't play games that often. That is due to the fact of not a large selection of good games. Most of the games are aimed for kids not yet in the 4th grade. I'm not saying thats bad but if your looking for more mature games I would go with a PS3 or an Xbox 360. The wii does not support HDTV which makes it look like crap on a HDTV. I think that Nintendo need to some rethinking. I know that wii is out selling xbox and ps3 but how long can they do that with the lack of good games.

Lots of fun, intuitive, and at least a little bit active.

author: Stephen A. Baugh
title: Family Fun
content: I picked this product over X-Box or PS3 due to the fact that many of their games are gory and meant for teens or older. My kids are younger than 10, and wii has good games for their ages. Plus, they don't just sit and push buttons, they actually stand and jump around. You should see my 6 yr old son boxing on wii sports, which came with the console. The way he weaves and hops around is a crack-up. Check out Super Mario Galaxy also.

author: Pen Name
title: Fun and Reasonably Priced!!
content:
I'm an avid gamer and I must say that I was skeptical about the Wii when it first came out.  I didn't *want* my gaming experience to change.  It turns out that Nintendo knows far more than I.  The controllers are intuitive and I find learning new game environments easy to do.  The party games are good fun and you feel like you're doing more than just 'sitting on the couch working on your a@@ impression.'
In terms of all the new platforms (xBox 360 and PS3) it is the most affordable of the three.  Plus, you get so much included - a hard drive (don't have to fork out more $$) and a wireless antennae built-in (a[...] add-on for the other platforms).
A hard core gamer will still need an xBox 360 or a PS3 to get your full gaming experience, but families and aficionados alike will love it!

Many games are simple enough for the little kids to enjoy them as well.  I would definitely recommend this product to anyone looking for a family gaming system.

content: I'm just the grandfather who bought the game. The recipients -- ages 6 and 8, seemed to enjoy it, and I was the hit of the Christmas gift opening for that purchase and another item I bought at Amazon.

author: Dylan T. Bach
title: The Best Seventh Generation Console
content:
As someone who has had some experience with the 360, PS3, and Wii, I truly think the Wii is the better system. It's graphics are understandably not as good as the other two consoles but not to the extent that it becomes an issue. While the library was a little limited at first I think it has grown to encompass all sorts of genres, not just the kiddy stuff that is often sterotyped. The bottom line is that when I have friends over we play the Wii over the Xbox every time. Sure some of the games and accessories are gimmicky but anyone with any sense is able to bypass those for decent games and quality accessories, I love using the Mario Kart wheel and the Zapper. Using analog sticks to aim weapons now seems silly to me.

If you're looking to only play first person shooters online constantly than the Wii is obviously not for you. If you want something that will provide plenty of fun and a new video game experience, give it a shot. It is completely worth it.

author: C. Kimhan
title: It's even fun for "Non-Gamers!"
content: I have never had a game system, have not been interested in these video games since the days of Qbert & Frogger... always thought they were a waste of time since I am always so busy with work and other priorities.  But then I had the chance to buy this at Xmas time thru Amazon, and boy, am I hooked!  I can't say that I still have the time, but now I have to make time.  Not only is this a blast, but I can honestly say my body feels like I'm actually getting some exercise!  I had to recuperate after the first couple of days of playing (my fitness age started at 71, i'm sorry to say, but now I'm down to 37, which is darn good for this 44 year old!)  This is fun and exercise all rolled into one!

author: R. Pickman
title: Nintendo always falls just a LITTLE short.
content:
No one will probably even make it to this review, but here it is. Nintendo has, bar none, the most addictive and enjoyable first party and second party titles in the video gaming industry. With the Wii they changed the way we played games and I give them the utmost respect and thanks for that.

 The problem is two fold:
 First, the gaming industry isn't ready for this kind of innovation. By that I mean, gaming companies find it easier and more economical to follow the same gaming model rather than taking the trouble to code in full motion control for 1 out of 3 consoles.

The second problem is that Nintendo always shoots themselves in the foot by leaving out integral elements of their consoles. The first of which is a lack of hard drive. Part of the primary appeal of the wii is the Virtual Console and Wii Shop Channel. Downloading games takes up memory however, and a 2GB expansion card isn't enough for most. If they can fit a 160GB drive in an iPod, they should be able to fit at least a 20GB drive in a Wii.
The second issue is opting not to include a chipset with the same graphical capabilities of their competitors. So not only is the control scheme more difficult to code, but developers have to make a second version of the game with lower poly counts, smaller texture maps, and dumbed down physics engines. These together make 90% of the developers completely overlook the console because they can still generate significant revenue developing for the other two consoles.

This also forces consumers to have to buy the 360, the PS3, or both so they can have access to the games available for everything but the Wii. The Wii had the potential to be the greatest system of this generation, but a couple bad decisions left it a little short.

author: Gene H.
title: Five Stars

author: NikkiY
title: The Nintendo Wii
content:
Ok I've had the Wii for a year now so I know alot about it.

Positive+
-It is fun and the remote works well.

-It's got alot of fun features like the Internet channel and Wii shop.

-You can buy old games (NES, SNES, N64, Genisis, ect)on the wii shop channel. (need wi-fi connection and wii points)

-Games are fun and work well with the Wii remote and nunchuck.

- ECT.

Negitive -
-It's a pain to put a GameCube controller on because the ports are on the top of the Wii, so to avoid knocking over the Wii I turn it on its side, but it just suks. So I got a wireless gamecube controller and they work very well!

-When you first get it, it's kind of confusing on how to sync the Wii Remotes but once you do then you have to get the settings on the Wii to make your remote show up on the screen and that takes a while.

-It takes a while for it to turn off. But that's not the big proplem, if you have Wi-Fi. When it's on the light is Green, when it's off it's red. But if you have Wi-Fi the off color is yellow-orange. It's hard to tell if the light is green or yellow, so I have to wait by the Wii and watch the Wii to see if the color is yellow or green.

I don't know if this helped but these are my + and -.

I also recommend that you buy Wii Play because 1: you get a second Wii remote, 2: you get the game Wii Play which can really help you get used to the Wii Remote and it's fun with 2 people!

author: Jonathan
title: Best games make this the best console to have!
content:
There's nothing like Nintendo.

As far as I'm concerned they own the 4 best gaming series in platforming history (3 being exclusive to Nintendo) Mario, Metroid, Resident Evil and Zelda. Unlike movie sequels they continue to improve and evole with the series. Although, it's tough to beat Super Nintendo's "Link to the Past" or "The Ocarina of Time" as 2 of the best games ever made.

The shooters are fine, but I get that stuff on my PC, it's the big 4 that keep me coming back to Nintendo for 15 years and 5 consoles. The thing that a lot of Nintendo detractors point out is the processor speed isn't quite as fast as the Xbox or PS3, but it's the quality of their games that make me very happy.
There's nothing much on the other side that I'm looking forward to or couldn't wait a couple years for a PC port.

title: Nintendo Wii! Even people who dislike video games love this game system!

Nintendo Wii has been a HUGE part of Nintendo and retail stores across the many nations. I have a Grandmother and Grandfather who are totally against video games but they LOVE this! Create your own Mii Play one of 5 Wii Sports- Tennis, Baseball, Bowling, Golf, Boxing(If you want to Verse someone you need a 2nd Nunchuk).

This is the best family entertainment I have ever experienced, for the time that Nintendo Wii has been out they have created a lot of games. I only wish they would come in different colors, probably within the next 2 years they will have a good 5-8 colors to buy. I really like to play Mario Kart Wii if anyone is up to playing, I also like to play Super Smash Bros. Brawl.

I hope you can find a Nintendo Wii, don't let this one go, this is one of the best gaming systems out there.

Be sure to pick up a few extra controllers.

J.R. Platt

author: klad
title: Why the Wii is so great!
content:
I have had this system for several months now and highly recommend it!  If you are trying to understand why the Wii is so amazing even though is it's graphics are not up to par with the other next gen consoles... it's because the Wii sucks you into the game not by visual looks but by tactile feedback with the remote control... it's the combination of the rumble and the built in speaker in the controller that makes this machine such a joy to use.

For instance if you are playing baseball and you swing your arms to hit the ball with the bat... it's the combination of seeing the player swing the bat on the screen and the satisfying clack of the bat with a slight brrr in your hand that makes you feel like you really did hit that ball.  It's a simple thing but it makes a huge diference... Sony actually dropped the rumble technology in it's PS3 even though it was standard in it's PS2.  This has been a major complaint of the system!

 So you can't look at the graphics and judge this system... you have to hold the controller and once you do then you will understand the almost cult status of this system! Initially there were very few good games for the Wii fortunately game developers are now catching on to this and creating games that tap into the unique Wii controller system.  I can't wait for the Star Wars game that is being made specifically for the Wii system... multi system games can be a real hit or miss for the Wii.  The only shame about this system is that you can't just walk into a store to buy it... you have pay extra ordinary marked up prices which show no signs of changing for this year.  Nintendo really should be ashamed and criticized for allowing this to happen, but they should be praised for realizing that us humans can not only play games with our eyes and fingers but with out full nervous system... hopefully the other manufactures will realize the error of the ways and start adding more tactile feedback to gaming.

author: Tylee
title: No

author: A.Whitaker

content:

The Wii is the best purchase I have made in years!  Now I can share gaming with my family (even the ones who said they hated video games - now I can't get them off it!)

I would most certainly recommend purchasing one of these consoles - you will not be disappointed.  Invite some friends over, and have a blast while playing the provided Wii Sports game.. LOTS of fun!!!

author: Toragaiko
title: Easy to use, even for someone who owned LPs!
content:
A friend introduced me to Wii Fit, which I LOVED, and decided I had to have.  I was a bit intimidated at the idea of having to buy and set up a gaming console, which I associate with teen-aged wizards.

It turned out to be super easy.  The instructions are clear--and mostly in pictures--and the set up is pretty intuitive.  Had everything up and running in 20 minutes, and that included finding a transformer and adding it to the mix (I live in a 220v country, and my Wii is a US-version 110v piece of gear.)  No worries!  If you can connect speakers to your computer, you can hook this up, too.

author: D. Serafin
title: WII
content: We purchased this for Grandma and Grandpa. Our 5 grandchildren came for Christmas, ages 2-8 and loved it! Bowling game is especially great, 3 year old bowled 38 first day by end of second day bowled 177 beating Grandma and Grandpa and older siblings! This game is a GREAT family game. Highly recommend for family time together!

author: Oaxacaone
title: The internet, ATM and Wii
content: I take my time before buying things and for a couple of years I had been joking about buying an XBox.  When the time to buy came, I researched and decided on a Wii.  It exceeded anything I could have expected.  The two points which sold me are 1) you have to get up off the couch and get active to play and 2) the focus isn't so much on violence, blood and killing.  I'm a senior citizen and my daughter picked this up for me.  We played it until our arms were numb and she is looking to get her own Wii so we can play on-line.  I check the daily weather and news stories on my Wii and my friends and I will soon start a bowling league.  For the price, you can't beat this system.  If I were paying 50 cents for every game I played, it would have paid for itself in a month or two.  The software selection is great and the prices are reasonable.  I rate the Wii right up there with the Internet and the ATM.  Get yours and you'll see.

author: Corey E.
title: Four Stars
content: would recommend and buy again

author: Paul Saitta
title: Don't get
content: Shipment was really late and did not come with cords don't get

author: J. Meyer
title: Truly a great system
content:
It is hard to express how this compares to systems like PS3 and Xbox360.  The dual-analog controlled systems are MILES away from what the Wii puts out there.  I am not saying that the Wii is better, but what it does is truly unique.

There have been plenty of reviews about gameplay already; I don't know that I can add anything to that.  However, what I can do is talk about what this system does differently to encourage multi-player gaming.

People love to make fools of themselves and they love to compete.  By combining these two aspects, the Wii gets people to move as well.  For instance, I was playing the Mario and Sonic at the Olympics game by myself after renting it.  My wife came in to the room while I was engaged in a heated round of fencing with Bowser.  She thought that it was pretty cool and wanted to play.  That, my friends, is what hell freezing over is all about.

Many games require minimal use of buttons.  In the same game, my wife was dumbfounded that she could participate in the long jump without hitting a single button.  This makes the system accessible to younger siblings and older parents/grandparents.  For those of you who don't know about the long jump controls, you alternately shake the remotes up and down (a la playing a drum) to run; depending on how fast you "drum," you run faster or slower.  To jump, you lift up the remote right as your character hits the take-off line.

Finally, the great equalizer...bowling.  I have yet to find someone who doesn't enjoy a good game of Wii bowling.  Grandmas play, 4 year olds play, corporate goons play (at our annual meeting for a Fortune 500 company they had 40 flatscreens with Wiis lined up in one of the entertainment areas; they had the longest wait).

This is a great family system.  If you want flawless graphics for over $600, get a PS3 and some games.  If you want to have a good time playing you system and not break the bank, but a Wii.

author: Donald
title: Pure Enjoyment
content: The Nintendo Wii is the kind of game I dreamed about as a child.  Now that I'm in my mid twenties I enjoy it like I've returned to childhood.  The combination of totally original game play and interactive gaming amazes me.  I also love that I stand and move around while playing a game instead of wearing a hole in the couch.  I recommend this for people of any age.

author: Heidi Greene
