content: Glad I purchased this system. Great price. I remember I used to play super Mario Brothers as a kid and wanted to play again. So happy I made this purchase.

author: Brian
title: A much better way to go in next-gen gaming
content:
This console is much better than the other two when it comes to new game design. Nintendo actually went for something new. The new control scheme is much more advanced than powerful CPU and GPU. It reminds me of the song, "Razzle Dazzle" from the musical "Chicago." "Razzle dazzle 'em
And they'll never catch wise!" is a perfect analogy for what Microsoft and Sony have done with their systems. At least Microsoft added other media functions to attract people to its system even though that doesn't qualify any more to be considered next-gen. Sony on the other hand, copy features from both of its competitors and still only has a half baked system.

Nintendo has no stake in anything but gaming, so they actually focused on gaming when the Wii was in R&D. They did put motion, force-feedback, and traditional buttons on its controller and it does work great. Sure, the graphics aren't the greatest but I was warned well in advance, even before the system came out that it would only be slightly better than the GameCube. So don't listen to people complaining about the graphics when they already knew what they were going to be like. The lower graphics does allow games to be easily put on a single disk. I thought the graphics on the GameCube were fine, so the slight increase pleases me. And, because the games aren't too graphically intense, Nintendo just needed to use full-sized DVDs, which can be read much faster than Blu-Ray discs, so performance is not sacrificed like on the PS3.

As for the limited number of games, for me it's not as bad for the Wii as the 360 or the PS3. There are more games for the Wii that I want to play than there are for the 360 or the PS3. I'm rather picky when it comes to the games I'll buy, so right now there are only two out for the Wii that I want with a third coming out in June. But there's only 1 or 2 for the 360 that I would want and none for the PS3, so it's not like I didn't consider games when I bought the Wii.

author: Hexydes
title: Lots of fun
content: The Wii is a ton of fun. It's had almost 500 reviews so I'm not going to say much more because everything has been said. If you can find one, get it. You'll not regret it. It's just a really well thought out system, and of course Nintendo's first-party games are second to none.

author: ZombieMan 5000
title: Priced right for a family
content: I have two small children so our budget is not that of say a young male bachelor. If you want intense gaming with blood and guts for a hefty price tag I suggest a Xbox 360 or PS3. If you're looking for an inexpensive system to play games on with your family then the Wii is it. It my not play DVDs but that's what my DVD players for. What's the point of buying a gaming console if every time you want to play a game you have to make the kids turn off Ben 10 - The Complete Season 1? All in all this has been a lot of fun in our house.

author: S. Larrick
title: Wii is a lot of FUN
content: The Nintendo Wii is great for all ages.  So many things you can play and do with the Wii.  We have family game night.  We challenge each other to see who can get the highest score in the family.  We exercise with Wii fit and The Bigest Loser game (WHICH really kicks your butt and helps to lose weight quickly).  I think anyone that has kids should get a Wii.  Keeps the kids moving and not sitting.  Plus the games are fun for adults also.

author: Middlebunny
title: Love it!!!
content:
I just purchased this item.  I've loved video games since childhood.  I had the Pong which I think came out in the late '70s, Intellivision, Sega Genesis, Sega Saturn and loads of games for my PC.  I sort of tired of console games after a while due to the cords and the fact that I couldn't play them while sitting up in my bed.  Even when wireless capability came out, I felt that PC games were more my style.  Over the past few years, I've had issues with PC games mostly due to recurring problems with my PCs. I currently have four PCs with only two functional at present.  Neither is capable of handling games more complex that those that can be downloaded from various game websites; thus, I've been anxiously waiting to get my hands on a Wii for over a year.  One day last week, I happened to notice that Amazon had them in stock and immediately made my purchase.  It arrived last Wednesday and I'm over the moon about it.  My mom, who lives with me due to health problems and is homebound, loves it too.  I think it may be just the thing to get her up and moving.  She was simply amazed to learn that she could access the internet from the Wii.  I've already loaded her usual websites into the "Favorites" so now she doesn't have to use her laptop since the Wii webpages can be manipulated into a much larger text size than the laptop.  She also loves the way the "Weather" Channel allows you to manipulate the terrain just like the TV Weather-man with their Doppler 4000s.

Personally, I am impressed with the Shopping Channel and the ability to dowload WiiWare.  This will give me access to cool games made exclusively for the Wii without leaving my house or waiting for something to arrive in the mail.  Although the WiiSports game that came with the console is enjoyable, sports aren't one of my favorite game genres.  I do really like tennis and boxing.  I haven't been an active tennis player since my youth but I find that my old strokes and body positions can be successfully employed with the Wii.  With a little more practice using WiiSports, I might be able to handle a real court and publich scrutiny by next Summer.  Boxing is a good upper body work-out and I'm hoping it will help tone my arms and waistline.

By now, most stores have sold out of their very limited inventory of Wii systems. This is unfortunate for all those parents searching for the system; however, all is not lost.  My local grocery store was actually selling them and had two left in stock.  This is the last place I would have thought you could buy a Wii system but obviously  was wrong.  The Wii is the best thing since sliced bread.  If you're still searching for one, please don't give up.  Even if you don't manage to get one until after the holidays, you'll discover that it was worth the wait.

author: bayou_hannibal
title: Good for parties and children, lousy for everything else
content:
By now, you have probably heard all of the news stories about the sensational success of the Nintendo Wii.  It's sold out everywhere.  Grannies are playing Wii Sports in nursing homes because it's so easy to pick up and play.  But here's what you won't hear -- the Wii is a pitifully outdated piece of junk with one major gimmick (the motion control).  I'd like to see follow-up news stories about the grannies to see whether they still turn the thing on.  I know that mine now mostly collects dust, as do most other Wiis

The defining features of the Wii is its motion control.  Here's the dirty little secret that the fanboys and enthusiastic recent buyers won't tell you: the Wii controls are terrible.  I have played through a lot of games, ranging from the AAA titles like Mario Galaxy and Zelda, to the party games like Mario Party 8 and Wii Sports and I can say this -- motion control is awful.  There is absolutely no precision to it.  If you had dreams of using the Wii-mote realistically like a lightsaber, than forget it. It doesn't facilitate any kind of decent control.  The only game where motion control actually improves the gameplay is Wii Bowling.  In every other game, it's generally an annoyance that is used in gimmicky fashion.  Random button pressing has been replaced with random Wii-mote gesturing.  By the time you have played a game like Zelda or Bully for a few hours, you will be wishing that you could push buttons in lieu of waving your Wii-mote around.  This is why 90% of the software on the Wii is shovelware party games.  This is why the Wii has the lowest ratio of software to hardware sales out of the three major consoles.

Speaking of shovelware, the Wii has by far the worst library of any game console this decade.  Most of what comes out for it is unplayably bad.  There are a few great first party Nintendo titles (which are largely rehashes from prior Nintendo platforms), and a few great third party titles like Bully and Resident Evil 4 that are already available on other systems.  Every multiplatform game that comes out, whether its Madden football, Star Wars: The Force Unleashed, Guitar Hero, or a Call of Duty game, puts its worst version on the Wii.  If you don't believe me, then look up the reviews for these games.  The Wii always gets the worst version of every game.  I cannot think of one single exception to this rule.

The reason for the poor Wii software library is that the Wii is nothing mroe than a Gamecube with gimmicky motion controls.  Everything about the technology, like graphics, level size, and loading times, are bad.  The Wii sees none of the recent advances that have improved video games, like realistic physics.  Not only does the Wii not get a good version of multiplatform games, it doesn't get the great games that take advantage of modern technology.  Fallout 3, Grand Theft Auto IV, Mass Effect, Far Cry 2, Dead Space, Left 4 Dead, Assassins Creed, Portal, Half-Life 2.  You cannot play these great games on the Wii.  Want to know why? Because they won't work on the Wii's 2001-esque technology.  You can't get downloadable content for Rock Band on the Wii.  Why? Because it lacks a hard drive.

Two years ago, the price point for the Wii was a major selling point, but now that that PC hardware, the XBox 360, and the PS3 have dropped in price, this is no longer much of an advantage.  You can actually get a barebones XBox 360 for $50 less than a Wii now.

The only people for whom I would recommend this console are:

A:  People with children between the ages of 3 and 10
B:  People who have lots of social gatherings at their house.

The Wii is a good console for children because of the simplicity of the games, and the motion controls do add a certain element of fun when you are playing with other people.  I must say that the times where my in-laws have come over have seen the Wii get a lot of use.  Other than that, not much.  My wife plays the Lego games with me, but you can get that game on other platforms with better graphics.

I bought a Wii about 8 months ago, and I'm thinking about selling it now.  I got some enjoyment out of it, but now I hardly ever turn it on.  The PC provides a much better gaming experience for me, and now I'm considering getting a PS3 or an XBox 360 instead.

author: TheRightAnswer
title: Overhyped and Not worth it
content: Quite honestly my wii is now gathering dust on my shelf right now due to its horrible game options and graphics. The sensor doesnt pick up half my movements and the remote is shaped in such a way that it is uncomfortable to hold. I first bought it thinking it was a revolution, but its so basic that the technology isnt even worth it. Buy an Xbox or Ps3 if your a family gamer and just buy some games from their online stores which have a lot to offer. If you a gamer you should know that this is a skull and crossbones for you. Trust me within a month you'll be fed up with this....

author: A. M. Whittemore

author: Monica

author: Mark
title: Wii wins!!!
content: I have to say, this is the best console (in terms of overall playing), of the 7th gen consoles. The motion sensor controllers are so much fun. The overall controls for wii games are pretty easy to pick up and they are addictive! I have been playing for a couple days now, and gameplay never gets boring. One of my friends got a PS3 a few weeks ago, and it's good too. He bought the system, an extra controller a game and an HDMI cable (required for HD gaming, no it's not really HD out of the box), and it cost him about $850-900 dollars. Ouch! The graphics rock, but that's really what you're paying for. Unless you have an HDTV, there is NO reason to get a PS3. I'm not a guy who's big on grpahics though, I care about how much fun it is. I mean I can live with halfway decent graphics.  Most people don't use the PS3 storing movies and whatnot, that's why we have normal computers. I had more fun playing the wii than I did his PS3. The wii also gets internet and you can freely browse all web pages (the PS3 does that). Also, you can buy a wii component cable for 10 bucks for people who have HDTV's, it'll improve the graphics. For anyone who wants an affordable, easy to learn, fun, new console, the wii is for you.

author: SallyCat

The graphics seem to put you right in the game especially the racing games.  All of you out there probably already have a Wii but even if you don't, invest and get one because it's fun for the whole family.

author: zack
title: Broke the day i recieved it
content: I played Wii Sports for about an hour and turned off the console to do some homework. When I finished the homework about 45 min. after turning off the console my roomate and I decided to play Wii bowling. I turned on the console and the start screen came up as usual. When i selected the disc it began as if it were reading the disc and about to start up. However, about 20sec later a black screen with white text came up reading there was an error with the disc reader. After unplugging, resetting, turning off for 5 min, taking the disc out, etc. I tied a differnt disc. Same error. I called Nintendo and they said they would send me a new Wii Sports, but i told them i had tried other games and it didnt work. I did not see the point in having them send me another Wii Sports. Long story short. I enjoyed this $90 game system for exactly an hour before it crapped out. Much to my dismay It still doesn't work.

author: Shannon L. Swint
title: The Wii is awesome!
content: purchased the Wii for christmas for my 8yr old daughter. However, we all use it. It is a great tool for those who don't get out of the house much. As for me I work out of my home so I don't get a chance to get out much so I use the Wii for excercise.WE mostly play the Just Dance game, or the Wii fitness. It really works...

author: C. Leiby
title: Just waiting for some games
content:
I've owned the Wii for about 6 months now and I wouldn't trade it for a 360 or PS3 for anything.  I love the way that the controllers make every game more interactive.  I've yet to play anything that didn't play better, or was at least more satisfying, when I played it standing on my feet.

And those same controls have already sucked in several family members who wouldn't otherwise dream of playing a video game.  But they all love the Wii.

Definitely, there's been a dearth of decent games (particularly those that really take good advantage of the controller).  But there have been enough to tide me and my Wii-lovin' 5-year-old over until we get some goodies later this year.  My X-mas list is already locked in at a single item: Guitar Hero 3.

If you've got a family, or if you're just tired of the same-old-same-old in console gaming, get yourself a Wii.  You won't regret it.

author: Mike
title: 14-year video game playing hiatus is over!
content:
I hadn't played a new actual video game in 14 years. No joke!

I was a huge fan of the SNES/NES as a kid. I played those systems all throughout my childhood. The N64 came out when I was about 16, but I never got into what the video game scene became. Video games seemed to become for harcore kids who were really into games and storylines. I never enjoyed games that required such involvement and depended on high quality graphics. Since I used to like to play video games, I loved games that had game PLAY. I really feel many games of recent years focused on new graphics and involvement (thousands of hours, etc.) and forgot about fun.

Then I got the Wii.

I waited a few years because I had long given up on video games. Now, I can't put the thing down. Between Wii Sports and Mario Kart Wii, I am now excited to play video games again. I think Nintendo not only has a hit, but has broken a huge demographic barrier and has created a long term trend. It has once again made video games useable for all ages and people. That's the way to a successful product.

My only dissapointment with the system is lack of a DVD player, but again, watching DVDs on a game system needlessly uses it for something it wasn't designed to do.

If you ever liked video games, buy the Wii. The 1995-2006 demographic of hard core videogamers will be dissapointed. Everyone else will love it!

author: iHyphy
title: Nintendo Wii
content: if your wondering which system to buy your kid...well, you should try asking them? hahaha, really though i bought this for my 3 1/2 year old daughter after i found out how much she had fun playing it at her mom's friend's house.  Her mom told me she was able to pick it up and play...i dont know if my daughter is a "baby einstein" but i think this is a perfect toy for a kid

author: Shevi
title: Wii love it!
content:
The Wii gaming system is different from any other gaming system. It starts, of course, with the user interface. The fact that you move your body to control the game differentiates it from all other gaming systems. But that's just the beginning. The Nintendo Wii is designed for a different kind of gamer. Games for the Wii are often more family-friendly and often they encourage group play. Games like Wii Sport, for example, let you play tennis by yourself or with a friend, and the let you compete to see who can score the highest in bowling. While other gaming systems concentrate on shoot `em ups and role-playing games for serious adult gamers, the Wii system is designed with everyone in mind, young and old.

The Nintendo Wii gaming system is very easy to set up. One small problem we encountered is the unit's tendency to overheat. I highly recommend buying a cooling unit to go with your Nintendo Wii. (We have yet to find a good charging station for the Wii-motes, as they are called. The Wii-motes eat up batteries very quickly, so this would be a great thing to have. The trouble is finding one.)

Of course, a gaming system is nothing without the right games to play on it. A few of our favorites include Wii Fit, Animal Crossing, Karaoke Revolution, Guitar Hero, Lego Indiana Jones, and Raving Rabbits TV Party. Everyone has his or her personal favorite, but we have yet to find anyone who doesn't want to play a game on our Wii: from the kids to the grandparents, and everyone in between.

Of course one of the most incomprehensible things about the Wii, is that the system which is better --for most people--than all the other gaming systems on the market, actually costs less. If you want a gaming system the entire family will enjoy, I recommend the Wii. I think you'll love it as much as we do.

author: Susan E. Caldwell
title: Gift for older brother
content: I have a Wii Fit Plus and wanted the same for my older brother.  Since he did not have the console yet, I had to find it first.  I knew he would never buy one for himself, but he has loved it!  His birthday is Feb. 15 and it took almost a month to find it in stock and at the right price.

I'm not a gamer, and I didn't play a long time ago!
Wii is different and I think if you are not a really addict to play you will love it!

author: Kenneth Meyers
title: Three Stars
content: returned it my 6y son buy this with out my knowing

author: Jennfer Lawmaster
title: ... not a big deal considering you can get them pretty cheap anymore) the console itself as well as everything ...
content: Other than the control doesn't seem to work (which was not a big deal considering you can get them pretty cheap anymore) the console itself as well as everything else that came with it worked just fine & was in such good condition for the price I have absolutely no complaints! I'm completely satisfied & couldn't be happier with this purchase!

author: Hope it helped
title: Great, but not perfect.
content:
I finally got my hands on a Wii after all this time and to be honest, I could've waited longer. As great as some of the games are, there are very few of them and the unique control scheme only dazzles you for so long. There's lots of great games on the horizon and this system is the ONLY place you'll find games like Zelda, mario and Metroid. On top of that, with the wii network where you can download hundreds of retro games, it has the largest library of games hands down, so long as you don't have any of the past systems/games that they came out on.

In the end, this game shows lots of promise, but so far hasn't quite lived up to the hype yet

author: carlana
title: Well worth the money
content: Bought this for my sisters 4 kids to share for Christmas and I was their favorite person... It came with everything I needed besides games and extra controllers but I knew I needed to get them. It looked great and worked even better.

author: Dennis A. Robertson
title: Wonderful Creation
content: Welcome to the wave of the future. . . I Love it!  Although they didn't spend the time and money on whiz-bang graphics, who cares!  This is so much fun, you'll never miss it.  I'm sure the next generation of consoles will be all things.  I own XBOX 360, PS3, and a Wii, by far the MOST fun for the whole famile:  Wii.

author: Summeroz
title: FUN FUN FUN!!! For ALL levels!
content: My heyday of video game mastery is when the Super NES was the cutting edge.  I excelled at Super Mario and Zelda.  However as the years passed and video games became more advanced I have been unable to finish the simplest of games.  That is no longer true!  The Wii is a fun filled little machine.  It is so tiny it takes up almost no space.  Better than that it is fun!  Me the video klutz can now play video games and well.  The remote is very easy to use.  You just point, swing, twirl and all other sorts of moves.  My five year old nephew can play the system just as easily and my husband who really wanted a PS3 also enjoys the Wii.  Thee Wii is able to satisfy all skill levels of gamers and it is a lot cheaper than the competition.  If you want something you, your friends, your kids and your parents can play the Wii is the game consul to get.

author: Karlos S. Dodson
title: Not Properly Tested
content: When I received this used Wii I was able to use it with an older game. Once I tried the game with one of our newer games the system requested that I update it. When I tried to updated it Wii issued an error code stating that it will not update because the machine was "hacked" by its previous owner.  Please test items from this seller immediately. I was unable to return the product for a reimbursement even though I was within the timeframe to do so.

author: phyllis jackson
title: Five Stars
content: great

author: Sheldon
title: Five Stars
content: Great price. Shipped fast.

author: 007cwz
title: The Wii was a great family entertainment system, and a lot of great games were made for it!!
content: I bought the Wii since I enjoyed getting to play with family and friends and there were a lot of good games released for the system. The Internet and add on features worked nicely!! Nintendo did a good job with the Wii system

author: Joern
title: hard to get but worth the effort
content: it needs a bit luck to get it at the regular price. I suggest you search for a "wii tracker" at google - they really work. In my case Amazon had it in stock for 14 mins after I checked the tracker - BUT it's worth the effort at the original price. The family loves it. It is a pity that they only ship it with 1 set of controllers, because the big fun only starts when playing with groups or at a party. To get a second controller I suggest you buy Wii Play instead of a single controller - better value.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: great!

author: Dino
title: Five Stars
content: very nice.

author: K. Beard
title: Fun
content: Got the Wii to get Wii Fit for days when I can't do my normal exercise routine. So far so good. Don't know if I'll ever play any other games, but enjoy using the Wii Fit.

author: Erika
title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
content: LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE it! It is so much fun, especially if you get the balance board, nunchuk, and mario kart wheel!  My recommended games are Just Dance 3 and 4, Gold's Gym Cardio Workout (with nunchuk), Zumba II, Mario Kart, and the Wii Fit with balance board.  Please do yourself a favor and buy this gaming system: your life will be enriched to the max!

author: N. Durham
title: Man this is fun
content: I'll admit I was skeptical at first, but I have to say that Nintendo's wonderous Wii is a sight to behold.  The motion sensored remote controls may seem gimmicky at first, and even hard to get a hold of for some, but once you get the hang of it, you'll be immersed in some of the most intuitive gaming unlike anything else you've experienced.  And unlike the PS3, the Wii features a bevy of excellent launch titles, and many of them are exclusive to the system.  The Wii includes Wii Sports, which is a great showcase for just what this system is capable of.  The game itself is a nice distraction and a taste of things to come for the system.  Yeah, the graphics aren't mouthwatering like what you see on the XBox 360 or Playstation 3, and it doesn't have all the bells and whistles that the other systems have either, but it's the games that make the system worth owning.  The Wii is compatiable with Gamecube games and controlers, plus it also features the ability to go online to the Wii's "Virtual Console" and download classic NES, Super NES, and Nintendo 64 games, as well as Genesis and Turbo-Grafx 16 titles; which in itself is an awesome extra that may rival that of XBox Live Arcade, maybe.  The list of first party games are great, including Excite Truck and of course Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess, and third party titles like Rayman Raving Rabbids, Marvel: Ultimate Alliance, Call of Duty 3, Super Monkey Ball Banana Blitz, and Madden '07 all fit in quite well on the Wii.  Upcoming titles like Super Mario Galaxy and the next installment in the Metroid Prime series, make purchasing the Wii all the sweeter, and the ultra affordable price should help seal the deal.  Yes, some people won't get the controls, and many may be turned off by the lack of mature games, but for what it's worth, the Wii is the best thing Nintendo has crafted in a while.  All in all, if you're looking for a next-gen system with a ton of potential, the Wii is a glimpse at what the future of gaming could be.

author: Kino Kahona
title: Nintendo came back HARD! Unbelieveable... a true gaming Revolution!
content:
I have to say, I am completely speechless on how MUCH FUN the Wii is. When you get the wiimote in your hands and maneuver the pointer on the screen for the first time you suddenly realize that you are in for a nice treat. It just feels so good and natural! When you play shooting games such as Call of Duty 3 or Red Steel, you feel like you are actually pointing and aiming at your enimies; not just pressing buttons! The accuracy of the controls are surprisingly truthful to your movements. If the games right now after launch are pretty good in controls just wait until winter 2007 after game developers have had time to tweek and get the full hang of this new technology. WHOA! Look out for some serious gaming experience!

The included Wii Sports game with the console is a top notch move by Nintendo. True, the game is simple. Yet because of this I was questioning the shrill excitment people are getting when they play the game. I thought to myself "yeah, I know it must be great to play videogame tennis, baseball, golf, etc in a completely different way but why all the fuss over it"? I didn't understand this untill I actually got my hands on my new Wii and tried the game myself. Whoa! I was completely floored! This title is quite entertaining, in fact it can be the main show of a party by itself! You can have four wiimotes thus four players challenging each other on a 2 by 2 tennis match and much more. Believe me, you will have a good time with this title especially when you "get the feel" for the game (you will know this when you start sweating).

The system itself is very quite, almost producing no sound at all except the occational short buzzes of the CD motor.

The ability to create Miis, that is, little customizable characters that you create to portray your character in a game is again simple but remarkable. I love the Virtual Console games that you can download for a small fee. The only downside currently is that if your game system gets defective and you get a replacement you cannot transfer your Virtual Console games to the new system; they die with the broken one. I do hope Nintendo will work a way around this in the near future though.

Overall, I am IN LOVE with the Nintendo Wii for its innovative controlling system, Virtual Console game downloads, ability to create characters to play in certain games, access internet through your existing broadband connection, free internet play, cheap price, and SO much more! I just don't know how Nintendo does it. One thing is for sure; This is the start of a gaming Revolution - an entirely new way to play and view games. Though, does this new revolution bond with the public? Just take a look at  Amazon.com's customer reviews and product rating of the system and you'll get your answer. Soon, Nintendo's competitors will follow this or similar technology but nontheless, the world will still know about the original and legendary company that started it all. Congratulations and best of wishes, Nintendo!

author: Mr. W
title: Just a kids' console?  I think not!
content: The Wii is the best console for all ages.  It has games for all, for the kiddies, and elderly it has Wii sports, etc.  For the mature, there's RE4, RE: UC, Red Steel, Bwii, Metroid Prime 3, etc.  So don't let some PS3 fanboy spamming the Wii forums with repetitive posts (at a time when GHIII is dominating on the Wii, while the PS3 version just seems to stay on the shelf) delude your decision with their extremely expensive console!  Bottom line, Wii rules, PS3 employees invade the Wii and PS3 forums on amazon to swade people to buy the extremely expensive/lacking originality PS3.  Wii>PS3

author: Stefanie J. Bailey
title: Didn't come as expected. Missing flap on unit making ...
content: Didn't come as expected.  Missing flap on unit making it look used at poorly taken care of.

author: Katelynn koch
title: One Star
content: Product doesn't even work.

author: Patricia A. Mattes
title: We love the Wii
content:
The wii came in the mail very quickly and in very good condition. However when we set it up, it was defective. We contacted the customer service department at Nintendo and they e-mailed us a shipping label so we could return it for a new set. Everyone was very nice to us through this ordeal. We cannot wait to get the new game back. They told us it would take about 3 weeks so we have another 1 1/2 weeks to wait.
Thank you Amazon for your good service and quick shipping of my purchases
Sincerely
Patricia Mattes

author: J. Marshall
title: If you can get one, they're amazingly fun
content: It was quite a challenge to find a Wii, even a holiday season after their initial release.  The search was well worth the time.  While is was suppose to be a holiday present, no one could hold back the urge to hook it up and start playing it now.  Everyone in the family enjoys the interactie and, at times, excerising gameplay.  If you find one, even if it mean hanging out in front of your local Best Buy, Circuit City, or Wal-mart, do it!

author: Corine Bulpin
title: Broke within 10 months of purchasing
content: Barely used, had parental controls that restricted our use to use the Internet, had to pay to reset it, the next day it has no video or audio input to the TV. It's completely fried.

author: Christian Bodet
title: Five Stars
content: great product

author: David Gordon Wilson
title: Wii
content: Our daughter, 13, wanted Wii basic, and I bought it for her in some irritation.  But she has enjoyed it immensely with her friends and family and by herself for far longer than I thought possible. It is very well done.

author: Robert E. Aune
title: Wii: another great game consol by nintendo
content:
Everyone had been raving about the wii, and i had played it numerous times. I bought one at an EBGames store and it rocks!!!!! i got mine with zelda twilight princess.
some good titles for wii include
1. Zelda twilight princess
2. Wii Sports (which comes with it)
3. Pokemon Battle REv.
4. Wii play( which comes with a free wiimote!)
5. Excite Truck
6. Rayman: RR
7 mario party
8. mario strikers
9. Metroid prime 3
and many more!!!!!!

author: James Kaufman
title: Wii - It's Fun!
content: Wii is a lot of fun.  It's easy to set up and you can be playing in minutes.  The Wii Sports games it comes with are fun to play and can give you quite a workout!  We also purchased an extra controller with the Wii Play package, and the controller recharging station (highly recommend both).  CAUTION when buying additonal games.  Shortly after getting our Wii we purchased the M&M's Go Kart race game.  In a word, it SUCKS.  You can't make the cars turn as described in the instructions and hence the game is virtually unplayable.  Tried to take it back but can't.  Moral of the story:  Know what games you are buying before laying out the $40++ for one.  Other than that, we are really happy with the Wii!!!

author: Bryan K. Bailey
title: Wiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiii ! ! !
content:
When this console went on sale, I sat up all night and into the mid-morning staring at it on Amazon pressing F5 every few seconds waiting for it to be available.  Got it for my boy for Christmas and now I hover in the hall waiting for him to start playing so I can grab my remote and join in!  This console is so much fun!  It is refreshingly different playing on a console that doesn't rely on an analog stick and button mashing.  I was concerned the controllers would be awkward and hard to get used to but within ten minutes the boy and I were right at home with it.  The console, so far, seems extremely stable with not a single glitch or freeze-up on any game wii have played.  By the way, if you get a Wii you gotta get Rayman Raving Rabbids!  Yes I'm 42 years old but it's my favorite.  Also, if you get a Wii, go ahead and get an extra set of controllers.

Was it worth sitting up all night staring at Amazon?  OH YEAH!

author: Joe Bohenick
title: Wii
content: I returned it. The used Wii (which I bought) only allows you to save six files. Buy a new one instead.

author: Jay Kaplowitz
title: it's not about the system...it's about the individual game
content:
When will people realize that it's not the system that sucks, it's the game.  It's up to the individual studio's to put out a good game.  Take ps3 for instance, while it can display in 1080p, it's the game that decides what resolution it is, not the system.

I own a wii.  Twilight Princess is amazing, Mario Galaxy is amazing, Metroid is perfect.  These are big budget titles that have huge production values.  It's the game, not the wii.  Third party mini-game titles are not the entire systems worth.  Do your homework on the games and you'll see.

author: J. Neal
title: Wii Love
content: I love the wii. It's fun and easy and the whole family can join in. My grandmothers both loved it. One of my grandmothers had even bought herself one. She was sick with cancer, but could still play it from time to time. Bowling is an all time family favorite.

author: jvarner64
title: Beyond my expectations
content: This delivery went beyond my expectations. The wii was in nearly perfect condition and came with everything I needed and more! My family has been having a great time playing it in the living room and I am so glad I made this choice. If someone is looking for a wii to buy get it from this seller!

author: TLizzard
title: Wii is fun for everyone
content: My stepson really wanted this and so we got him this for Christmas.  This unit is so fun even the grandparents can get involved.  We have had so much enjoyment playing different games and sports.  Would definitely recommend to anyone.

author: rrh
title: Very Happy Family
content:
This gift came from Santa.  This was the best Christmas present that my children have every had. I do recommend 7 years and up because you have to remember to wear the strap with some of the games.  We really get into the game and we are glad that the new straps on the remotes work to keep the remote in your hands when you swing the bat or other moves in games.

Santa bought this game to get five members of the family off their rearends and playing sitting video games.  It worked to get a disabled member of the family active. It was a great form of physical therapy without it feeling like it.

This game is the ultimate gift if you want a Christmas to remember.  I do agree with the fact is for players 7-100.

author: V. Johnson
title: Great way for her to be
content: Christmas present for my mother. Great way for her to be active

author: Christina Williams
title: Five Stars
content: Item was exactly described by seller. Would buy again :)

author: KK
title: Too much fun
content: My husband and I just picked this up with the Sports game included.  I had heard that some fitness gyms have started to include the Wii Sports, so I thought that maybe we should give it a try.  We are 50+ couch potatoes that really need to start getting into some activity.  My husband can't get enough of the bowling and golf and I love the boxing.  I'm sure neither one of us will be able to move tomorrow, but it will be Sat. and we'll have some time to recover by Mon.  I really think that we'll be able to keep this up.  It is so much fun.

author: looneytoonfan
title: Nintendo Wii is addicting
content: We got this and hooked it up in just a few minutes with no problems. Once we put in Wii Sports we could not stop playing it. Bowling is addicting and we can't stop playing it. You won't be disappointed in getting one of these systems.

author: pamila
title: Four Stars
content: IT LOOKED BRAND NEW, SO I WAS HAPPY

author: LYNN GOLDBERG GUGLIELMO
title: Terrible Product
content: No peripherals meaning you have to buy many different accessories adding to a much higher cost and some of the accessories aren't being made anymore except for cheap Chinese knock offs. The product was dirty; I could scratch the dirt off with my finger - disgusting! The flap covering the cable outlets is missing.

author: kira
title: excellent for stretches
content:
After only a few days of using Wii-Fit, my back pain was nearly gone.  Adding this to my gym workout is making all the difference. I rushed out and got Dance Dance Revolution and Just Dance. Using this in conjunction with the gym is improving my posture and flexibility.
You do a fit test and sit up your Mii avatar not just for you but for your pet!  Your avatar picks up your pet's and you do a weigh in.  You get fitness tips as well.
This product is worth the money.

author: Making something simple complicated
title: United Gameplay
content: This is the best system ever! Nintendo really scored with this one. It really gets you in the game. No other system out there can compare to the Wii. It's fun, inexpensive (unlike the other ones), and gets you moving instead of sitting on your rear end. My whole family likes the Wii. My mother and aunt aren't really gamers but they totally fell in love with the Wii. I now have a hard time to get them off of it because they constantly want to play Wii Sports. My aunt constantly says "it's fun" and "I like it". Also the photo channel is excellent great way of viewing photos with a large crowd around. I can't get enough of it either. Great system for the whole family to enjoy. Non-stop family fun.

author: CHRISTINA HARLES
title: Five Stars
content: Missed my wii - this one works great!

author: leon simmons jr
title: Five Stars
content: Good product fast shipping

author: Kindle Customer
title: Wii LOVE THIS THING!
content: So, I've never been a big gamer because we just weren't raised with them.  Since Mom was a kindergarten teacher, if it didn't have an obvious "learning" factor, then it wasn't brought into the house and she despised pretty much all electronics including the TV much less games!  So, now many many years later, I finally bought my first game console thinking it'd be more for my husband than for me.  Little did I know that I'd be virtually addicted to it in no time flat!  I love the fact that it's wireless!  Less mess especially from all the spilled drinks and so much safer than tripping over all the cords ... and with no cords draped across the room, my cats aren't drawn to them for chewing.  Yes, my reluctance to get into gaming because all the costs add up is still very real because when you get the base set, you immediately want to buy extra remotes and nunchucks and the charging station and the wheels and the fitness stuff and heaven forbid you forget just the cost of the games alone.  However, it's become so much fun and since it's really rather portable, we've taken it almost everywhere to entertain ourselves, our friends, the kids and anyone else that shows up.  There just seems to be something for everyone!  We even took it to a funeral where there were going to be some rather bored people eventually - we just set it up to the TV they had in the "Family Room" & people would pick a game here or there to relieve a little stress!

author: Victor Mejia
title: Get Up Off the Couch!
content:
I have to agree with most of the folks here and say that this is a great game console. It doesn't have all the technological bells and whistles like true HD capability (it's only 480p), has limited internet access and doesn't play other media like DVDs (but it does play GameCube games). But it is fun.

I like the fact that you need to get up off the couch and play these games. Remember when games meant physical activity instead of sitting on a couch pressing buttons? Well, here's a game console that actually encourages physical activity. If you're a parent that wants to encourage physical activity to your kids, this is the console for you.

There are a few things to note though:
1.If you have a mounted flat screen TV, the included wired Wii sensor will be problematic. The wire won't be long enough to snake through a wall and into your A/V rack. Fortunately, a few companies have like Nyko have produced wireless sensor options. They have it here in Amazon.
2.If you want to get the most out of the Wii in terms of image fidelity for your HDTV you'll need to get component cables. These cables will allow the Wii to send 480p signals to your HDTV. Nintendo didn't bundle component cables with the Wii. You can purchase the Nintendo component cables or you can get third party options. All of which are available for purchase here at Amazon.
3.For all those who are finding it hard to get a Wii, try checking the online and brick and mortar stores on Wednesdays and Thursdays. That's usually when shipments arrive.

Now don't get me wrong. I'm not saying that the PS3 and the XBox 360 don't have their place. Both of those gaming consoles have media center-like capabilities that the Wii can't touch. In the case of the PS3, it's Blu-Ray player. But that isn't the demographic Nintendo was aiming for with this product. It was aiming for the family gaming market. And in THAT market, the Wii excels.

author: wayneco
title: Family Fun
content: DH was able to hook this up in no time; easy to set up.  My family spent hours playing with the games that come with the Wii!  Easy enough for a young child to use, yet fun for the seniors.  (A very young child, age 3, did have difficulty operating the Wii remote, but we are not an experienced gaming family.) We had trouble activating a second remote when using some other Wii games (not with the ones that came with the Wii; they make it easy to use another remote).  After doing a little online research, I easily figured out how to do this.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Works Great
content: Works great! Have played for several hours on it so far and have come across no problems. I was a little skeptical buying a used Wii after the last used Wii i purchased ended up not working but that was not the case with this one. It came on time, well packaged, and fairly clean. Overall very happy with the product and the seller

author: M. Harling
title: for those who cannot get about...
content: I have had MS for 20 years, but over the last year I have become unable to drive because of visual problems.  I used to swim every day at the Y but I can no longer get there and, having encountered the wii at a physical therapy unit, I started campaigning to get one for my birthday.  Well, I have it now and I couldn't be more pleased.  I used to be a pretty good tennis player, now I can play again - SITTING DOWN!  I'm also improving rapidly at bowling and golf, still some way to go at baseball and boxing.  Best of all, I can compete with my husband and even beat him sometimes!

author: Concerned Father
title: The most affordable fun you can buy
content:
Wii Sports (the game that comes with the syste) is a great game to use as a party game or a game that allows you to get some exercise.  The innovative controllers make this system completely different from any other game system.  Swing the controller slow, fast, with a twist, it all makes a difference.  Some games let you use the controller as a pointer.  The price is very reasonable for the most fun system you can own.

Even if you have another system, you owe it to yourself to get a Wii just for the different experience it provides.

author: Pouhana
title: Wii
content: Brought the Wii game so I could have access to Netflicks.  Shipping was fast.  Hooked the Wii up to my TV and was able access NetFlicks right away.

author: Michelle - Seacoast NH
title: The Wii is fun, but I'm not paying gougers on Amazon.
content: I played the Wii with my kids over Thanksgiving break.  It was a lot of fun!  My kids are now hoping to get one for Christmas. Starting at midnight on black friday, I have tried to get them one.  No go.  It seems that the manufacturers of these products play games with children's holiday wishes in trying to create a sense of urgency about these toys.  The gougers who buy these things up and sell them at more than double when they are out of stock everywhere are not getting a penny from me.  It is just a video game, after all.  I'm surprised Amazon participates in this sort of thing.  These people are holding kids' most sought after toys for ransom.  My kids will be getting sports equipment and ipods this year.

author: pegleg buyer
title: Awesome system
content: Bought this for my son and he loves it. Perfect condition and plays great!

author: S7Jordan
title: Good clean fun for all ages
content: Jump on the bandwagon and get a Wii system!  Good clean fun for all ages, easy to use, can turn even a non-gamer into a fan!  I highly recommend the Wii.

author: mary
title: great fun
content: great fun still going strong

author: Nancy J.
title: ... for a group of developmentally disabled people and they LOVE it. It helps with concentration
content: I purchased this for a group of developmentally disabled people and they LOVE it.  It helps with concentration, balance, coordination and socializing.  They all gather around to cheer each other on.

author: Amazon Customer
title: One Star
content: Didn't work at all.

author: Cassandra
title: One Star
content: It was dirty and sticky. I didn't say anything about missing doors and it had missing doors.

author: HomerKSA
title: Finall the Console for the rest of us!
content:
All right Husbands and wives...mothers and daughters...fathers and sons! single or still in harmony of suburban bliss.  If and when we all adults end up trying to find ways around healthy fun and family entertainment, I think Nintendo nailed it!

This is a console like no other. We all have busy working and family styles and its no different anymore in this part of the world either. The best thing I like about the pre-tense of this platform is its non-hard-core-gaming affinity for the never really played games crowed category; or complex gaming systems that would drive any new comer to gaming insanity.

I like the simplicity of the game that is included with the machine: WII SPORTS!  Ii had my share of hard core gaming on the PC and PS2. However when I try to play these high end games, I honestly do not have the time or willingness to finish them. The one game I am absolutely looking forward to is Star Wars unleashed!  Which is coming sometime next year I think

Anyhow, fantastic gaming console. Its for anyone new to gaming or reborn into video gaming. Has that old arcade feel to it; especially the simpler games. Fun for all the family.

author: Tara Bishop
title: Nintendo Wii
content: I got this system for my 8 year old son as a reward for his great report card.  To my surprise, the whole family has loved this system.  We have competitions in on the sports games - we all created look-a-like Wii characters which makes it especially fun.  We also created look-a-like characters of Grandparents and Aunts and Uncles.  To our delight, they all ended up on our "Baseball team."  It was really cool to see "Grandpa" hit a home-run!

author: Melissa
title: no
content: it doesnt work it comes in black and white.......... and belive me i have tried everything it would take to try to fix it!

author: Christopher J. Lang
title: Praise was warranted, criticism overplayed...
content:
First off, the "innovative controllers" we've been hearing about for months are truly what they were billed as:  intuitive, active, and innovative.  WiiSports, Zelda TP, and Trauma Center are incredibly fun.  Zelda is beautiful to look at, no matter what the "graphical limitations" of the Wii are.

Secondly, the games I list above make full use of the new control setup.

For the price, the Wii is a remarkable setup.  You might not have the "flashiness" of the 360 or PS3, but trust me...having seen all three side-by-side running Madden '07, the graphical difference is more Dreamcast/PS2 than PS1/PS2.

Anyone who's seen Resident Evil 4 on Gamecube, should be excited about what Nintendo will be able to do with this system.

author: J. Blanke
title: YES
content:
The Wii is the second tv game console I have owned and every single penny I put towards it was worth it. I got mine about a year and a half ago. I got at costco in a bundle with an extra wii remote and Legend of Zelda Twilight Princess for 300 bucks. That's a whole fifty dollars off. The new graphics for the Wii are a huge step away from the gamecube. The quality of the games and video is purely sweet eye candy. Many people say the the remotes don't work or that the games are all for little kids but that isn't true. All of the games I own (which is a lot) are definently not for kids.
The Wii menu is as cool as can be. I highly reccomend connecting your wii to the internet so you can buy games and surf the internet on your own console right from the living room. Sadly the internet channel costs 500 points or five dollars but it's worth it. Also the Wii comes with a lot of free storage space so you probably won't have to get a memory card for a while.
GET IT CAUSE IT IS AWESOME!!!

author: AlyB
title: Five Stars
content: Great product! Works great! Thank you!

author: kauna13
title: love it so much i bought it twice
content:
This is my second Wii. I sold one a while back and got an Xbox w/ kinect. I was dumb. I missed the Wii immediately. I gave the xbox a fair amount of time, but ended up selling it too and getting another Wii.
It's all a matter of preference I think. I'm not a big online player and I don't like a lot of the popular xbox war-style games. I prefer puzzles and the classics *Mario!!
:)

author: leurys
title: leurys rodriguez
content: wii console is good, but not satisfied with the purchase, since I received the console and the gear had broken console tube to pay for repairs, the price to pay was 36 dollars, the console is repaired and works well .

author: Doobie
title: Like the iPod, but for game consoles
content: Ok, I'd like to say that I'm not a Nintendo fanboy.  Although I am a fan of their handhelds, the first console I got was a Gamecube, and I frankly was not impressed.  There was nothing to distinguish it from it's competitors (besides a lack of features), and it's game library was underwhelming.  That said, the Wii is the coolest system that I have ever had the joy of playing.  It's amazing.  I think this console is destined to become the iPod of videogames, something that revolutionizes an entire industry and basically takes over.  If it doesn't, whatever.  It's very compact and well designed, but it's what's under the hood that counts.  By now, you've heard that it's not about graphics, but a new way to control your games.  And people will say that it's just 'Cube technology with motion controls.  Well, those people are incredibly wrong.  The remote and the nunchuk are incredibly intuitive and fun to use.  Just fire up tennis in Wii sports and you'll see what I mean.  My mom tried it last night, and we were both having a blast.  Try that with a PS3 or XB360.  And it's not just for casual gamers.  The Legend of Zelda is about as hardcore as gaming gets, and it controls very well on this system.  But I think my favorite thing besides the control is the channel system.  Wehn you boot it up, the Wii displays a number of "channels" that you can choose.  There's the gaming channel, obviously, but then there's also an internet browsing channel, a virtual console channel (to buy old console classics), and news and weather channels.  These all work really well, and the news and weather channels are especially useful.  Best of all, it's all so streamlined.  Basically, if you are on the fence, don't be.  This system just launched, and it's already sold millions.  And with a great lineup of quality games this year (Sonic the Hedgehog, SSX, Prince of Persia, Metroid Prime 3, Super Smash Bros., Super Mario Galaxy, etc.), hopefully there won't be a software drought like with the last console, and there will be increased 3rd party support.  So what are you waiting for?  Go have some fun!

author: vikings
title: Ed Milhimes
content: Order came without games. Showed games on box cover when order was procesed where are my wii sports games this pisses me off.Ben from amazon called the same day to correct the problem,He showed me that people do care this is great,very profesional. THANKS

author: Eric L. Mccormick
title: Wii would like to play
content: This is the first game console I actually bought new for myself.  A few years back I bought a gamecube for a girlfriend(so I no long have access to that), before that I bought a PS1(at a yard sale) but never got any games for it.  Before that my parents for me a Nintendo (original NES) for my birthday and before that an Atari 2600.  I still have my NES and Atari and they work but I never play them because my computer games are just much better.  Maybe one day I can sell them for a lot of money for being in good condition and antiques.  But until then, I will play with Wii.  I was thinking about an Xbox or PS3 but they all have the same type of games as they always do, maden this or halo that.  There are a lot of sports and first person shooters.  Howeve I am not a big sports fan and my girlfriend will just complain if I'm playing RPGs all day.  Now we have games we can play together.  Not only does she like to play but even my parents like to play too.  My mom though she would hate it but once she started bowling, she was having a good time.  My dad actually wanted me to leave the game syetem over at his place so he could play more.  Now home many dads play their sons in games on an xbox360 or ps3?  If you are looking for a game system with an interface like you have never experienced get this, its fun, cheap and you won't loose your girlfriend over video games.

author: Glenn D. Rogers
title: Excellent
content: Fast shipping, easy to hook-up and fun to use. The Wii fit pogram is great.

author: S. Seneca
title: Love our Wii.
content: We love it. Many many many uses out of it, still going strong more than a year later, no issues!!!!

author: William Parks
title: Great, imperfect system
content:
There's a reason there's so much hype around the Wii - it's simple, fun, and intuitive.  It lends itself well to a pick-up-and-play mentality, with no shortage of minigames available.  There are a few things to consider before purchasing one, though.

First is the Nintendo Factor.  Nintendo is very well-known for having weak support from other developers.  If you owned a Nintendo 64 or Gamecube, you might remember waiting 3 or 4 months between triple-A titles, and that hasn't changed.  If anything, it's worse, as the motion-sensing controls require developers to both think of an innovative design to incorporate them, and smoothly put them into the game.  Not everyone's up to the challenge.  The flip side of the Nintendo Factor is that you get Nintendo's first-party titles, which consistently shine as some of the best games on the market.  Super Mario Galaxy, Metroid Prime 3, Zelda: Twilight Princess, Super Smash Brothers Brawl - very safe bets.

If you like playing online, the Wii is a big disappointment.  Guitar Hero III has online play, and so will Smash Brothers, but that's about it.  This is a far cry from what you'll get on the other consoles.  The Virtual Console's selection of vintage games is nice, although it's strictly old console games - no new or independent releases.

Also, be aware of the system's power.  Aside from motion-sensing and some of the bells and whistles like an internet browser, this is in the same ballpark as a PS2 or Gamecube.  It looks better than either of those, but not by a lot.  Nintendo's art style works pretty well on it, with their games being the visual highlights, but the Wii can't do a lot of the things a PS3 or 360 can.  Games are getting bigger, more open-ended, and more freeform, and Wii owners aren't going to see a lot of that.

Of course, it's also priced much lower than the other systems - $[...] vs a suspect $[...], with much more still to buy for the latter.  The games themselves are $[...] cheaper as well.  It certainly doesn't feel like a ripoff.

I focused on those negative points because while the Wii has no shortage of (very well-deserved!) glowing press, those caveats seem to be glossed over by most outside the "gamer culture."  If you can handle those issues, I'm sure you and your Wii will be very happy together.

author: C. Pak
title: Love it!
content: I got to admit, for someone in their late 20s, I love this system! It's really interactive and with the right games, perfect for people of all ages.  I'm very impressed with the Wii and defintely think that Sony has met its match.

author: sjrwlnd
title: Product doesn't work
content: Tried to use and product doesn't work. Huge disappointment.

author: Evolveria
title: Cannot Go Back
content:
My favorite aspects of the Wii in no particular order would have to be: 1) Controllers. It has changed everything. 2) Games that use the controllers. Third party game developers are as excited as we are and I can't wait for each new title. 3) Virtual Console. The ability to catalog and play ALL generations of Nintendo games, plus Genesis and TurboGrafx is huge. 4) Channels. Although not released at launch future channels for news, weather, web browsing and more make obsolete all the WebTV boxes out there.

Having played video games since basically the Atari 2600. For years I have enjoyed many popular consoles. I am not against owning multiple consoles. I have always followed the games, not the boxes that play them. The Wii is literally a revolution and will make you blissfully unaware of anything else within five minutes of gameplay. I had the honor of playing a Wii about a month before its release date at a Nintendo Fusion event. In the first five minutes I understood why this console makes gaming more fun and exciting. When I got home after the event and fired up the Xbox, I almost got sick trying to play games with buttons again. You have to play the Wii to grasp the reality of it, and will then appreciate this products solid five star rating. Nintendo is a company who learns from history and has created a masterpiece that continues to blow me away. I bought the Wii because I did not want another next generation box playing the same old games with more detail. Once you play the Wii, you literally don't want to go back.

author: LOPcagney
title: Winner of the Console War, Wii60 or WiiC seems like the way to go
content: I've played the Wii multiple times at my friend's house and was lucky enough to pick one up this morning, and all I can say is, this is the most, albiet light-hearted, fun you will have with any system of this generation. You've all heard it before: It's affordable, it's innovative, etc. so I won't repeat any of that, but what many people don't touch on is the simple convenience of using a Nintendo product overall. Their support is superb. Compared to the countless scandals with Sony using dishonest viral advertisement, Nintendo gives you just what it promises: interractive fun. The controlers work very well, much better than any similar commercial technology today, and the games are easy to get into and generally age-appropriate. The only downside is the graphics, which, while crisp and ideal for the more light-hearted fun Nintendo offers, can't match the visual power of a 360, PS3, or a PC. It also misses the more "mature" gamers who'd rather save the world guns blazing than roll a monkey around in a ball or play a game of bowling (with incredible realism, by the way). Though the control scheme seems ideal for First-Person Shooters, so far, Red Steel and Farcry have failed to impress, well, nearly anybody, and while Red Steel can be alot of fun, it is nowhere near as intense or innovative as Gears of War. For those of you who like both styles of gameplay, I'd opt for either the 360 in addition to your Wii, or a powerful PC.

author: Amazon Customer
title: nintendo wii
content: I love this product.  I use it almost everyday and I am getting better slowly at all the fitness challenges.  I can't wait to get the new wii game jillain michaels 2009 workout.  It should really kick me i n the pants and get me off to a great start.

author: harmonswife007
title: Sent a unit without the included game w/broken controller
content: Did not come with the game as advertised and the nun chuck was broken....thanks a lot buddy it was my kids that got ripped off

author: Joseph LaCerra
title: Everything Old is New Again
content:
My first thought about the Wii was 'This is a slick system'.  It is slick, from its packaging to its operations and characters.  At first it was a lot of fun.  But as I improved my skills on Wii Sports (Tennis and Baseball for me, primarily) I detected the old Nintendo tendency of the system playing me!  Wii manipulates the player rather conspicuously.  Every tennis game is brought to Deuce, no matter how much the AI has to fudge to do it.  Sometimes it just renders your racket useless, sometimes it forces idiotic errors on you, or makes them itself.  It also does this with your baseball bat, and manipulates the games to get a seemingly predetermined result.

It also forces you to play against AI players with skill levels so high you really have no chance.  You do not get to select them, Wii does that.

It was great for a few weeks.  Now, I still think it's slick, but just not any fun.

author: J. K. Baker
title: Wii system a Huge Hit
content: My 11 yo son got a Wii for his birthday and the whole family has enjoyed it.  My husband plays with them everyday.  We like that instead of sitting down moving your thumbs only, it gets the kids up and moving.  Huge hit and looking forward to more games that are active.

author: bigdave
title: Basic Wii package
content: We ordered this basic Wii package and it shipped as advertised and arrived on time a couple of days before Christmas. We have played it a lot and everything that all the reviews before me said is definitely true. The video display is good although i am using the lower quality video cable and have not gotten the HDMI cable yet so it may improve when I get the better cable. I got the sport game pack and one controller with it. My wife and I played it for a few days (we are both in our 50's) with one controller and had to get a second controller to make it easier to play. Having to share a controller is a pain. And some of the games really can't be played by two without a second controller so plan on getting that. I highly recommend this game console as it makes a couch potato get up to play it so any movement is good!

author: F R
title: Older model Wii is the one to get.
content:
I got this one "Like New" for $50 on Amazon Warehouse Deals. Had free 2-day air shipping. Arrived fast from amazon.

It came in the original box with everything in it, Wii Sports game included, and looked pretty much untouched. I can also play my old Gamecube games which is great.

author: Zachary Edge
title: Wii
content: i was so impressed in the way that this web site works, i used it again.

author: Mary Bianchi
title: Nintendo Wii
content: I think this is a great gaming system for anyone that wants to do more than to use their thumbs.  It gets you up off the couch and you really feel like you are playing tennis, or baseball, or whatever it is you want to play.

author: Hopeigetit2
title: Five Stars
content: Love it! Perfect! Thank you! Working beautifully :)

author: AllisonOfTheAmazon
title: Very Pleased
content: This Wii game console has provided my family with endless entertainment - as well as a little exercise thrown in the mix - and you can't dislike something that accomplishes all of that!  As my children grow older, they request new games for the Wii, so this system allows us many gift ideas for birthdays, Christmas, etc.  This was a great purchase and I would recommend it to anyone!

author: John S. Brooks
title: Five Stars
content: Everything as it should be. Thank you very much.

author: R. Toro
title: Good Game System - Though it is a bit aged now
content:
I have had the Wii for years now, and I am writing this review because it is a good system which has provided hours of entertainment to many people of different interests in my home.  If you are in the market for an inexpensive system, this is a good one to buy, as many of the games are readily available at relatively low prices.

If you want a system that will last you many years, and if you have more money to spend, you may want to wait until the next generation of gaming system is released.  However, for a light video game player, this will be a very good buy. It doesn't come with much though. You will likely need to buy a second controller and some games, as the system itself only comes with the sports games (which are OK, but you will soon want something different to play).

I recommend the Wii Play set, because it is entertaining, and has the added benefit of including an additional Wii-mote. Wii Play with Wii Remote

author: J. Benefield
title: Gave as a gift
content: Tried to give it to an injured soldier, but unfortunately he was unable to use it because of his injuries.

author: M. Noe
title: Gets you off the couch
content:
A great addition to any enteratinment system. The graphics may not be as good as some of the more expensive systems but the ineraction that this provides with a family and friends goes way beyond graphics. This seems to be one game system that will be around for more then a couple of years. You can use old games from the past or add hardware and newer games, you have so many options to keep things fresh.
Shipping from Amazon arrived very quickly as usual. It sure beats going to a store using gas and waiting in a long line....thanks Amazon.com  :)

author: MA Amoroso
title: Finally found the WII
content: You still have a hard time even finding a WII in the store.  Amazon had them with free super-saver shipping.  Another store had a sale on games.  I recommend WII Play (with additional remote) and Resident Evil 4 for the older kids (like my husband).

author: Scott
title: Don't buy it for the shooters & rpgs....buy it for the fun
content:
I've read through all the bad reviews here and actually agree with some of their points. If you are a gamer that enjoys FPS's, get an Xbox 360 or a PS3. If you're a big RPG guy, consider another option like an online PC game. If you want to have fun for hours and hours with friends and family, consider a Wii.

I got one for Christmas. It is now about 10 days later, and no one in my family can put it down. Every day they come over to do their Wii fitness age for the day in Wii Sports. My brother, dad, wife, and son can't get off of Excite Truck and various Wii Sports games. My mom wants to bowl all the time. A good friend is constantly playing tennis and Zelda.

This is the most fun I've ever had with a console. My brother's 360 has sat dormant since Christmas...even the two new games he got for it have hardly been played.

The Wii is for old and young alike. It is not for the hardcore gamer that wants realistic blood & gore. It is a system for families and friends to play and laugh together.

I got Zelda for the Wii. It's fun. But I agree that the Wiimote's capabilities don't add a lot to this game. Maybe in a future version it will. Right now, many of these games were made for the Gamecube and have simply been "adjusted" to work with the Wiimote. The games such as Wii Sports & Excite Truck were specifically made for the Wii and really show off how the controller can enhance gameplay. Soon, more game developers will begin to understand how to best utilize the Wiimote's abilities. A year down the road we'll start to see FPSs and RPGs that will compete with the 360 and PS3 for gameplay.

Until then, hardcore gamers stick with those systems and the rest of us will have a blast playing this totally new type of gaming console. This is not the next generation of the same old console. The Wii is a whole new category of gaming console. Not necessarily better, but altogether different.

author: Chris T. Siegler
title: Nintendo Wii.  Worth it!
content: Excellent game system.  Family oriented, moreso then I even envisioned. The physical involvement is what makes it really "stand out".  I can see why it's so popular and hard to find in stock.  Highly recommended.

author: hondo434
title: wii game console
content: Wii game console is great for beginner and experienced gamers. If you want to exercise and not feel like your working then this is the console for you!

author: J. Leslie
title: Easy to hook-up!
content: This was very easy to set up and so far, the games we have played are great. I have had to limit the time on this game as my six-year old wants to play it all the time.

author: H. Hartung
title: We LOVE the Wii !!!
content: I bought the Wii mostly with my ten-year-old daughter in mind. I have been BEYOND pleased with how much the entire family has enjoyed playing the Wii. My 72-year-old mother-in-law even likes it! It's an awesome party game and the included "sports package" provides hours of fun. I would recommend buying an extra remote and nunchuck because most of the games are more fun when played in multiplayer mode. If you have more than 2 children, I would probably purchase 3 extra remotes and nunchucks. Several of the games can support 4 players. The "Wii Play" game comes with a remote and like 9 games and at $5 more than the remote alone, it's a no-brainer purchase. The Wii is not comparable to a PS3 or XBOX for graphics, hard drive, etc. but that is not what makes it great. The motion-sensing controllers and user-friendly gameplay are what make Wii a top seller. Everyone I know who has one loves it. I'm completely satisfied with this purchase.

author: Pollyessster
title: A great system but. . .
content: The Wii is great.  I love the controller, there are so many possibilities which  unfortunately few of the games take advantage of.  Where are all the great games?  I'm still waiting.  I own two games--Rayman's Raving Rabids and Excite Truck.  Both of these games are excellent, but everything else I've tried seems like it's for little kids.  I'm an adult.  I grew up with Nintendo and though I can't say I'm a "gamer" I do enjoy playing--only there aren't any good games coming out for this!

author: R. Manning
title: Amazingly Addictive
content: Invest in quality rechargeable batteries. You'll want to play for hours when you first get your Wii, and cheaper batteries might not hold out. Even now, several months after I purchased my Wii, I still end up playing for extended periods when I do play. My opinion is that the Wii is best suited to being a group play console, since the fun you're having playing with other people helps offset the distinctly primitive-seeming graphics.

author: NeuroSplicer
title: Wiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiii !!!!!!
content:
Forgive me Source-Code for I have sinned. For years I was a dedicated PC-gamer. I though ill of gaming consoles, considering them consumer-toys rather than entertainment systems. Who needs overpriced and oversized gaming consoles that can play Movie-DVDs and even BluRayDisks when most good games are released for PCs as well and they look and play better on them? And I was mostly right. However, the NINTENDO Wii is a different breed.

Gaming on the Wii is an experience one has to live at least once - but preferably whenever he or she feels blue. Sure, it may not sport the cutting-edge graphical capabilities of a SONY PS3 or the game titles selection of the XBox. Nevertheless, most Wii games take full advantage of the consoles capabilities and the exclusive games selection include the unsurpassable The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess, the absorbing Metroid Prime Trilogy, the mesmerizing Okami and the soothing Endless Ocean: Blue World.
Not to mention the capabilities of Wii Fit Plus and Wii Sports Resort when coupled with a Wii Balance Board!

If you can still find one, I would advise buying the (Limited edition) black one. I keep mine in our TV room and the black blends perfectly with my other home entertainment electronics. In any case, do not miss the revolution.

There is simply no other console that offers so much fun. Both SONY and MICROSOFT have technologically excellent gaming consoles - but NINTENDO is the only one that always keeps in mind that gaming is supposed to be FUN.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

author: B. Wilson
title: Nintendo is BACK!
content:
Man oh man...I haven't had this much fun with a system in a long time.  I currently own every next gen console, and the Wii gets the most play time by far.  The revolutionary controller on this system will open up a whole new world in gaming over the coming years.

Thank you Nintendo for looking to the future, and making such a huge leap in gaming!

author: ron rudmann
title: Five Stars
content: Product performed properly and was delivered in a timely manner

author: James Anderson
title: Four Stars
content: cool

author: Jordan
title: Great product
content: Great product like I said plays wii and gamecube games wish ik that b4 I bought my gamecube but great system overall would recommend 5 stars

author: karen medina
title: Three Stars
content: was not clear about this product

author: M. Zimmerman
title: Fun for everyone
content: I got this for my 3 and 7 year old sons and we all love it. It is easy to play and fun to play sports games that I never enjoyed on other game systems. We have the carnival games too and it is fun too.

author: Dave
title: Fun and Active game
content:
First, it arrived early, in good shape.

I found this game console very interesting, and a lot of fun. It came with the "Wii Sports" game. I highly recommend to make sure this game comes with it if you purchase a game console. The sports game by itself sell's for around $50.00, So getting it makes this package a fare deal.

It gets used everyday, keeps a record of what you've done and estimates your age "according" to your performance at a random collection of activity's that it picks out for you to do. Get a few people together and it can really be a lot of fun. Some of my friends have bought one since they played ours.

It has everything built in to connect to your wireless internet. It found it and connected without any problems, very easy, and nothing extra to buy. Has it's own weather and news channels (and of course shopping channel). Now we send e-mail and pictures to our friends and family using the Wii. And it show's up on their Wii.
One thing, you can only play certain games on the internet against others, and there aren't that many of them yet.. That's about the only little negative thing I can think of... and I'm sure there will be more "internet play" games coming out.
I recommend this game, for everyone, children and adults. It's an active game, not just pushing buttons.

author: Cool Kelly
title: Good Times
content: Everyone loves a Wii

author: Superpig
title: tons of fun
content: What I like about the wii is that you don't really have to buy tons of games for it to be fun. I played around with wii sports for a while before I got any other games (I got guitar hero, which is great by the way). Really great system, even though I would wait for amazon to get some in stock before buying one.

author: John Boland
title: FUN ON CHRISTMAS MORNING!!!
content: I BOUGHT THE $200 BASIC SETUP PLUS THE EXERCISE FIT ATTACHMENT FOR ANOTHER $100 PLUS AN EXTRA CONTROLLER SO TWO CAN PLAY.  NOT A CHEAP GIFT.  SO, HERE IT IS, CHRISTMAS MORNING AND GUESS WHAT THE KIDS ARE DOING?  YEP, PLAYING WITH THE Wii AND THE FIT ATTACHMENT.  WAS IT WORTH THE PRICE?  I GUESS SO!!!  ALL THE OTHER STUFF IS SITTING ON THE FLOOR WHILE THE KIDS ARE PLAYING WITH THE Wii.  OK, I GUESS I CAN'T RETURN THIS GIFT....!!!  I'M STUCK WITH IT!!!  SERIOUSLY, IT LOOKS LIKE FUN FOR THE KIDS.  WORTH EVERY DOLLAR, I SUPPOSE!!!  :o(

author: Chewbacca37
title: Missing Parts in Shipment
content:
There was supposed to be a remote and nunchuck w/ this order.  Also - there is no a/v cable (even though your product details on the invoice that came w/ the package states "Has the wires and the sensor" - the av wires are not here (sensor bar and power supply are here).

Please send the missing components.

author: M. L. A.
title: Gets me moving!
content: I'm over 60, and very much of a computer potato. The Wii (with the Sports bundle) gets me off the computer (for a while every day, anyway!) and gets me moving! Bowling is the most fun sport for me. I also bought the Wii Fit to go with it. It's helping me with my overall strength, as well as body balance issues. It's even helping my overweight husband. There is a great variety of games to choose from, so that even when I'm feeling not-so-good on any given day, I can choose lower-energy games (exercises.) I have zero complaints! I love it, and can't imagine ever "outgrowing" it or getting bored with it!

author: Lisa
title: wii
