content: I bought the wii for my kids, and actually enjoy it as much as them. Even their grandparents enjoy playing it.  What a wonderful concept.  We have enjoyed much family entertainment with the wii.  It is worth the $$.

author: Cameron
title: Five Stars
content: Came early and worked perfectly..

author: Amazon Customer
title: Awesome game system
content:
For us this is a great system - I get to play with my kids during winter when we dont get out too much, and get some exercise in the process. So far we all like it.

The only downside I can think of was that it took over a week before it was shipped out (and about 2 weeks to arrive). This was mentioned when placing the order. Not a problem since we were not waiting anxiously for it, but Amazon has usually shipped most most other things the next day.

author: Husam J. Alnajjar
title: Wii is the only choice
content: Look it is palin and simple. If you are tired of your children spending so much time playing with a video game for hours and hours sitting on te couch. This is one video game that I will allow my children to play as long as they want. This video game has a remote control that reacts to your arm and hand, some times just the littlest movement might mess up your score. My children have to be standing to play several games such as Wii Sports, and NFL. You have to swing at the right time to hit a ball in baseball, you have to push the control at the right time, to tackle an apponent in Football, you have to move left and right (quickly) or your face will be knocked out in boxing. Plain and simple: when I play baseball or tennis, I sweat.

author: Kristopher D. Miller
title: Mainly got this for the girlfriend...
content: Works great!

author: Loretta Weldner
title: Wii review
content:
this was purchased for my grandchildren.  They were ecstatic when they opened
it and truly LOVE the Wii!!!

author: B. Bates
title: Great entertainment
content: My 16 year old daughter loves the product, and her parents enjoy it as well.  Just kind of bulky and we have storage issues.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: Everything came as expected, on time, and practically brand new! Thank you!

author: R. Devinney
title: Fun for all ages, not just for gamers
content:
We have had a Wii for about a year. Most games made for the Wii involve physical activity, which is a big improvement over previous "couch potato" video games. But many classic games are available for the Wii too. We have MarioKart which is a lot of fun but doesn't involve activity. Like all newer game consoles, Wii has WIFI so some games can be played on-line.
The reason I gave it four stars instead of 5 is Nintendo's marketing strategy of keeping Wii and Wii fit artificially scarce to keep prices up. This gives way to phony "bundles" where the seller throws in low value or worthless items and doubles the price. Hold out for just a Wii at the list price. You will find one if you keep looking and calling. All Wii consoles come with Wii Sports which is still the best Wii game package. Before buying other games, check out reviews and consider renting games first. I do recommend buying at least one additional wiimote and possibly a nunchuck.

author: Christian G. Bulante
title: Awesome!
content: I managed to pick up a Nintendo Wii back in January, and it's been lots of fun ever since. Wii Sports is a fun game, especially in multiplayer, and perfectly demonstrates the capabilities of the Wii remote and some of the actions that can be done. For those still trying to find one, good luck, and when you get one, it'll be definitely worth the wait.

author: Andy Wyatt
title: A Great Console, With Few Flaws
content:
Before I start out, I would like to say that each of the three consoles has its flaws. The PS3's is price, the Xbox 360's is the lack of hardware that comes with the regular package, and having to pay for Xbox live, and the Wii's is it's lack of great graphics, and how the Wiimote almost makes it limited.

The Wii is the console that you sit down and play with the family. Even those with little or no gaming experience can enjoy the Wii, with it's awesome multiplayer capabilities, and the Wiimote is just an extension of your arm that controls the game. You feel like you're in the game, and thats what makes this console the most intersting. Xbox has it's games, PS3 has it's Blu-ray and stunning graphics, but the Wii really shines in playability. You want to play the Wii, and games like Wii sports really gets everyone involved.

Overall, I think that anybody would not be disappointed getting the Wii, but the only problem with ordering off amazon, is that the versions they're selling actually cost more than the 80g PS3 bundle. Just go to Walmart and get it.

author: Kassandra torres
title: Came as said
content: It's awesome works great

author: Trevor M
title: Great Condition! Super Fast Arrival! No Complaints. 100% Satisfied
content: I Ordered a Wii Console from this Guy. And withing 3 days the package was in The Mail. I applaud his quick delivery. The wii Was Like Brand New! And in perfect condition. It was a week ahead of delivery! Thanks Man! A Great Product at a Great Price delivered Extremely swiftly a Week ahead of Schedule. Thanks!

author: Anthony
title: Five Stars
content: Everything works like a charm. Some pieces show some wear but it hardly matters

author: L. Owens
title: Wii from a boomer's viewpoint
content: Could not find a console anywhere within 200 miles of home - Walmart, Bestbuy, etc. were all out of stock.  Ordered from Amazon and had it in my hands the next morning!  Easy to set up.  Easy to use.  Fun for one or a crowd, ANY age.  Wii Fit gives me a decent workout in the privacy of my own home and I love the real feedback and tracking.

author: S. Sweeney
title: Wii Love the Wii
content: I had sworn off videogames years ago, but I have to say that the Nintendo Wii has really challenged all my previous thoughts about gaming.  The traditional joystick/keypad and button system is secondary to body motion.  Wii love our Wii.

author: THATCHMAN1
title: Great for adult group entertainment
content:
As someone in his very early 30's, I loved Nintendo and SNES as a teenager. I didn't get into the Playstations much, nor do I really use my XBOX360 much. But the Wii is the perfect meld of light entertainment & fun with a dash of "back from the day" with older games you can download.

I fully recommend this for anyone who has held out this long and still hasn't bought one.  It's just a blast. Nothing intimidating, just lots of fun with little commitment.

author: Shey
title: Great Price, Great Fun!!
content:
It is always a pleasure to shop with Amazon.  Prompt hassle-free service.

The Wii game is great value and I love it - I can finally have fun 'exercising'.

author: Oscar Gerardo Munoz
title: wii
content: The purchase was excellent choice. The games and system are advantageous due to the fact it is interactive. The gives the whole family achance to play and have an activity we can all do together. The fact that none of my kids are just sitting while playing video games is a plus. All my kids, my wife and myself are getting a good sweat which means great exercise, fun, and an awesome cardio workout. Thank you amazon for providing an avenue to by this product.

author: Omar U.
title: Five Stars
content: Excellent

author: Damian Sosa
title: Best one?
content: Just awesome... i have a x360 and this one.... i play this more than the xbox xD

author: Scooby Doo
title: Not necessarily for GAMERS, if your child is a GAMER they won't care for the Wii
content:
I bought this a few years ago and wanted to review because we barely ever play. I should probably just sell it back to someone on here.

To clarify my title: If you or your kid actively plays XBOX or PS3 then they probably won't like the wii. its for smaller children and families. The games are fun and mostly simple. the motion activated controllers aren't perfect and it has an awkward learning curve.

It seems that each game handle the motion controller differently to the point that you have to relearn with every game. Its annoying.

the graphics are poopoo compared to the XBOX and PS3. this is not a blueray player, ps3 is.

this is not good for internet apps or browsing. None of the consoles are good for browsing internet yet.

author: Traci
title: wow
content:
I finally managed to find myself one (call your local stores.. they tend to randomnly set them out) and I'm glad I did.

This system is cheap compared to the ps3 and the 360 and that is mainly why I ended up buying it. The motion sensor stuff should end up being really good once developers take the time to make good games. It appears to be solidly made and I like the color, doesn't look cheap.

The backward compatibility is a good thing for me, I really can't afford to buy the $50 wii games at the moment. But you need a gamecube controller and memory card to play the old games - the wii controller will not work.

I'm really looking forward to seeing how nintendo uses the usb ports in the future. Having an internal memory (512mb) is a really good idea, and using SD cards as memory as well is nice because those have gone down in price considerably. Great system for families with kids or for people who are looking for something unique :)

author: Amanda K. Norris
title: Amazing! Exactly what I wanted and even more.
content: Amazing! Exactly what I wanted and even more.

author: Kevin
title: fun game
content: The wii is fun and the wii sports is probably my favorite game.  I like the bowling and baseball.  It puts you in the game.

author: Dooshima Ross, Ms
title: Five Stars
content: Its great

author: Mitch
title: "Wii love it"
content: Came in great condition and works great, it's like new but without having to spend an outrageous amount of money, wish I would've shopped on Amazon more often the past few years.

author: Jones Online Shop
title: This is a great system.
content: This sure beats the sit down only move your thumbs for two hour systems. I wanted something that would get me off the couch and this did it. I only have couple of games, but I'm impressed with them.

author: Elizabeth A. Shumway
title: WII Purchase
content: This was money well spent.  This was a Christmas present for my daughter - and thought it was expensive - it was worth it in the end.  She loves to play the games that came with the unit.  And the seller was right on the money with getting us the product in time for Christmas.  Thanks for making our daughters Christmas one that she will not forget.

author: Serdar
title: Fun! Fun! Fun!
content: Wii is definitely a great console. Even though its games don't have the superior 3D graphics in Xbox360 or PS3, they are so much fun. I only hated lack of availability when I decided to buy one, but it was worth it.

author: William Ashmore
title: Must Have Fun
content: My roommate had a wii before i moved out. I loved it.  I used to work for gamestop before I moved also. This is a great system.  It is very social orientied and loads of fun if you have friends over to play.  Here is a warning though, once u get a Wii then you run into the problem of finding the controllers for it.  You will have to hunt for controllers.  I recommend getting Zelda when you get the system.  Wii sports is a great game, it just gets old after a while if you play by yourself.  The virtual console is good so far, but not great.  Many classic games that bring back memories. When i got my Wii, i just happened to walk into a gamestop and they had one left from their afternoon shipment. When i was buying mine someone else walked in asking for one. So if you dont wanna pay the money on ebay for one, just hunt around various game and huge retail stores.  If you have young kids this is a great way to play with them and to be introduced to video games if you have not played for a while.  Even for me at 23, I love this "kiddy" system.

author: JWL
title: Console is Short Lived & Customer Support Leaves Much to be Desired
content:
I was so excited when I got my Wii console, despite the ridiculous name.  Yet only a few years into owning it, Nintendo cut off some of the primary game features that I bought it for in the first place, like the ability to play with users online.  Best guess is they are trying to force users to migrate to newer consoles, but not all of us can afford to upgrade every few years, nor is each new iteration worth shelling out for.  Removing features that were part of the product description when I paid for it is a terrible business model and one of the worst aspects of the digital age.

Unable to get the most out of my Wii games, I turned to downloading retro games through the Virtual Console.  But one day I accidentally downloaded the wrong one, and when I contacted Customer Support hoping that I could exchange it for the correct product, they wouldn't even consider it.  They simply said they do not allow returns and quoted something about Terms of Service.  What kind of company cares so little about customer service that they won't do something as simple as exchanging a digital download at no monetary loss to themselves?  I don't have a lot of disposable income, so this was a blow to morale and a huge disappointment in the Nintendo company.

I've always liked their games but I guess they really just don't give a flying fig about the people that support them and made them what they are today.

author: Ben Rowland
title: A great system for casual gamers and old-school Nintendo fans
content:
I purchased the Nintendo Wii in September 2008 and it has been working great for me ever since. As an old school gamer who grew up playing Nintendo systems, the Wii was the first "next gen" console that I sought out and I have been very pleased with the gaming experience that it offers. It is not a system designed for the hardcore gamer, rather one that is meant to reach a wider demographic of people who may not have grown up playing games. Below is a summary of the good and bad aspects of the system and the games available; keep in mind that these are subjective to the gamer.

Pros:

1. Quality first-person titles and an improving library of third-person games. Many may dismiss the Wii on the basis of it being a "kiddy" or "lifestyle" system based on the lack of adult-oriented games, however few can argue that Nintendo really delivers with their franchises. "Super Mario Galaxy", "Metroid Prime 3", "Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess" and "Mario Kart Wii" are all fantastic games that really do the franchises justice. As the system has aged, more quality third-party titles have emerged such as "Mad World", "House of the Dead: Overkill", "No More Heroes", "Okami", and "Klonoa".

2. Innovative controls. When properly utilized in a game, the unique motion controls of the Wii Remote are a blast and they do bring a new level of depth to the gameplay. Sports games, puzzles and platformers all benefit from this and it makes the game more involving; rather than having to remember what 8 buttons perform what functions, it's all about pressing a few buttons and waggling the remote.

3. User-Friendly Interface. The Wii menu is perhaps the most streamlined and easy to use dashboard out of all the consoles. The Wii Shop is also easy to navigate in and out of, and shopping for games and add-ons is a snap.

4. The Virtual Console. As was the case with the GBA and the DS, Nintendo is making a killing off of their old titles. The Virtual Console allows you to download classic games from the NES, SNES, Genesis, Neo Geo, and a host of other systems. The Classic Controller is require to play them, however this is a nice add on especially for older gamers who grew up in the 8-bit and 16-bit eras.

5. Integrated wireless card. If you have wireless internet and your router is compatible with the Wii, this is your best bet for connecting the console to the internet.

Cons:

1. No Ethernet port. I am not sure how Nintendo screwed this up, however there is no Ethernet port in the back of the console; there are only 2 USB ports and you will need to purchase a LAN adapter separately. This is an annoyance if you don't use wireless internet.

2. Inferior graphics. If you are a gamer that needs to have the best graphics, then you will be better off with the PS3 or the Xbox 360. The Wii has good graphics however it is technically inferior to the competition. Sadly, this means that some of the cross-platform titles will be inferior on the Wii, but then again graphics are not everything.

3. Gimmicky games. Because of the unique controls, a lot of the games being produced for the Wii are gimmicky and focused more on the controls rather than story and gameplay. For me, this includes the "Wii Fit" and "Wii Sports". Both games were fun for the first few weeks, however I got bored once the novelty wore off and I have not played either game since. This has improved over the lifespan of the system, however this is still a lot of "Shovelware" being produced.

4. Limited memory. The Wii only comes with 512 MB of internal memory, which is a drop in the bucket compared to the 120 GB and 160 GB hard drives being offered on the Xbox 360 and PS3 respectively. I guess this is because the Wii is not download-intensive, however the 512 MB gets eaten up quickly if you download a lot of Virtual Console and Wii Ware games. Fortunately, they system allows you to use an SD card to store and back-up downloaded content.

The Pros and Cons of any video game system often depend on the gamer, so the above is just my own personal impressions after having owned my Wii for almost one year. Overall, I like the system a lot and I play it often despite a few shortcomings. I also own an Xbox 360 and that fulfills whatever needs that the Wii is not currently meeting, so I have no regrets about purchasing this console.

author: Alex
title: Wii is great, but not adult oriented.
content: The WII is a great system to play party type games on. Most games that are for the WII are geared towards kids/teens, while xbox/ps3 dominates in the shooter market. I don't think the WII will ever have a strong shooter following like 'Call of Duty: modern warfare'. There is a sizable amount of workout games that are pretty fun for the WII. If you have kids, your kids will love you that much more for buying them a WII.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Wow - Great for whole family
content: This is only the 2nd review I've ever written on Amazon, but I just had to say a few things about the Wii. It's great. It only took 15 minutes to setup and then I was playing tennis, boxing, bowling, and finally the Marvel Ultimate Alliance game. This game is great for two big reasons. First, I actually got tired boxing and got a little winded playing tennis. That is great for the kids. They won't just sit there and push buttons. The 2nd great thing is the numchuck. I have never been good at figuring out the combiantions of buttons to press, and the numchuck minizmizes the need for that skill. The only negative are the graphics, but for $250 they are fine. I just started playing today, so I will probably update this later.

author: The Truth Hurts....
title: Wii find you Guilty.
content:
I'd like to give a stfu to my foul fiends @ Nintendo. Understand I am so fond of the memories that Nintendo has shared with me. My first NES Super Mario Bros & Duck Hunt, With Zapper. The Original Legend Of Zelda packaged in a gold cartridge.

Super Nintendo with Mario All stars & Super Mario world. Nintendo 64 the very finest TOP FLIGHT of the Nintendo platforms. So many consistently awesome titles. Mario kart 64, Super Mario 64, Doom 64, Quake 64,, and the Zelda titles. Top Flight bitches.

I will even give the Game Cube a nod over Xbox, or PS2. The Micro mini discs were too sweet. The best cube in the world. So much technology packed into a small space became a gadget we can still marvel at today. In spite of all the child orientated games, I loved you Nintendo. To thank the millions of people who loved you and had similar stories of gaming glory. You reward us with......

The Nintendo Wii with motion plus controllers. I like the concept your hand is the controller. Here the problems one by one. 1. For the price they charged, would it of killed them for Bluetooth control? Leaving us with a constantly fluctuating signal even with the sensor bar aligned. Sometimes, not often it would work as intended. 2. No HDMI input. The PS3, and Xbox 360 both were out at the time of this technology, and a blind man could of has seen HDMI was the way of the future. A Nice bonus was this technology was included in both PS3 & Xbox360.
3. No playback of DVD, or Blue ray technology.
4. Bad features of a remote. The controller later released for retail @ $59.99, It should have been included for when the sensor alignment fails, and sooner, or later it always does.

For these reasons, and the many nearly unplayable games like The steering wheel for Mario kart Wii. Which in a later review I systematically take Mario Kart Wii apart and expose it for the trash it is, and why it nearly killed a franchise. That's for a later day. It's for the aforementioned reasons above that I could never give Wii U a chance it's still more of the same BS. Thanks for fixing a nearly unplayable platform, giving it a fresh coat of paint with the fixes. Tuh Duh! may I present Wii U, It's what Wii should have been in the first place.

No thank you Nintendo. I think I will wait for your next console to be released. I know sooner, or later you will make another great system. You did it in the past, It's most likely in your future as well.

author: Travis
title: Wii Like it but
content:
I bought my wife a Wii for christmas, so we've been using it for the last two weeks.  I have it connected online with the built in wifi, which was pretty strait forward.  If you have a wireless router they have a decent technical assist section and if you don't the nintendo wifi adapter is inexpensive and works for both your DS and Wii.  I would also like to say I have every other cosole and both handhelds DS/PSP.  I don't care who makes it as long as it is fun, so this is in no way bashing or favoring a product based on the manufacturer.  The only way I'll have a high sense of Brand loyality is if I own stock in a company.

GAMES:

The system is fun and different.  I've played Wii sports, supermonkey ball, Excite truck, rayman, elbits, Madden, and trauma center (never have been a huge zelda fan, so waiting to rent.)  I wouldn't rate any of these games higher than a 7 out of ten.  I really wish excite truck had online play as it would have raised the replayability a little.  The best thing about the wii is that the games aren't just a "graphical" upgrade.  They try to get you involved.  My favorite so far is wii sports.  I turned trauma center off after about 15 minutes because I have the DS version and it didn't seem fun to me anymore, and man does the dialoge get long.  I haven't used the virtual console yet because paying 5 dollars for a game that I'll play for a few minutes is way to much.  So as far as games go, there aren't any (unless your a zelda fan) that feel that polished and worth the 50 dollar price tag, in my opinion. Before buying I'd recommend checking a game review site such as IGN.com or Gamespot.

Controller:

I like the new controller but don't like have to buy a wiimote 40 dollars and the the nunchuck 20 dollars.  Most games require both so if you want to play multiplayer you have to buy at least one extra set.  The system does come with one complete set.  I enjoyed the new controller because its different.  I don't want three new consoles with almost the same exact input device.  I'm glad they changed it up.

Backwards compatible Gamecube:

Excellent.  It's as easy as pie.  Pop the top cover and plug in you wave bird and cube memeory card and your good to go.  For anyone looking to buy a gamecube I'd say just wait till you can buy a wii.  Not only will you be able to play the new games but you'll be able to play every gamecube game.  They really did this feature right.

The internet browser:

Is currently free and works well with the wiimote.  It wasn't as painfull as using my psp.  You can easily navigate through menus and zoom in on pictures.  The weather channel also works well showing up to a 5 day forcast, but if you already have a computer this is just a "neat feature".

I know a lot of people are going to hate me for this comment, but right now the wii isn't a must have gaming machine.  Why, because it's only two months into the launch and the game line up is very meak.  This is to be expected and as wario ware, super mario, metroid come out we'll see exactly what the system has to offer.  For those of you dieing to get your hands on one, relax. ours has been sitting for the last 3 days untouched. The newness wears off and your left with one or two games.

  Again these are my OPINION's,  I think a lot of the people who reviewed the system on here did so within a day or so of turning it on for the first time.  Everyone loves that new car smell.  To me its always about the games, not who sells it but how much fun it is to play.  I not an english teacher or a student so if you don't like my spelling/grammer to bad I already graduated and you can't take my degree.

author: Jody C. Moore
title: Wii is a must have for having fun!
content: My husaband and I bought this for our daughter and her husband for Christmas and wow was it a hit! They loved the bowling and tennis. We called the 'kids' to see how they were and how they like the Wii- they LOVE it and  they were sore from all the moving around they did while having fun. My daughter said, this is the funnest excercise she has done in years. She got to work out and have fun doing it.

author: john hann
title: Nice nice
content: I never wrote a reveiw so yeah haha, but it came in the mail super fast t was in better condition than I exspected I recommend it if you are a nintendo person

author: MS
title: Great gaming machine for all ages!
content:
I never played any games or used any of the gaming systems (nintendo ds, xbox, ps2 etc..). The last game I played was doom ( a couple of times when it was released and then got bored of that).
Nintendo Wii has converted such a person to a game addict (almost - not quite yet!). The included sports game disk is good (I do have some issues - there is room for improvement in tennis in placement of the ball, you cannot move the player etc).
I also tried Mario and Sonic at the olympics another great game for Wii.
In all it is a great entertainment for the whole family.
I wish Nintendo makes it less scarce in the US.

author: Kimo
title: Great Fun! My kids (and I) love it!!!
content: I bought this for my son as a Christmas present.  He absolutely loves it.  I also love it and I'm not really into video games anymore.  This game is just so radically different, it takes me back to my youth when games using joysticks and paddles and were all about fun, not trying to out-technology each other.  The included Wii Sports game is a blast. It introduces you to the controllers very nicely.  Although the remote and nunchuck feel a little weird at first, they are very intuitive because body movements are far easier than just mashing finger buttons.  Setup was pretty easy and we were playing in minutes.  The graphics are very nice.  I really don't care if they're not in the highest 1080-whatever resolution and doubt most kids my son's age will either (or adults just looking for pure fun).  Gameplay is smooth and very immersive.  The games all have the usual Nintendo feel of family fun.  The Wii Wi-Fi setup was also a breeze.  After connecting both Wii's to our home network, we were immediately checking sports, weather, and news over Nintendo's free online service. The Wii uses a standard SD card for memory.  I was able to give my son a huge memory card for almost nothing (compared to previous prices for memory cards on his PS2 and Gamecube).  There is a reason these things are selling like hotcakes. Besides the buyer-friendly price, it's a great console.  My son was so possessive of his Wii, my daughters pooled their Christmas money and gift cards to buy their own.  Now they play each other wirelessly.  I only have a few very minor gripes.  The battery life in the controllers is pretty bad.  These things suck down AA batteries like crazy.  I've already changed the batteries twice in each remote during a month of gameplay.  I'm about to invest in some rechargable AA's.  The remote also sometimes loses it's partnership with the console when the batteries are exhausted.  You also have to be careful with the wrist strap.  The strap on my daughter's remote snapped after only a week; and it was supposedly one of the improved ones.  Fortunately, the remote remained in her hand and didn't result in one of those flying Wii remote stories posted all over the web.  To Nintendo's credit, I received two new straps by mail in less than a week after completing a brief online form. Other than the strap, the quality of the materials is excellent.  Our remotes have been dropped several times, including once on a hard ceramic tile floor, and haven't suffered a scratch. Nintendo also extended our warranty to 15 months after we registered our Wii online (Don't know how long this deal will last, but it's worth a few minutes on the web for 90 extra days peace-of-mind). Don't despair if you can't find a Wii on store shelves.  If you scout the advertisements and show up at the store when they open, you have a very good chance at scoring one; no lines or camping.  Just make sure you're there at opening because they usually sell out very fast.

author: Nitram
title: Party Machine
content: We have Wii parties with our friends, and I have to limit the invites - it is too popular. Everyone has a blast - no one talks about whether or not it is "better" than the other systems - they just have a great time. Playing solo is also a lot of fun - there are plenty of great games out there to keep you entertained (but also a lot of bad games - be selective). This may not be the system of choice for the "hardcore gamer", but for average folk looking for a good time, the Wii is perfect.

author: C. Schwartz
title: Great for all ages including baby boomers!
content: Wii is so much fun for all ages & great way to not be a couch potato....love it.  Now we have even more in common with the grandkids when they come over for a visit....bring your remote!!!

author: BRITTNEY
title: Unfortunately
content: Unfortunately

author: Jill B. Ward
title: Five Stars
content: worked great love it

author: Debbie
title: Five Stars
content: Excellent service, just as advertised.

author: C. Robinson
title: From NES to Wii it's another home run, Nintendo does it again!
content: This console is must have simply for Mario and Zelda. While Microsoft and Sony are pushing high definition video formats, Nintendo is pushing FUN and it shows.

author: Christy P.
title: Wii - tons of fun for all ages
content: I cannot say enough about the Nintendo Wii!  Never in the history of console gaming systems has a system brought together people young and old.  My mom has never been the slightest bit interested in video games, but we have her hooked on playing Wii.  I even brought the Wii on our family vacation (we're all grown adults) and it was one of the best ideas we've had to fill in those empty moments in the evenings.  It is akin to a board game, where you can learn it and pick it up in a matter of minutes and enjoy it with your family for the rest of the afternoon, and that's just with the Wii Sports that comes with the console, let alone the other games you can purchase.  Finally a gaming system for people who like to be social, and that appeals to all ages.  Makes a great party feature!

author: DanielH_84
title: excellent choise for virtual gaming
content: I think that the nintendo wii has gained a reputations as one of the best creations that this japanese guys has come with.  I love the fact that using the remote as a virtual point and aim in every single game that i played.  The graphics are ok, not as good as another gaming systems on the market, but im focusing my review in the virtual game experience, way beyond for just pushing buttoms, i mean you must move the controller to play the different games that are available!!!!.

author: Parrish C. Moore
title: Simple system w/ great sensor.
content: The Nintendo Wii is probably one of the best consoles ever. Not because of the graphics or anything like that, but because of the sensor for the Wii-mote. My friend got me the Wii as a gift and I opened it up not knowing that the graphics were so lame. Lol, but the system still blows me away. I love it to death. I had Wii sports and Super paper Mario. Wii sports made me feel like i just actually did the sports and Super Paper Mario was a classic Mario feel with also alot of new innovative controls that the Wii offers. I would reccomend this too anyone. A gamer, a parent, and a non-gamer too. The Wii is a fun console and workout for anyone.

author: F. Wallace
title: WII Purchase
content:
Our new WII is more than we expected.  We have really enjoyed the set.  My wife also had purchased the additional 9 game series plus and additional controller.  We are looking forward to purchase the WII Fit and other accessories as we are financally able.
It is a great addition to our home games (video, board, etc.)
The only problem we had was in actually receiving the WII.  The USPS sent it to the wrong location, so it took a few extra days getting here.  But it did arrive before Christmas.

author: CRH
title: It is great!
content: I purchased Wii and Wii Fit Plus. I have used them everyday and I love them. My husband and I play the sports games that came with the console and it has been a lot of fun. It was easy to set up and doesn't take up much space. Once installed, it is easy to follow. It is fun and good exercise. Surprisingly, I have even enjoyed the boxing, a great workout for your arms. I would recommend it to everyone.

author: Norman A. Belanger
title: Mom loves her Wii !!!!
content:
Mom is almost 82 years old now and in my whole life she has never asked for anything. Except last year she asked for a Wii.
Do we have fun now when we visit her. In the past there were many times when I didn't really know what to talk about. The Wii has sure changed that. And Mom is hooked. She has played until as late as 2 A.M. on more than one occasion. And we made Wii people to represent her, my grandson and myself. When we are not there she will play and call me up laughing and say that it is hilareous to see me and my grandson watching her play from the stands.
This game has brought us a lot of fun and has improved our communication because we really have something to talk about now. This game is great family entertainment that includes everyone that can hold the control in one hand regardless of their age. And it also closes the generation gap.

author: Charles
title: Five Stars
content: Good

author: Rohit Sinha
title: Happy to have a Wii
content:
+ Good fun games in the Wii Sports pack
+ Ended up buying second remote and the Wii Play games are even more fun (though you end up becoming a couch potato)
+ Very happy to have this wii with me

All games always seem to be so fresh ... i am still not tired of playing the games.

author: Dixon Parker
title: One Star
content: Worked fine for a few months but now the power will not come on.  Can't trust used consoles.

author: Jonathan H.
title: Awesome Product!
content:
Wii
The idea and execution of the Wii is simply amazing. I never got into video games, because hitting buttons on a controller and just sitting there is boring to me. The Wii solves this for me and is a great way to both get exercise and play a game. Being physically active is a big part of my life, and this is a way to bridge both exercise and fun. Brilliant!

The sports games that come with the Wii are cartoony and get old after a while, but they are meant to show game developers what can be done. For instance, there is a Brunswick bowling game that is more difficult and is photorealistic than the bowling game that comes with the Wii.

I'm just waiting for them to have controllers that you strap to your wrists and ankles...

author: Atticus
title: Best $250 we ever spent!
content: We love our Wii!  We were able to find one right before Christmas, and have played it almost every day since.  I think I actually play it more than my daughter!  Its a great way to keep the kids active when they can't go outside.  We only have a couple of games so far, but we're really enjoying it.

author: Chris G. Mann
title: wii.......fun for the whole family
content: This is alot of fun but participants should stretch and warm up their muscles before playing. The wii is easy to set up and easy to play and can easily allow multiple players. There is a large selection of games for it and you can even use "game cube" games with this system. ( you can get them alot cheaper from used gaming stores).  The graphics are not as good as on other gaming systems but fun never the less. All and all a great system with something for everyone and it keeps you active while playing.

author: Cory Acome
title: Five Stars
content: Works as expected. No disappointments here!!

author: Austinite
title: Five Stars
content: An original - Great!

author: Manny H.
title: The best gaming platform ever!
content:
It took us a few years to get a Wii. When my son's sixth birthday came around his grandma got him one, so we're now getting exposed to the Wii experience.

I am amazed at how this game can get you off the couch (a much needed thing these days) and into action. Having only played Wii Sports so far, I find myself breaking more than a sweat after a few rounds of Boxing.

I cannot say enough good things about the Wii. Between the console and the Wii Fit Balance Board, we are looking at a brand new way to exercise and have a lot of fun at the same time.

author: Emz Orld
title: WII Console
content: The WII console was a complete set as stated, only the WII sports game did not work otherwise I'm happy with my purchase.

author: Phreak777
title: 5 years later it still rocks!
content:
I bought this 5 years ago, and this dude still makes me have fun when I'm feeling down.

I've been always a Nintendo fan because I love Zelda (ever since the first NES version). There are other games that rock my world too, but Zelda beats everything for me.

About the Wii, it's one of the best things I ever bought. Just last year my power source stopped working right after the lights went off for the entire neighborhood (It wasn't plugged to a surge protector). Bought a new power source and problem solved. The controllers consume a great deal of batteries, but for that I have rechargeable batteries and chargers... So, as I said, i love it!

author: John Judice
title: Great deal. Great product.
content: I bought this item for my nephews birthday. I didn't want to spend a lot of money because he's only 5 years old and I thought he might not take care of it as well as an older child would. I found this one and the seller had good reviews. When it came in it was packaged well. It was clean and looked like new. It had everything that they said it would have in the box. I tested it for him before I gave it to him. I did have to hook it to my Wi-Fi and install latest update, but that was no big deal. It was a great deal and it works just like brand new. My nephew loves it. I recommend this seller.

author: Will Smith
title: What an innovative little console
content: We received our Wii console today from the Walmart bundle purchased on Nov. 1st. After we tucked the kids away in bed mom and dad decided to give the console the official functional/working test so the kids would not be disappointed on Christmas day. First off let me say how impressed we were with the efficiency of the packaging. Everything in it's place with no wasted space and no room to move around and get damaged during shipment. Typical Nintendo quality. Everything packed in foam and plastic in marked boxes labeled 1 & 2. Installation and setup was very easy. The system is tiny and appears to be very solid and well made. We installed the 4 GB SD card that I had purchased from Newegg and the system recognized it with no problems. We attached to our HDTV with the supplied composite cables and proceeded to load up Wii Sports. All I can say is my wife and I have not had this much fun with a video game console in a long time. That remote is something else. Very accurate, realistic and fun. We played with the tennis and bowling before we decided to box it all back up for Christmas. You do need plenty of room for those vigorous swings. All in all were very happy with the purchase. If I had anything negative to say it would be with the cables included. I wish Nintendo had supplied the component video/audio cables for use on HDTV's instead of the composite cable. This system is highly recommended!!

author: Pamela D.
title: wii
content: the wiis reject butten dont work that good thats the only thing thats wrong with it . other then that its ok . you needed to let people know that but you didnt ...im letting you know this , thats why i amonly giving you 3 stars .

author: REC MAN
title: Arrived on time
content: This was a Father's Day present that the grandkids will love to play with, too.  Grandpa is practicing up to beat them at Bowling!!!

title: Fun! Fun! Fun!
content:
Having had an XB360 and PS3 for a while, I finally picked up a Wii.

In one word, the Wii is a lot of fun.

Compared to the other consoles:

XB360: The XB360 is simply a gaming powerhouse. The XB Live experience is also, in my opinion, far superior than PSN.

PS3: Honestly, I don't own any games for the PS3 other than a few arcade games. I use my PS3 simply for the BluRay player. However, I will add that the PS3 does integrate with the Sony PSP very well.

Wii: Once again, Nintendo doesn't follow the status quo and comes up with something unique. Nintendo for went diving into high definition and instead gave us unique game interaction which is proving to be very enjoyable. However, if you have an ED/HDTV, I would still recommend picking up a pair of component cables for the Wii. Even if you have a standard TV, with S-Video in, I would also recommend picking up an S-Video cable. The composite video is a little on the weak side, which leads to some artifacting and flickering in blue fields. Either of these cables will eliminate this. I also recommend networking the Wii since you will be able to get updates. The Wii has built in wireless (and supports WPA/WPA2) networking, but if you have a wired network you will have to pick up an additional USB-Ethernet adapter. If you network your Wii, definetly purchase the [...] "Internet Channel" (which is actually an optimized Opera browser.) The browser works very well and loads pages fast. It is even better than the PS3's browser. Why it wasn't included, I don't know. It even works great with YouTube!

The virtual consoles (NES, SNES, N64, Genesis, etc) games are a little pricey in my opinion ([...]), but I still bought SM1, SM2, SM3, SMW, SM64.

Like the other two consoles, I recommend running it horizontally instead of vertically. I simply don't trust the drives to give as much life running vertically as they would horizontally.

(EDIT:  I'm adding this long after I posted this review, but you can organize your channels.  I discovered how by accident!  Simply press and hold both the "A" button and trigger, while over a channel.  The channel will be "picked up" and you can drag it anywhere you like.  Yeah, this was probably in the manual, but who reads manuals?)  :-)

Overall, it is a very fun system.

I am glad I bought it.

author: bob evans
title: Wii apparatus
content: What a unique piece of equipment a Wii is!  It was so easy to set up that me, a 69 year "Grandma", set it up by myself.  The instructions were so easy to follow and wiring was very simple.  Three generations of our family have had so much fun using it.  It is fascinating to watch how the picture on the TV depicts your body's movements - like in bowling, golf, etc.

author: Curious One
title: what else beside BUY ONE needs to be said?
content:
Maybe the fact they you really should not pay more then $250 for a new one unless it is a bundle package.  You can find them at Target, Toys R Us, K-Mart and Walmart if you keep checking.  I attemtped to buy one from a lesser known market with terrbile results and recommend sticking to known retailers.

This system is EASY to install and set up.  We had the wii up and running in 15 minutes.  wii Sports is usually included with the console so you don't have to go out and buy a video game to start. This game gets you active and is a great introduction to how the sytem works. Most reviewers have already detailed the inner workings so I will just add that whoever thought this sytem up was a genuis!!  The interaction between the controls and the video game are amazing.  This system beats any other in my view.  The potential for wii is mind boggling although they have been a little a slow in output lately.  Hmmmm.  I will sit in anticipation of what they will think up next.  I do have my eyes on a wii Fit but wonder what lies ahead.......

There are great resources (including Amazon) to research the best games to suit your interests.  I recommend checking reviews, renting them or checking at your local library before buying since they can be pretty expensive.

author: Walter Feegis
title: Good times for all.
content:
Every once in a while, I come across something that encourages me to take some time to write a review, in this case, the Nintendo Wii.  I probably won't be able to say enough to satisfy all the Wii devotees or I'll say too much to fire up all the detractors.  If you are an inflexible "full time gamer" who can't seem to get past one shortcoming or another because the Wii isn't up to your standards, don't bother reading on.  If you have never played a video game and are exploring the option for yourself or children, then this may be of some help.

I've read many reviews of the Wii that begin, "I had it a week (or month) and it's now collecting dust because it didn't (fill in un-met expectation here) compared to the (XBOX 360, PS___, etc).  It's unfortunate that way too many folks these days need instant gratification in order to be fulfilled or narrowly define what is considered worthy or not based on a comparison to something it isn't supposed to be compared to.  There's 2 things that I think are obvious about the Nintendo Wii: 1-it was created for a specific target audience, namely, Nintendo loyalists wanting the next generation Nintendo console, non typical gamers and kids; and 2: it was not created to compete head to head with the graphics intensive and usually brutally violent games of the XBOX and PlayStation line.  If you understand these two points, you will see that the Wii is an excellent choice.  My family is easy to please as we still purchase board games and we all enjoy playing those as well as all the electronica that comes and goes in an instant.

After a year, the hype of being newly released cannot account for the lack of availability.  Wii's are in short supply for a good reason, they're a great buy.  The price is well below the other guys but the bang for the buck is more than many things I've purchased before. Availability of games is also not a problem.  My last visit to Wally World found shelves full of a variety of games.  The Wii also allows older folks who have never played a video game to get in there and play against 5 year olds by using familiar movements like throwing a bowling ball or swinging a bat or tennis racquet to perform the onscreen actions.  The idea that a family can get together and play is a diminishing trend due partly to the fact that more kids are playing video games that parents don't have time to learn or even understand.  The Wii also plays the earlier Gamecube games that will soon become available at bargain prices or were purchased over the years of use with the Gamecube.  We have plenty and my kids still enjoy those games as well.  There are slots for the Gamecube controllers, memory cards and microphone as used in the Mario Party games and 2 USB slots for a keyboard and whatever else Nintendo offers as a USB add on.  Another nice feature is the wireless connectivity.  If you have a wireless Internet connection in your home, the Wii will find it and connect to offer on-line Nintendo shopping, weather and news.

There's not a lot of sitting around with many of the Wii games.  You have to move.  Every notion you've had about kids staring at video game screens while buried down in the couch cushions may change after using the Wii.  Some of these games require movements that will almost wear you out.  I've watched my kids play just about every game we have standing up.  We have Guitar Hero III and I have a better appreciation for the effort that rockers have made over the years in their performances.  The cover versions of the classic rock songs are excellent and my kids are enjoying the rock songs we listened to in the 60's, 70's and 80's.  I've even been forced to listen and "play" a variety of musical genres that I previously ignored and actually now like some grunge and heavy metal.

The biggest after purchase cost over-run for me came from purchasing extra controllers.  The typical Wii package comes with one controller.  Depending on the game, if more than one person wants to play, you have to pass the controller from player to player and this doesn't work for team or head to head games.  Extra controllers run about 40 bucks and the Wii can handle up to 4.  Although not necessary, a standard SD memory card can be used to store games and settings and those are available these days for under 15 bucks.  This is a big improvement over the expensive propriatary memory cards that were used with the Gamecubes and were never enough for all the saved games.  In all, I probably dropped 600 bucks for the console, 4 controllers, 1 extra nunchuk, battery charger and stand, 6 game discs, and all of this was purchased at "normal" retail prices.  With the price gouging out there, this was actually a good deal.  Please don't be suckered into over paying due to impatience.  The Wii will be available soon when things settle down and waiting will also be a good lesson in patience.

Finally, I appreciate Nintendo's effort to include parental controls with both the Wii and access to their website.  In order for me to allow my kids access to their webpage, I had to fax an application detailing what I would allow my kids access to before they could begin using the website.  To some that may be overkill but to those of us that understand the dangers of the internet (predators and unscrupulous marketing techniques) Nintendo of America is a breath of fresh air.  Also, through the Wii menu, I can limit or deny access my kids have to games rated as inappropriate for kids of their age.

Enjoy!

author: Dean Robinson
title: Wow Wii!!!
content:
After reading the reviews for months about how wonderful the Wii system was, I decided to take the plunge. Usually when a product is hyped as much as this, you are setting yourself up for a big disappointment.

Absolutely NOT the case with the Nintendo Wii. I've been playing video games since the days of PONG and have NEVER had so much fun as I have with the Wii.

Yep the Xbox 360 and the PS3 have better graphics. GRAPHICS SMAPHICS! Can you say FUN???

Video games are supposed to be entertainment and the Wii system does entertainment in spades! Everyone that's played our system says they are going to get one. The Wii system is probably the best party game around and will bring smiles and laughter to everyone that plays. Even those curmudgeons who don't play video games get hooked!

Wii Sports is included with the console and with that game alone the system is well worth the money. The number and variety of games will satisfy both kids AND adults! Want to burn some calories? Go a few rounds of boxing. You'll lose weight I guarantee it! We're also looking forward to the balance board and Wii Fitness that is going to be released this holiday season. Imagine having a game system that also doubles as your gym?

But there are also a ton of games from third party developers that are outstanding! For example, check out my review of Tiger Woods PGA Tour 08.

It's absolutely incredible that a system this much fun is HALF the price of the "next gen" systems. The only thing "next gen" about the Xbox 360 and the PS3 is their processing power. The Nintendo Wii truly qualifies as the Next Generation of Video Gaming.

Trust me, take the bucks you would spend on a bare bones Xbox 360 or a PS3 and get the Wii and a ton of FUN games.

Did I mention it is FUN FUN FUN???

author: lmjr21
title: Nintendo Wii
content: The used Nintendo Wii I purchased came in good condition as described by the seller, It's loads of fun for the entire family and for all ages. The Wii sports game gets you moving and is unlike other games in which you just sit there without any movement. I would recommend this gaming system to everybody.

author: OldBlue56
title: Ripoff
content: Who would pay over 700 dolars for a 70 dolar console max!?

author: Lucille Alexis M.
title: Can't beat the wii!!
content: The wii is just really fun. My father had some businessmen from his company over and they had a blast! I should have gotten it on video! My aunt played it and is not a gamer at all, and loved it. One reason was that there arent as many buttons so you dont have to remember what everything does, it just is fun.

author: Dana
title: Best Thing We Have Bought!
content:
I bought this for our family the first year it came out.  The first night we set it up, my husband and I NEEDED to box each other.  In 30 minutes we were DRENCHED with sweat and laughing and having a great time.  Since then, this video game console has been the center of parties (the kids have gotten Guitar Hero and many other things), family entertainment and so much more.  With 4 kids we need to have stuff for them to do on days when you can't get out of the house (aka 24 inches of snow) and they need to get rid of energy.  We have other gaming consoles and 9 times out of 10 they pick the Wii.  This Christmas, I bought one for my mother and it was worth it.  My mother-in-law has one and they have "Wii Parties" where they get together and golf, play tennis and more.

We have different games for the unit - from Wii Music to Guitar Hero to Mario Cart.  There haven't been any we aren't happy with and NONE just sit on the shelf.

The ages can vary as you can tell - from my parents (ages 70-75) to friends kids ages 4+ and everyone has fun.  I see (as a mom) less arguments when they are playing this than any other video game system. It's all fun!

Well worth the money!  You do need 2-4 controllers and definitely the charger unit or else you better have stock in batteries!!

author: Edgar
title: Funny and good quality
content:
Funny and good quality.
Fun for the whole family with an excellent video game console. Very entertaining. I like it.

author: Rocklin
title: It is a fun gaming system
content: It is a fun gaming system, especially if you are new to video games.The wii has many fun games which can be obtained for relatively cheap. The nunchuck takes some time to learn.

author: B. Cox
title: Wii- a great whole family gaming experience
content: The wii truly is a great experience for the whole family. The fun, innovative gameplay is a joy and translates across many generations. I had players from age groups 5-60 playing my wii over thanksgivining and all were greatly enjoying the bundled wii sports game. There are a few good launch games (Legend of Zelda, Excite Truck, and arguably Red Steel) with the promise of many great Nintendo titles in the coming year. I think it is a great buy and a great holiday gift for a child or gamer of any age.

author: Sara
title: Wiivolutionize How You Game
content:
I've had the Nintendo Wii since the US launch day on November 19th and I am completely in love. I've been anticipating this console ever since what seems like ages ago when I'd first heard of its development. Immediately upon getting it home, I didn't rush to unwrap Zelda: Twilight Princess (a game I'd had on pre-order as a Gamecube title almost for 2 years!) or Trauma Center -- I set out to check out what online capabilities my new Wii had.

Unfortunately, a lot of the online features will not be available until late December/early January, but I knew this prior to launch day, so it wasn't that big of a disappointment. The Opera browser isn't yet available, but when it is, it will be free until June 2007 in the Shopping Channel, which is found within the Wii's main menu. Also in the Shopping Channel is Virtual Console. Through Virtual Console, the Wii-user may purchase Wii Points (1USD = 100 points), which is the currency used to purchase classic games of Sega Genesis, NES, SNES, N64 and TurboGrafx16 fame. Currently, Nintendo has only been releasing a few of these at a time every Monday, and there weren't very many out to start on launch day. What games are available, however, are great titles. I've personally been taking advantage of the available TG16 titles such as Super Star Soldier since I'd never had the console.

The Weather and News Channels also are not up yet and will not be until late December/early January. Through the Photo Channel, you can store and edit (to some extent) photos on your Wii. You can also send photos to other Wii-friends. I've also found that your Wii is given an e-mail address (w+wiicode@wii.com), which you can send photos to if you do not have an sd-card. However, you must use an sd card for mp3s and movs (the only audio and video formats I believe work on the Wii) as there are size limitations and file restrictions. The Mii Channel is a fun way to create characters that resemble yourself or others. You can send your Mii to your friends, and you can set your Miis to "mingle," which will enable all Miis on your Mii Plaza (including those sent to you) to be sent to everyone on your friends list to a place called the "Mii Parade" in which they can choose to keep them or dispose of them (sad.)

Of the Wiimote, I've found it to be completely intuitive and not in the least intimidating or difficult to control. Wii Sports is a great introduction to using the Wii-mote, but it definitely just isn't a demonstration of how to use it. I still avidly play Wii Sports by myself and with others and I forsee myself continuing to do so for a very long time. I've barely started Zelda: Twilight Princess because of finals, but, what I've played of it is completely and literally awesome. I still plan on picking up my Gamecube version of the title, but the Wii controls are perfect for this title. There's one major difference between the Wii and Gamecuve versions: Link is now right-handed, for the first time ever in the Wii version. This change was, of course, made because most people are right-handed and the controls rely on the Wii-mote. Although I am right-handed, I kind of wish they hadn't made this change or, at least, made a left or right handed preference choice like in Wii Sports. For those of you familiar with the DS title Trauma Center, I recommend picking it up for the Wii. It's the same story-line but with a few differences and some bonus levels added in. The controls are more forgiving than in the DS version, but overall, it's actually a bit harder.

I don't know how to end this review, but I should really get back to studying for finals so that I may fully deserve my Zelda-fest come next week! For all of you who don't have such obligations, go play Wii!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: Comes fast works perfect with no problem

author: banzzaii
title: False advertising, much?
content:
My Issue:
I'll be honest, I loved my old Wii, I used to play Super Smash Bros Brawl using my Gamecube controllers and it was a lot of fun, until my brother had an accident and it stopped working. I ultimately decided to get a new Wii, but everywhere I looked I only found the NEW Wii consoles that aren't backwards-compatible with Gamecube controllers and accessories for some reason, which I didn't want because I have a lot of Gamecube games that I'd like to keep playing.
After a few hours of browsing, I FINALLY find a Wii that CLEARLY SAYS it has backwards compatibility (The one I ordered), HOWEVER it turns out it doesn't, so now I have to return it.

Why Amazon?
I don't even know why you haven't changed the "Product Description" section since it CLEARLY states that the product I ordered has backwards-compatibility with the Gamecube, nor do I care at this point. I just want my money back now, thanks for nothing Amazon.

author: Vickie Ann Estes
title: Five Stars
content: This was a present for my daughter for Christmas. She loves it.

author: Robert
title: One of the best gaming Softwares
content: The Nintendo Wii is amazing. They are constantly coming out with games and they are so totally worth the price depending on which game you buy. I've played Super Mario Galaxy and it is just amazing. Now, there's already a Super Mario Galaxy 2 coming out! This is one of the best gaming softwares I think there could be in the present time, with it's unique style of gameplay. It's so much different than the other consoles and it also is alot more cheaper too ;)! That's something we could ALL get along with hahaha! This has amazing graphics and it has new innovative ways to have fun! It's even funner when playing in a group. It also sources as a way to get active, because Nintendo also provides you with fun active games like Wii Sports, Wii Sports Resort, Wii Skiing, and MANY MORE! I love this console and I think it's the best out yet. Go get your Wii today!

author: Melissa Moore
title: Four Stars
content: Very good

author: Plato
title: Great!! Not for Serious Gamers!!
content:
We bought this for my 2 boys ages 5 and 7 and I think it will last us for years.  It's easy to figure out, they stand up and move around to play and we enjoy it every bit as much as they do!!
Some reviewers have complained about the graphics and/or the games in their reviews - if you've done any research at all you know this system is targeted at younger children and parents who want alternatives to Doom, Grand Theft Auto, Mortal Kombat and other shoot-em-up games. Nintendo doesn't try to hide that that the graphics and many of the games are simple. And man is it fun!

TIP:  BUY THE RECHARGER!!  The remotes burn through batteries.

author: Mr. Andra Howard
title: We love our Wii
content: Great game console, lots of fun.  Shipped with no problems easy set up and no problems.

author: Thomas Wells
title: One giant leap for the gameing Generation
content: Nintendo did it!  I have been wondering when one of the 3 were going to pull out a new idea.  Cause not one company has come up with anything original in Years.  The Wii is an absolutly amazing console.  Now granted most of the game are childish, but there are a small handful of cool games out there for it.  I got mine used and with out Wii Sports, but in all this console is just too cool for words.

author: gifter
title: Wasnt in a box
content: it did not come in original box and was dirty but works great I actually purchased this as a gift for my nieces

author: Mom2Joe&Sam
title: Great family fun...well worth standing in line for at 3 a.m.
content:
Just throwing my humble opinion in the hat -- We love this system!!  Not every game utilizes the remote well, but the ones that do are great fun and I'm sure more titles will be added soon.  As for the games that don't, we just hook up a different controller.  We've been playing Wario Smooth Moves and Rayman Raving Rabbids and they're hilarious.  Laughing, talking, moving (as opposed to sitting like a lump)... simply the best.

It's definitely not for the graphics snobs out there or others who like the more intense games but that's why the Xbox 360 and the PS3 consoles exist.  You play yours and my family and I will play ours.  Actually, my kids play and like both kinds of consoles.

author: Joy in Depew
title: very fun and enjoy--but don't believe amazon shipping
content: I love the game system, and have had no problems at all with it.  I have one gripe with Nintendo though, and this is a warning to anyone new to the system (like me): the instructions are useless.  I figured out more just by trial and error than by using the booklet that came with the system.  Not a big deal, just a warning.  Also, don't for a minute believe amazon on the delivery time-they are full of it.  I ordered it with basic shipping, I wasn't in a hurry, HOWEVER, waiting 5 business days just to fulfill my order is ridiculous.  I can guarantee that if I paid for the express shipping, I wouldn't have received it by the time they guaranteed.  How do I know this?  Because once packed, it only took 3 days to ship, which has never happened before.  A big deal? maybe not, but I wnated to warn anyone who was buying this as a gift.

author: Niki
title: Amazing!
content: Its great! The whole family can play and my 5 1/2 yr old loves it! Much better than the other games where one sits in front of the TV and wiggles their fingers on the controllers.

author: Almostadirondack
title: Fun for the whole family!
content: We love Wii!  The entire family plays together, it's funny to watch Grandma bowling, lol. The kids like that we are all interested enough to play right along with them. The tennis is so realistic that I stink at it just like in real life. The best part is the kids are up and moving around, interacting instead of sitting. The graphics are not beautiful, but that's not what Wii is all about.  On a side note, I do have a friend who's son cracked their TV because his hand slipped through the remote strap, he did not have it cinched.

author: A. Salcido
title: Funnest Console around!
content: This is the funnest console period. You get to interact with the games which makes it that much more fun. Get the wii fit, and you can even have a fun workout, this is a fun console for the whole family, and a great alternative to the button moshing consoles and games.

author: Amanda L.
title: Addicting!!!
content: So much fun for everyone in my family. We play Rayman and Elebits with the kids and after they are in bed we are hooked on Zelda. The sports game that comes with it is also a lot of fun!

author: Barbara Kunina
title: Five Stars
content: Super fast delivery. Item as described. Thanks

author: Cold Head
title: There Is Something Amazing Going On Here!!
content: I haven't played an actual video game system since I was about ten years old. I was a huge fan of the Super Nintendo. I loved Zelda, Mario Brothers, and Donkey Kong. More recently I felt that video game systems got away from the fun side of it all and got too serious. I always enjoy playing a game that didn't require a person to spend hours on end to have fun playing it. I like to pop the game it play for a little while and turn it off. I don't want to stress out and get mad while playing a video game. After one day of playing Nintendo's latest entry in the gaming market. And being the first video game system I have purchased for myself in 15 years. After actually being excited about finding and purchasing an electronic device for the first time in my life. The Wii brings back what it feels like to be 10 years old again. It is very exciting. Having only played the Wii Sports game that came with the system. I am very impressed with just how much fun Nintendo has made gaming become again. The Wii will be something really big for Nintendo. I can't wait to see what kinda games they have up their sleeves!

author: ct
title: Way better than expected
content: I had this image of gaming for only kids but they do have games that are for adults as well. The graphics is not like the PS 3, but the interactive of the game play overall is much better and more challenging. The remote control takes some time to get used to. Not much down side aside from the battery dies pretty quickly since you'll play so much on it. So its a great buy overall that's why its still the top seller.

author: J. Alva
title: Amazing..
content: I recently got a Wii after waiting so long to get it and tired of hearing it was sold out everywhere.  It's so worth it.. It's an amazing product and it definitely changes the way you play.  THe controller is somewaht sensitive but not in a bad way.  It's the most amazing console I've experienced with.  I love it and hope you make the most out of it.

author: Linda Latch
title: un useable so far
content: so far we have not been able to reset the unit.  It hung up during the use of Guitar Hero and we cannot use it. Very disappointed.

author: ESEMOH
title: Could wii possibly have a wiiner in the console war?
content: I'll tell you right now that I absolutely love Nintendo systems, from the NES to the DS and now the Wii.  But I also love the Xbox and the 360.  I also love the PS2 and the PS3.  I won't even get inot Sega systems.  That tells you right there that I am not a fanboy...I simply love games.  A console is a very hard item to review.  The success of a system always comes down to software.  The Wii has a great, innovative new way of playing games.  Playing games in this new way means nothing if the games themselves are not fun to play.  But I am not worried at all because Nintendo has always made fun games.  Let's see if third party developers can do the same.  It's true that the Wii isn't as powerful as the 360 and PS3, but I have never been big on graphics, even though I know a lot of people are, even though they shouldn't be.  I know it doesn't support HD but games still look beautiful running in 480p.  Just look at Twilight Princess.  And games are only going to keep getting better visually as time goes on.  Just look at some of the stunning games that are pushing the PS2 to the limit.  Only time can do that.  Built-in wi-fi means that you'll be downloading VC games in no time.  The "Virtual Console" itself is almost enough reason to buy this machine.  I absolutely love being able to play the games that I grew up playing, and that's a lot because I've been gaming since I was three.  Make sure you get Punch Out and A Link To The Past....I can't wait for Ducktales!  Games are what sells systems, but this is a great system to play games on.

author: Regio Sassi Neto
title: Five Stars
content: Very good

author: jackiec
title: awesome
content: Perfect for what I needed.

author: czukr
title: Five Stars
content: good

author: dianne kwok
title: new generation of fun gaming
content: After purchasing the Wii, I fell in love with it. Nintendo came up with a unique way of creating a new generation of gaming with the family and friends. The specific games they created to compensate with the Wii is very fun and enjoyable. I especially love the Cooking Mama game, where you use the Wii remote move and do things. Being interactive with the Wii is a plus. Great for kids of all ages and adults too!

author: MM
title: New - Inventive - Unique - Fun
content:
I'm not a big gamer, never have been.  Many years ago I enjoyed video games, but got away from it.  This year for Christmas I thought it would be fun to give it a try again.  A few days after Christmas I first picked up the PS3 - someone was just returning it.  The graphics were incredible and it held a lot of promise.  However, it seemed that it was geared more for serious gamers.  After a few weeks I returned it.

I then decided to try the Wii.  It was hard to get - I had to wait in line before the store opened - I felt weird having to do this.  I purchased the Wii and went home to set it up.

Boy was I surprised.  I was blown away.  What a fantastic idea.  The Wii Sports was terrific.  I played for several hours and was in amazement.  The graphics are not as good as the PS3, but while you're playing it doesn't matter (if you have an HD TV get a component?/composite? (whichever the better one is) cable for a much improved picture).  The whole experience is very immersive.

I haven't played many games, but the ones I have so far have been great.  The ability to browse the internet, get weather, and get news are a nice bonus.  I look forward to future offerings.

I am very happy with my decision.  Be sure to pick up an extra remote or two because playing with other people is a blast.  Nintendo has a huge hit on its hands with the Wii.  For about $250 it is very reasonable and a great way to add some fun into your life.  Everyone is busy and this a great way to take some time to have fun alone or with others.  I don't think it will get old as new and more imagine games come along.

author: Grandma Nette
title: Grandson very pleased
content:
Reviewed by A Simple Taste for Reading: [...]

I read this book to my story time kids and they love the interactive pages along with the bright and bold illustrations!  They really enjoyed the mystery of finding Jazzy while identifying all of the other jungle creatures!

author: Steven P Dear
title: Good Gaming
content: Has been working great for 3 years My Grand Daughter who owns it will not allow me to buy the Wiiu

author: Jeffrey Devries
title: wii may be the 2nd best system out there (windows PC bing best)
content:
The Wii may not be the best graphics out there but graphics are not everything. I LOVE the wii because of the GAMES and the 100% GameCube compatibly. The other systems (ps3, xbox 360) have raelly bad compatibly with there older systems (ps2 xbox)and the games are not as fun!! Yes I have a PS3 and a PS2 but a love my wii alot more. It is all about the games not the system. Also the wii is not hi-def but if you really need hi-def you can get an ADS Technologies HDUP1500 HDTV Upconverter
http://www.amazon.com/ADS-Technologies-HDUP1500-HDTV-Upconverter/dp/B00009XSYZ

author: blanca villaran de arróspide
title: Five Stars
content: good

author: Science Teacher Dad
title: 5th Grade Dad
content: Great game system.  It forces physical exercise and creates family interaction.  No one waits for more than a minuter or two before he or she is brought into the game.

author: Richard Dracass
title: Bring your family back together with family game night
content:
I bougth the Wii a few years ago for my husband's birthday, and it was such a great decision. We use it all the time. It brings the entire family together, multi generations. My kids love it, my friends love it, our parents love it, even our 90 year old Grandmother loved it.
The game selections are endless, there is something for everyone. Little kids, teens and adults. The applications are amazing too. Not only is it great fun, you can use it to get in shape too with games like Wii fit, or even Dance Dance Revolution.
I can't say enough good things about the Wii. Fun for your entire family, and a great way to creat family memories your kids will cherish.

author: Richie Etwaru
title: Mii
content:
Mii like Wii very much :-) and I have not been a traditional gamer. So to have this product convert me to a partial "gamer" says a lot.

I see some long night of Wii bowling ahead. If you are looking for fun get this product. If you are looking for a gift, find out the preferences of the person you are purchasing it for first, some hard core gamers may not find this to be appealing.

-Richie Etwaru

author: Paul R.
title: Everyone should buy a Wii
content: Buying a Wii(Nintendo) this time around was a no brainer for me.  I haven't owned a Nintendo since the original and there is a huge backlog of games I plan to catch up with the Virtual Console - once they're released...for the time being, I'm engrossed with Twilight Princess.  Hopefully by the time I'm done with that, more VC games will be released and hopefully a "media center".

author: Adelie
title: Hours of fun and fitness!
content: My husband and I just bought a Nintendo Wii and we love it!  It has gotten us up off the couch.  We are now working together while playing the interactive games on the Wii Sports disc.  I could not be happier with the results of the time we spend playing our Wii, it's much better than sitting around watching TV!

author: otisia
title: Two Stars
content: Product didn't come as pictured.

author: Debra Thornton
title: great for the entire family
content:
I got one of these as a gift for a family member I thought would be able to get moving a little thanks to Wii Fit.  What I didn't expect is how it brought the entire family together with something they could do with each other.  It's a lot of fun and something that anybody can do.

If you are really into video games and blowing stuff up, this is not the best system, but if you are looking for a different video game experience that is unlike anything you've ever done, and is something that anybody can do, this is the system you want.

author: bixodoido
title: My "family" console
content:
I have long been a Nintendo fan but was, I confess, a bit turned off by the Gamecube.  The games were so limited, it seemed everything cool was coming out for either the PS2, the Xbox, or both (and not the Gamecube), and the proprietary titles (Mario Kart, Zelda, etc), great as they were, were not enough to keep me enthralled with the console.

That having been said, my Wii has rekindled my interest in console gaming.  The unique techology of the controllers, the family-style games, and the virtual console were just appealing to me--so I took the plunge.  And already this thing is well worth the price (and it is the cheapest of this generation of consoles).

Most of the great Wii games I've encountered so far are more appealing to either a multiplayer or a more casual audience.  I consider myself a hardcore gamer but do most of my gaming on the PC, so this console is perfect when I just want to relax and enjoy a nice, enjoyable game with my family.  My wife, my kids, my parents and friends--almost everyone I know enjoys playing the Wii.  I don't know that this would be my first choice if I were exclusively a console gamer, but as it is it serves my purposes very well.  And it's got many of the non-gamers I know hooked.

One of the great features the Wii offers is the "virtual console"--the ability to download (for pretty cheap) many older games from Nintendo's earlier consoles, the Sega Genesis, and the TG 16.  This, to me, is a great feature.  While many of these games are not as enjoyable as they once were the nostalgia factor is incredible, and there's nothing quite like downloading the original Zelda for a pittance and spending a few hours messing around with it and just remembering "the good ol' days."  And with new titles being released every week or so this is sure to continue to be a great feature of the Wii.

In short: someone looking into this gaming console with the express desire to play very intense, "hardcore" games will probably be served better by the XBox 360.  But for anyone who wants an enjoyable gaming experience with high playability and loads of fun I highly recommend the Wii.  The innovative design and enjoyable games will provide countless hours of casual entertainment.

author: S. Parzych
title: great system
content: This is an awesome system.period. The size of this thing is so much smaller than the others espicially the ps3.
