content: I think i bought the right wii i just recieved mine and its in great condition the only sucky thing is i dont have the sensor bar nor a wii remote but that doesnt matter im not concerned but im still gonna get them!!! recommend this it shipped fast!!!

author: Alena
title: Good for low-impact exercise - tons of fun!
content: We bought one of these new and my daughters played it until it died. Now, with them out of the house I figured 1. I'd be alone during the day, so would't get embarrassed if someone walks in and I'm hula-hooping (hysterical to watch someone else do). 2. It's mine! ALL MINE!!!. I'm happy with this one so far (plan on hooking it up tomorrow). Everything came as described (bought it used this time). I recommend it to anyone who is bored to death with low-impact exercise.

author: Stewmeat
title: Wii rocks!
content: Who would have imagined that a game console could be made that would allow people from so many different generations to come together on a Saturday night.  The Wii can be played by almost anyone of any age and you don't have the typical issues you do with other consoles which is using those control pads.  With the wiimotes even my 68 year old mother can learn to play a game of tennis or bowling in no time flat.  This is a great system that is well worth the money.

author: SES
title: Wii - on the move!
content: The Wii is a great product because of how it challenges the notion that video games keep you inactive.  This one gets you up and moving, to be sure!

author: Amazing G
title: I`m owner of this model of this and proud of it :D
content: If you are looking for outstanding graphics turn away now. But if you are looking for a family friendly stay in tuned. Yeah graphics arent the best on regular or hdtv but who cares. Im huge fan of the wii. They have a lot family friendly games out there. I do not believe in first person shooter games. They put a lot thought making this system family friendly. Yes system this model wii play gamecube games. If you be playing for years on it should be the better 2 other companies. No i don't have a family but i look for postive gaming. i love its games inventory, ease of use, and how long it should last [with respect]. there are no fakes for a wii so with negative reviews. i would look past them for a family friendly system. thanks for reading this.

author: Barbara Petolicchio
title: Games are okay not the greatest but pretty good
content: Games are okay not the greatest but pretty good. some times it malfunctions with certain games and it blacks out. on instinct you try to pull the plug, but you get an electric shock. i do not really like it. kinda sucks and you can't get any good games at Game Stop.

author: snowdrop
title: It pays to go to best buy at 5am...
content:
I got one this am and it's truly just... awesome... Nintendo really did take interactive gaming to the next level.. that's the only way I can think to describe it. If/when you get this console - before you play any games you bought, play the wii sports game that comes with it... it's pretty cool.

Also - it has a built in wireless adapter that works for an 802.11b connection (not g). If you don't have a router that does b or if you don't have a wireless router period: there are 2 adapters you can get. There is an ethernet adapter, as well as a wireless usb adapter - the wireless usb adapter plugs into your pc and the wii wil utilize your pc's internet connection.

author: VV
title: fitness for beginners !
content: I purchased this originally for wiifit and loved it. Now i only use it for NewU Yoga and the Deepak Chopra meditation , but its a staple for me

author: Jay
title: Perfect
content:
Ordered this Wii 6 months ago and shipped very quickly. Serves great for family activities. Great price as well. Couldn't have liked a better offer than that.
5/5

author: Sam Caplan
title: A great acomplisment
content:
Let me just start off by saying that the wii is totally different. as i make my review im going to cover some more technical observations a little further down. as someone who has at least tried all the major systems out there, you just cant compare it to the ps3 or the xbox 360 because its not trying to do the same thing. Whereas the ps3 and 360 are trying to make supercomputers affordable ($300-600 and $80 a game just isnt affordable enough for me), and focusing on multi-media functions and extra features, the wii's focus is making an incredible, intuitive, inexpensive, inclusive, and fun gaming experience. I am a technicly minded person, and it takes alot to suprise me or impress me when it comes to technology... and althogh the wii's core isnt more then a beefed up gamecube, i was impressed.

when you take the wii out of the box, the first thing that i noticed is the quality of the packaging and the neat and tidy organization of the parts in the box. The unit itself is suprisingly small and thats important because i dont think its very practical to lug around a 10lb box everytime i want to play a video game at a friends house. Although i only had the basic composite video cables, the video quality was quite good and depends alot on the tv you are using. I have a 63" samsung dlp tv and the video through the basic cables is perfectly clear and crisp, however on a more inexpensive tv, you are reminded that your only using composite cables. The unit itself is physicly more solid then any game console i have every used, including sturdy hinges on all doors. from when you put the bateries in the controller, and when you easily set up the system, and when you realise the wiimote strap comes pre attached, and the sensor bar already has sticky pads on it, or when you plug in a connectors on the back, you can tell that nintendo tought about lots of details. I just cant stress enough how solid the unit is and you can really tell that its a quality product.

The controller is the most incredible i have ever seen or used. It exceded my expectations as far as responsiveness also because the motion tracking has no delay. the sensor bar is just two sets of flashing infrared led's that the wiimote uses to understand the location and distance of your tv for pointing. When you use the wii sensitivity adjustment tool, you can auctually see what the wiimote is seeing on your tv and it becomes clear that the wiimote auctually has a camera sensor in the front for picking up these signals, as you aim the wiimote at any ifrared emmiting device like a lightbulb or candle the wiimoe auctually sees the signals as if it were looking around. overall the remote has far more advanced triangulation then i originaly thought. The accelerometer's in the wiimote also use the constant force of gravity to know how your holding the wiimote, so that the wii can triangulate exactly how its being held and moved on every possible axis. The pointing relys only on the accelerometers percieved motion of the wiimote and the sensor bar location so that having a different kind or size of tv doesent effect the speed or sensitivity of the wiimotes pointing functions, thats important because it really eliminates alot of possible bugs with the whole system although you wont always physicly be pointing exactly at what you trying to point at on the screen.  The bluetooth has given me no trouble and you dont have to worry about waking the wiimote up because the wii itself will wake up the controler or prompt you to push a button that may confirm something on the screen and at the same time wake up the wiimote without you knowing. The wii can tell you the battery life of the remotes and can adjust the volume out of the speaker. The rumble function makes using the remote more tactile and the feedback is important to make the wii easier to use because the feedback during pointing is helpfull to be more accurate. Although the wiimote's little speaker wont blow you away with quality or loudness, the sounds are not distorted at full volume and it adds an unexpected level of immersion and detail to the wii experience. hearing the racket hit the ball (the sounds are well timed and mix well with the sound from your speakers) and feeling the rumble in the controller just ads another level to the wii experience and makes the games just that much more fun. the nunchuck has the same motion sensing capabilities as the wiimote itself and plugs into the bottom of the wiimote without having to do anything other the plug it in when you want to use it and unplug it when you dont. No other action is required. its all very simple to understand for anyone. Another thing that i never knew but is a greatly appriciated feature is that you never have to reset the system when you want to play a different game or return to the main menu.

Im basing most of my review off of my experience playing wii sports, and an important thing to note is that there is a high level of accuracy in the motion tracking for these games, although golf is probably the least detailed in picking up your motions. when playing bowling, the straightness and twist on your throw all comes into play. When your playing baseball the position of the bat that your charecter is holding is representative of how your auctually holding the wiimote in the air and you can move it freely. in boxing, the motion of your body is sensed when you lean and also the tilt of your hands so that you can punch high, low, swing around, jab, undercut, whatever you do it will be (mostly) acuratly sensed and translated into player motion very responsivly.

Many people have written about the other features of the system and i have written about what impressed me most. The gameplay is so wonderfull that me and just about every one of my friends are playing competitivly for the first time in ages. My friends who have never played a video games before are suddenly immersed and because your not wasting time learning button combinations, you can improve your technique by auctually making a better golf swing, or dodging punches faster, or using your backhand swing in tennis at the right time. And as you get better (and each friend can track there own progress with there own mii charecters) the charecters you play against get more challenging. The gaming experience is so much more intuitive that i can say that anyone who doesent mind standing will enjoy at least one game on the wii to the point that they will want one themselfs. this system is everything i had waited for and far exceded my expectations in every aspect possible.

nintendo has a real winner on there hands.

author: Ernie Moch
title: Five Stars
content: good

author: Samantha Cutler
title: Incredible buy!
content: This product shipped earlier than expected, was extremely affordable, and only had very few minimal surface marks that are completely unnoticeable. It works great!

author: C. Monster
title: Wii - Imagine the possibility (NINTENDO'S BACK)
content:
I'll make this quick.

1) Price is VERY reasonable.  I like to think of it as a suped up GC - with all of the add on features I never got (ethernet ,etc).

2) Remotes ARE AWESOME.  Intiutive - and makes you THINK about the possibilites.  Exercise using the WII!!!

3) Can use previous GC accessories -Thanks for the $$$ saving.  Why would you redesign "yet another joystick controller" for the sake of it (or a memory card? - Speed and size - not as important - wireless way more important).  INVENT and focus on breaking new ground.  Again Nintendo nailed it.

4) Easy to setup.  Wirelessly connected in minutes. Registered and online shopping in minutes.  About 10 games to download at launch.  This was COMPLETE thinking on Nintendo's part.

5) You create yourself as Mii and they get to meet people in plaza online - friends etc.  It's like IM - but better packaged and really fun.

6) Nice clean sleek package to play all the previous classic nintendo games,etc.  (gc,n64,supernes,nintendo,tg16 - I have all of those bulky systems and now I can time capsule them - without losing the opportunity to play the best games of those systems).  Imagine the demand for GOLDENEYE and the forums that will allow you to ask for each and every game to download.  Nintendo is genuis ($$$) and while they are out to make a buck - they really make you think its ALL about the gameplay with this system.  PS3 will have horsepower and a boatload of features- but ultimately you need GOOD games and INGENUITY.  REALLY happy with my purchase.

So ONE "I hope they improve":

1) Sensor bar - I want a longer cord.  I also want the bar to allow for a movie screen between the sensors and the remotes. Also, an ability to move the sensor around (and adjust the game setup to account for where its located -like a projector).  I imagine they will get an accesory for this.

Go get one!  Now...the moment is here.. I'm off to try Zelda...

author: A. Okura
title: Great Fun
content: OMG!  What fun.  You won't be disappointed.  I am over 40 and my arms are sore from playing tennis, baseball and boxing -- I admit I'm out of shape -- and I can't wait to get back to it tomorrow.  Very good way to get some exercise while having fun.  This little unit packs quite a punch.

author: rekerdguy
title: A fun game for theENTIRE family
content:
My wife and I are definitely not the gaming demographic. Neither of us has particularly been involved in any way with video games since our teens. That all changed when we saw the Nintendo Wii being used at a family get together. My mom (in her 80's) was right there with every other generation-spanning member of our family, screaming, laughing and having fun. The whole family was playing or engaged in watching for hours. It was one of the best times in years that we spent as an entire family and is a must have.

I know that graphically this game system doesn't compare with the more expensive PS3 and Xbox systems. That said, the Wii is really geared toward the WHOLE FAMILY having fun together and it accomplishes this with flying colors!

author: slapper
title: wow
content: thats what i said ......wow . i ordered the nintendo wii on a monday and it was here on wednesday . no shipping or taxes . and thats after looking online at walmart , kmart , target and even craigslist. you couldnt beat that deal if you tried. and i got it at the price the other stores were advertising it for .

author: K. Holcomb
title: Sports are a blast for non-gamers.
content:
After hearing great reviews from friends and family, I got this for us for Christmas, along with an extra remote and the Wii Fit Plus. I told my mate I'd gotten him something he didn't know he wanted, but would end up really liking. That was exactly the way it was. We are not gamers, just middle-aged people looking for alternatives to outdoor exercise in crummy or cold weather. He loves the tennis. We play each other sometimes, or he plays tennis himself and I use the Fit Plus.  Bowling is a hoot (I swear there's a Dude-like avatar) and baseball gives you a pretty good workout (they all do if you want them to). The extra remote is essential if you want to play together.

Everything was packaged perfectly, and surprisingly easy to set up: in fact, it was a snap.

title: Excellent System
content:
The Nintendo Wii is a great system, some games have regular graphics, but graphics still better than the ps2 and xbox and gamecube, certain games have graphics equal to the Xbox 360 games like Super Mario Galaxy, Zelda Twillight Princess, this system is like a on and off hd console. Remember In 2008 the nintendo wii will release its true graphical abilties.

The wii could be compared to a Xbox 360 On a Standard 480i tv. Depending on the game even higher!

author: skf1965

content: I think for myself this is better than PS3 and Xbox 360. You can't come close on the action and fun that the Wii uniquely offers at such a cheap price compared to the other two and it will play all your old game cube games as well.  Kudos to Nintendo for taking so long to create this fantastic system that young and OLD like myself really enjoy.  I recommend it for everyone.

author: christiandaae

author: H. Zhan

I would recommend this system to anyone, gamer or not. It will immerse you into the games you play and at the same time not make you a couch potato. I am very excited for new games that will be coming out for this system!

title: Love the Wii

The baseball game could have more action but the golf, bowling, tennis, boxing as well as other games we've purchased are fun.  The graphics on the golf are amazing . . . the way the trees reflect in the water is stunning for a video game.

title: voice problem

author: Amazon Customer
title: The Wii is awesome!
content: Our family loves the Wii! It was everything we were expecting. The kids ages 14, 11, and 10 along with my husband and I enjoy the interactive gaming. I think it is awesome that we can be at home on a cold winters day and everyone is up and moving with the Wii!

author: Mike
title: Nice change of technology
content:
I bought this last month thinking I will have absolutely no chance during the holiday shopping to get one. Thank goodness I was lucky enough to get one. Out of the box it was easy to set up.
The Wii is a nice change from the Xbox 360 and PS3 (high priced alternatives). Yes the graphics of the Xbox 360 and PS3 are no question the best but the Wii has the motion sensor. Almost like a virtual reality setting. The added feature is the possible workout you get while playing the games. I have been playing the Wii Sports and my arms actually hurt the next day and playing them for an hour makes you sweeat enough to "think" you did a workout. Not bad for someone who has zero time to go to the gym.
 The graphics are basic but they look nice on a LCD TV. I play mine on a 42" LCD Sharp Aquos and it's amazing. The sound is great. This system would rock if it had the PS3 or Xbox360's graphics.

author: Danny Yu
title: Wii still love this console!
content:
The Wii came out, with a refreshing new design and innovative idea: incorporating motion into gaming. Still, after 5+ years, the Wii  still stands as a friendly-to-all type of a console. Family, friends, everyone can enjoy playing Wii games together. In the past, and still presently, the emphasis was on the individual gamer and the online experience. The Wii has many games that bond family and friends together, as well as provide an online experience.

What you should know:

- Many games on the Wii (at least produced after the Wii's release), are motion based. However, be wary that some games are not fully motion based. Generally, the motion detection is good, with some awkward hiccups here and there.

- You can play older Gamecube games on the Wii. I love this feature! I've found myself browsing in my local Gamestop for games I've already wanted to try, but didn't get a chance to. You can also connect the gamecube controller to the Wii, as well as use the Wii's new gamepad or other companies' Wii-compatiable gamepads.

- The graphics are bad. I can't put it any differently. I can tell you that it's okay that the graphics are nowhere near modern day technology/standard, but it's not. It's one of the only flaws of this machine. You'd think that by 2006, Nintendo would know how to incorporate better graphics and fun gaming experience together. However, I'd give Nintendo a break because they spent A LOT of money on research for bringing motion gaming to the general public.

- The internet browsing, picture viewer, among other Wii menu apps, are very nice. I enjoy watching videos on the Wii browser.

My experience:

- I love playing games on the Wii that are of multiplayer nature. Everyone has such a blast. The bad graphics actually make the experience enjoyable, funny, hilarious, light-hearted, ironically. There are games that are Nintendo exclusive like Super Smash Bros. Brawl and New Super Mario Bros. Wii. Mario Kart is also a blast. It's unlike any other gaming experience. These games are instant classics, although it's only been just a few years.

- Get your butts off the couch! Gone are just sitting down and exercising your eyes, thumbs, and fingers. You can now get up and do simple but addictive sport games like Wii Sports, exercise with Wii Fit Plus - Software Only and even dance with Zumba Fitness. XBOX and PS3 just started catching on, but the Wii remains the most ahead of the curve right now.

- I like the interface of the menu, the little intricacies like the sounds, loading icon, etc. etc. Everything feels so happy, delightful, and soft. It's hard to put in words, but the Wii feels friendly to interact with.

Bottom Line:

- The Wii is the first to introduce the motion style of gaming, and still is the best at doing so. With updates of the Wii Remote Plus - Black and the addition of the Wii Fit with Balance Board shows that the Wii is willing to make updates to continue to improve the gaming experience.

- There are much more of a variety of games since the introduction of the Wii. You'll see shooting games, Movie-themed games, sports games, children's games, etc. etc.

- 2-4 Multiplayer at its best. Whichever games you decide to play with your friends and loves ones, you'll be sure to have an enjoyable time.

author: C. Chartier
title: Greatest game system ever!
content:
I'm sure there are plenty enough reviews that there is nothing new I'm going to say, so I'll try to make it short.

I just recently bought a Wii. I have had an Xbox 360 for a few years and it, frankly, has not done much for me. I play it for about a month, then put it down for 6 months. A few games might draw me in, but the game system doesn't draw me in.

If you want long involved games that take months to complete, then Xbox or Playstation is more your cup of tea. If you are not a big time gamer and just like short simple type games, then Wii is your cup of tea.

More than that though....it is a whole new concept that gets you up and off your butt. There is something different about the ability to really do the game actions rather than just holding a controller and pressing buttons. I love holding the controller like the handle of a bat and swinging it when the ball comes on the screen. It gives a whole new element of fun when playing over game systems like Xbox and Playstation.

Kudos to the Wii!! I'm VERY HAPPY with my decision to trade in my Xbox 360 and get the Wii. It was one of the best decisions I've made.

author: Don Lombardi
title: Wii with Sports Game
content:
It's great. Came with a game already - Wii Sports. Easy to set up and install. Able to go online without the need of a computer, just internet.

Excellent shipping, received nothing broken, earlier than expected.

author: K. TOM
title: Five Stars

author: S. Habib
title: Best Nintendo System Ever!
content: Nintendo has really stepped it up with this console. I'm not a big fan of video games, but when this came out I had to get it. It's a great way to exercise while having fun. Not your traditional sit on the couch for hours game. This game really gets you going!

author: S. Bell
title: Wii gamingg system
content: The Wii gaming console is the most exciting gaming device in this decade.  It brings families together by involving them into the action of the various games it plays.  Unlike most video games, the Wii transports its players into the action of the games by using the remotes like you would the various implements of the real live game, such as, a tennis racket, a bat, a golf club, etc.  The beauty of the bowling game makes you feel like you're actually bowling (and your score truly reflects how you actually bowl in reality, be it good or bad!!).  Boxing brings you "out of the corner" and gets you to physically swinging your arms, as you jab and strike, and your remote picks these movements up and translates them into boxing the video representation of your opponent.  Gone are the sedentary days of former video gamers.  Get in where the action is. Go Wii!!!!!!

author: Barbara Thielke
title: wii system
content: The Wii system is fabulous...it is helping me to lose weight the correct way..thanks for the fast service in shipping it me...we love the wii fit and wii sports thanks

author: Adrian Jenkins
title: Although it's early in the game...
content:
...the Wii has exceeded my expectations. Do you want flashy graphics? Look elsewhere. Do you want fun? Find it here, for a price that's easy on the pocketbook.

Nintendo has always been about style. The Wii capitalizes on this. I hope the controller is more than a mere hook, but even if it is, what a hook! There is a great synergy (stupid word, I know, but descriptive in this case) between the launch games and the system, something which cannot be said for the bloated PS3. And there is enough novelty here to make it a good alternative to the X-Box 2 (or whatever it's called), which seems now to be hitting its stride.

"Zelda" is a great game. There is a bit of a learning curve for the controller, as the X-Box afficionado reported. Indeed, it took me a whole 5 minutes to get comfortable with it. And Wii sports is an excellent package - that comes with the system.

Don't overpay, though - I just picked mine up yesterday, and they are beginning to hit the stores. Amazon will have theirs soon, and not for the bloated 500 bucks some people here seem to think they'll get after Christmas.

To sum it up, Wii is the most fun system out there at the moment. Ultimately, its lack of processing power will hurt it in the long run, methinks, but for the pricetag and the initial launch, it is the big winner. Happy gaming!

author: Tamzarian
title: The Best System
content: I purchased the Nintendo Wii console about a week ago, and to be honest it is the best system of the three in my opinion. It took me several months to locate this system in a store. The best advise I can give anyone is to not buy this system online. The entire Nintendo Wii system only costs 250 dollars. Any true retail store will sell it to any individual for 250 dollars. Most of the people here want 400 dollars or more. If you buy the system online your going to get ripped off. I'm not going to tell anyone how to get one in the stores. If one is smart enough then one can figure it out on their own. These are the people who buy it before you can get to it, and then sell it back to you for a lot more. My best advice is to just be patient. Either go look for one in the stores, or wait until next year when the demand is not so high.

author: San Marcos
title: Great System for Every one!
content:
The Wii console is great for you of the whole family.  I have listed some positive and downfalls about the Wii below:

Positive side:
1.The Virtual Console (Nintendo's online store): You can download all the old 80's games, Super Mario Bros., Donkey Kong, etc.
2.The remote uses hand motion as a form of controlling the character (easy to use)
3.You can use all of your Game Cube stuff, such as controllers, memory sticks, and games.
4.Graphics are great! (no PS3 graphics, but the entertainment excess the default)
5.Nintendo has an online internet setup with News, store, and internet searching; no mouse or computer desk required, search with the wireless remote from your love seat.

Some downfalls:
1.Wii has only 512MB internal memory, so you're going to have to purchase a Scan Disk card for storing extra memory later. (I got 1GB for $[...] at Amazon, which I use just for my Virtual Console games)
2.Not all games (non-Nintendo) are setup to use the Wii remote perfectly such as Call of Duty 3.  You also need the classic controller or game cube controller to play the old games.
3.Internet online sells.  Recommendation: purchase the Wii system at a retail store or a known company ($[...]).  I have been seeing sells for over $[...] just for the console alone.  My total was $[...] with an extra controller, 1GB SD disk, Zelda, and a warranty.  I also have been renting my games to see if I like them first.

You'll going to enjoy the playing the Wii!

author: The Duck of Indeed
title: An Awesome Console
content:
The Nintendo Wii is a very fun console, plus it's cheaper than the PS3 and 360.  The games are also cheaper.  The graphics aren't as good as the other consoles, but they're still pretty good.  What makes the Wii so fun, besides the large number of fun games you can play, is the motion.  Some games don't make very good use of the motion, but some games are just so much different than games in the past.  The "Super Mario Galaxy" games are great to play to see what you can do with motion.  "Okami" is another great game where you use the Wii remote to draw, and "Metroid Prime 3" makes you feel like you're really in the game the way both the remote and nunchuk is used.  Not only are there a lot of fun Wii games, but the Wii can play GameCube games and also can download Nintendo, Super Nintendo, Nintendo 64, and I think Sega games, as well.  It can't get all of the games, I think, but it probably can get the main ones, at least.  The Wii can also get Netflix, which is convenient.
The controllers are wireless, of course, and have sound, too, which I think isn't necessary and probably makes the batteries go out faster.  The batteries last about a month for me, but it could be more or less depending on how much you play.  Some games are played with just the remote and some are played with the remote and the nunchuk, which I think is fun because it makes the games even more different from each other.  You alo can save your Wii games to the Wii, so you don't need a memory card.  (You do still need a GameCube memory card to play GameCube games and an SD card for the downloaded games and for extra storage, though so far, the Wii has had enough storage for all my games.)
Now you may have heard about all the people that have thrown the remote into the TV screen and wonder how likely this is to happen to you.  This isn't really that likely if you wear the wrist strap and don't go insane with the remote.  I've never gotten close to this happening (I rarely ever swing in the TV's direction anyway, unless you're playing tennis or something), so if you're concerned about losing your grip on the remote and cracking your TV screen, don't worry.  Just be careful.
Anyway, to summarize, the Wii is a very fun console.  There are just so many fun games you can get, even for the older consoles, and the motion makes it even better.  The graphics aren't as good as the competition, but at least the Wii console and games cost less.  There's a reason why the Wii used to be so hard to get.

author: Tracey the Great
title: Even My PARENTS Enjoyed Playing!
content:
I like playing with the latest and greatest in technology and when I saw the first commercial for the Wii, i knew i had to have it.

This is so much fun to play.  It is so easy.  My parents who are almost 60 loved playing it.  We spent two weeks over Christmas playing Wii sports (mainly bowling and tennis) and much to my dismay, my mom (who i would call technically challenged) was BETTER than me at some of the sports games.

This console is so much better than the PS3 - as far as enjoyability to be had by all.  We got the Wii and the PS3 at the same time and I have still NOT played the PS3.  (Mostly because I am not interested in any of the games that are out for the PS3 but also because the ease of playing is just not the same.)

I would have gladly paid much more than the $249 that the Wii retails for.  This is a great time to be had by everyone young and old.  Make sure you get the second remote and nunchuck - two remotes are a must have for group play.

content:

author: Megan
title: 10+ years and still going strong
content: I've owned a Wii for over 10 years now-- since it came out in 2006. This console has been with me threw multiple moves and has survived them all. It's still working perfectly fine after a decade of use. In fact everyone in my family who bought a Wii after mine (they played on mine and were hooked) have died either. Very durable. It's slim which is amazing for small spaces. I know it's a legacy platform at this point, but I still recommend it.

author: Shorty
title: Love the Wii
content: My Wii came pretty quickly after I ordered it. I set it up right away, and I love it. It's a fun system.

author: Randi Morse
title: Best Game System EVER
content:
I love Nintendo. Not only do they make family-friendly games, they think outside of the box.

After much begging and pleading with friends, my boss in California (I live across the country) was able to snag one and ship it to me. It was a huge Christmas surprise and now my husband, my two children and I have all become addicted.

Our friends came up on New Years Eve and we spent all night playing with the system. Bowling was great, boxing was great, and baseball was a hit! We even enjoyed playing Wii Play. My friend's husband goes to a gym and says that he felt as though he got more of a workout that he enjoyed than he does at his expensive gym, so now they're looking into getting one.

The Wii is truly the best system Nintendo has designed yet. If you don't have one, try one. I guarantee you'll love it, especially if you have young children!

author: Amanda Faber
title: Soooo worth it
content:
I absolutely love my Wii system!  Just about every night my family and I are battling it out in the bowling alley, and I still expect to wake up one night and find my dad practicing golf when he thinks no one's watching.

My family as a whole has had other game systems in the past, but this is the first one that I personally have purchased, and I don't regret it at all.  I can't wait to take it with me back up to school so my friends and I can have the ultimate Wii bowling showdown

author: Fitness Fan
title: Fun...to a point!  Review from a longtime Nintendo console buyer
content:
I've bought almost every system that Nintendo has put out...the SNES, the N64, the NDS, and now the Wii.  I've had the Wii for over a year.

It's a good system.  I LOVE that you can download the older Nintendo games that I enjoy like the Diddy Kong series.

And I also enjoy several of the Wii games, like Mario Galaxy, Mario Kart, Zelda etc.

But I think my Nintendo console buying days are over.  Why, you may ask?

Because Nintendo ALWAYS puts out a few really good games at the console launch (almost always a Mario and a Zelda) and for a couple of months after.  And then....sucky games abound!!!  Nintendo just can't seem to get it up and keep it up!  I haven't bought a Wii game in months.  I think the last one was Guitar Hero (which, yes ok, is admittedly awesome).

It gets irritating supporting a company that puts out, in my opinion, a majority of substandard games that even my 10 year old nephew won't play.  Nintendo is just so hit and miss.  When I look at game reviews at IGN or Gamespot...the reviews are 6 or below for most Wii releases.  Maybe 1 out of 20 games released gets a great review.

For a gaming console for the casual gaming family?...oh yeah, get the Wii.  They have probably a good dozen games that you can get that will keep you entertained for some time.  And probably a good dozen more kid-friendly games (tho' don't ask me what they are...I haven't been all that interested in the "My Pretty Pony" type of games).

author: Vince Costello
title: totally awesome
content: works great, very fun, easy to set up, great seller communication. a must have for any gamer or people new to gaming. great price. shipped fast. i was greatly satisfied by both the product and the service.

author: Gary
title: Fun...but fragile.
content: The Wii is a lot of fun.  But, here, five months after purchase, I have to send it in for repair.  Nintendo tells me the "card reader" is likely shot.  It will not read any disc.  I tried their cleaning kit, to no avail. Five months of use.  My old Gamecube lasted six years, sometimes being left on 24 hours a day for weeks.  My Wii, in comparison, was babied, never played more than a few hours.  I will say that Nintendo's customer service seems quite good, and they're repairing it free.  Still, a month without a game console is not fun.  I thought, being Nintendo, the Wii would be ultra reliable, but Nintendo tells me that mine is a common problem.

author: octovia
title: Bought this wii used and it came in excellent condition. Haven't used yet it's a Christmas gift ...
content: Bought this wii used and it came in excellent condition.  Haven't used yet it's a Christmas gift for the kiddos. But all around looks and seems great!

author: Alyse
title: 5 stars
content: exactly as expected. no complaints!

author: john
title: very bad product
content: Doesnt work good, didnt came with all items ready to play i had to buy separate accessories to my son to play, all games colors are black and white bcuz the console doesnt work good

author: Kenneth A. Labuda
title: Wii
content: I am 67 years old, recovering from a recent fall which has confined me to a wheelchair. Not really being able to do anything, I purchased the Wii. Since having so much fun with it I have friends and neighbors over to play the bowling game. It's great!

author: Kristi
title: The Best!
content:
Nintendo has done it again.  This gaming system is truly revolutional and takes gaming to the next level.  While many will argue that the graphics are not comparable to PS3 or Xbox, this system can hold it's own on what it does have.  This system gets you up off of the couch and puts you into the game like never before.  With this system you have to move, and you often find yourself forgetting that you aren't really performing the action in real life.  With the Sports game that is included, you really feel like you are bowling, or hitting home runs... You swing your arm back just as if you were really bowling, and you hold the Wii Remote like a real baseball bat and swing away!

There are a multitude of games to come for this system and so many of them look promising.  This system is a bargain for the price as the system also features the option to download games of old (NES, SNES, N64, Sega, etc...), the system will have internet browsing very soon, you can send messages (emails) to friends, and it plays Gamecube discs.

This system is easy to use (for most games) and even a person who has never played video games before can pick it up and learn it easily.  It is great for people of all ages no matter how young or old, and it is HIGHLY entertaining!

author: James P. Burrow
title: Fun,Fun,Fun
content: This is the most fun I have had in along time.. The games are so real and really gave my wife and myself a fun way to get some exercise and play some old games like bowling, baseball, and even boxing

author: David Atkinson
title: Addictive fun
content:
While the XB360 and PS3 are new generation in name, they really only improve the visual quality of the games; the Wii radically alters the way games are played.

Wii Sports is a perfect training game for the new remote to let one see and feel how it works. Tennis is incredibly fun and boxing is as much of a workout as DDR or more. Zelda and Madden are great fun. You cannot play this game sitting down (except for maybe Zelda), so get a Wii and get ready to sweat!!!

author: Rajeev D
title: Good one....
content: Got it for my 5 yrs old niece she really loves it that's all matters.

author: Theresa Douglas
title: Five Stars
content: very satisfied!!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Two Stars
content: We didn't get our controllers and our cords and sensor bar for our wii

author: B. Miller
title: Great for sports games
content: If you like sports video games, this is the game system for you. There are also a lot of add-in accessories that make this game system even more fun.

author: BandB
title: VERY impresive!!!
content: I bought one at Circuit city for 249. Now that my 3 kids and I tryed it we are hooked! It is every thing they say and more. I dont think I would pay the 450 plus the scalpers are asking but its your your choice? Worth every penney at the real price. Be patient and keep looking online.

author: Ed from NY
title: No wii sports
content: Did not come with wii sports

author: rukusphil
title: super fun for the whole family
content:
even though i'm not much of a gamer (anymore), i still play wii with my gf on occasion. i also own a PS3, PS2, and N64 but never play them. i even have guitar hero on PS3, but i still only play wii because the wii games are much more fun.

i also have a wii fit, which i also highly recommend.

author: Spiros P Spiropoulos
title: Wii CoCsole worst network vconnectivity in the world
content: Sorry but after 3years of frustration I have to leave this review. I have never had a product that was as incapable of understanding the network it was connecting to as this one. This unit cannot connect to a router for the life of it. And when I go to the wii settings page for help, the instructions are so complex you need to be a network engineer to understand them. Abandon this piece of junk and buy something that has some intelligence. That's what I did. This thing ended up in the garbage and I got a different product. Goodbye Nintendo.

author: Rosie
title: Very happy with product & service
content: Waited awhile before leaving feedback to make sure it worked for awhile. Works perfectly fine, no problems with the Wii console or the controllers. Very happy with product & service! Everything was packed very good & received it quickly.

author: Jennie
title: luv it
content: Packaged very nice. Fast shipment. Only thing I had an issue with was I got one paddle that came with a rechargeable battery  so I had to buy a docking station. Instead of the Wii remote coming with a regular battery back. Grate price as well

author: K. Steele
title: Wii the must get next gen.
content:
I got a wii in line on launch day, and the things you can do with just the system and wiisports in amazing.

I truly didn't know how much fun just making mii's were going to be and wiisports is easily a game that would make money if it was sold alone.

While the graphics aren't that of the ps3 and xbox360, it has fun games to make up for that. I'm impressed with what Nintendo is doing and I was one who was put off my them for many years and it's great to see the system getting some games that will be remembered way down the road.

author: Yi Dong
title: the very best
content: most fun I ever got from any video game. Wii sport that comes with the machine is very much addictive. The twilight princess is even more. I couldn't stop until I finished the whole game. And I am planning to re-start from the right beginning again. Best in almost every aspect. And the image quality is also pretty good. I know PS3 or XBOX360 gives better audio and video. But, hey, this is a game. Wii is the best game experience. Try it if you haven't.

author: Sweetpoptart
title: Five Stars
content: 5 Stars

author: Sz
title: Just plain fun
content: The Nintendo Wii is just plain fun. My wife actually plays video games with me now, and when we brought the system over to my parents' house, they even joined in. That simply wouldn't happen with other consoles. Though I am sure there are fun games on other systems, those games probably won't draw the crowds and get people playing together like the Wii will. I just hope Nintendo and other companies continue to release fun games at a good pace in the future.

author: Anita
title: he love it!
content: Got this for my grandson,he love it!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: No issues.  Got what we expected

author: Joseph Marcos
title: I was super excited because it said my package was not supposed ...
content: I was super excited because it said my package was not supposed to arrive until late october, but it came within 4 days of ordering! However when I went to open my package I realized my Wii didn't come with any of the cords ( the sensor or the charging cord) it's really annoying as the description explained it came with everything. I can understand not having the remote, but not having the basic cords to plug in is frustrating. I had to order separately. Make sure you know what you are getting. I'm giving 2 stars as it was fast delivery but it didn't come with what it said.

author: Kerry Kobashi
title: Superb!
content:
Its Xmas 2006 and I am writing this in it's wee hours. After playing with the Wii for over two weeks now, I can say that this has to be the toy of the year. Forget PS3 and XBox 360 - the Wii for the price is a whole lot of fun and very entertaining.

Although the system doesn't support high end resolution screens and use high end graphic processors, who cares. The idea here hits the nail on the head - develop a moderately priced video gaming system that gives players a rich, engaging experience. It's the handheld controllers that gives the Wii the interactive experience that makes playing games on the system so fun.

Not only that, but the system is backwards compatible with previous consoles. Imagine being able to run NES, TurboGrafix, Nintendo 64, and GameCube games. All those old game cartridges, memory blocks and controllers can still be used. You can also get the Wii wired to the Internet. Simply set your Wii's wireless settings to tap into your wireless router. There, you can go shopping for Nintendo games from the past. Although the selection is small, new games will be added (and yes those that I did purchase did run).

So what's so great about the Wii? Its in the controllers. The wireless Wii remote and the nunchuck take gaming to a new level. Being able to gesture in a more natural way makes the gaming experience so lifelike and real. For example, box like you box, swing the golf club like a hack and even bowl like you normally do. The 3d spatial interpretation of the controller's position really makes this unit so unique.

I was pretty lucky to get a new Wii and I'm sure they are still hard to get this Xmas. For those dying to get one when they come in stock, get it because its a heck of a lot of fun and well worth the price!

author: W. Hurley
title: Wii-mote NOT just a novelty.
content: I've spent a week with my Wii and can honestly say it is fantastic.  The controller is not a novelty, it's just a new way to interact with your game.  If we had all started out with a Wii-mote instead of pushing buttons, we would be thinking the idea of going to a non-motion sensing controller was idiotic.  The Wii-mote does take getting used to but it is a lot more fun than pushing buttons.  The biggest difference is that the Wii-mote can tell how hard you want to steer a car or fling a ball, a button can't do this as well.  Anyone waiting to buy a Wii with the idea that they're concerned it's a novelty, don't wait any longer.  I would recommend just buying the Nintendo-written games for now (no third parties) like Excite Truck and Zelda since I don't think the third party games take full advantage of the Wii-mote just yet, especially the sports games.

author: Tiger
title: Fun for Casual Gamers & Non-Gamers
content:
The Wii is a pretty fun as a casual game experience.  Only on the Wii I can play many games with my wife.  She uses it a lot more than I do.  We primarily use the Wii to play casual games together.  The graphics don't measure up at all to XBox 360 or Playstation 3, but can still be plenty of fun for games where graphics are not important.

I use the Wii for Wii Sports, Wii Fit, Boom Blox, Mario Party, etc.  I find myself using the Wii less and less and my XBox 360 much more now since I more often want to play some deeper, more graphically intensive games.  There far fewer Wii games I am interested than those for other consoles, but the other consoles do not yet have the unique casual game experience that my wife and friends are excited to play.

I still recommend and like the Wii, but it isn't trying to compete with Xbox 360 or Playstation 3 which are entirely different kinds of gaming experiences.  You either want to play some of the casual games with motion controls or you don't.  If you aren't a big fan of Wii Sports, then there is probably little reason to buy a Wii.

Adult friends and family have bought the Wii that would have never bought or played games anymore.  So it definitely has opened games up to them again.  However most of them have significantly decreased their usage of the Wii after the first few months or year, haven't bought new games, or have stopped playing all-together.  So if you don't play and are wondering how long lasting it will be, you probably will not play forever.  But if you want something fun that you can do in a group setting, it is a nice option.

I consider a Wii a replacement for board games.  It is fresher and more exiciting ina group setting than board games for many and can be used once in a while when you want a casual game like that.

author: Jama Chorush
title: Wii Review
content:
Wii
The Wii provides entertainment, excercise, news, forecast, internet, download of old and new games, photo and video support, internet and sevral system updates. However the Wii lacks features of the Playstation 3 and XBox 360 graphics, DVD, Blu-ray or HD DVD support, low price for games, titles, common video formats such as WMV and MPEG-4 however, it does support motion J-PEG, motion AVI, and Motion Quicktime MOV, as well as titles for download. In defense of the Wii, unlike both systems it has a better remote that can be used for great gaming and exercise as well as more excercise by real-life sports and fitness games by emulating on-screen characters.

author: W. Warshauer
title: Revolutionary Console
content:
After having played through some of Zelda: Twilight Princess and the Wii sports, I have to say that I am thorougly impressed with this console. Physically it is very modern looking and about the size of your average external dvd player. It would fit in well with any entertainment system. But of course the important part is how it plays. Obviously, the best part about the wii is the level of interaction. I'm the kind of gamer that likes to swing my controlers around while I'm playing, so the ability for my motions to actually control the gameplay is wonderful. Might I also add that the remote control combination is the best I have ever played with. I was a little unsure of it at first because it is so different from any other game controller, but everything is very natural and it allows for a great range of motion. It does take a little bit of time to get used to the quirks of the motion sensor, but it comes very quickly. Unfortunately the graphics on the wii are not as good as its rivals. However, what is more important to you, graphics or gameplay? And the graphics on average will be acceptable for 99% of gamers I would expect.

Another plus about the wii is all of the other stuff besides gaming you can do on it. I'm still exploring all the many facets of the console, but there really is a lot available. And I also love the fact that I have access to a whole catalog of classic games on the virtual console. Big plus for nintendo there. And of course, how many other consoles that you have purchased recently come with a free game, and a pretty decent one at that. Overall this is a great system that will meet the needs and desires of the whole family.

Pros:

-Great interatction

-Fun gameplay

-Free game with the system

-access to a bunch of classic games

-Excellent Price point

-Great Remote control combination

Cons:

-Average graphics

-Wii remotes eat batteries

author: Andy
title: Nintendo gets it
content: Who wants a niche market box when you can get something the whole family can enjoy.  I have not bought a console since the PS1 and I jumped at the Wii with both feet.  I bought a second controller for the wife and we have spent hours playing golf, bowling, and even boxing.  I am not sure I will even need other games...nintendo better get online services up to support this box, because the revenue model is a one stop shop.  You dont anything else!!!!

author: L. Mitchell
title: Wii love it!!!
content: Lame, I know. :) We own this and an Xbox360. (With 6 kids we weren't even thinking about a PS3). Only my husband plays the Xbox360, but all of us play the Wii. I have the Wii fit and other "mom" games, the little ones play Tony Hawk downhill jam (the controls are simple so they don't get frustrated) and Diego, the older kids play Rayman TV Party and Mario Galaxy, and the hubby loves Guitar Hero. We also play it when we have people over. They tend to want to play Wii Sports and American Idol. All in all, a great console for folks who like to play (in the same room) with their friends and family.

author: malcat11
title: Game-On LLC.
content: Console base and controllers are filthy, covered in clearly visible and crusty spots, some clear and some small red and blue ones. The sensor bar has a dent in it so large I’m going to have to make sure it even works before I give it to my son. I knew I was purchasing this used and it wouldn’t be “like new.” However, it was explicitly stated that this was to come in “very nice” and “very clean” condition, which it did not. I would say fair at best. Pretty disappointed. The company had good reviews which is why I chose them.

author: Deborah F Burns
title: One Star
content: I CALLED BECAUSE IT DID NOT CONNECT, IT NEVER DID WORK FOR MY GRANDSON.

author: Rajendra S. Gondhalekar
title: Wii is just FUN
content: My wife got an XBOX 360 for me and my son as an after Christmas surprise.  I asked her permission to return it and get a Wii at $100 over retail instead.  I have never regretted that decision.  Even at that price, I could get a few more games (especially cheap used Gamecube gems like Metroid Prime, Super Mario Sunshine, and Zelda Wind Waker).  I was also able to get Zelda Twilight Princess, of which I have barely scratched the surface.  All of these games were made in a way that my 8 y.o. son would enjoy far more than almost any of the dark shooters that XBOX/XBOX 360 library seemed to be dominated with.  After hooking it up, I was amazed at the responsiveness of the Wiimote, the sheer joy of controlling Wii sports, creating Miis for the whole family and the visiting friends of my son, and the intuitive interface of the spinning globe on the silly Forecast channel.  The XBOX 360 may have the adavantage in terms of HD graphics and overwhelming processing power, but it doesn't have the Wiimote, which to me is a far more important advancement.  Don't event talk to me about the PS3.  I've seen black boxes of the $600 Sony dud gathering dust in every store I've visited while on the hunt for a second Wiimote and Nunchuk.  I've never, ever, seen a Wii on sale anywhere.  I'm glad I got mine when I did.  Even a few more weeks with this joyous wonder were worth the extra cash I doled out.

author: Michael Anthony
title: fun fun fun
content: I know this is an older item but it ws actually a lot of fun to use this in different settings.  Way worth the purchase especially for smaller children.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Provided Hours of Fun
content:
As the greatness that is the Nintendo Wii comes upon the twilight of it's lifecycle, I have to reflect a bit over what the system has done for me.  I'm a man in my early thirties now, so when I grew up, I grew up on Nintendo.  Sure, there was a bit of Atari action going on a little before that, but when Mario presented his mustached self, I never looked back. That very fact alone has a lot to do with the fondness I now look over Nintendo's latest incarnation; the Wii.  Much has been made over the years about how it's the lesser of the next gen consoles, what with it's subpar graphics and kiddie games.  All of us Nintendo lovers have had to put up with the scene where one of our acquaintances who loves to play Call of Duty asks us if we play on XBox live and we respond, "No, we have a Wii."  Suddenly we can see the person begin to look down their noses at us as they begin to talk in a fake superior British accents about how they're sorry that we're stuck with an inferior gaming system and suddenly I feel like I have to apologize that my gaming doesn't fit their standards of gaming.

That's when I have to stop myself, look them in the eye and say "Yep, stinks to be me.  All those hours of fun I've had playing Mario Galaxies and Zelda and Metroid Primes have obviously been a huge waste of my valuable gaming time.  I see the light."  Pause to let the sarcasm sink in and go about my business.  Perhaps fire Mario Kart up when I get home.  The point is simply this, going in we knew the Wii wasn't going to have knock out realistic HD graphics.  And frankly, we didn't care.  We believed in Nintendo because of years of top quality games.  The motion controls are fun on the games that do get them right, but if they aren't your thing, most of the time you don't have to use them.  I myself think the motion controls are pretty cool.  Unfortunately, a lot of games didn't realize how to incorporate them and you ended up with a lot of games that degenerated into waggle fests.  But you pick up a game like Metroid Prime 3, where motion controls take an already awesome gaming experience and shoots it to the next level, then it was worth it.

Sure, we saw a lot of sewage drenched filth come out on the system and had to wade through a lot of uninspired junk to find some jewels.  But when we did, wow, how refreshing was it to play those games.  This is an incarnation of Nintendo that has seen three top tier Mario Games, two Legend of Zeldas, and two Metroids.  How many generations of Nintendo consoles can boast that, apart from the original?  And graphics?  They may not have been photo realistic, but the good games that knew how to work with them and give us good art design with vibrant colors really looked great.  Take a look at the Galaxy Marios or even Mario Kart.  You could play a new Ghostbusters game on PS3 or XBox 360 that looked like you were watching a movie, or you could play a version on the Wii that looked like a slick cartoon that made you FEEL like a Ghostbuster.

To me, that's what makes the Wii a success.  The fun of the games.  And yes, they weren't all kiddie games.  Try out the bloody No More Heroes or MadWorld and you'll find some slick no small kids allowed violence you'll be shocked to find on a Nintendo system.  Even first person shooters; while missing the photo real HD graphics, they control like a dream with the Wiimote/Nunchuck combo.  Point and shoot.  Super accurate.  Not everybody is a "hardcore" super gamer.  There are some, like me, that grew up on the Nintendo brand that love those original games and love to play the continuation of those series.  And when you throw a game changer like the Wii Sports games, it's like icing on the cake.

I'll never regret getting a Wii.  For someone who didn't game much between about halfway through the N64 years to a couple of years into the Wii lifecycle, it has, in the end, provided me with hours of fun.

author: becky walk
title: One Star
content: It didn't work

author: Inspector Gadget
title: It was fun while it lasted
content:
Despite being a non-HD console without even the ability to play DVDs, the Wii still gave Sony and Microsoft a run for their money two Xmases in a row over the past five years. The motion controller and nun-chuck was an innovative idea that attracted customers who had only ever been used to standard control pads. But with the release of PlayStation Move Starter Bundle and Kinect Sensor with Kinect Adventures and Gunstringer Token Code the Wii has lost its unique edge, and since it never offered anything like the PlayStation Trophies or Xbox Achievements the online features are limited to those stupid 'Miis' and the rather dull Wii Store.

The console itself is sturdy but small, and feels more like a toy than something that belongs connected to your home entertainment system, thus making it more likely to be kept in a kid's bedroom. There is no separate audio out and the video connection is, at best, RGB. It has the ability to play GameCube games, which is a huge bonus as there are a lot of hidden gems out there for that system, but they are region-locked, so you can't import otherwise unavailable games from the other countries, ditto for the Wii games themselves. None of the downloadable features are really any good. If I want to load pictures onto a games console the PS3 is more appropriate, plus it also features the ability to save audio and video files, which the Wii doesn't. One of the better features is the aforementioned Wii store, which offers retro Nintendo and Sega games. But they hardly ever update it and the payment system feels like a con.

I really do feel that the reign of the Wii is over. It's a Remora fish swimming in the wake of the bigger consoles. If you're going to invest in something for your kids or for your home theater then leave this be. It's great for a toy if you pick it up cheap, though it will never be a 'main' Xmas or birthday present again. I'm sorry to say it, but unless Nintendo goes HD for their next console, they are finished.

author: Houston
title: Five Stars
content: It's a wii, what can I say.

author: Andrew B. Hooper
title: Great
content:
I am very pleased with the Wii as it provides realistic game fun for the whole family.
It was the last thing my beautiful wife of 43 years ask me to order for the grandkids before she suddenly passed away.

A Hooper
Dec. 16, 2008

author: Matt Trussell
title: They did not send me the cable to plug wii ...
content: They did not send me the cable to plug wii into the tv. Also disc drive makes a long 'wrrrrrrrrr' noise when i turn the device on.

author: Cheryl F.
title: Wii is wonderful
content: There isn't much one can say about a console as it only seems to sit there and play the games.  It works.  The seller was extremely responsive when I questioned him about a part I thought was missing (stand) and he sent one immediately. The console is exactly as described, it was received well within the stated delivery time, and I have had no problems with it at all.  Works all the time, every time.  Thank you.

author: Chad Mallett
title: a must for kids and older
content: I have 3 nephews and 1 niece, All 4 get to play, I can find games for all 4 and they love it.

author: Harold R Rawson
title: Five Stars
content: This works and was as described.

author: spl
title: Five Stars
content: My son loves it!

author: Ashley Montgomery
title: The only reason I purchased this product, was because ...
content: The only reason I purchased this product, was because it said that the only items that would be missing were: manual, cover, art or packaging. The box did not include the AV cable that is necessary to view the screen, as well as the remote. To buy these things separately I have to dish out $35 more. It is one thing to not include the remote. I get that.... but the AV cable? That's a little insane. I thought I was getting a deal, but I am not.

author: Mo-man
title: Don't be fooled!
content:
Before you go on with this purchase you need to know one thing. This is not a high end graphically intense console and it isn't supposed to be. Too many people are complaining about how 'bad' the graphics are and I'm sorry but if you don't like it you should not have purchased the item (do your research before you spend your money.

With that said the Nintendo Wii is everything it is supposed to be, a fun for all gaming system. Though the graphics are similar to that of the Game cube the Nintendo Wii brings family fun and friends closer together. You may not be able to play your precious Halo 3 on it, but to see your wife bouncing around the room trying to pull off some of the Wario Ware mini-game moves is more than worth the price of the console.

Another great thing about this console is the ability to download old favorites right to the system and have them to play whenever you want, no need to dig through the attic to find that old copy of Mario 64!!

I say Nintendo delivered on their promise of a console that is both fun and great at bringing friends and family together.

author: Millz
title: So when you buy from some one like this please make sure their legit
content: The person that sold me this wii said "It was fully tested and works" but that is straight up Bull... The wii when I plugged it in turned on and worked and then when I turned on the tv it did work... It didn't display on the screen I bought another AV cabel to switch to HD but it still didn't work. I tried my other tv that use for daily gaming and still no picture on the screen. So when you buy from some one like this please make sure their legit. (I looked at many many youtube videos and read many many responses on forums and the wii website for help and they all said the same)

author: Chivonne M.
title: Don't listen to the haters like I almost did
content:
I was shakey at first to buy a Wii because of some negative things I had heard. I went ahead and bought it anyways and DO NOT regret it.

Some people said there weren't enough games to enjoy. There are actually too many for me too choose from. I live in a house with two younger kids. Games that involve heads being blown off or anything like that would not be allowed so I knew buying an Xbox or Ps3 would be stupid. Plus only Nintendo has Mario! I love Mario and Zelda.

If you are still unsure than try one out. Trying is probably the best thing you could do. Going by what someone else says isn't very reliable because everyone wants something different.

author: katchya
title: If you want one, get one before they are extinct, especially if you have Gamecube games
content: This is how I get on Netflix and Amazon Prime and Youtube on my not smart TVs. I prefer the Wii U functionality, but the Wii U costs more now than it did three years ago. I got this rather than the Fire Stick because I am deluding myself that I will use the Wii fit again and fear my old Wii is getting too old or my kids are going to take it one of these days. The Wii/Wii U seems to have better connectivity that the Fire Stick, and the Wii works if you don't have HDMI.

author: kim  kaye
title: Five Stars
content: LOVE IT A LOT OF FUN

author: Shalla Art
title: Necessary Fun!
content:
Wii Fit is sooo fun! And it's motivating everyone in our family (even our friends) to get up and start exercising and learning new sports.

I've lost the 5 pounds I gained during the Holidays within a week (and I didn't diet or anything... just didn't eat as big a portion and played this game... making sure I did some stretches with Gilad on Fit TV first to help me get high scores and beat my husband's.

It can get competitive but competitive fun for everyone! And if you like wii fit, you got to have this console :)

the only other one I'd recommend is Xbox 360 Console Includes 20GB Hard Drive so you can play Xbox 360 Rock Band 2 Special Edition after exercising on the wii fit.

author: L. Williams
title: New to Video Games- Again
content: I received my wii along with the Fit for my Birthday, and I must say I'm really enjoying it. I've gone wii crazy, and have even purchased more games and accessories. I like that you can download classic games, and that it connects to the Internet. It reminds me of games I used to play a long time ago. I don't know what some of the reviewers are complaining about, but what do I know? I'm not a true gamer... The controls are not like my old Nintendo from back in the 90s, so thats a step up.

author: Paul Olzak
title: Best system out there
content: Lots of hype in the wii now and it is hard to get. With good reason... This gaming system is perfect for a family or for someone just looking to got nuts in boxing... Love the Wii and it is the best system I ever paid for...Period

author: S.Papstein
title: No Title
content:
Nintendo comes into the 5th generation of gaming with the Nintendo Wii, despite the name(wii, haha), the wii is a home gaming consol that is created by the godfathers of gaming, Nintendo.

 The one big thing about the Wii is what everyone knows about, the Wii-mote. The Wii-mote is a new twist on a game controller that makes the system more normal to the world. It looks, and functions like a remote control. Instead of moving an anolog stick up, down, and sideways, you just point the 'mote at the screen, and it moves there. Nintendo uses that function in all their games; example, in zelda, you move the 'mote to swipe your sword, or in a shooter, the 'mote moves the gun cross hairs. If the remote still isen't getting you all giddy and mabey not want to use it, fine, some games are gonna use the Gamecube's controller(Smash Bros. Brawl)

 Next to that, another cool feature is the vitual consol. Virt. console allows you to download any game Nintendo has made(with a internet conection) on a home system, not handheld. The prices are more than stuff from other platforms, like Xbox arcade and whatever Playstation calls their stuff, but it still isen't expensive, the max price is $8. The Wii allows you to play 'cube games, but you can't download it, just stick 'em in. With an internet conection, you can download diffrent channels; theres an weather channel, it gives a 5 day forecast of most cites. Theres a news channel that gives any type of news, from international new to sports and to tech. Theres a photo channel where you can take pics from a digi cam or cell phone and email it.

 Last of all is the Mii's and the free game, Wii Sports. Wii Sports is a free game that comes with the system, it has 5 diffrent sports(bowling, boxing,tennis,baseball,and golf) to play, most of them are gimmicky and not deep at all, but there great to play with parents or grandparents. The Mii's are avatars(or caracatures) that you get to play in Wii Sports and other titles(not all), there fun to make and you can get 'em to resemble celebs.

 The Wii's the hot new thing these days, if you liked, do like, or never played videogames, buy this, there are developers that are making fun games for the hardcore to the never owed a system.

author: kristina
title: Unhappy
content: I do not like the Wii i got, i bought it and it doesn't work. Was expecting it to work.

author: Amazing Creations
title: Wii is Fun
content: Product arrived way ahead of schedule. Works like a charm.

author: John Pullen
title: Wii
content: This has been a fun game to play and my son has invested several hours trying to improve his ability to use various functions.

author: Adam L. Safianow
title: The True Next Gen Experience
content:
Most of you have heard about the crazies waiting in line for days to get the PS3 or the Wii or the hundreds to thousands of dollars people are spending on eBay for something they can easily get in 6 months without the line hastles. But what you are looking at right now is the Wii. Now, I'm sure you've seen the Wii as the number one video on YouTube being smashed to bits by a sledgehammer, but you don't really see how great the system is.

PROS:

-The Controller - The controller is amazing. With very fluid motion, great responde, and full usage in every game, this truly is innovation in the making. Not only does it feature minimal buttons, is wireless, reasonable priced, it also has a speaker on it to get the full surround effect; it even rumbles.

-The Size - This device is not another box to put on your shelf, this thing is tiny. When first shown at E3, people were in awe; and Nintendo one-uped and said that the final one is smaller. I wasn't at E3, but I can tell you, this thing is SMALL. It is about the size of a Tom Clancy hardback, and probably lighter. The controller is also very light.

-Backwards Compatibility - This thing is very backwards compatible. It accepts both the Wii disks and the Gamecubes in a very clean slot loading drive, very Apple-esque if you ask me. Games on both versions load very quickly, and give you the amazing experience. It would have been awesome if Nintendo made the Nunchuk, but I'm happy using the classic controller.

-Wireless Options - Not only does the Wii have bluetooth (controllers) but it also has Wi-Fi, and connects very easily. This is excellent, especially with the Nintendo DS' wireless options.

-Nintendo Arcade - This is probably Nintendo's biggest advantage over Sony, and even Microsoft. As show with how many people got into the Xbox Live Arcade after the Wii's announcement, this is something to reward Nintendo about. You will, over time at least, be able to play every Super Nintendo, NES, Genesis, Nintendo 64, or Turbografix-16 in full. All games at reasonable prices, new and old games can enjoy the experience. This also gives many of the American Wii owners chances to play games that have never been released on this side of the Pacific.

-Design - BEAUTIFUL. With more colors on the way, slot loading drive, and a beautiful finish, this is the best looking out of the three systems by far.

-Price - VERY competitvely priced. You can buy two Wii's, Zelda, a Classic Controller, and a couple of Arcade games for the price of one PS3. At $249, this is the same price as a 30GB iPod, and cheaper than a Razr cell phone.

CONS:

-No HD - It runs at standard 480p, but doesn't run up to 1080's like it's rivals. Nintendo is more about the experience than the graphical appeal, which is why it is considered the weakest. Nintendo has claimed that it can run the Unreal 3.0 engine, but that's something we'll have to wait and see. The graphics look about on par, if not a little better than the original Xbox, but if graphics aren't all you're concerned about, than you'll have a blast.

-No Blu-Ray, HD-DVD, DVD, or CD compatibility - This is not a media device; this is PURE gaming. Nintendo hasn't announced anything, but don't be suprised if extra accessories are on the way.

BOTTOM LINE: This is what Next Generation Gaming is all about. If you are looking for something NEW instead of an improvement on the old formula, than the Wii is your system!

author: C. Emmett Wallman
title: Great fun and system for the money
content:
my brother owns this and i love playing it with him. there are a few drawbacks, but overall the system is great and unique. i own a ps3 and 360 and this is the most fun of the 3.

PROS:

-inexpensive

-unique controller- great for all ages

-fun lineup of games

-small, will fit anywhere, even in tight areas

-hard to overheat. can be on for days with no problems

-gets the family involved

-photo, online features and news and weather features are cool.

-reliable (unlike the 360)

CONS:

-terrible graphics compared to the ps3. they are good though since it costs only 250

-weak processor. it needs a power upgrade.

-cant play dvd movies

-doesnt support 1080 high definition

-ugly color. black would have been nice. when it gets dirty, the marks are easily visable.

author: Ashfault
title: I Am NOT a Gamer Review
content: I don't care what anyone says, the Wii is fabulous. This one was bought for my 75 year old mother. The whole extended family, from 2 year olds to 80 year olds enjoy playing Wii games. None of us are true gamers and I think many of the elitist reviews are some sort of video game snobbery. Pretty much everyone, but the 2 year old, is able to instantly play and enjoy all the Wii games. The fitness benefits are also tremendous. There are so many games available that give you a work out while you are having fun. I recommend the Wii to everyone. It is well worth the money.

author: Jaime Linton
title: Five Stars
content: Thank you so much. Very fast shipping!

author: Justin Song
title: fun,exercising gaming device
content:
Nintendo Wii is a revolution in the gaming industry. Nintendo wii is the only game that combines fun and exercise.
Using the remote controls, you can play with friends and family.

I personally played the wii sports game, and it was one of the best game ever. It was realistic, fun and easy to play.

_PRO_
-combines exercising which no other gaming devices do.
-no violence, or any sexual content that many games have.

_CON_
-might get bored really easily.

Overall: I recommend wii to people who want to have fun and exercise at the same time.

author: William Judd
title: The Wii
content: Anyone into gaming on tv will like the Wii.  I do recommend getting a HD cable if your tv is HD capable.  Makes the picture a whole lot better.

author: nancy dagostino
title: Three Stars
content: Ac adapter doesn't work

author: Terry Osenbach
title: Nice
content: It's a Wii.  My kids love it - even after 5 years, it never get old.

author: Kenneth R. Garland
title: Amazing, simply a pleasure
content:
So I was able to order one of these LONG before available and Amazon shipped it to me on the launch date. I had overnight shipping so it came the day after on Monday. Wii haven't stopped playing the system, except for the time when it errors out. Apparently there is an issue out there that is not being talked about very much which is system memory corruption. Nintendo has been very good about sending replacement units and they replaced mine instantly with 2day air shipping. However, my replacement unit was cracked so I got a third replacement which is expected to arrive tomorrow.

Another item that is a bit of a let down that the wireless in this is only 802.11b instead of 802.11g which would have been great as I support only G in my network which is a WDS setup with WPA2 encryption. I"m waiting for the LAN adapter to come out before putting this thing on my network which has been a bummer because I want to use the Wii points to download some stuff.

I'll have to say that all those troubles aside this has been one of the most entertainming gaming systems that I have ever owned.

author: Amazon Customer
content: Who’s here b/c of Tim and Nick 😂😂

author: Eva
title: One Star
content: not what I expected

author: CDig
title: Wii Fit Board is Great...Hope an upgraded CD will come out though
content: WE LOVE THIS BECAUSE EVEN PEOPLE WHO HATE WORKING OUT WILL ENJOY THIS......I HAVE TO SAY THOUGH THAT IT COULD USE SOME IMPROVEMENTS. FIRST BY LETTING YOU CHOOSE FROM MORE THAN JUST TWO TRAINERS AND NEW EXCERCISES...ALSO YOU CANT EVER DO MORE THAN 6 TWISTS....OTHER EXERCISES LET YOU WORK UP TO OPENING NEW CHALLENGES (FROM SETS OF 10 TO 20), BUT THIS ONE DOES NOT. ALSO, WE'D LIKE MORE OPTIONS AND FLEXIBILITY ON THE PERSONAL TRACKING CHARTS AND CALANDER....YOU SHOULD BE ABLE TO GO IN TO CHANGE YOUR GOALS, ETC MORE READILY, RE-DO STAMPS, ETC...MAKE IT MORE FUN AND INTERACTIVE... ALSO, IF YOU GET INTERUPPTED IN THE MIDDLE OF A WORKOUT, IT WOULD BE NICE TO SIMPLY RESTART THE EXERCISE. YOU ONLY HAVE THE OPTION OF RESET WHICH TAKES YOU ALL THE WAY OUT TO THE Wii PLAZA INSTEAD OF SIMPLY RESTARTING THE EXERCISE AGAIN. THAT KIND OF STINKS. ALSO IF WE ARE TALKING OF IMPROVEMENTS, IT TAKES TOO LONG SOMETIMES TO GET THROUGH THE EXERCISE...MORE TIME IS SPENT WAITING FOR IT TO BEGIN, (IF PEOPLE LIKE THAT, THERE SHOULD BE A PAUSE BUTTON)...AND MORE TIME WAITING TO GET THROUGH ALL THE "A" BUTTONS AFTER EACH WORKOUT...THEY SHOULD GO FASTER BECAUSE IT TAKES A FULL HOUR TO DO A 30 MIN WORKOUT. HOWEVER; ALL THAT SAID...OVERALL, IT IS WONDERFUL FOR BEING ABLE TO WORK OUT IN THE PRIVACY OF YOUR OWN HOME WHEN EVER YOU WANT TO AND IN ANY APPAREL YOU DESIRE... AND I FEEL IT IS MORE MOTIVATING THAN VIDEOS SINCE IT KNOWS WHAT YOU ARE DOING AND TELLS YOU IF YOU ARE DOING AGOOD JOB AND IF YOU NEED IMPROVEMENT, BUT IS ENCOURAGING....HOWEVER THERE NEEDS TO BE MORE DIALOUGUE TO THE ENCOURAGING TIPS AND MANY MORE FITNESS TIPS! THE SAME OLD ONES GET PLAYED WHEN IT ASKS IF YOU WANT TO HEAR A FITNESS TIP....ALSO IF YOU GAIN WEIGHT AND IT GIVES YOU A LIST OF REASONS TO SELECT FROM, THE LIST IS VERY LIMITED.
