I AM WAITING FOR AN UPDATED VERSION (HOPING THERE WILL BE ONE) AND ALSO FOR THE Wii NUTRITION COMING OUT IN DECEMBER...CAN'T WAIT!! IF EVERY HOUSEHOLD USED ALL OF THIS, WE MIGHT HAVE HEALTHIER PEOPLE AROUND.

author: Mommy of 4
title: Best Game System Made
content: We are extremely happy with our system. I love that it gets the kids off of the couch and active. It's also fun for the adults. I had no interest in our PS3, but love playing this with the kids.

author: Sunil K. Narahari
title: A purchase worth the wait
content:
I have always been avoiding the purchase of video games for my kids who are aged 7 and 9. But when I first heard and read about Nintendo's wii, my thoughts started changing.

However the severe shortage of the product and my reluctance to pay a premium kept me from buying the product. We were able to finally buy this product for Christmas this year. This game has become our favorite family past time. Whenever possible the entire family is involved.

I have found Wii sports very addictive and also like the training features. We have just ordered the Guitar Hero III and hope to have more fun. This product is so refreshingly different from the PS and XBox. My son has a lot more physical involvment. There is a lot of jumping moving and arm movement, rather than just the thumbs getting 100% of the exercise.

This is one purchase I will cherish for a long time.

author: Melinda
title: DO believe the hype, the Wii is great fun!
content:
To start off, my fiance and I are experienced gamers who own the PS2 and recently were given a DS lite. My very first system was the NES. I have been wanting a PS3 but was not willing to spend the money to get one. Having a DS lite and also playing party games on friends' Gamecube influenced our wanting a Wii. Of course, the price is much more reasonable as well.

We were lucky enough to get chosen in the Vote drawing. Having it arrive before Christmas was perfect because the whole family was home and could try it out. My 65 year old dad loves the bowling! The Wii is so innovative yet instinctive in its design. With Wii Sports, the movements are the natural motions you would perform if you were really playing. The physical involvement of the games is genius. It is so physical we are actually a little sore from playing! The unexpected consequence of that is we want to take breaks in between. You can get a satisfying gaming experience within an hour, so you're not sucked into spending your whole day playing.

You could just get the system without buying anything else and be happy. One controller works out, though you have to switch each time. You cannot play versus each other without another one. We'll likely get another controller soon. Four days after the system arrived I bought The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess from Target; it was on sale. Zelda is my fiance's favorite Nintendo series and this one does not disappoint.

All my expectations for the Wii have been surpassed and I am always amazed to see what else can be done in the games using the remote. It is just like nothing you have ever played. The whole family will really enjoy this and get a little workout, too!

author: J. Fenger
title: Wii love it!!!!!!!!!!!
content:
On Christmas, I heard that my little brother had bought my parents a Wii. My first thought was what are my 57 years old parents going to do with a video game system. We went to their house that afternoon and I was totally amazed. The entire family from 57 to 3 was taking turns bowling.

My husband and I agreed we needed to get one. I couldn't see paying over $500 for it on Ebay, so I called every store withing a 100 mile radius for days until I found one.

I know it is not a tremendous amount of exercise, but it is more exercise than just sitting on the sofa barely moving. My theory is to play the game as if you are actually playing the real sport.

author: Lori K.
title: Five Stars
content: A+

author: Pistol Pete
title: Nintendo Wii for Mii!!
content: More than a year ago when I learned of Nintendo's project 'Revolution' I was more than skeptical and figured I would get on board with the next gen era via PS3 or 360. As 'Revolution' gained momentum and more and more information became available my resistance remained strong but my intrigue began to grow. Initially I thought the same as most opposition to the Wii would - too strange, too childish, too different. Then the 'Revolution' became Wii and the buzz began to grow. The game release lists began pouring out and critics began to rave of the new control system. My interest peaked and next thing you know - BAM - I'm waiting in line at Toys R Us in Times Square with my little lady and Santa ends up one of the lucky few who were able to get their hands on a Wii the opening day! I was so pumped that I told her I couldn't wait until Christmas to play so she let me have it as an early Christmas gift! IT IS AWESOME!! I of course started with Wii Sports - bowling is rad! I have it in my basement where my boys and I kick it on Friday nights - you couldn't think of a better system to have - I'm bowling in my basement on Fri nights with cold beer! Friggin sweet! In addition to the freebie Wii Sports I also got Ultimate Alliance and Call of Duty 3! They're so sweet I'm not even going to discuss them now cause I'd get way too pumped! Long story short the Wii is awesome and has got me so pumped that I could kick something! Friggin sweet - Nintendo Wii for Mii!!!!!!!!!!!!

author: morpheus
title: the awesome Wii
content: I recently bought Wii when i finally found it for $199 on amazon and it is an amazing thing! I have played on SEGA and XBOX before this but i like Wii way more than them. Wii is so easy to use and play with. Setting up and configuring the remotes are a breeze. The games that came with it was great. I then also bought the Wii resort and i love it.  Whoever came up with the idea of Wii is a genius!

author: Rachael
title: such great family fun
content: We got it mainly for our five year old son, but we all love to play it.  It keeps us moving, and laughing.  I'm so glad we bought it.

author: S. Eddy
title: Nice, but outdated
content: we needed a game system for another room, so we got this. The graphics are nothing compared to the other consoles. With new stuff coming out every day, dont waste your time or money

author: Nirdesh Mittal
title: Amazing
content: I bought this console roughly a month back, and am already addictive to the technology used. I can play tennis at home with shedding some real sweat. A must for all teens, beware of the addiction though...

author: Abdallah Dallal
title: Four Stars
content: excelent

author: No Quarter
title: What a game console should be!
content:
Ever since I heard about how the controller was going to work I've been excited to play this machine.  Finally in November, after waiting out in the cold for 16 hours I was able to get my hands on the Wii and play one.  This is truly what the next revolution in gaming should be.  I think Nintendo did the proper thing by not focusing on graphics and processing power like Microsoft and Sony, but instead changing the way we play.

When I first opened the box at 12:30 a.m. and saw the insides I knew this was a console for everyone.  Everything is laid out in a way to hook it up quickly with little help from instructions.  Within minutes I was swinging a "racket" at my TV and trying to move out of the way from jabs at me.  Yes, the graphics are not much better than the Gamecube (which I tink was always better looking than a PS2) but I enjoy everything.

In the end, if you want to have fun playing games, and get out of your life for a while everyday, there is no better way to do it than with this console.

author: C. A. Luster
title: Wii Weeeeeeeeeee
content:
I didn't have much desire to ever own any of the arcade style games like this or the Playstation, X Box, et cetera. To me the cost was prohibitive for the games and since you can not use them for other things like work which you can do on a PC. The Wii changed my attitiude. Since my wife asked for a Wii for Christmas I have bought several games and devices to make the overall experience better. I must admit I love playing most of the games myself and some are indeed very physically demanding. I recommend this Wii system to people of all ages and this software runs the gamut of being useful in playing a variety of the games for the Wii. One warning, be sure to clear the area in front of the TV.

The problem isn't the controls strapped to your wrist, it is hitting items on tables with those controls and sending them flying into the TV screen. While bowling with the Wii I launched a TV remote control into my HD Projection TV set and cracked the plexiglass screen. So with the bat, golf club, and tennis racket you run the risk of hitting something into your set. Just be aware of that and clear the area of any hard items. I highly recommend the Wii. Great fun and exercise rolled up into one package. I suggest you shop around as sometimes they are way overpriced because they are not easy to find, however with a little effort you will find them selling for the manufacturer's retail or slightly higher. Over four hundred is just scalping.

author: barb
title: I am sending back I bought. This for someone ...
content: I am sending back I bought. This for someone but he's getting one for xmas. I fell and was unable to send back will get it in the mail this week

author: sweettyyangel
title: I love this gaming system!
content:
This system is great... it is sooo much fun that when I bought this in May I couldnt put the wii remote down to go to sleep! I played this thing all day long and I mean all day long!
Now that I've had it for 6 months I think its the best thing out there!! I recommend this system to anyone!

author: Grandma Red
title: Enjoy
content: Got it to watch Netflix and for grandkids when they come to vist,  Had no trouble setting it up with a little help from Nintendo.  Glad I got it.

author: Bearfan
title: fun workout?
content: My family and I have had a blast with the Wii ever since we bought it.  We played a few different games.  Had a blast with them and at the same time we got a workout like you wouldn't believe.  The soreness only lasted a couple of days but was well worth it.  The Wii is a great system for any age!!

author: Derek A. Benner
title: This is great for exercise!
content:
I bought this solely for its exercise potential.  And it is working out great!  I am morbidly obese and I'm finding that the Wii Sports games that came bundled in it are perfect for someone who cannot stand for long periods of time.  I'm currently up to 40 minutes per day doing a combined routine of bowling,boxing and golf-with an occasional game of baseball or tennis.

Buy the Wii and start getting fit!

author: John Mudd
title: Comparison to PS3
content:
The great reviews for Wii are well deserved. I own a PS3 and never imagined I would buy the Wii console since the graphics were clearly better on the sony system.

So why do I now own a Wii?  Gameplay fun.  The other systems have excellent features, but often miss on simple gaming and playfulness.  Mario Kart is a great example.  Silly cars shooting turtle shells at one another offers a great setting for new and old gamers.  Everyone who comes to the house can enjoy the game.

Compare that to many of the technical heavy race games on the other systems that focus on realistic graphics and high level controls and the system is not great for newcomers (yet rewarding for those who put the time in).

Head to head games will usually be better on the PS3, but the original and wii specific titles are some of the most fun gaming experiences for groups.

author: Eliminator Man
title: Don't feed these vultures
content: I'm rating this without even pulling it out of the box.  The reason for my review is to beg you not to pay these crazy prices.  Give the system a couple weeks to catch up and the system will be available for its list price of 249.  Better yet do what I did.  Small quantities are showing up at stores locally as of now.  I called my local Game Stop earlier in the week and they said the might have a few later in the week or early next week.  They said the truck comes in every day at 10 and they don't know what will be on it.  I called at 10:30 and they had "a few" for sale.  I cut out of work and got to the store 15 minutes later.  There were two other customers in the store, both  buying new Wiis.  I got the last one.  I rather go through this exercise 10 times or wait a couple weeks till stocks rebuild before I'll pay some greedy creap like the people offering them here for way way above retail.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Exellent product
content: excellent product, was delivered on time, I recommend the product and this company

author: Admiral Trench
title: Good product
content: It came. It worked. It was fun.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: It worked great, even played smash bros brawl without me having to fix the hardware

author: Beauty
title: I love the Wii!
content: Im a big Ninetendo fan so the Wii was a must-have. With all the games available, I'm sure theres one for everyone to love. I originally bought the Wii for the WiiFit exercises, but when that became old, I bought other types of games to continue to have fun with it. I like it more than my playstations due to the fact it gets my butt up off the couch!

author: Amazon Customer
title: But it is a great game.
content: My family is enjoying the game...Shipment was on time from the company...Everything to play the game was in the box I just had to purchase a game which I did....But it is a great game.

author: Lauren Hanson
title: wii is delightful for this non-gamer
content: My husband really wanted the Wii, and I really didn't.  I think video games are a waste of time.  BUT enter the Wii.  It's truly FUN for gamers and non-gamers like me.  I truly enjoy the games that get you off the couch and interacting with your family.  The sports and Wii play games look simple, but are challenging so they keep you interested.  My definite favorite is Dance Dance Revolution hottest party 2, for which you need the dance pad.  It is SO fun and you really burn calories as you play.  I'm probably going to get the fitness program too.  I think we'll get our money's worth with this system.

author: Jersey Girl
title: The Wii is not just for kids! Super Fun system for all ages!
content:
I FINALLY got a Nintendo Wii after searching everywhere, I found out about craigslist so I read a posting from a guy right down the street from me who was selling the Wii for a very reasonable price. I just got it last night from the seller and I'm loving it! I'm an older gamer, female and I've been a gamer from the 1980's.

The Wii is alot smaller then I realized, it's sleek, unique and cool looking. The Wii-mote, the main remote is comfortable to hold although it took me awhile to know which button does what but I really like it. The Nunchuck control is pretty nice too although the only time I connect to the Wii-mote is for the boxing game in the Sports game that came with the Wii. Yes, there is a game included unlike the other next gen systems! The sensor bar was very easy to set up and the entire setup didn't take long at all. The Wii has two owner manuals so you will definately want to read them to get the most out of your Wii.

I started playing the sports game as soon as I could...this game is INCREDIBLE! It is VERY physically demanding so if you are lazy and don't want to get moving, then this is not the game for you! This thing will kick your behind and get you into shape! Speaking of which, there is actually a man who did a six week experiment playing the Wii sports game to see if he would physically get more fit..guess what? He lost 9 lbs!! He got ALOT more fit loosing inches on his waist etc etc. I plan to incorporate playing the Sports game at least 4 times a week to get more fit too! There is even a fitness age test which after a few rounds of some of the different sports games like tennis, bowling, boxing etc, you are then assessed a fitness "age". The best to get is 20 years old but I scored 68! lol! Alot of people I read scored 68 as well, higher or in the 50 age range and these people were alot younger! It takes into consideration your balance, speed, reaction time etc. Usually if you play every day or on a regular basis, your fitness age will improve. I know I want to definately to move my fitness age to alot younger to match my age group. It's amazing to play tennis while you are moving the Wii-mote like an actual tennis racket or play bowling while swinging your arm like you are holding a real bowling ball. It's just the coolest thing. The baseball game is a blast, I Love the crack of the ball when I wack the hell out of the ball sending it soaring. A very fun game!

PLEASE do NOT let the Online capabilities pass you by! You thought the Wii was fun by itself, wait til you get connected to the Wii's internet either via Wifi (wireless) or wired (ethernet/lan) with a dsl modem or wired router, you have this whole new other world available to you. You can actually DOWNLOAD CLASSIC games to your Wii!! via the "Virtual Console" (VC) so you can play classic NES games, Super Nintendo games, Sega Master System games and Turbogrfx. You need to buy Wii "points" in order to pay for the games because they are not free. You can get points by using your credit/debit card or if you don't have them, you can buy the Nintendo Points cards at your local gaming store, walmart, target etc and redeem them. I haven't bought the games I want yet because most of them use the classic Wii controller which is sold separately but when I get it, I plan to d/l the Zelda N64 game. Imagine that..you can have Wii games, Gamecube backwards capability AND you can DOWNLOAD Classic games!  There is a weather channel, a new voting channel in which you get to cast your vote on various questions, there is even an international vote question. There is a internet channel where you use a web browser to surf the net and you can even register "friends" so you can email them etc.

I'm running out of space here, but I HIGHLY recommend the Wii to all age groups, it is NOT just for kids, I only know one child with the Wii and the rest are all adults with no kids! The Wii is extremely fun, has great potential and with the online features, it's just a great experience for anyone. You may have been putting off getting the Wii or thought the Wii remote control was lame looking, but you don't know what you are missing. BUY IT and see for yourself. If you buy it now and register, Nintendo will increase your warranty to 90 days making your warranty 15 months instead of just 12 months!

author: stacy
title: works great, cheap
content: On time, clean, works great, cheap!

author: JMotts
title: Excellent console - and fun for the whole family
content:
My family is lucky or foolish enough to have a Wii, XBox 360 and now a PS3.  I can say without question that the one that brings the most joy and is the most fun for the family is the Wii.  Nintendo's decision not to go toe-to-toe with Microsoft and Sony was a wise one.  By focusing on gameplay and really nailing the wireless and motion-sensitive controllers, they have created gameplay that is addictive, incredibly fun, physical and novel.  Sure it doesn't output in HD, but with the component cable (which unfortunately costs extra) the output is 480p and is clear and DVD quality.  It is certainly enough for the majority of players.

Many members of my extended family do not play video games at all but they couldn't stop playing Wii Sports, which is wisely bundled with the console so you can play the console right away without purchasing another title.  Each person in my family has their favorite of the five games on Wii Sports, but it showcases the motion-sensitive controller and gets you used to this new type of gameplay.  My mother-in-law, who I have never seen play any video game ever, loved Wii Bowling.  My two cousins (under 11) challenged each other in boxing and stopped fifteen minutes later only because they were sweating and so exhausted that they couldn't raise their arms.  How many times does that happen while playing video games?

A huge selling point for me was the Virtual Console, the online store where you can download classic games from the original Nintendo Entertainment System, the Super NES, Sega Genesis, TurboGrafx 16 and the N64.  What a great nostalgic trip.  Once I got the wireless connection set up, I bought some Wii points and downloaded the original NES Legend of Zelda, and this past week downloaded Super Mario Bros.  Playing these games takes me back to when we got our first NES in 1986, and it has been a blast.

For $250, it is without question the best value, the most fun and the best gameplay right now for any age and level of experience.  I cannot recommend it more, and I have not been this excited for a game console in 20 years.

author: A Human
title: Great for hardcore gamers,and casual gamers.
content:
Me myself am a "hardcore" gamer. The Gamecube lacked something..The Wii has it.

It's extremely fun. Nintendo fans will have a blast. Metroid, The Legend of Zelda, Pokemon, Super Mario Bros. There's also the virtual console. For a few hundred points, you can buy older video games,even Sega ones.

This is a great buy,the best console of this generation. It has what the others lack. Fun. Pure fun. It has tons of it.

This is my favorite console to date, and most defiantly one of the best consoles.

It has a better array of games then the other consoles, and is more fun, in my opinion.

I highly recommend this, even if you own a PS2, PS3 or 360.

author: John H.
title: Fun For Whole Family
content:
I bought the Wii for my family and I and we all love it.  From my three year old who has become a bowling master to my bride who has avoided video games for the almost 15 years I have known her.  I hate to sound corny, but the Wii has brought some very fun family times.

Nw if only the accesories and games would lower in price a little.......

author: Jeremie J. Canty
title: Love it
content: Had to get this, needed something different for the kids and this was a great buy for them to learn how to develop motor skills.

author: Tee
title: 2Gud2btru
content: I was very nervous to purchase a  used Wii but I am really  impressed  with my purchase.  The only thing that didn't  work was the remote.  I  purchased  a new one through Amazon & honestly I have to say that you can't  beat the price that I  paid!

author: Jason P. Brocius
title: The best ever...and will only get better.
content: I am a hardcore gamer, have been since i was 6 in the '80s, and wanted to throw in my two cents on Nintendo's new contenda.  i know there are a lot of Sony fanboys out there who want to talk about the PS3 (i do eventually want one, too) but the fact of the matter is that Sony basically gave me, along with many other gamers, the finger with the release of the PS3, believing their own legend would make them a surefire hit.  Well, here's the little engine that could.  Nintendo has proved(sales figures continue to surpass all expectations) that people are happier with innovation than just eye candy.  Do i appreciate that Sony has beautiful graphics?  Absolutely.  However, when playing the Wii i am so involved with the on-screen action graphics hardly become the core issue anymore.  Playing ALL my GC games in 480p is great, the virtual console is fairly priced, insanely fun, and well set up(except for not saving CC information for later purchases), and the game selection, which admittedly suffered from mini-game syndrome at first, has seen an increasingly diverse sections of games, most of which are far more reasonably priced than competitor's.  For all the 'kiddie console' naysayers out there, we have Manhunt 2, Madden 2008(including telestration!), Scarface, Red Steel, The Godfather, and more besides, all including Wii exclusive controls that actually enhance gameplay greatly.  Honestly, nothing gets me and my other Adult friends together like the Wii has and Wario Ware, it must be said is a great drinking game!  I have owned this puppy since February have 8 games, not including Wii Sports, and love playing all of them still.  Plus it's really nice that it gets me and the wife closer together even though it hurts to get spanked in Rayman!  Keep in mind, the Wii has only been out a short while and with the amount of consoles being sold, will only continue to get more good exclusives and provide support to 'hardcore' gamers like myself.  See you online!

author: Cavs Fan
title: The Wii is pretty disappointing overall.
content: The Wii could be, and should be, great. But it's not. I'm a dad with a 10 year old son. The best game we've played is Wii Sports which comes with the console. That's pretty sad. The controllers should lead to some creative games, but most of the games have been pretty awful. Mario Olympics is pretty good. Lego Batman was pretty good- and used the controls well. Tiger Woods golf is pretty much unplayable due to bad controls. Many other games are really poorly done, like all of the Carnival Games, Mini-Golf, etc. Wii Sports is fun for get togethers, and creating Wii characters is pretty fun. Other than that, just about any other gaming system is 99% better. I'm sticking with PC gaming myself.

author: Douglas Evans
title: Five Stars
content: Great

author: Dean L. Springer Jr.
title: Must own for....well, everyone!
content:
Truly a blast to play! I've had a Wii for a few months now and I am throughly enjoying every second I'm playing. Be it Super Mario Galaxy, Legend Of Zelda: Twilight Princess or the fun Wii channels that Nintendo offers for free. The fact that these are so hard to find is a true testament to how fun they really are.

The Wii can be played by anyone. The entire family, dorm, or office will be able to grab a remote and start playing. You really don't even need to buy a game initially as the included Wii Sports will keep you and everyone else bowling, golfing, playing baseball, tennis and boxing for quite a while. But when you do decide to pick up some games, there's a great selection for everyone and big games like Super Smash Bros, Mario Kart, and Animal Crossing coming in 2008.

author: ASDJ
title: READ THIS
content: Buy the wii if you have kids or like inviting people or throwing parties in your place so everyone can have fun while spending less in a gaming console. Otherwise, if you wanna have motion-sensored fun buy the kinect and if you want a real videogame console buy the xbox360 or the ps3 and do not let nintendo steal the beloved licensed franchises as Zelda, Metroid and Mario by making a 'console' that doesn't even support high definition. Come on nintendo get serious! by making your market bigger, we, the real gamers, owners of nes, snes, n64 and gc are the ones paying the price dont be sooo cheap

author: M. King
title: The neweset and best nintendo yet!!!
content: I got the wii a couple of years ago and i love it. It has many new features on it like wireless remotes, wi-fi online play, stores, channels, miis, motion remotes, exercise games, and weather channel. It has a great store that u can go to to buy old classic games with points and play them on the wii. There r many channles to use and buy too like weather, photo, mii that u get to make ur own people, news, and many, many more that u can buy. Its graphics r not as good as the ps3, and xbox 360 but it has great graphics for nintindo. The sound is awsome and very clear. It is very fun to play multiplayer on it. U can either store memory on the wii itself or use memory cards. Which it holds more than enough space. U can also play the GC games on it and hook up GC remotes to play GC games or use them on multiplayer games. The only thing i do not like about it is that it does not play any movies or music.

author: breyonna
title: Five Stars
content: Love it wish came with games

author: Richard Stuhler
title: It took a bit of set up time using our old unit manual but it finally got working and has been good so far
content: It came with the cover missing and did not include the manuals.  However, it did come with some controllers that we did not have.  It took a bit of set up time using our old unit manual but it finally got working and has been good so far.

author: Madeline Chavez
title: Great product!
content: I recommend this product. The seller shipped it well packaged and arrived pretty fast. This game console is fun and also can bring lots of fun with the family to play.

author: Grammy
title: Why I love MY Wii
content:
Well as wii know  there is no other game like the Wii for fun and fitness!  And it always lives up to ones expectations 100% !

Once you play one at a friends house you are then hooked !  And they keep coming out with more and more challenges and fun things to do ! And what a great way to get kids and adults as well, up and moving .!
Any age can play ..... even people with disabilities !

So I love my Wii and it was shipped perfectly and on time!

I have only good things to say about this product !

OH one problem I with Amazon though...I was only allowed to buy one nunchuck.  I needed three of them and they limited me to one ??????  Don't understand that one .  So I will keep that in mind next time  I shop ,

Thanks !

author: L. Priester
title: Great family system!!
content: I am so happy with my Wii purchase. It's the one thing that my whole family can take part in and have an awesome time. From 3 to 35, we enjoy the system very much. And I love the selection of games that can be purchased - most especially the Wii Fit for me. Every household should have one of these!

author: Jackie Roberts
title: Wii Game
content: We bought this to help my mother work out and keep her balance.  Unfortunately, the Parkinsons progressed to a point she could not use it.  BUT, our daughter loves it and looks forward to having friends come over and challenge her on the variouse games.

author: Soto Santiago Juan Carlos
title: Best console
content: Hours and hours of family fun, every1 can play, easy to setup, easy to play, very light and thin. Excellent choice. Only cons is it's graphic capabilities (not ps3/xbox360 images :S) but fun over graphics for me ^^

author: K. Spicer
title: Just like the NES, 'Nintendo' Revolutionizes Gaming again
content:
I remember getting the original NES for Christmas back in the day.. Oh man, that system brought arcades home for real for the first time.  Elegant simplicity.

Ever since, it's been Graphics, Graphics, Graphics, RPGs, RPGs, RPGs.. blah.. Take it or leave it, no one had the mind to take chances anymore.

I don't know who woke up one morning over there in Japan and said, "A Wii-Mote would be better".  But it is..

My father, who bought me my original Atari 2600, and then later, my Nintendo Entertainment System, never ever played a game with me.  Until he saw the Wii, and so he bought one and plays Wii fitness every day.  Everything you hear about how amazing the Wii is, is absolutely true.

author: SWachter
title: Five Stars
content: works, came quickly and with no hassle

author: Ida
title: Still works great. Better than anticipated
content: Still works great.  Better than anticipated.

author: N. Tesla
title: What a Surprise!
content: I picked up the Wii this past week as a Christmas present for my kids.  Of course, as the responsible dad that I am, I had to 'test' the system, just to make sure everything works on Christmas morning.  I've only played the included Sports game, but the control is a refreshing change from our PS2.  I can't wait for Christmas morning.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Don't pay what these vendors are asking!
content: I have been searching for a Wii since they came out and I saw many times the vendors on here asking 500 to 600 dollars for just the console. If one is patient enough, and calls aorund on different days one can find one. I found one two days ago, all I did was call an E.B. Games around 11 when they get there shipments and found one and for the amount of money being asked here bought 5 other games along with the Wii sports that comes along with the console. DOn't let these greedy vendors try to make money off you just because they have one ready right away, if one tries a little, one can find one and not lose as much money out for the same product.

author: Mushamisi Kahari
title: Wii came to play
content: I am a fan of Wii simplicity. The games for the system are drying up as developers are marching onto the next gen systems but the fun is easy to pick up and play. The system works and is sturdy enough for both young and old players to let loose. The system also does not run through batterys too quickly for the controllers and in my case the wii fit board. I would definitely recommend while you can still get one.

author: Jaylene
title: Great Wii for family!
content: Fast shipping. Easy setup. I've been using my Wii for almost 3 months now. There's no scratches and I got everything that was included. I couldn't be happier. Works great! Thank you!

author: L. LEINEN
title: Always wanted one and I'm not disappointed one bit!
content: I love the Wii! It really is a lot of fun. I took it with me to our family's Thanksgiving gathering and we all (adults) had a wonderful time playing! I'd advise for any family to add this to their family fun. I'm glad I finally purchased the Wii.

author: LunarFlame17
title: Review from a hardcore gamer
content:
So I finally managed to get a Wii a few days ago. Lack of availability and lack of money have held me back thus far, but fortunately I finally have one. A lot of people have said stuff like "it's good for kids but not if you're a 'real' gamer". Well I say that such talk is nonsense. I've been playing video games for 20 years, and I've owned a vast array of systems (NES, Super NES, Game Boy, Virtual Boy, Nintendo 64, Playstation, Game Boy Advance, Dreamcast, Playstation 2, GameCube, Xbox, DS, Wii) and as you can probably tell from this list, I started out as a Nintendo fanboy, but it's been many years since I owned exclusively Nintendo systems. But the Wii has convinced me that it's time to return to the fold. For one, the other two systems (Xbox 360 and Playstation 3) are way too expensive. Sure, there's a $300 version of the 360, but it's basically worthless. You still need to buy a $40 memory card to play any games, plus it only comes with a wired controller. I've been using the Wavebird for too long to want to give up wireless freedom.

The second problem with the other two systems is that they really don't do anything new. They're basically just the same thing as the last generation with better graphics. Nobody claims that the Playstation 3 has any decent games yet, so let's look at the 360's lineup. The only thing that really impresses me is Gears of War, and it only impresses me cause it's freakin' beautiful. In terms of gameplay, it really doesn't do anything that wasn't done during the last generation. And that's where the Wii comes in.

I'm too old and too jaded to care that much about bigger and better graphics anymore. I want something that lets me play games in a whole new way, and the Wii allows me to do exactly that. I believe that the Wii-mote will utterly change the way video games are made, and I think that it's capable of things that people haven't even conceived of yet. I'm very happy that the Wii has been as popular as it is, because that means that third-party developers are going to have to develop games for it, and those games are going to have to make use of the Wii-mote to be good.

As for graphics, yeah the Wii can't output in high definition, but it is capable of more than people give it credit for. Have you seen screenshots of Metroid Prime 3 or Super Mario Galaxy? Those are some awfully beautiful games. The Wii is twice as powerful as the Gamecube, which means that the graphics should be at least twice as good. I'm guessing they will get even better as developers come up with new tricks for using the hardware.

The last thing I want to mention is internet. Unfortunately, due to my computer sucking, I have not been able to get online with my Wii yet, but when the wireless router I ordered comes to my house, the process should be completely painless, if the Wii Operations Manual is any indication. I'm very excited for Virtual Console. As a life-long Nintendo fan, I'm very excited to download classic Nintendo games and have them right on my Wii's internal memory. Frankly, I feel that if you compare the Wii's online service to that of the 360 or the PS3, the Wii wins hands down. Sure, you can make the argument that Xbox Live has the Wii beat in terms of content (although that's not true if you have a craving for old Mario and Zelda games), but $50 a year? And no built-in wireless access? You've got to be kidding me. And as for the PS3, I've heard of no compelling reason so far to get online with it. If you ask me, it really isn't that surprising that PS3 isn't selling very well.

So to sum up, if all you care about is graphics, then by all means waste your money on an overpriced rip-off like the PS3 or the Xbox 360. But if you care about games and about getting in on the ground floor of the revolution, then get a Wii. You definitely won't regret it.

author: Fox3
title: Terrible Shape
content: Pretty much already fell apart in shipping.

author: Bette (Jodie) Redditt
title: Works great
content: Works great, no problems.

author: Barbarella
title: Wii Wules!
content: Shipping was amazingly quick! Great fun with Wii Sports - made pro in bowling in no time! I'm terrible at golf with the Wii just as I am in the real world, but I'm getting better at tennis! Gets us off the couch, lots of laffs when we all game together - what's not to like?

author: Ben N. M.
title: Five Stars
content: This product works fine up to this moment. Bought it for my son and he loves it.

author: Wesley Arnold Jr.
title: Fantastic for kids ages 5 to 11
content: One of the best purchases I ever made. Kids love it.

author: L. Smith
title: lasted five years
content: The Wii is great for my two young boys, even though I originally bought this as an anniversary gift for my husband.  Unfortunately it died on us a couple of months ago. I believe it died because the boys would keep it on for long periods of time while they did other things in order to save their place in the game they were playing.  We just replaced it with the new model.

author: Amazon buyer
title: The Wii bad or good?
content: Well the only con to the Wii is the graphics. If your looking for highend graphics look for the PS3 or the Xbox 360. Though the Wii has pretty good graphics from Nintendo. Its DVD quality 480p. But the Wii totally changes the way most people play games. From pressing buttons and turning joysticks to motion sensors. The wii is extremly fun. I would recommend this for anyone. Its also more fun to play two player. I would shell out another 50 bucks for another wiimote and numchunk. Also when you start you really don't need a game to play because it comes with Wii sports which is really fun.

author: Z. Roots
title: Converted Wii Man
content: I was a PS2 guy all the way and when the new generation of consoles started coming out I sold the PS2 fully expecting to get a PS3. Well the more I waited (saving money for the Ps3) the more I heard and read about how great the Wii expereince is. My brother bought me the Wii as a wedding gift and my idea of what gaming is changed for good. I used to play video games by my self, every now and then a friend would come over to play but that was rare. Since getting the Wii I have played on my own twice. The beautiful bride can't wait to play and we have Wii parties with friends. We load our profiles into the Wiimote and go to a friends house where everyone participates. It really is a gaming experience completely different than any other. I can now tell you that I will not be getting a Ps3 or 360 because I don't want to end up the loner on the couch. Party at my house bring your Wiimote!!

author: Ron
title: One for the younger kids
content: The Wii is a great system for younger kids, and has a few good games for older ones also. For example: Super Smash Bros. Brawl. It is a great game that I play all the time with friends. The wii is cheap and good entertainment. It is definitely a great system to have if you have younger kids or just want something on the cheaper side of gaming.

author: J. DEATS
title: The Wii in review from a 30 something adult
content:
MY EXPERIENCE

Console is super easy to use, just piug it in and follow the on-screen instruction. You don't even have to read the manuals. Using the special controller is natural and takes only a few minutes to figure out.

Here are some important tips:

* The Wii Sports pack in allows you to play multiple players off a single remote on Golf and Bowling. For Tennis and Baseball you will need at least two Wii remotes to play multiplayer. Boxing is the only Wii Sports game that requires the add-on numchuck controller so if you can't find an extra numchuck don't let it ruin your day.

* The Wii classic controller is a waste of money. The classic controller seves only one purpose, to work with the virtual console. The virtual console is part of the Wii on-line experiencing where you can pay to purchase classic games like Mario 64, Donkey Kong, Sonic, Bonk, etc... You can not use the classic controller with Gamecube games, however you can use a Gamecube controller in place of the classic controller, so instead of paying all that money for a classic Wii controller, just buy a few Gamecube controllers!

* The Wii store is not very developed yet. The Opera web browser is not available yet (it's early Dec) and there are only a couple dozen classic gamnes to pick from at this point to use "Wii Points" to buy.

TIPS AND BUYING

TARGET, BEST BUY, TOYS R US and CIRCUIT CITY. These retailers accepted Nintendo's charter and sticking to the plan, they are holding Wii systems when they arrive and then making them available to customers at an "available upon request" available date. Walmart has signs posted in their bigger stores advertising an available date for their next shipment.

All retailers are also helping out their staff, making units available to employees. So if you want one, find out when new stock is arriving and be willing to wait in line. If you can't use EBay and pay out a few extra hundred for someone else's time waiting in line. If that's a problem then accept that you won't get one. Retailers aren't putting them out when stock arrives, so you can't just mozzy into a TARGET after work and expect to maybe find one, by holding the stock back retailers and preventing this from happening.

* The controllers are also hard to find, but retailers are putting them out when they arrive. Often time systems arrive with the controllers, I've  noticed a trend, where there are controllers on the shelf often there are Wiis in the back being held for a specific self date. Don't try to haggle for one though, the best you can hope for is to get a date they will make them available for sale.

WILL HISTORY REPEAT (PS3 to go the way of the 7800 and Neo Geo?)

When Nintendo introduced the NES back in 1985 the video game industry was a bit like today. Atari was suffering because they had gotten into a rut of producing the same type of games over and over again (sound familiar Playstation fans?), in their quest to build a better game console Atari engineered the 2600's replacement, the 7800. It would have awesome graphics, it would target the high end of the market and it would cost a lot. But the 7800 was almost dead on arrival, In the early 80's game market gone stale, Nintendo released the NES, with it's packed in laser light gun and optional robot bundle, it was part gimmick, part innovation,  but unquestionably it was 100% fun.

Fast forward twenty years later. Nintendo's lost their dominance, now we have professional gamers and owning the latest console is like having the latest designer sports shoes, it's a cultural thing.

But just like the 80's, gamers are starting to wonder what's next. 3D graphics are now on their third (or fourth) generation, we're nearing photo realistic real-time quality. Gamers want something more than a high price tag and flashy graphics. If you would have pulled someone aside in 1984 and told them Atari is going to get their but kicked and their next system is going to flop you would be laughed at. Sony Playstation fans may do the same thing now, but what Nintendo has done with the Wii is amazing. They have turned the clock back and returned the fun to gaming, they've given us something new yet retro enough to be hip at the same time.

Forget the N64 and the Gamecube, let's move back to the dominate days of the SNES, Wii isn't embarssing in the slightest, it remains Nintendo cute, but is carefully designed to be modern. In an age when professional gamers stick to suped up PCs and the consoles are getting old, Nintendo has stepped and as made the console new again.

author: Sammy Lindsay "J"
title: Wii
content: This is by far an awesome gaming system - I was never into video games all that much before but this thing gets you up and moving - it gives you an amazing workout while providing a lot of entertainment.  I would recommend it to anyone

author: J. Harrison
title: Three Stars
content: It won't attach to my internet. I have looked on line and went through the steps.

author: TheLynchFamily
title: Never play thought I would like it only
content: Works on certain tvs. It came fast though and works perfect

author: Z. Balaporia
title: Great fun. Lives up to its promise
content: We love our Wii.  The kids have fun and its good family fun time.  Be warned, they will get good at the games a lot quicker than you so be prepared to be humbled.  Good leassons for the kids on how to handle success too.

author: Carol
title: Most. Fun. Ever.
content: The Wii is everything I could want in a console. I am not big on graphics in consoles because that is why I have my computer :) The Wii is perfect for almost anybody, and even doing normal mundane things on the Wii is enjoyable. I found it fun that in Zelda to slash your sword you use the motion sensitivity of the controller. Even the Wii Sports games that come with the console are very enjoyable, especially playing with a bunch of friends. The Wii is definatly a must have.

author: Patricia B. Coleman
title: Great product
content: Purchased gaming package for family use. Package came with five basic sports program. Family has had hours of enjoyment with this gaming unit. Would suggest purchasing additional controller and nunchuk controller for play with multiple players.

author: Ladena D. Clay
title: Not usually a gamer...but I am now!
content:
I don't usually play video games. That's because I married one of those gamer nerds who generally beats me at everything. What's the fun in that?

Well...the fun is now the Wii! Because he's used the PS2 and the Dreamcast and all those older models, he's not so great on the Wii. Where this item was manufactured for people like me...spazzes!

Thanks to the Wii, when I jerk and bend and twist and jump, so does my game! I love it!

author: Friede S. Lundell
title: Amazon out classes Alibris everytime
content: As this was a Christmas gift for my in-laws, I am writing simply to state the superiority of Amazon of Alibris.  The shipping was prompt and on time despite the worst time of year for shipping.  Everything arrived as exactly described and made Christmas shopping that much easier!

author: Cjay
title: Great Product
content: User friendly and great price.  Received in a few days.  I am throughly happy with this product.

author: Amazon Customer
title: My only complaint, is that the power button doesn't ...
content: My only complaint,is that the power button doesn't work.

author: Michelle Smith
title: Great Game
content: Love my Wii. Great for parties and to get a little activity after work if you cant work out.

author: donnie lankford
title: Great working condition.
content: Works great and am very happy with my purchase.

author: bulletstopper
title: Wii delivers
content: Alot of fun.  Easy to learn controls.  Less intimidating than other consoles due to the unimposing look of the controller.  Yeah sounds like a press release from Nintendo but all turn out to be true.  My wife hates video games but loved Wii sports.  Just pick up and play.  No complicated tutorials.  No shapes on the controller to represent certain actions.  No weird combos.  Just swing a bat/racket/club, and your character does that action.  Simple.  Boxing rules by the way.  Fun in the Mike Tysons Punchout kinda way.  Alot of fun.  The Wii is also a little graphics powerhouse.  Call of Duty 3, Zelda, Need for Speed Carbon, all blew me away with how nice the graphics were.  The Wii is for real.  It's a blast.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I'm Hooked!!
content: I bought this system with every intention of purchasing the guitar hero game.  I bought the Dance Dance Revolution game first though and now I can't stop myself!  The system was extremely easy to install and the controller is easy to use.  The few games already installed on the system are basic to use and I love it.  I'm addicted to the Revolution game and I'm ready to purchase the other Wii system games (i.e. Wii Fit and Guitar Hero World Tour)!  I'm ready to get another controller and dance pad too!  Bring it on!!  I love this system...so awesome.

author: Kevin @ MightyBuying.com
title: Not a perfect 5 stars, but I rounded up.
content:
The positives about Wii have all been written about to death. It accomplishes it's goal, it changes the way we think about playing "video" games.

So that being said, I'm not going to gush over the positives... I'm going to point out the few negatives I see with the system, but before doing so want to remind people I voted the system at 5 stars.

pre wii prep - If you have your TV in a room cluttered with things such as furnature... you might need to rearrange stuff either before every playing of certain Wii titles or permantly to get wii's full effect.

I noticed with Wii Golf... (especially if the censor is above the TV), the game struggles to pick up on my strength of swing. It also does this with kicking off in Madden. It should be noted I have a high TV (wall mounted very high), but certain games might be affected by where you put the censor, in certain TV set ups. Just something to note that might only apply to 10% reading this review.

Your ARM can tire with extended play of certain titles (boxing comes to mind, Madden, etc) (however I think as a parent potentially buying for Children this could be a plus).

and really that's about it... minimal. Basically I highly recommend the Wii, but I did want to point out a few things I noticed playing it over the course of today.

author: Superwoman AJ
title: Guess who in my family got hooked on the Wii!!...
content:
[I popped on amazon.com one day several months ago and the front page was advertising the Wii for $[...].  I knew that was a good price and snagged one for my son and me.  Good thing I bought it when I did because the next week, amazon.com was no longer offering, and the sellers who are are jacking up the price ridiculously every time I look.]

I never in my wildest imaginings thought the Wii would be so much fun.  And it's not my 16 year old who got hooked, it was me!  My favorite game of all is the tennis that came with the Wii Sports package.  I got up to 2047 tonight.  It is my favorite form of exercise - I play it morning and night, sometimes until my arms are just too tired to swing.  It is just fun.  I have bought a few more games, and was actually first introduced to the Wii by my daughter's American Idol game.  But, I prefer movement - tennis, baseball, bowling, darts, etc.  I didn't realize I was a total "gamer" now until I read some of the comments here.  Go figure...  I bought some more games tonight; can't wait till they arrive.

author: SAVE OUR TEENS
title: wii sports
content: Wii Sports This Wii sports game came with the Wii system that I purchase here for x-mas. It was so much fun for my family. We played for hours. You really feel like your playing. My favorite is tennis. The next morning my body was a little sore, but it was worth it. We only had one remote, so we took turns. I plan on buying three more remotes, because you can play up to 4 players. This gaming system is the best by far. You will not regret this purchase.

author: Marc E. Rayborn
title: very, very FUN game!!
content: this system is so much fun!!  the golf is awesome, frisbee golf is just as fun.  So many different games for the whole family to play.  Would definately recommend this to anyone looking for home entertainment!!

author: D. Maxwell
title: perhaps Nintendo should get a Nobel prize!
content: A entertaining video game that offers fun AND exercise. it is not viloent which is excellent for my younger children(depending on the game you chose).  What the gaming world lacked, the Wii makes up!

author: D. Brennan
title: Wii is all I expected and more!
content: I purchased the Wii with my 6 year old in mind. I initally felt that it would be easy for him to learn how to play with it and we could play together. I got what I asked for, the game was very easy to hook up to my standard TV set and as I had hoped, my son and I love the game and can play it together. He picked up on Mario Kart very quickly and loves the game. I was not aware until getting the game that it evaulated your health age. I look forward to getting the Wii FIT in the furture.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: Very happy with the reconditioned product.  Would buy from them again.

author: M. Mercandante
title: Works fine
content: Console was in great shape. The controller was roughed up with black stuff all over the bottom of it. We already had controllers for a Wii/Wii U so it won't be getting used.

author: Thomas Carlette
title: Cheap and easy to use.  Fun for everyone!
content:
The Nintendo Wii brings whole bunches of friendly fun to the family at a cost that won't break the bank.  It really is the go-to console for just about anyone tight on cash and looking for some games to play.  It has just enough shooters to keep your trigger finger happy, with Metroid Prime 3: Corruption and Resident Evil: The Umbrella Chronicles.  It has classics like Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess and, obviously, Super Mario Galaxy.  Not to mention Super Smash Bros. Brawl is coming soon.

The Wiimote + Nunchuck form an inseparable, intuitive pair.  Some games (Mario) seem to use the motion controls better than others (Metroid), although that doesn't mean Metroid uses the controls poorly, just not as well.  The controller is a solid accelerometer, and accurately detects when you're swinging it and in what direction and how fast.  One word though: the sensor bar's native adhesives are very weak.  Invest in better ones.

The Wii is a simplistic console.  Nintendo, as always, has been only a gaming company.  Unlike Sony, it doesn't make TVs or VCRs.  And unlike Microsoft it doesn't release software other than games.  But that means it can focus all of its attention on making a great console with great games for it; and the Wii shows that off beautifully.

Now for the bad news: the Wii's online play is very clunky.  I would say it's almost unbearably clunky.  The ridiculously long "friend number" that you need is a very ... interesting solution for online playing considering how Xbox LIVE or even Playstation Network does it.  Also, the best you'll ever get (I think) in terms of graphics is somewhere around 400p (but please don't quote me on that).  For sure, however, is that you're never going to even approach 1080p.  Not even 750p.  If you're looking for bleeding-edge, eye-popping graphics, the Wii is not your console.

Prior to owning a Wii, I had owned both a Playstation 3 and an Xbox 360.  I can say that all 3 play very differently from each other, but if you are like me and have moments where you don't necessarily want intense single-player action on a PS3 or equally intense multi-player battles on LIVE, the Wii is there, ready for some irreverent fun.  It's the ultimate party console, great for when you've got friends over (just make sure you've purchased some spare controllers!).

Before I leave, I should mention the Nintendo Wii comes with Wii Sports.  Before you bash it as a stupid collection of pointless minigames, I should mention that they are in fact a lot of fun.  You can't ever actually "win", but it's still tons of fun, especially if you want to waste time.  Don't expect deep gameplay, but ... I think the best example to give is the game Tetris.  Nobody expects deep gameplay from Tetris, it's repetitive as all heck, it's simplistic, and you can't ever really "win" Tetris.  Yet it is also strangely addictive, just like Wii Sports.

author: simone
title: Five Stars
content: Came in time.wish it came with more than one controller but I'm not complaining

author: Ivan Orozco
title: the wii console is the best console in the world
content: the wii is the greatest console in the world all the wii games are awesome there true classics the graphics on the wii games are awesome the motion controls on the wiimote rocks and the best part for me is downloading all the great old-school games on the wii virtual console i grew up with and the wiiware games are excellent as well all the wiiware games rocks buy this system if your a huge nintendo fan you wont be sorry

author: Ileana Vermilyea
title: Mom watching her sons having fun!
content:
Although it cost twice as much than if we had waited until after Christmas, the smile and ejoyment in our son's face's were worth the extra cost.  This was their only large gift item from Santa!  They play it everyday and seem to enjoy all the games and ease of operation.  I am the one that set it up and it was defintly easy to do.
It got here with enough time before Christmas to not be worried about Chistmas morning.
Thank you.

author: LuXuZ
title: Value/Fun
content: You won't be able to find a better fun package for the same price. This is from the perfect birthday gift, to the perfect exercise partner. It is a good investement for fun as it is for cardio fitness, just choose the right game!

author: Brent_223_
title: Nothing better than a Wii!
content:
What's better than a Wii?

Nothing.

author: Gaddiel
title: Family Fun
content: The Wii is the best family-friendly console gaming system out there right now.  If you are a hardcore FPS gamer, there are other systems that are better suited to that.  However, if you like party games or games the whole family can enjoy, the Wii is a great choice.  My family loves WiiSports, which is included with the product. All of these games are perfect for a party atmosphere, because they are fun to play AND fun to watch.

author: My Opinion
title: Ultimate Party Game............
content:
Many times with other consoles like xbox 360 or ps3...it is hard to get everyone invovled if you have a group over.

Other people start talking amongst themselves, watch TV or a Movie in another room.

Or just plain can't play the Nex Gen games/systems available. To many buttons and functions that leave you confused and unable to participate.

Not so with the Nintendo Wii.

Easy gameplay, involves gameplay for 4 people. Young and Old Casual Gamer or Not..the Wii beckons back to why we play games. for FUN!!

Wii = Fun!

Enjoy!!

author: Kevin J. Loria
title: Great new system...great new controls
content:
As you have heard the interactive controls are the best thing about the new Wii, that and the fact that it is the cheapest platform out there.

Games like Sports (free with system) and Wii Play are worth owning the system for alone. The boxing training segments can be quite a workout!

The system is compatable with the old cube games (although you must use game cube memory cards for them rather than the Wii cards. Another bonus is the wireless internet options allowing for downloads of classic games and more add-ons appear from day-to-day. Future releases like the remake of Destroy All Monsters & talk of Star Wars combat games have me looking foward to spending more on Wii.

One negative: Like it's competition, the games for the Wii are overpriced, but blockbuster is already renting them.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not satisfied!
content: Has been sent back! Not satisfied!

author: Matt Fi
title: Fun for family
content: Great fun for the family, not meant for a hard core multiplayer online fanatic like my self.  The extended family has forced me to buy batteries at costco but it's well worth it!  I love this system when it comes to family entertainment and also brings out the competitiveness in even the most subtle people.  Love the system, hate the available online issues, but you know what? This is about getting the family together and enjoying each others company.  Want to bring the family together? Fork over the $200 and enjoy!

author: D. Biggins
title: Wii system
content: Gently used product, in very good condition. Product was as described and arrived in a timely manner.

author: es el queso
title: It is that good
content: Get one, if you can. It's as much fun as you have heard, and easy and intuitive to use. Gamers and gamer-haters alike will have a blast playing this and even watching others play it.

author: K. KRAUS
title: Thank you Amazon!
content: Wii is a great game system and worthy of 5 stars but my greater appreciation goes to Amazon.com.  Somehow on 12/21 Amazon had Wii systems for sale for the regular price of $249.  We ordered it and it was delivered on Christmas Eve.  It was definitely a great surprise for my kids.

author: Peg Wade
title: Three Stars
content: ok

author: Sandra Kay Underwood
title: Five Stars
content: Works like a charm. Easier to set up this time, too. Don't know what is different.

author: Mark C
title: great fun; really brings back the good ol' days
content: I don't want to end up repeating the other ecstatic reviews for the Wii so i'll focus mainly on the ability to play gamecube games as well as download other previous nintendo titles from older consoles. I grew up playing mario bros 1, 2, 3, super mario world, legend of zelda, contra, etc... and its great to be able to play them on the Wii- you can just download games off of the wii store channel and more titles are being added every day. It really brings back the nostalgia and its great being reunited with all the old characters of my past. The ability to play older console titles, as well as the whole onslaught of great wii titles really makes this the best console in my opinion over the ps3 and xbox360.

author: ShuzforKK
title: Got to have a Wii
content: If you must have a gaming console it has to be a Wii, of course you can get the others, but this one is much fun, yeah more storage or better graphics from the other guys, but nintendo does gaming like they only can, not like the other guys involved with everything else (sony, microsoft). The Miis are a fun way to get everybody invloved in the game and guess what it plays all the gamecube stuff too

author: nmart
title: good products
content: This works well for the entire family.  We get Netflix on it, so it is nice to have the movies and TV programs streamed live.  The internet connection is challenging when surfing, but the games works great.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The "newness" quickly wears off
content:
The Wii is certainly fun for kids and there's a few games that are fun for the family, but after that intial fun wears off, older teenagers or adults will find the game lineup for the Wii console is just way too limited to offer long term enjoyment.  Can't Nintendo produce a game with something "OTHER" than the ridiculous Mario character or name in it?  There's just way too few decent products out there for the Wii if you're older and you instead end up playing goofy "cartoony" games all day long.

You can buy "WiiWare" games directly online and download them to the Wii if you have your Wii connected to the internet, but these games are just not that good and I can't find any that are actually worth the Wii Points you have to purchase to download these games.  Also, their Wii internet browser must be purchased for Wii points, which is frustrating since you are already paying for Internet access through your ISP.  Even after getting the Internet channel/browser, you'll find that the browser is a joke and many web pages don't display properly, and "most" content such as video, audio, etc. will NOT function inside their browser.

Thus, if you're considering buying the "Wii Points card" to download additional Wii channels or games, I highly recommend you buy just a single card of the lowest cost.  Don't spend a bunch of money buying a lot of points, only to find out there's really nothing there worth downloading.

The internal memory of the Wii is sadly limited.  You can add an SD card to "copy" stuff too, but the SD card really isn't used for anything functional and doesn't "add to the internal memory" for storing channels and games you purchase.  Thus, I have to wonder what benefit having an SD card "really" gives you?

The Wii remotes work fairly well, but often times you're left wondering "what happened" because it didn't do what you thought it would and some games just become an effort in frustration because you can't perform the required button combinations to perform a task.

You can create a "Mii" character to resemble yourself in the Wii, but "many" games ignore that and won't use the Mii character, so it's a bit self defeating to do this.

If it weren't for the fact that I have kids, I'd never have bought a Wii and instead would have bought an XBOX or Playstation if I really felt the need to have a gaming console.  They definately offer a wider variety of games and genres and aren't so hung up on the annoying "cartoon" games that is the primary lineup for the Wii.

Kids will have lots of fun with the Wii, but to get all the controls and accessories to let your family play together will cost you a "LOT" of money, so keep that in mind and most definately research the Wii games available and compare them with the other gaming consoles out there before you commit to a Wii, or you may find the gaming fun won't last long due to such a weak lineup of games for the Wii.

author: Marley
title: Five Stars
content: Great value, got everything as advertised. Wii is is better shape than advertised.

author: Jonathan Brown
title: Awesome deal
content: Exactly how it was described. Works great. Only thing I had to buy was an extra controller. Awesome deal for a great gaming console.

author: Teri Hutto
title: WONDERFUL
content: MY HUSBAND AND I ARE IN OUR MID 50'S AND 60'S AND WE HAVE BOTH LOST WEIGHT SINCE WE STARTING PLAYING THE WII. WE LOVE IT.

author: shea
title: Five Stars
content: I love the Wii

author: J. Nuez
title: Great product, great delivery speed
content: Ordered the system last week, received it three days later, four days before the estimated delivery time. Great product, loads of fun, and great service by amazon.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Wrong part.
content: The product came with the wrong A/C adapter so it was not able to connect to my tv. It should have been: red white red blue green and then red but I received what is attached in the picture below. So until I purchase the right A/C adapter, can’t even be used.

author: Kathleen A. Nolte
title: Three Stars
content: love it

author: N. S. Warden
title: not in very good shape
content: top was missing but the item works - it will turn itself on sometimes so i have to use an extension with an on/off switch

author: Mark Pearson
title: Great fun the family and non Hard-core gamer
content:
I have been a Playstation-a-holic and will remain with either playstation or possibly Xbox360 but I must admit the Wii is a lot of fun.  I have a 5 1/2 yr old son that has been playing PS2 with me but the games out for that system are too advanced for him.  The Wii looked like a suitable replacement and it sure was.

I bought 3 games today, after waiting on line for 4 hours, and my son plays with the Wii Sports the most.  In fact, he has beat all the adults in the house in bowling and has not stopped letting us all know.  A really great system for the money.

I won't give up on the Hi-Def systems.  I need my blood-n-gore, superb graphix and great titles that Wii cannot provide but the Wii has founds it place in my family's hearts.

Now, if you don't mind I need to get back to bowling practice so that I can beat my son!

author: KBJ
title: GREAT FOR THE WHOLE FAMLIY
content: I purchased this as a family gift for Christmas. My son is 16 and already has xbox 360 so I wasn't sure if he would be interested in the wii (he likes to play alot of sports games)and my daughter is 12. My husband does not or should I say did not play at all. I was shocked to see that everyone loves this and wee all play together great family games!! Sure to bring the family together!

author: "M"
title: If you got it in your cart....keep trying.
content: Just an FYI - I was able to get the Wii into my cart when they were briefly available on Amazon around 10 am (CST).  Before I could pay, they were telling me they were no longer available.  It moved the item to a "Buy it Later" section.  Even though the product page kept saying they were unavailable, after trying several times, I was able to click on "move it to my cart" and purchase it.  They gave me a projected ship date of Nov. 27th.  If you have it in your "buy it later" area, keep trying to move it to your cart!  I'm hoping this won't get cancelled, but it looks pretty promising.  Good luck!

author: FV
title: Pleased Buyer
content: Love it! it came a little worm like advertised missing the covers for the top ports but I dont mind. It works flawlessly, came with a stand and a wiimote+chuck. Couldnt have asked for a better deal

author: Bradley C
title: Great System, games not as fun as XBOX
content: Wii is a revolutionary gaming system, however, at this time, there is not a huge selection of games for me. I'm the World of Warcraft, Elder Scrolls, Halo type gamer and there isn't much out there. I download and play the classics which is an awesome feature, Mario World, Super Mario,  and Sega's Sonic the Hedgehog more than I play the Wii games. I guess I have to be patient. My 8 year old loves it though.

author: Silvia
title: Wiinderful
content:
I never been a fan of PS/Xbox systems since I do not believe that good videogames are the ones with the best graphics. The Wii proves one more time my point. The "Wii sport" video game does not have amazing graphics, but the gameplay is fantastic. You can stand in front of the TV holding the controller like a baseball bat and and see it wiggling on the screen  like it was for real. The motion sensor is quite amazing in understanding your movements without requiring any particular position (other than being between 3 to 8 feet from the tv). The system is relatively cheap (as compared to  others ...) and it comes with a game.  Among the lauch games there is "Zelda" which is probably one of the best series in videogames. The control of Zelda is pretty cool as well.

In conclusion...buy it!(as soon as you manage to find in stores...I got lucky...)

author: Kimberly D. Morgan
title: wonderful christmas present
content: Bought this for our children ages 3, 9 and 14 and they all love it. Item just as expected. Mom and dad are hooked too! Hours of family fun and a great workout! Money well spent!

author: David Hale
title: Just what we were looking for
content: Needed a replacement Wii as the disc reader on ours was starting to fail.  This used one works great.

author: Avid Amazon Shopper
title: Addicted to Wii
content:
Love it, love it, love it! Santa brought this for my 4-year old son for Christmas, and it really lives up to the hype. His favorites so far are Wii Sports (this game comes with the console), Mario Party 8, and creating Miis. I love the Zapper (sold separately for about $20 and includes a game), Tomb Raider, and Resident Evil. If you have a wireless network, it is incredibly simple to connect to the internet, which opens up even more possibilities (my son likes the create a Mii contests).

One note of caution though - should you need to open up the console to retrieve a toy that was jammed in by an almost 2-year old, you'll need a special screwdriver called a "tri-wing." Only a couple of bucks online, but with shipping, it can take a week or so to arrive. You might consider buying one before you need it just in case, especially if you've been down this road before with VCRs and DVDs.

author: Jessica C. Bullock
title: Next Generation Game System
content:
I never considered myself a full-fledged gamer until this system came out. I work at Toys R Us so when they came in one day suddenly, i put on on hold and bought it after my shift off of impulse. I must say, it was well worth the money.

I havnt been able to turn it off since the day I got it. Although the graphics arnt up to 2007 standards the gameplay is awesome. The entire thing is all motion actiavated and the Wii sports is one of the best things about it. After a few rounds of baseball my shoulders began to ache.

Its a great game system also in the fact that it doesnt allow you to sit down and play games all day. You actually get up and do something. So now more being lazy I guess.

But overall, its an absolute awesome system and well worht the little bit of money that it costs. its good for everyone, even non-gamers as its easy to figure out with very few buttons on the remote to have to deal with.

author: Darrel Habets
title: Five Stars
content: Got it for my daughter for a Christmas present. She uses it whenever there's time.

author: C. Franz
title: Strangely appealing, more fun than should be allowed, possibly hazardous to your (friend's) health
content:
Although Nintendo is somewhat of a household name for someone of my age (>40), I never really thought of getting myself a console. If I play games, I always played (and still do) them on a (high-end) computer. All that changed when I first saw the wii demoed shortly before christmas 2006. What intrigued me was their truly innovative game controller design (yes, boys love toys), and the way they integrated into the games (I saw demos from the wii sports series).

So, on a whim, I decided on getting myself a wii, without really knowing what I got myself into. For even measure I threw in a second controller (I seldom play alone), and a title I seemed to recognize: Legends of Zelda. The box I purchased came with wii sports, and the second controller came with wii play.

Please note that I have no experience with regard to other consoles, and the following is purely my experience I derived from playing with wii.

First of all, the device is easy to set up. The console's design and manual make it clear that this is a mature product from a company that has a lot of experience creating consumer devices. You can't, for example, accidentally mix up plugs. The only thing that I did not like was the flimsy wire that connetcs the console to the sensor strip (which looks like an accident waiting to happen). Plug in power, plug in sensor strip (this was the most difficult, as I could not decide where to put it for best performance. As it turned out, I shouldn't have bothered. It works no matter where I place it), connect to TV, pair with controllers, and I was ready to go. Using the controllers is strange at first, and using them as pointing device has nowhere near the precision I have come to expect from a mouse. During set-up of the console I thought that this did not bode well for game play later on. Again, I should not have worried. Most games don't rely on the pointing abilities of the controller but on it's motion detection. A very nice feature of the controllers is the feedback (both aural and tactile) it gives at various moments (e.g. it slightly vibrates when your pointer is over a clickable button, or chimes when your console becomes active in two-player bowling).

I tried the Sports games first. Yes, I've heard the stories. And laughed at those poor saps. And yet, it only took me a few minutes to stare sheepishly at my controller dangling from the wrist strap. I let go while bowling. It is a testament to the game that it becomes so immersive so quckly that you forget what you are doing. Going on to baseball I barely managed to dodge my friends swing. It was forceful. And executed in blissful forgetfulness that I was but a few feet away. I knew then that even though potentially harmful, this was real fun.

The wii also comes with built-in WiFi, which was a surprise to me. It connected without any problems to an open access point, but required a little more work to connect to my secure wireless network. I have not yet tried to access the internet (save for two firmware updates that the wii performed flawlessly), but I'm delighted to see that it works.

Something I also like in this console is their fun and friendly (and sometimes slightly over-protective) way they approach gaming. I really like the 'toy shop' atmosphere surrounding the device, which appears to be a stark contrast to the overbearing, testosterone-suffused "GAME THIS!" attitude that other consoles seem to exude (perhaps one of the reasons I never looked at other consoles). I already have that, and more, in my workstation (which it well should. That beast's graphics card alone has triple the price tag of the wii). The wii, on the other hand, is petite, white, and, strangely enough, seems to actually *look* happy. It appears to emphasize fun, not performance.
Accordingly, the wii's graphics are nothing much to write home about. Somehow, though, I find it strangely appealing. Even though the graphics are simplistic, it is the way the games are presented, and the way I can get immersed through it's game controllers. I'm having more fun waving that little white stick about than I've had in a long time of precisely pointing my mouse.

All in all I am really delighted by this console. I won't play shooters on it (for that I have my computer), but the interactive sports and party games are so much fun (and a positive danger to anyone near you should you choose not to be careful) that I simply cannot resist them. I wholeheartly recommend this console to everyone. If possible, try to get a demo at your local store. Beware -- you might be hooked immediately.

author: J. Myers
title: Sears is sold out
content: I got one in my cart, but couldn't get it through check out.  I've been up since 3:30 AM, reading all the posts.  My husband is in line at Best Buy - 85th, and supposedly they have 109 pcs.  They open in 50 mins - keeping fingers crossed...

author: Fernando Almonte
title: This console rocks!!!!
content:
I bought this WII for my 3 years old daughter and we have been playing Super Mario Galaxy, we both love it and the best of all this is the WII version that play Gamecube Games just like I wanted it.

It is in great condition and I really recommend buying it from "SWAYS", this seller ship fast and like I said before the WII is in great shape, it is like new and the price is good too.

My daughter is happy and me too, this is reason enough to rate this as a excellent buy.

author: hookedmamainpa
