author: Nytehawk
title: Finally got one!!!
content: This was the large "Santa" gift this year.  The kids got up early just as everyone's kids do on Christmas.  They weren't downstairs more than five seconds before we heard screaming and hollering....lol  They wanted to set it up right then but I was able to put that off until the afternoon the rest of the day it was a fight for the controllers.  The main game we played was bowling and even my 4 y/o son was able to do it on his own after just 3 frames!  I can't wait to get some of the other games that are out or will be released soon.  This is definately one system that can bring back the family time that most don't have anymore.  We also have a wireless router at home, and the setup wizard in the Wii is very simple and straight forward.

author: rosa i ayala
title: but works like new!
content: Used, but works like new!

author: Donald Calhoun
title: Wii Sports
content: Setup was very easy.  We had it connected and running in less than 10 minutes.  My wife and I played tennis for 2 hours the first session...so hard we were sore the next day!  And this is a video game I can play with my son and we both enjoy it!

author: H
title: Gaming convert
content: I have not played a video game since playing Seaquest when I was a kid on my Atari. I'm more of an outdoor type of person who likes to hike and bike and the idea of staying inside on my bum playing a videogame was completely unappealing. And then, 25 years after mastering Seaquest, I tried the Wii, and was hooked. It is so much fun, especially on a rainy day when you can't do anything outside. I still can't ever imagine playing XBOX or Playstation, but the idea of moving while playing a video game is so novel and just so much fun, its really perfect for people like me: almost lifelong non-gamers. Even my father-in-law, who poo-pooed the idea of us buying a gaming system had the biggest smile on his face when boxing. I would recommend at least trying it, you'll probably like it.

author: Just Another Mom
title: Fun for all
content: One word can sum up this game console:  AWESOME!  My husband spent a few days of standing in the cold to get one of these.  I have to say that before we had it I thought it was going to be another of those so-so game consoles like all those that came before it. But I was wrong.  I'm not a big game console player but I LOVE the Wii.  It's easy to use, it's compact size doesn't take up a ton of space. The games it comes bundled with are AWESOME! Everything about it is just easy to use, even for someone who doesn't game much.  Plus, it's awesome that it connects to the internet and you can communicate with your friends, can access the weather and all sorts of other wonderful features.  It by far exceeds any other console that I've seen.  We own just about every other console that has been put on the market and I would trade them all for this one.  Highly, highly recommended.  Well worth the conservative price!

author: Kimberly Seidel
title: Wii love it!
content: We bought this for a Christmas present to the family and everyone loves it. It really was the perfect gift!

author: frank wolf
title: Five Stars
content: great deal

author: Mark Twain
title: Wii is Wonderful
content:
This is best video game I had ever seen. I agree the graphics is not top of line if you use 1080P but the best part is it allows you have games with physical activity. That was the big reason, I got it for my Kid but later I realized that I am playing it more than my Kid. By default you get following games -
Tennis, Baseball, Golf, Bowling, Boxing
My favourite is tennis. You really get a feel you are playing tennis. The remote , which works as racket for Tennis is wonderful. It even simulates the sound and vibration , you get when ball touches racket.
Great game to play with guests. Have few beers and enjoy Bowling at comfort of home and free of cost. Until now I had not spent extra on games . When I will get bored with included games, I shall shop for more. It will be great if commenters put reviews about WII games as comment to the review. This will be helpful to WII community.
Also this game console wirelessly connects to internet and you can see whether, news or download games. Overall it is wonderful game console. I wish it was number 1 in graphics too. But let me make it clear, even with that shortcoming it is number 1 overall and that is why it is best selling (with a very wide margin compared to number 2) game ,despite supply shortages

author: Nate and family
title: We really like our Wii!  Fun for the whole family!
content:
The Wii is a very user-friendly, versatile, and entertaining computer gaming system.  It really is much more than a game base -- there are channels so you can check the weather and the news, you can add an internet browser (for a small fee, which was disappointing at first until I realized how small the fee really was ... and since I can't post amounts in a review I'll just say it is about the same as a video rental and less than a movie ticket), and many more options are available.  It comes with a very fun set of games (bowling, boxing, tennis, etc.) that make use of the very versatile controllers that are included.  Additional games can be downloaded (for a fee) or purchased -- and now you can rent them (or buy them used) at most major video chains.

What I like most about the Wii is that it seems to be designed for family use.  This is not just for boys who like shooting aliens.  There are lots of activities that make it simple and fun for the whole family, from very young to very old.  You create little "Miis" that represent (and look like) you (or not, if you prefer), and they become your character in the games -- we spent a while just creating characters for each member of the family, letting each create their own but making suggestions to each other and laughing at the various options each chose.  It is a lot of fun.

With the internet compatibility -- especially if we hook it up to a USB keyboard -- this really becomes like a new household computer.  You can check email, browse, buy, anything you like.  (If you have a Gmail account you can even do word processing and spread sheets on their website -- so it really becomes just like a new computer.)

There were a few glitches -- we have a DSL internet connection and while we could hook up quickly when we tried to install the upgrade that the system recommended we found that it stalled about 4 times before finally completing the download and completing the upgrade.  Something similar happened when we tried to download the internet "channel" (browser).  Eventually we got everything working, though.

One more thing that bugs me a bit is that the Wii won't play DVDs.  Apparently it is able to do so, from a hardware standpoint, but they haven't installed the software for various reasons (and there is no way to get the software through Nintendo).  That is the only reason I might have preferred a Playstation -- which natively plays BluRay and DVDs.  I'd like it if I didn't have to switch between my DVD player and the Wii, and could just use the Wii box for both functions.  Still, this is a pretty fantastic device, that I'm sure will get a lot of use from my whole family for a very long time.

author: TMiller
title: Wii Console
content: I'm very happy with the Wii console. It's really helps with keeping your kids active.

author: M. Benishek
title: WII
content: It cost more then I wanted to pay but the purchase was well worth it.  We are two adults and play the Wii everytime we get a chance.  I would deffinately recommend anyone even someone that can't excell on normal gaming systems to purchase this and enjoy.  I know I have!

author: Shelby
title: Bought used
content: Our wii was fried in a power surge so I bought us a new one. Didn't feel the need to buy a brand new one since I already had the cords and everything, just needed a console. Ordered my used wii from the company EZCORP and received it when they said it would arrive. Unfortunately, my dog got a hold of it and chewed up the wires, luckily I didn't need them, but the console was saved in time. When I brought the package inside the console was filthy and nasty, and not from my dog, this was stuff a child would do. The cord you put around your wrist for the controller was absolutely disgusting and brown and smelled. The remote was sticky with brown stuff. I wiped everything down real good with some Lysol wipes but couldn't keep the wrist cord. It was filthy. I realize it is a used console and it's not going to be in perfect condition, but I at least expected to get something worth $60. The company should have taken 5 minutes of their time to disinfect/wipe down the used games they buy. We had our wii for a long time and it was in perfect condition and we have two kids who played it all the time. The console and everything works great, but it would have been nice to receive something clean and halfway decent.

author: Kay
title: Love it
content: I love my wii!! I use my Netflix every day ! I'm actually saving money by turning off hbo. Easy to move from room to room, easy to use just a fun thing overall!

author: Christie
title: Not what I was looking for
content: I expected the cords to be with it also, however it was just the wii itself without the av cord or adaptor. I don't know if I read it wrong or what, but wasn't what I was looking for.  Also the top of the wii was missing.

author: Captain Chunk
title: Go for it!
content: I just got the Wii this morning after waiting only a few hours in line.  Thanks to those who post on forums and customer discussion for tips that lead me to getting a Wii!  This is the first time I have got a system directly after launch.  I just couldn't wait for the Wii!  --Setup was a breeze and packaging was very efficient.  The controls are very nice and feel natural.  The Wiimote is very responsive and play is very real.  I have only had a few hours with Zelda and Wii Sports but I have no complaints with either one (I'll keep this to a Wii review).  Someone complained in another review about the controller being too loud and not being able to adjust the speaker.  There is an option to lower the volume.  I even had my wife playing the Wii (and she was kicking butt) and she was honestly sick of hearing me talk about the Wii so that is saying a lot.  After a while we were both laughing and having a great time.  I have been grinning ever since the moment they handed me my white box.  Don't pay a high price for an auction!  Wait it out and keep hunting.  I only looked for 2 days and finally got lucky.  Thank you Nintendo, I can't wait to see what can be done with this system.  Don't hesitate if you're thinking about the next system you want to purchase.  Go for the Wii!

author: snowman playing in the snow
title: bright future
content:
The nintendo wii has been incredibly fun. I bought the wii initially because super smash bros. brawl was coming out. But after having the wii for over a year, I found other games to be more fun. I love wii sports. It is one of the only game I can get my parents to play (another is boom blox). For the record, the last game my dad played was super mario bros. for the nintendo and my mom has never played any games at all. To have my parents play games is a priceless gift that the wii has given me. We have something else to do in the living room besides watching TV.

The wii needs more good games. Don't get me wrong, the wii has some really good games. Wii sports, boom blox, super smash bros. brawl, Super mario galaxy. By the way, galaxy is a very, very good game. It is the my favorite game on the wii (and the best game in my opinion). However, the wii only has a few of these games. There are mostly bad games out there where the developer has just mixed in a bunch of minigames. These type of games probably outnumber the good games by 10:1 (I made that number up). These games are giving the wii a bad name. They make it seem like only 5 year old kids play the wii. This is contrary to what the wii is about. The way nintendo is advertising the wii, it seems the target audience is everybody, not just little kids. So, nintendo developers should lead by example and create some more mature games, not games like wii music.

Even though only a few good games exist for the wii so far, I think its getting better. Recently, Boom blox party, excite bot, punch-out, and tiger woods PGA tour 10 has just come out. They came out only a few months apart from each other. This is a huge improvement and shows that the developers are getting the hang out making use of the wii. An attachment, the wii motionplus (sold separately), makes the wiimote much more responsive and realistic. Where as before, little motions like nudging the golf ball into the hole 2 inches away could not be read by the wiimote, now it can. It can copy your exact motions. This is very big news!! In games like wii sports, after a certain skill level the pros become the same because there is not much more you can do than wag the wiimote at the right time. Now, you have to get the positioning of the wiimote right since the 3D position can be accurately read. This means more tradition gamers can have fun with games built for the causal gamers. It will be exciting to see what developers can come up with now that 3D motion can be accurately read. I can already see a whole new level of puzzle games!

author: D. Rhoads
title: Wii
content: I got the Wii  mostly to exercise but I like the games as much as my granddaughters. the games are a great way to have fun as a family and keep moving. I would recommend this game for everyone who doesn't want to be inactive all winter long. Great entertainment for family and friends.

author: K. KAUFF

content: This is the best buy I ever made for family entertainment.  Recently, my children and grandchildren were here and we had a blast!  The grandkids were very familiar with it since they all have one at home.  They even brought their own games to play and sticks!  I highly recommend this product.

author: Donna Parsons
title: excellent system
content: The system has met every expectation that I had for it and I was not dissappointed because I bought it from several persons recommendations.

author: Ryan
title: Five Stars
content: You can play Super Smash Bros on it. That's about all the reason to buy it.

author: Ellen Holdredge

content:
Great gaming unit. Easy to use...offers fun for all ages. Lots of additional games
available.  Half the fun is creating your avatar.

author: duey
title: Wii Fit Plus
content: We have really liked it a lot.  You don't have to worry about the weather to exercise.  The time goes so fast when you're playing!

author: Naomi

author: C. A. Perna

content: Easy to connect to the T.V. Lots of hours of entertainment. Makes for a fun afternoon. I would recommend buying.

author: Kathryn E.
title: Great exercise even without Wii Fit
content: I wanted to get Wii Fit, but couldn't find one so I went ahead and just started with the Wii.  Much to my surprise, even these games are great exercise and a lot of fun.  Try bowling 4 or 5 games with each hand.  You've just done about 80 lunges on each side.  If you don't feel that the next morning you're in a lot better shape then I am or else you're a whole lot younger!

author: Blu
title: From a sizzle to a fizzle
content: There are far more party games for this system, and childish games. Its not the family system all the time because not everyone wants to play lack luster games. The good games come out every now and then but seldom are they considerate as far as looks. Some peripherals have their set backs, like the Wii Speak that does not allow you to use it at all if you don't have any Wii Friends. Waste of $$$ on that note. Wii Classic remote could really be used for great games like King of Fighters 12, and Street Fighter 4, if they actually considered making them for the system, but its seen as the mediocre party game system that seldom gets quality content, and thats mainly through Nintendo itself. We are waiting, but it sucks, if the Wii has more juice than the GameCube then there shouldn't be any excuse for last Gen titles with a $50 price tag slapped on them like they are worth it.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Fun for all Ages
content: Graphics are great, so are the games.  Love it -  this is a game for all ages.

author: matthew
title: the  best  product  for  kids
content:
I  like  very much  this  product.

My  kids  are  happy  after  they  played  wii  games.  I  am  going  to  buy  another  wii  game

product.

Thank  you  very much

author: D Berkowitz
title: Up Up and a Wii
content:
Finally, I had a chance to play the Wii. And I only played the sports games that came with the system.

I started off playing boxing, which was alright, but then it got really involved. Batting practice blew me away; I had to bend my knees and step into the swing. When I practiced hitting to a certain location, it was a drill I never once did in years of sleepaway camp or gym class.

Sony and Microsoft were focusing on building the next best game systems, and they probably have (I've played Xbox 360 but not PS3). Yet with the Wii, Nintendo did something else entirely. They created an interactive experience, something you'd wait on line to try at a World's Fair.

I know I'm slow in saying it, yet with game systems, I'm hardly an early adopter; at home I have the original Nintendo Entertainment System from the 80s, still working (Dr. Mario's the current favorite). Despite many thoughts of upgrading over the past two decades, this is the first time I've ever really thought it's worth it.

All I'm left wondering now is how the heck Nintendo did it.

author: Ben Nicholson
title: Great Fun
content:
I start of by saying this is a review for the console not prices and combination packages. Console - This is a great console it's lots of fun, especally in groups but also good by yourself. The graphics are not as good as a PS3 for example but they not ment be. To really enjoy this you got to get the right games like Mario Kart, Wii Sports Island, the Olympic games, any tennis game and Wii fit. If you want something for a great shoot 'um up get something else. This is great and is lots of fun for adults and children a like.
Wii Sports - It's a great game in it's self Tennis and bowling is brilliant. Boxing, golf and baseball are also fun but (sometimes)can take a while to get into them. With it's scoring system you only play computer players of your standard and and that scoring systems gives something aim for.
Get it

author: CWarnock51
title: Five Stars
content: This was just as advertised and I am very pleased with it.

author: S. Bitters

content: The wii is a fun console but you can't compare it to the 360 or p3.. It's just diffrent than them. The graphics are good but it's hard to tell if they are better than the game cube.. If you are a hard core gamer you might not like this console the game selection is week and theres not that good of online play. I own all 3 console and I like the 360, wii, then p3. I am a father of a two year old and a two month old so I have little time and when I do get some time I'm on the 360 playing with a buddie.. Overall the wii is still worth getting it's fun during partys and it's fun playing with the wife.

author: Creighton Chow
title: Best Nintendo System
content: This system is very interactive and has fun games that gets friends and family involved. This really brings the family together; instead of boardgames, families just play the Wii together.

author: R. Thibault
title: Wii's as gifts
content: Purchased two Wii's as Christmas gifts for our grandchildren. We are sure they will all enjoy them.

author: Annj R.
title: Best console I've ever played!
content: I'm not one typically for video gaming. I got the wii for my husband as an early Christmas present and was happily surprised to discover that I enjoy it as much as he does. The interactive way it's set up and actually requires you to get off your duff and move is great. The size makes it convenient for fitting it among all our other media, and the remotes are easy to use. My only problem is that it only comes with one remote and nunchuk, but Wii sports is awesome and it wasn't a big deal to get a second remote.

author: ldieringer
title: Wii is EXCITING!
content: Quick Shipment of this product.  The Wii is a great way to get the whole family involved. No issues so far!

author: Chow
title: A wii for the ages!
content: So much fun playing the sports pak and the graphics are beautiful! Don't bother buying the Opera browser download for internet browsing. The quality is poor and not all www sites are accessible. But we bought it to get our butts up and out the chairs and it's working! If nothing else my hubby and I are playing and laughing together while the rains pours outside. The boxing segment will really get you moving and burning calories! Tennis would be second for physical activity while bowling and golf are fairly tame but lots of fun. GAME ON!

author: Cynthia Dines
title: Great for kids with disabilities
content: Our son has cerebral palsy, but loves to 'play' video games. This usually isn't very meaningful for him as he can't really control the actions of the games, but he has fun nonetheless. (one option, though mostly for little kids, is the game "Whack-a-Mole" that simply plugs into your VHS/DVD player and you interact with the T.V.) We are looking forward to getting the Wii for our family this Christmas, specifically so he can interact on a more social level with his cousins who love doing things with him.

author: topgun
title: Wii remanufactured
content: I love the unit but the hand controller was very poor.  Had to order a new one from a different seller.  Now, I am very happy.

author: Jeremy C.
title: Three Stars
content: works good for now being a used unite.

author: carlos
title: Five Stars
content: excellent product

author: F. Workman
title: Innovation Trumps Graphics
content:
Sure, the PS3 or 360 have better graphics, but you cannot beat the innovative design of the Wii wireless wand.  At more than half the cost of the other systems, there is no wonder that the Wii is blowing the others out of the water.

If you can find one, purchase it today.

author: Hg(CNO)2
title: 7th Generation Console System Winner!
content: The world has three seventh generation console systems:  XBox 360, Playstation 3 and the Nintendo Wii.  Each system is unique in their own way.  Wii has classical Compact Discs, 360 has red-ray HD discs and PS3 has blu-ray HD discs.  Wii discs hold the least information.  PS3 discs hold the most information.  Because of this, Wii has the worst graphics of the big three.  This provides the Nintendo gamers with an inexpensive system with inexpensive games.  Retail for the Wii and retail for new Wii game releases are significantly less than the competitors.  The prices are unbeatable and with the wireless remotes with motion sensing abilities, it is among the most unique gaming consoles ever.  It is fun for children all the way to the elderly.  It is so versatile and easy to learn that anybody can get the hang of the games.  Both family-oriented games and mature games have been released.  Wi-Fi is also compatible with the Wii so you can get online.  The Wii also has the Wii Shop Channel, which provides a gateway to the past.  Old games from NES, SNES, N64, Turbographix and Atari are available for download from the Wii Shop Channel.  On top of that, Gamecube discs slide right into the disc intake and are playable as if it were a Nintendo Gamecube.  Any gamer from the late 80's, 90's, and early 2000's should certainly buy a Nintendo Wii to relive some of the classics in the original gamer era.  Nintendo is constantly bringing out new updates and releases to enhance the game play.  For old gamers and new gamers alike, this is the gaming console from the 7th generation gaming consoles to buy.

author: H. Massey
title: Lots of Fun!!
content: I bought this as a Christmas present for my 26 year old brother and his 21 yr old girlfriend, and they love it!!  This is all they talk about now, and they play it so much their arms are soar.  I could not be happier with the quality of pleasure they are getting from this gift!!

author: D. D.
title: Wii Family Fun
content: These games get kids off the couch and they actually get some excerise. My husband and I like the bowling best but the grandchildren love all the games. It's worth every penny.

author: milo
title: wii is just "OK"
content:
i have had the wii for about 3 months now, i actually bought it for my son but secretly i wanted one so badly.
i really wish i had bought a playstation 3, a lot of the wii games are poor versions of ps3 and x box games.
i dont like the fact that you have to use the nunchuk and wiimote for games that would be so much easier to play with a standard controller - like i was really looking forward to playing call of duty, but its impossible with the wiimote and nuchuk, you end up trying your hardest just to keep your hand still so you can move properly, there is no option for a classic controller which you could rest on your knee for more control, a lot of the games are like this.
i really really dont recommend the wii if you are a hardcore gamer, you will be dissapointed.
on the other hand wii fit is very good, also Dance revolution is great fun, rock band 2 is immense, but i really would not buy a wii again just for wii fit.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The unit was extremely dirty; the remote does not work
content: The unit was extremely dirty; the remote does not work; and the game sleeve was missing game - the only positive was the fact the game console worked ; very disappointed

author: Bubbalicious
title: IF YOU ARE A TRUE GAME THIS IS FOR YOU!
content:
First off, let me say that I own all three next gen systems. And even though I hate to admit it, I think the Nintendo Wii is the best of the three. Why you may ask? It's simple. Games are supposed to be about having fun. When the Atari 2600 came out in the 80s the graphics really werent that great, but the games were a lot of fun. I place the Wii in that same category. This is really a lot of fun! Not to mention you can download all of those Atari games we all you use to love.

Nintendo is really on to a good thing when they created the motion sensored contoller too! I believe that both Microsoft and Sony will copy this genius idea. So, if you like to have fun when playing video games and just dont stare at the graphics like an ape, then I would say the Wii is for you.

author: Jeffrey
title: I bought it for wii boxing and smash bros.
content: I bought it for wii boxing and smash bros. didn't come with wii sports but at least it works fine

author: Thomas Petite
title: Great
content: We were able to get the Wii this holiday season. It is extremely easy to set up and in minutes you are playing. Unlike other console games you and your children will be off the couch and moving. The Wii Sports game which comes with the Wii is very good. It provides fun for all and shows off the Wiimote capabilities. The tennis & boxing games in particular gets your heart pumping. The graphics are not what you would find in xbox or ps3 but the interactive capabilities and game play far out weigh any perceived graphics deficiencies. My daughters love the Wii and finally if they are going to be playing a game system at least this one gets them up and moving. I highly recommend this system.

author: Aaron M Cotton
title: Five Stars
content: Great source of entertainment.

author: Arun B. Nayar
title: A Fun Toy for the casual gamer
content: I bought the wii from Amazon in January 2007. I sold it on Ebay in July 2008. But that does not mean the wii is bad. I am what you could call a hardcore gamer. For me hidef graphics and sound, strong gameplay mechanics and deep plotlines are key factors in enjoying a game. Also I prefer to play my games alone, without interference from family or friends!!! So I guess I am not the target demographic for this console. I did however enjoy a few games that managed to hold my attention for more than a few hours. First was Super Paper Mario and the next was Metroid Prime 3. Once I finished those two though, the motivation to continue owning a wii vanished.  I wish Nintendo would use all the profits they made with the wii to design a truly next gen console that will please both hardcore and casual gamers alike.

author: MRW
title: Hear it from me, buy a Wii!
content:
I have owned 6 different gaming consoles.  All of the Nintendo's and the Playstations.  The Wii beats them all!  The assortment of games offered are amazing and the get up off the couch playing is totally a plus.  Though don't over do it...my arms were killing me after the first night.  The Wii is easy to set up and understand.  The controller took a few tries to get use to (never played with a wireless).
My husband and I play everyday and we even have Wii date nights.  If you are buying for children (especially if you have couch potatoes) the Wii is it.  There are plenty of kid friendly games to choose from plus most of the games are fun for adults.  I know because I bought some for myself.  The price is good and you wont be a lump on the couch.

author: Gene
title: Five Stars
content: ok

author: Melanie Edwards
title: the results are in. Nintendo Wii is the most inovative console to date
content:
the Nintendo Wii is the second of the seventh generation games and let me tell you all, it is so cool. after playing one at the local store, i can see why its changing the gmaeing world. for one, the controller is the best part. the wireless is amazing and so inovative. at first, its a little tricky and will feel weird but after about five minutes or so you will get the hang of it. the graphics arent the best like the Xbox or Ps3 but it still is superior to the Gamecube graphics. also, the channels are a nice addition, it can really make the console yours. i also love the backward compatitbilty, now i can play all my favorite Gamecube games unlike before. the best is the price, only 250? thats a plus in my book cause let me say i am not ready to shovel out nearly 800 dollars worth of money for the Ps3 and a game, forget it! also, some adivce, dont get the wireless for the Ps3 it is really clunky. also, i want to address all those people who are worrying and trying to get the console, lighten up! its only the first week, they are bound to be scarce. and have you checked the calender? Christmas is still a long way of, so more copies should be coming in. besides, you'll have a much better chance of getting the Wii then the Ps3 cause if you think your going to get that thing anytime soon, your crazy. do you know how back ordered that thing is? i keep on getting replies that it'll be shipped by...April or so. so overall, the Nintendo Wii is going to change the video game world. definently the thing to get.

P.S. the Zelda launch is also a neat addition.

author: Crystal Smith
title: Whole Family Loves It!
content: I bought the Wii for my family online after searching local stores only to find it SOLD OUT. Setup was easy and quick. We all love playing it. My husband and I are competitive and so being able to play against each other is great. Our 3.5 year old loves that he can play many of the games on the Wii Sports game and looks forward to doing his "wii fitness" every day (poor kid gets 80 years old every time, but hey he has fun!!) Overall, this was a smart, convenient, and family friendly product/package and we couldn't be happier. Thanks Nintendo and Amazon!

Well,he was wrong. This system is terrific for people like me, the casual gamer. I can hop on and play a game in a few minutes, then stop if I want/need to without feeling like I didn't finish something.

The controllers are very cool and everything works great!

author: PearlGirl
title: Wii Sport Clenched This Sale For Me!
content: I played my sister's console before I bought my own. I love bowling and tennis, and I get a good workout from the included disc. I also invested in Wii Fit to get started on my workout routine. I am not a gym rat, and this will give me the benefits of a gym in my own home. I think most of the games are overpriced, but I was able to get some good deals at Target. Overall, this is a good deal for the price. Setup is easy and ready to play within a few minutes. My teenaged nephew has Wii, XBox and Playstation. Wii is the one he plays with most often.

author: agentfrodo
title: It's great.
content:
Last November I had enough money to purchase either a Wii or a Xbox 360. I had tried to buy a 360 when it came out in 05 but was unable too. After breaking down different equipment and games I would want for each system the Wii was actually only about 50 cheaper. The two part controllers are a bit expensive and I wanted a memory card and component cables. You could really get away with a lot less if you're a casual gamer though.

  I decided to get the Wii because of the new way to play Madden, Legend of Zelda and Wii Sports. I'm so glad I did. Not only are the games that sold me the system awesome, it's something everyone can play.

  I've played Wii Sports with my Grandma, my father, my niece and nephew, and my wife. And all my Video game friends as well. It only takes a few seconds for anyone to pick up and play the Wii Sports games.
  Some of the Games are more complicated like Madden and Call of Duty. But the controls really draw you into the game and you feel more a part of it than you would if you played it with a regular controller.

  Nintendo still doesn't have very many mature games; there are games I would like to be playing on the 360 like Lost Planet, Dead Rising, and Gears of War. This is going to change soon as Scarface and Godfather are coming to the Wii. And the Wii Controller works well in FPS such as Red Steel and Call of Duty, so I expect more will be coming.

  Graphically the Wii will never match up against the 360 or PS3. Some people may be a bit disappointed that most of the games graphics don't seem noticeably improved over the Gamecube. But a few games like Need for Speed show the Wii has potential

  There is really no online yet like Xbox Live, and from the news reports it sounds like it will never be quite as great as Xbox Live anyway, because you'll only be able to play with people who gave you their friend code. Which you won't be able to trade on Wii online. You'll have to know the person someway else.

  All in all I'm very pleased with my decision to get the Wii. Madden, Call of Duty, Wii Sports, and Legend of Zelda are 4 of the best games out right now for any system. Rayman Raving Rabbids and Excite Trucks are two enjoyable games that I play often and with friends as well. I don't think Red Steel and Need for Speed are particularly good games but I keep finding myself coming back to play them.

  In addition the Nintendo Virtual Console lets you trade Wii Points for classic NES, SNES, Genesis, Turbo-grax, and N64 games. While there is only about 60 games out for it, the selection is much better then Xbox Live Arcade and about 3 more come out each week. I have about 10 classic games already, it's almost like having all those systems in the Wii.

  I would definitely recommend the Wii over the 360 or the Ps3 right now. Unless you're a big fan of the 360 exclusives or wanted a Blu-Ray player.

author: The Dude
title: FUN!
content:
Got this for the kids for Christmas.  I have three kids.  It's tremendous fun!  I like that the games are generally fairly active, and many are multiplayer.

The Wii Sports game that comes with it is quite fun.  I've rated the other games I bought separately.

My only complaints:
1.  Should support 720p or even 1080p video.  The graphics are somewhat out of date.
2.  If you have three kids, you can't just buy this.  You also have to buy extra controllers and other accessories to get the most of it.  The total package really adds up.

One upgrade I don't recommend getting is the Motion Plus.  I've had a lot of issues with those (as noted in my review of them).

author: Ashley Gardner
title: Compared prices and this was best deal around
content: Arrived intact and on time. Was a great deal and in excellent condition.

author: Sunny Sewing Honeybee
title: We're Having Fun with the Wii
content:
The Unit

This specific set (the main unit, one Wii remote, and _Wii Sports_) is enough to get you started, but really, it should be viewed as only partial. Because only a couple games can be played with multiple people and one Wii remote, it would be helpful if one more remote came with the unit. Check for prices and you will quickly see why! It's not really a complete system with only one remote. Most people will likely want at least two.

Disabilities and the Wii

Much has been said about the Wii being used in retirement homes with the elderly, as well as with the disabled. Due to health issues, our family has now been doing activities together that we haven't been able to do in years. However, playing most of the games in a sitting position is difficult, and people who lack motor skills will have a difficult time with some functions, such as pushing buttons at once or letting go of a button at the right time. Coordination is important, and this has proven a bit of a challenge at times. When used with a wheelchair, individuals may find they need to remove the chair's armrest, which may or may not be safe for certain users.

Wii Sports

_Wii Sports_ features five games: baseball, boxing, bowling, golf, and tennis. Game play is easy and mostly straightforwardly similar to real-life play of each game. The graphics on _Wii Sports_ are cute, but not what one might expect in a game today. The backgrounds are more impressive than the "Miis" (little personalized icons). The baseball game even removes the arms and legs of Miis!

Some of the "filler," especially in the baseball game, seems slow, and the filler can't always be skipped by pressing a button, and this grows frustrating at times. Instructions on how to play the games and what different on-screen icons mean is somewhat vague at times.

What I really enjoy is the fitness test, which can be taken daily. There are little mini practice games for each sport, such as batting practice. Once these are played, they are unlocked and show up at random in the fitness test. You can track your progress and improvement over time. This game also grows with you by saving your progress and giving you more difficult computer opponents as your skill level progresses.

Adding On

If you already have a Nintendo GameCube, you're in luck. Nintendo has made it so that much of what you have is likely compatible for play on the Wii--with the Wii operating as a GameCube of sorts. If you don't already have GameCube components, getting the Wii is also like getting a GameCube, though you will need to buy extra components to set it up as such (memory card, controllers, and games). Unfortunately, not much information is supplied by Nintendo on how this works, and it took research before I realized that the Wii remote could not double as a controller for GameCube games. On the positive side, people are getting rid of these items and they are selling for low used prices now.

At the time of this review, Nintendo has upgraded only the add-on units (such as the Wii controller and _Wii Fitness_) rather than the main unit, which is a welcome change from the way technology becomes obsolete the moment you purchase it.

Aside from games and accessories that can be added on, the Wii also has Internet connectivity that Nintendo is still (at the time of this writing) actively updating.

Overall, we have found the Wii to be a welcome unit in our home that has enabled us to have family time and lots of fun. I hope you enjoy it, too.

author: William D. Stinson
title: stibi
content: We have a Wii and when our children and grandchildren come to visit, they love to play it.  This is a perfect Christmas gift and the new price makes it all the better.  The shipping was fast and accurate and I love how Amazon allows tracking of the shipment. Thanks

content: We bought this system as a gift for someone who had never owned one. The system came with everything as promised, was clean, and worked great! Thanks

author: Angela S.
title: Five Stars
content: Perfect condition, kids love it!

author: D. Zberg
title: It's just something to do when there's nothing else going on
content:
The Wii for me:  I have had the Wii for about 2 months and I am not very impressed. I have not found a game for Wii that I can get lost in for hours or even a game that I really look forward to playing. Instead, it's more of a cure - or a band-aid - for boredom.

The truth about gameplay:  You cheat. Most everyone cheats. People don't hold the remote like a baseball bat or a golf club; they hold it with one hand and do half hearted swings. This has been the case with every game I've played thus far. Also, holding a remote or gun up to the screen is not something I can do for hours. Mario Kart is the only game that I can play with my arms on my lap.

The fitness aspect:  Using the Wii for fitness (I have Wii fit & EA Active) may work for seniors or pregnant women but for the vast majority, it's a joke. Run in place, move your arms around and balance on one leg etc...  If you are serious about getting in shape, don't count on the Wii to help you.

For get-togethers:  The Wii is fun with other people. If you have people over a lot or live in a dorm-like setting, the Wii could be a bonus but I don't remember going over to anyone's place specifically to play some Wii.

The people I have noticed that like the Wii:  Nintendo junkies, parents, younger kids, and people in dorms.

The people I have noticed that don't like the Wii:  Singles 18-35 that enjoy rated R movies and don't go to church.

The Wii is not horrible. It's not exactly fun either. It's just something to do when there's nothing else going on.

author: Amazon Customer
title: less cables
content: Less cables

author: none
title: He loved it, but not cannot play it because it ...
content: This item was a gift for my grandson.  He loved it, but not cannot play it because it sporadically stops working.  It may need a fan to cool it off, but I don't know for sure so I am writing this review just in case it is a problem with the one that I bought.

author: Oats400
title: It worked
content: It worked, kids love it.

author: LA
title: Finally get what all the excitement's about
content:
I am a middle-aged female who has been curious about the Wii for several years. I was finally able to purchase it at a very good price but still had my doubts. For one thing, I was worried about how much space it would take up. I HATE clutter, and I did not want a bunch of stuff sitting around. No problems here. The unit itself is very small, and the accessories can be neatly stored in the entertainment center. I also worried about the physical space I'd need since our family room is cozy. Yes, we've hit a couple things, but after readjusting we seem to be fine.

Oh, I was also worried about installation. Not a problem. It installed quickly and easily and began working seamlessly.

This unit came with the Wii sports package. We got the Wii about four days ago and have been playing with it for hours every day. It's a good workout too. Yes, I was a bit sore after playing the first day, but that just tells me I'm out of shape (already knew it) and need to keep playing to get in better shape.

In my opinion, the two best games are bowling and tennis. I found the boxing to be great for stress reduction, but it's much more taxing than the other games. Perhaps when I'm in better shape I'll find it more enjoyable. I haven't quite figured out how to do well in the baseball game, but again time will tell.

Bowling and tennis, however, are lots of fun and provide an excellent workout.

I am very pleased with this purchase. I feel strongly that I will be in much better shape in a year with the help of this game.

author: Great product
title: Wife and kids love it
content: Years of family fun

author: jane eyre
title: Great family fun
content: This is so much fun.  My children and I enjoy playing against each other and they love playing with their friends.  Definitely worth the purchase and let me add, AMAZON.COM is unbeatable with their quick shipping, great customer service and FREE SHIPPING.  I love Amazon.

author: AJMV

My kid ha been using it for long time and it instill working.
For sure Wii is an an unparalleled experience as a game player machine.
Will recommend this console to others. Much better thar the boy games.

author: Daisy G
title: Love the Wii!
content:
We love our Wii...
Easy to install, play, and great fun for the whole family.  Even my 4 year old can play and we all love it.

author: Bigheartaz
title: Five Stars
content: Just as described. Prompt service.

author: CallMeAl
title: Nintendo's Motion-Detecting Console
content:
I first tried out the Nintendo Wii in mid-2008--playing such games like Wii Sports and Wii Play. It wasn't until Christmas of that same year when I finally came to own a Wii. To be completely honest, I was very impressed with the Wii's ability to detect my movements simply with the flick of the Wii controller.

When I first looked at the console itself, I noticed it was extremely tiny compared to the Playstation 2 or the Xbox 360. At the same time, however, it is much heavier than it looks--as Nintendo made use of every single space they could find in this system.

I've always seemed like the kind of person who couldn't sit still while playing a game--and this system only quenches my thirst to move while playing games. Games like Super Mario Galaxy, Sonic Colors, and Godzilla Unleashed all require me to move my body in order to emerge victorious in the game.

While it is a pleasure to know that this console gives me the ability to interact with my games through movement, older Nintendo fans may be pleased to know that you can insert and play Nintendo GameCube games thanks to the Wii's backwards compatibility with its predecessor. All you need to do this is a GameCube controller, a memory card, and a GameCube game itself. For those of you who want to go even FURTHER into Nintendo's past, you have the option to hook up your Nintendo Wii to the Internet and go to the "Wii Shop", where you can buy many old games for the NES, Sega Genesis, Nintendo 64, and much more.

Overall the Nintendo Wii is a fantastic home console. Even though its day are numbered and it is about to be replaced by the more powerful Wii U, I cannot tell you how much fun I have had with this console.

author: jellylecious
title: Two Stars
content: lasted for 3 months...total reap off

author: Catherine C.
title: great game for physical activity
content: The Wii is a nice compliment to current video games as it incorporates actual physical movement into each game.  Most of my co-workers now own one after first playing the Wii at a holiday party at my house.  A bit pricy as are the many desirable accessories, but all in all, a good investment.

author: AmazonUser
title: Beware of the sunlight problem
content: My cousin has a Wii, and I visited her once and spent some time with the Wii.  One night, we played it, and it was pretty fun.  I didn't experience any problems with it that night.  Then the next afternoon, I tried to navigate the Wii menus, and the pointer on the screen moved around very erratically as I moved the controller around.  I wasn't sure why that was happening, as it didn't happen the previous night.  I tried to play some games, but it didn't work very well.  Then later at night, I tried it again, and the pointer was very smooth.  I did not see any of the jerky/erratic movement that I saw during the day.  Turns out the problem was due to sunlight coming into the house during the afternoon.  My cousin has her TV set up against a wall that has some windows and a glass sliding door, so a lot of sunlight was coming in directly at me and the Wii controller.  That screws up the Wii sensors.  I did a search on the internet for "wii" and "sunlight" and other people have the same problem.  Although the Wii is pretty fun (at night), I will wait for Nintendo to fix this problem in the next version of the Wii before I buy it.

author: Schadstoffsöldner
title: Nothing good after the n64 era
content: Very few Wii games are good. If you look at the statistics, the vast majority of Wii games are in fact of very poor standard. The only bearable titles are Mario, Zelda, and Metroid. The only game I was addicted to was Mario Kart Wii. Also, the system doesn't support DVD moves. The hardware is also very weak; I'd be surprised if it is even 10% better than the GCN. The controllers use AA batteries and you can't charge them by connecting them to the system.

author: Wayne
title: Addiction
content: Since getting the Wii Sports hooked up I have become addicted to the vrious games, arms been sore nightly, hoping to get past this phase of soreness as I continue to play... Awesome game, highly recommended. Also I enjoy being entertained by the wife on the Wii Fit!!!

author: Jose Luis Garza Lizano
title: Great fun, but it leaves a "what if.." flavor in your mouth.
content:
In my opinion, the Wii is great fun as a gaming video console or as an entertainment device to have in every family's living room; for casual players (the kind that don't usually play videogames) it's a great first-entry into the new standard in videogame interactivity; the big "but" is regarding to all of us who've been gaming for the last 10 yearas (a.k.a. "the hardcore gamers"); as one, I can tell you that you'll find a good selection of games in the Wii's gallery, but not with the depth or quantity of any of the previous generation of consoles; as such, it looks that most of the games the Wii is getting right now are focused more on this "casual" new market, and the games more traditionally aimed (or "hardcore") are being developed for other systems (PS3 or Xbox 360); in addition to this, Wii doesn't support HD graphics, which isn't all that important, but when you're playing Zelda: Twilight Princess or Metroid Prime 3: Corruption, and you also have any of the other two consoles, it's difficult not to wonder how would it look if the Wii had all that other technology (even if the gameplay is truly revolutionary).

In a nutshell: the fun is top-notch; the games are still to arrive (as of october 2007)

author: Natasha Romanoff
title: Great for the family
content:
Although, the Wii isn't high def on graphics per say, like PS3 and Xbox360, is so unlike the other systems because it's just good for bringing the family together to have some fantasic fun.  Wii Sports (the disc included) has tennis, golf, bowling, baseball, and boxing...all played interactively. No more couch potato video game systems!

The Wii can even pick your internet connection wirelessly if you have a router. This allows you to surf the net and connect WiiConnect24.  The Wii is inexpensive compared to the PS3 and Xbox360, but it worth so much more when it comes to bringing your family together to play and getting your body into some physical movement!

author: Carm
title: Wii Well Worth It
content: I just received my Wii and I don't think I'll be sorry.  I Love It. To begin with it was easy to set up and it had all kinds of great programs.  My only problem was being unable to control the  Wii Remote, but I don't think it will take too much time to master it.  I work out 5 days a week at a gym, and sometimes my form is not that great, but I'm sure in no time using the Wii will help me.  I say, GET THE Wii.  YOU WON'T BE SORRY.

author: D. Flanagan
title: console.

author: rogivens
title: Needed another wii after old one shorted out.
content: Works great. I didn't want to pay for a brand new one but this one might as well been new. The kids are back to having fun. Thanks

author: K. Yagi

content:
I'm usually quickly bored by video games, but I played straight for hours.

I highly recommend getting this.  It's worth the $250.  It'll also give you a workout without you knowing.

author: Kaen
title: Five Stars
content: Have a grreat time with the Wii with my adult friends

author: Looney 2
title: Wow! Great product!
content: Wow, what fun!  It's great to see a product that's so well designed. My 10 year old son is now in love with the Lego Star Wars Game, which has turned into a love for the Star War movies.

author: KarthikN
title: Just as good as a Video Game Console can get
content:
Amazing!!! is the only word for it. The guy who invented this is an absolute genius. None of us in our family are Video Game freaks. But this thing got us addicted and is so well designed and intuitive that you want to keep playing it.

It would have been nice if they provided HD abilities in this so you would not be looking at an alternate gaming device considering the latest advancements in technology. Nevertheless, the other consoles like PS3 and XBOX are no match to this.

author: P. Zimmer
title: What's not to love!  WII and Amazon are a great team.
content:
My husband and I are in our 60's and were introduced to the WII at our daughter's and son-in-law's this past Christmas.  We really had fun playing the games and working with WII-FIT, so that's what I wanted for my 60th birthday in February.  We're still have a great time and amazed at how much exercise it can be.

I kept looking until I could find it at the price I wanted.  Same for the WII Fit, but it took a little longer to find it at a retail price.  Even with the free shipping, I had WII Fit in two days - amazing!

author: SVPMARTIN2
title: AWESOME PRODUCT-AND SELLER
content: My family and I are able to enjoy the games and play them as a family . It's a great product-and the entertainment lasts a long time. The seller was very precise and easy to work with.

author: Angie
title: One Star
content: it didn't come with a cord!!

author: Daniel
title: Overall, Fun for All Ages
content: As a big sports fan, I figured I'd give this console a shot over the more expensive XBOX 360 and PS3.  However, I found I enjoyed several Mario games, than many of the sports titles.  The Tiger Woods golf games are probably the best sports games on the Wii Console, but for whatever reason, it gets old playing it over time.  It is also disappointing that the best tennis game on the Wii is on Wii Sports.  The Mario games that I've played are terrific though.  From Super Mario Galaxy to Super Mario Bros., Mario games will keep you entertained for hours.  If you need a break from that, the Wii Sports or Wii Sports Resort is a lot of fun, especially when playing with at least one other person.  Overall, I would say I have a great deal of fun with the Wii, just some games, like on any system will be a little repetitive over time.

author: Edward
title: Wii!!!
content: Love the Wii.  Seems more family-friendly than others and has the types of games I enjoy.  Would not give it up without a fight.

author: Billie S. Nenninger
title: Five Stars
content: Good product

author: Perplexy
title: Almost... wait for wii2
content:
This is a great system.  I have owned it for a couple years now.  The controllers have never had a problem (and they have been through considerable abuse).  My only reason for giving it a 4/5 is that it isn't HD.  Come on! they should have at least given consumers the option to have true HD picture quality.  As an older gamer (over 21...) I have been spoiled by the graphics of PC and Xbox 360 games.  The Wii is not just slightly worse either.  There are times I have trouble reading the numbers or letters on the screen because of the low resolution.  It drives me crazy!  It is particularly irritating because everything else about it is so awesome!  The menus are intuitive and the controllers are an epic step forward for gaming.
I own both the Xbox 360 and the Wii.  I have played several games for both systems (simpsons, call of duty, need for speed) and in all three instances I prefer the Xbox versions of the games.  I can honestly say it is much more fun to play the Wii games because of the level of interactivity, but all of the games are much 'lighter' adaptations for the Wii.  Since the Wii doesn't read discs with as much information on them, the games end up resembling the Xbox versions, but with many extras trimmed off.  By this I mean story lines are gone, options are absent, and the levels/worlds/stages are always lacking details.

Bottom line:
Wii is great for simple games (brain age, wii sports, etc. but if you are into games like forza, call of duty, etc. you best stick with another console.

author: Ash2000
title: Fun, Fun, Fun for the family!
content:
So far, all the game consoles we have got for my 13 year old has been just for him. Even with some urging from him, I would find it hard to get involved in the games. Not so with the Wii. We got this just ahead of the Memorial weekend and throughout the weekend, we NEVER switched on the TV for watching some show. All of us - myself, my not-at-all-techie-wife and son - got hooked.

The technology behind the Wii is just amazing. It is incredible how swinging the remote in space can be sensed correctly by the system in determining whether you made a jab or a punch or a forehand or a backhand -you get the point. This is like bringing high quality simulation to the family room. In the near future, we will soon have training games that make a person better at say, golf or any other game.

It seems that the Wii sports package that come as part of the original purchase is all that we need right now. The games - Bowling, Baseball, Tennis, Golf and Boxing - are all high quality fun. I never thought I will try Boxing, but it is the game I, as well as my wife, have enjoyed most. What's more, is it gets your arms swinging quite a bit and at the end of the day, you will end up with quite a sore arm (which is good anyway). Yes, the Wii is something you have to get up and play! Don't think you can get your daily dose of workout here, but it is better than playing a video game sitting. One fun part of the Wii sports package is the Fitness challenge. I came up rated at an age 80 :( On my defense, this has got more to do with the skill/technique required than physical abilities).

One thing that other gaming consoles boast about is higher definition (better than 480pi). But, the other dimension that the Wii provides - involvement physically - far exceeds this drawback. So far, we have just tried the Wii Sports that come with the base package. The graphics is fun and I haven't found a need to appreciate more than it is.

If you have a wall mounted TV or are planning to get one, then you will see quite a few wires that need to come of the TV. These aren't an eye-sore, but if all other wires are hidden, you may want to plan for wires-behind-the-wall.

I really haven't found something to complain about. The remote comes with a strap now that secures it to the hand and keep it from flying off and hitting nearby objects or the TV. If there can be some improvement, then built in storage to hold many games would be an advantage as one doesn't need to keep popping in and out DVDs.

Lots of fun in store for the family in this gaming system! With the summer coming up, you will have a little less to complain about your child's time with video games. Video games are better this way due to physical involvment and this can be a starting point.

author: Chase7777
title: Three Stars
content: Thank you!

author: Glenn-bo
title: It's OK, BUT!!!
content: It's fine.  I'm just disappointed that I cannot just replace the one part that failed and I had to purchase the whole d____ system even though I had sthe rest.  Now I have duplicate items for which I have no use!

author: Chanda J. Rojas
title: More amazing than I ever expected!
content: The reason I bought this was for the Wii fit, I have not owned a video game since Atari. I am hooked! Everyone in my family is using it from my 2 year old to my 68 year old mother. I love the excercise, having it hooked to my wireless network and getting news. I can definitely say all the hype is well deserved.

author: Ken Fontenot
title: Family Friendly Console That Gets Everybody Moving
content:
I've been playing with the Nintendo Wii console for over a year now thanks to some friends of mine who have one.  We got one for Christmas this year and finally decided to write a review of it.

Simply put, the Nintendo Wii does things that no gaming console has ever done before.  It gets the entire family (and their bodies) in motion.  The included "Sports" game is, as many others have stated, a very basic game, but it is very fun.  Tennis, Bowling, Baseball, Boxing and Golf are all offered on the game, and each of them requires some level of mobility from the player.  In tennis you actually swing the racket.  In bowling you actually bowl the ball (and can put a little English on it, too).  Baseball allows you to pitch and bat, and you can alter the direction of both with how you move the Wii controller (or by pressing buttons during delivery).  The golf game can be just as aggravating as the real thing, and you must vary the strength of your swing to get a good shot.  There are also fitness and training options on the game that can give you your "Wii" age.

The most strenuous (and most fun) game on the "Sports" disc has to be boxing.  You literally have to bob, weave and juke your way around the ring in order to avoid getting hit by your opponent.  As with the other games, your level of skill increases with each match you compete in, win or lose.  The Sweet Science has never been much sweeter in a video game such as this one.

Setting up the console was simple.  Simply follow the instructions and you'll be fine.

Once you've got the console set up, you can then begin to personalize it.  You maneuver through the Wii's menu options via "channels."  There's the game channel, which plays games (including GameCube games), as well as the Mii Channel, a weather, news, photo and internet channel.  While I have only used the Mii and Game channel, I have had friends tell me that the other channels work very well once they are hooked to your internet connection.

The Mii channel is almost a game in itself.  On this channel, you create your individual character that can be used in some Wii games.  After creating your character, you are given the option to let it "mingle" in a room with other created characters.  Some of these characters will show up as your ally or opponent in games, adding to the "personalization" of the game.

As stated before, having to move around makes this console that much more fun.  It gives you a little bit of exercise without making you feel like you're "working out."

Highly personalized, easy to set up and very family friendly thanks to a large number of games that require multiple players to get up and move, the Wii will be a hit in any home.  Highly recommended.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Please and satisfied
content:
I got my Wii as a gift for my Birthday, you can imaging I was so eagar to start using it. Impress as how fast my order it was expedited and well packaged damage free; I inmediatedly open it up, read just the basics instructions, I had it up and running in about 10 Minutes. I am not a computer whiz so I was please with the simplicity to set it up, any one can do it.  I absolutely recomend this product. I am having great time wether by my self or with some friends, It can bring a lots of fun for the whole family. I love the fact that you can read the news, browse the Internet, with some limitacions- without connecting your computer to your TV. I have only one complain or regret that I cannot stream my pictures as slide show from my computer, only from a SD Card. Given that you have a broadband Internet Service, I do.  Will I buy again or recommend Amazon?, Absolutely, I already order some extra remotes and got them too. Thanks Amazon.  Edgar

Nintendo Wii 6 in 1 Charging / Docking Station with Console Stand & Cooling Fan, Double Remote Charging Dock, and includes 2 External Rechargable Battery PacksWii

author: Moose1
title: Fun and a half
content: My children & grandchildren have had a Wii for several years. Finally decided to get one for my home. Wii is fun for whole family, especially when nothing on TV or no "good" movies on. ( Kids are better at this than I am). Lots of activities (games) that contain no "shoot-em-up" stuff, unless you want that. Got a great deal, brings family members together, what more can you ask for?

author: Michael Griffo
title: Too Much Fun!
content:
I bought the Wii for my children for a Christmas gift.  Now they are having a hard time playing it because I am on every spare minute I have and I even find myself making time to play it.  Between myself and my children we have had all of the Nintendo systems, Sega, Play Station 1-2-PSP, Nintendo Game Boy-Color, SP, DS Lite.  The Nintendo Wii is a blast to play the wireless remotes work well, it has the option to use wired remotes either classic Wii (sold seperatly) or it is compatible with Game Cube remotes.  I did buy the Nintendo USB Wireless internet connection.  I have a Westell VersaLink router modem for my computers internet connection.  I tried to use the wireless internet option with the Wii and the modem but I kept having problems with the setup(probably my inexperience with wireless networking) so I bought the USB adapter for the DS and Wii.  It was easy to set up (you will need a dsl or broadband internet connection and Windows XP)and I have not had a problem with the connection since I set it up.  I rated the Wii 4 out of 5 stars because of the graphics or lack of.  The X-Box, PlayStation 2 and 3, PSP, are much better with the graphics.  But to be honest I just love the Wii.  I have played 9 different games and just bought four more.  My kids are having so much fun getting up and interacting with the games.  They are not just sitting on the couch pushing buttons.

If you are going to buy a Wii system the only accessories I would recommend are an extra wireless remote and an extra nunchuk controller.  You do get one of each with the system and some games you can use one controller for two or more players.  Also if you do not have a wireless modem the USB Nintendo internet connction is easy to set up.  Some people say that there are cheaper USB adapters but the Nintendo USB Adapter($34.95) comes with a disc that you put in the computer follow the steps and you are connected to the internet via the Wii.  Another advantage of the wireless connection is that Nintendo has made some of its most popular games from Nintendo, NES, Sega, etc for download to the Wii memory.  You can buy Wii points either through the Wii connection with a credit card or a Nintendo Wii Points Card from stores that sell game systems.  I bought 3000 Wii points for $30 through my Wii connection.  I bought Super Mario Bros for 500 points.  The first Mario Bros is 500 points, Donkey Kong is 600 points, and more.  It's a blast from the past.  My son has a Nintendo Game Cube, we can play the games he has in the Wii also.

There are alot of accessories becoming available for the Wii.  To set up the system most are not necessary.  The system comes with a stand, built in memory, sensor bar for wireless remotes, one wireless remote, one wireless nunchuk, a/v cables, power adapter, 5 game sample disc.  Memory cards are only for saving Game Cube game information, Wii game info is stored on the Wii memory.

I usually do not leave detailed reviews like this one, but the game is so much fun to play. Also I had so many questions about what I needed to set it up. I hope this review helps you.

author: B Harris
title: Wii oui
content: This was a real find.  Bought it just after Thanksgiving when they were very scarce and overpriced.  Reasonable price in light of where they ended up before Christmas.

author: Bogdan Nagle
title: Five Stars

author: Laurie
title: Five Stars
content: thanks for saving the day!

author: Graham W. Burns
title: Great system for non-gamers
content: As members of the 50+ generation, we are not hard-core gamers. The Wii offers an alternate way to spend a pleasant evening or afternoon that even our children seem to enjoy with us...and that is rare. An evening of bowling or golf provides an alternative to our usual couch potato tendencies. It's not only fun...it's better for us.

author: FoodandtheFury
title: how to win favorite aunt award
content:
My nieces and nephews apparently love theirs. So do their parents...who use it to stream netflix, etc.

I bought these for xmas for my nieces and nephews last christmas. Games for follow on bday and xmas gifts. Everyone wins.

When they first opened them my nephew (only 3) did not know what it was and tried to barter it for "a real toy". Now it appears, he's very pleased with it...

author: IResQK9sNKy
title: Love The Wii!
content: We love our Wii! This game system is the bomb! SO many games you can play, so physically interactive, unlike anything I've encountered before, I SO recommend this!! LOVE IT!!!

author: Ccb
title: Wii love it!!!
content: Keeping up with the joneses' has not been fun in a long time, but buying the Nintendo Wii has been a blast.  Sure the games are a bit pricey, but the Virtual Console option gives people in our age range the option to buy the games we played from "back in the day", and still get schooled on all the latest crazes.  The remotes are a little time consuming, but once you have the hang of it, it is so much fun.  I suggest buying a classic controller, even though the button configuration is not totally the same when playing a classic like Super Mario Bros.  I also purchased a gamecube controller, and use it more, so i guess it is a personal preference choice.

author: smurf77
title: Just a party console
content:
This console has a lot of potential.  But, Nintendo chose to focus on the casual/party gamer rather than on people who like to play detailed/challenging games.  It's a smart move because people quickly get bored with unchallenging games and buy new ones as a result.  This means more $ for Nintendo.  After having a Wii for almost 1 year, I've only kept one game that I've bought.  After learning my lesson, I'll never buy a game before renting it first.

I don't mean to sound too negative because that one game I kept is probably my favorite game of all time and the motion controls are better than just clicking buttons and moving a joystick.  But, things could be better.  For example, one of the strengths of the console is the online play because it's much more fun to play against another person than it is to play against the computer.  Unfortunately, the online play is being destroyed by hackers who either cheat to win or just do it to make sure everybody else is miserable.  Nintendo can do something about it and has temporarily punished the Mario Kart hackers a few times.  However, after a few days, those people are back online and still hacking.  So, I give the Wii 5 stars for innovativeness and 1 or 2 stars for games and online play.

author: KILEY PINDER
title: Five Stars
content: happy,happy,happy thanks alot!

author: Christopher S. Davis
title: Great Console, Lousy Games
content:
The Nintendo Wii, which was released back in 2006, is a fun and unique gaming console. It is much like other video game systems in that you just need a TV and a power outlet to hook it up and play. What sets this console apart from the others, however, is the motion sensing controller (aka wii remote or wiimote). Along with the controller, the Nintendo Wii is also relatively cheap. Actually, this is not entire true as throughout its history, the Wii has been in short supply. This means that finding one may cost you more than Nintendo wants retailers to charge (sometimes a lot more).

As said before, the biggest thing the Wii has going for it is the controller. The wii remote has all kinds of fancy parts which allows people to control some games, simply through movement. A good example of a game like this is actually the one that comes with the console: "Wii Sports". It's fun, simple, entertaining and is a great example of what the wii remote can do.

Wii Sports is a decent game and most people will enjoy it, however, the fact that it is the most well known game on the system is a bad sign. Actually it's more than a sign and there is a reason the system does not have many well known games which is simply because it has hardly any half decent games at all! It doesn't matter if you are into action games, sports games, puzzle games, role playing games, racing games, simulation type games, strategy games, fighting games, adventure games, or even educational games; the Wii just does not have a good software selection.

The lack of any good games is a huge problem for the Wii. Untill the Wii can get some good software it is just barely worth buying at this point. There's potential here, but that is all, just potential.

Pros:

- The size of the console itself is very small and is nice to look at.
- The innovative controller can be fun and simple to use.
- In theory the system is cheap.
- Wii Sports is a great party game.

Cons:

- Wii Remotes are expensive. ($40 for the remote and 20$ for the nun chuck. Since you will need 3 more of each to play four player games, this will add up quickly.
- Nintendo has not kept up with demand, thus causing market prices to increase.
- The number of good games can be counted on one hand, and of those games many may not even be the type that you like.

*EDIT 7/11/09*

Nintendo, thankfully has gotten a good number of wiis in stores (finally) so finding one is no longer difficult. Prices are now going to be consistent which is great for any potential buyer. Seriously, if cost was a problem before it shouldn't be anymore since you will no longer be paying more than MSRP.

That said, there is one new problem that I found which wasn't mentioned in the original review; that being the battery life of the wii remotes. It seems like I'm replacing those two AA batteries very often. I'm gonna give a ballpark estimate of about 30 hours of use but don't take that number too seriously. Also, they seem to drain even when not in us, though at a MUCH slower rate.

I still think the wii is a wonderful piece of hardware that Nintendo did a fantastic job creating. However, I also still think the system has way too few good games on it.

author: M. Peters
title: Wii best Console ever
content: In my opinion this is the best gaming console. The best feature is being interactive. I only play the interactive games. You actually get tired and workout different muscles based on the game. I guess users who don't like being active prefer games that challenges your finger skills and coordination. Great product the entire family can enjoy that is no overly complicated.

author: MoonLightOnWater
title: Great buy
content: Wanted an affordabe, gently used Wii console to go with my new Wii Fit...very pleased with my purchase. Great quality and value.  Will purchase a used product again.

author: J. B. Blackburn
title: pseudo exercise discovery
content: Looked for a long time for anything that would get my husband on his feet and moving that was not called exercise.  He has PPS and even walking is painful.  He can stand as long as he can then sit in a chair and play all of the games in the Wii sports package and be moving more than he has in some time and have fun doing it.

author: R. Michalski
title: Great Console!
content: What else can I say about this console that hasn't been said already?  I love how fun this system is, it is much more immersive than any other home console I've played.  The controls help to make games feel more realistic than the typical button mashing that I've been used to doing.  Graphically it is a minor step up from the previous generation, which doesn't bother me too much because of the fun I have with the system and I own a Xbox 360 so I have my High Def gaming along with the Wii.  I just recently hooked my Wii up to my new HDTV and to me it has made an improvement on the picture, just not a great improvement like you'll see with a PS3 or Xbox 360 unfortunately.  I also like how Nintendo has set up the Virtual Console so I can play my old favorites like Super Mario Bros and other classical games.  And it's $250 bucks, can't beat a very good and unique console at that price.  The reason I gave it a 4 for overall is that at some point I like to play some High Def games, but as far as fun is concerned it is a definite 5 for me.

author: PDoak
title: I love nintendo products but this one is the best
content:
The wii is innovative, amazing outstanding and fantastic.

I am amazed every time i play it about how clever the Nintendo creators have made it.

If you want a games console then the wii is the one for you. Nintendo dont compete with real life reality like war games or anything like that they understand people play computer games to have fun...and so the worlds they create can be fun! Like Mario kart and wii sports.

I have been playing it for days and see no sign of getting sick of it.

author: miguel velazco
title: Five Stars

author: Amazon Customer
title: Fun for the family
content: This is a gaming system which is fun for the whole family. Even adults who don't usually get into playing video games will enjoy this. Playing Wii Sports is easy and enjoyable. The kids also got Wario Ware and plan to get Zelda. Internet browsing on a computer is much better than on the Wii, but it's a nice option to have for just casual browsing when you're not near a pc. You probably need to get at least one extra Wii remote and you definitely need to buy extra batteries. We got NIMH rechargeables. I liked buying from Amazon as they are a trusted seller and delivery was within a reasonable time frame. I didn't have to wait in a long line!

author: L. Lee
title: WORKS GREAT! BROUGHT IT BRAND NEW!
content: I've had this wii going on almost 2 years now and it still works great. I received my wii even earlier than expected. I brought this gaming system for my 5 year old but the games seemed a little to complicated for her to play on her own so I then brought her a nintendo ds. She hasn't played with the wii since. So if you are looking for something that has more kid friendly games the NINTENDO DS is definitely the way to go. She plays it almost everday. Its great for drive time or keeping her busy at home. And they also have great educational games for young kids. But I will say that the wii has been great fun time with friends and family at home.

author: Rayzor Ramoan
title: One of the most popular nintendo systems to bad about the shovelware
content: I would have liked to give it a 4.5 review for the amount of shovel ware and lack of games that were released on the system. Say what you want about Nintendo they always find a way to innovate and this system was a massive blockbuster at the time. There were some really great titles on this system like Super Mario Galaxy 1 & 2, Donkey Kong Country returns, Metroid Prime 3 Corruption, to games to appeal to the masses Wii Sports & Wii fit to underrated gems that deserve more praise and admiration like Sin & Punishment and Mad World (my personal favourite on the system). Also these were built to last I bought a PS3 in 2009 it conked out in me in 2013 I had to get a new one, I brought my Wii in 2007 and it still works!

author: Stephen Brooks
