content:
I am not a gamer, nor any one in my family. I didn't think about buying either PS3 or Wii when everybody was talking about until I saw the Wii ADs.

I like the idea and finally I got my own.

I love it since the first minute I played it. Since then, all my families and friends who visited my place love it. I have no idea about the other systems but I really enjoy my Wii.

author: Karen A. Walker
title: Unhappy camper
content: I was very disappointed when my son opened his present and set it up and it didn't work. Nothing the manual suggested we do worked. It has been resolved(by calling the Wii company) but he had to wait more than a week to play it.

author: Mark Norris
title: best system ive ever played!!
content:
i havent met anyone yet that hasnt enjoyed playing the wii, my 45yo dad even likes it and he didnt even like the playstation(1,2,or3) nor did he care for any of the xbox's. so it really can appeal to all ages no matter what background.
after the 1st two nights of playing the baseball game that comes with it my muscles were sore and it felt as if i had been working out for a week. this is not to say a lot of the games are a workout you can sit down for quite a few, somewhat defeating the purpose behind the system. the ability to buy the wii points through the system is a great idea ensuring you dont have to run to the store if you want to get a classic game.
for the most part a lot of classic games are on the and they keep adding new ones everyday. ive downloaded supermario bros3 and it only took about 5 minutes to download and it works perfectly, you can even use the start-select trick.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Three Stars
content: did not come with the stand

author: Mariam
title: Five Stars
content: Works great!

author: N. Stephens
title: Wii!
content: Love the Wii too bad Star Wars Force Unleashed was over in few days Star Wars: The Force Unleashedthe game is way too easy. Alright back to getting Wii fit!

author: Sara Mowery
title: great
content: great price and it works lovely. I've had it for a couple years and I haven't had a problem with the wii itself.

author: Janz
title: Five Stars
content: My grandson loves it.

author: Victoria
title: Five Stars
content: We love the wii! It's so much fun even just now getting one

author: Derek. E
title: Wii Rock!
content: Love this little system and it's so cheap!

author: K. Bailey
title: Greatest Console Ever Made!
content:
The title says it all. Nintendo has done what other console makers could never do. Make a system that appeals to everyone. And I do mean EVERYONE! Whether you're an advanced gamer, a novice gamer, a mother, a father, a grandparent, kids, whoever! Doesnt matter if you have been playing for years or never have played in your entire life. YOU WILL WANT TO PLAY THIS!

My wife has been playing the new Zelda & Wii Sports games for like 4 days straight! And she NEVER used to play games. She loves the motion sensing controls of the system & says its easier to learn because it feels more natural than just mashing a bunch of buttons on some huge brick of a controller like the other guys (Sony & MS) have. And its totally affordable too, so its a GREAT deal for what all you get with the system. The graphics aren't quite as good as the PS3 or Xbox 360, but they are still great & will still knock your socks off. Be sure to get the component cables for even better looking graphics too!

Mark this on your calendars folks. Its the time in history when Nintendo took gaming to the next level. Bravo!

author: Kamar A. Henry
title: Wii
content:
The Wii is fabulous ! ! It allows you to play as if you're playing the real games  - expect that you're playing the games at home !!!

  KIRK ANDERSON

author: Jerry A. Covey
title: Wii comments 1/08
content: We purchased our Wii in late Nov 07.  We played games with our whole family and everyone thought it was great.  The best thing is that it gets you up so that you're more active physically with many of the games.  We would recommend it to anyone in any age group.

author: astrologys Flame
title: Nintendo WII
content: I love my Nintendo Wii.  We couldn't find one anywhere until we decided to look on Amazon.  There were several for sale!  The first time fell through because they were out-of-stock, but Amazon let us know of another vendor who had them. Thank you Amazon!  I use the sports application, especially the bowling game.

author: Shauna Mcclure
title: Fun for every age!
content:
My husband and I have had so much fun with this console. We are video game addicts and currently have everything from the original NES to the Wii. I have to say, Nintendo really hit it on the head with this one!

I have boxed with with mother-in-law, played tennis with my dad and went bowling with my friends. And while I wouldn't recommend this for a strenous aerobic workout, it certainly gets you and and moving. There was a little bit of a learning curve only because the controllers are unlike any other game controllers from consoles past. In reality, both my parents and in-laws (who are far removed from the gaming "culture") picked it up very quickly and had an enjoyable time.

As new games come on the market, the wide-range of capabilities because more realized as seen in the myriad of "poses" in Wario Ware: Smooth Moves. Using the contollers for games such as The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess bring an entirely new dimension to adventure games.

Overall, the Wii is an incredibly innovative and fun. It has a relatively low price tag and I would highly recommend it to gamers and non-gamers of any age!

author: Kira
title: Controller Doesn't Work
content: This arrived as described.  It seemed to be in pretty good condition but when I hooked it up the controller didn't work.  It's really disappointing since now I can't use, or even test, the console to see if it works.  I've had to purchase another controller which costs about half what I paid for the entire system.

author: A. Thompson
title: Wii are big fans!
content: This game is awesome!  Titles available for both kids and adults, and for both single players and groups.  Wii Sports really exhibits what the console and new controller technology can do.  I would recommend this game to anyone.

author: Taylor79
title: Defective power chord, Otherwise great!
content: I bought this item from a used seller and the only thing I really have to complain about was the power chord was defective when I received it, which is a inexpensive part to buy so I really will not complain too much. Was shipped in a quick timely matter!

author: Kanimime
title: Wii has promise
content:
For 250 dollars, this system is worth it.

More importantly, if you are thinking about buying one, the most promising aspect of this system is the potential for group gaming. The controllers, like Nintendo advertised, offers a lot of fun for gamers and people who have never touched a video game before--this aspect beats out the other two, more powerful systems. For the most part the controllers are strong.

Now sure there are games out there that are worth playing by yourself such as Zelda, but I think the biggest grab this system has is the ability to make gaming fun for everyone.

This system has the promise of being the number 2 system because of its price and its ability to be played by almost anyone.

The one lacking point is the graphics. Sure, this may only be a minor aspect for some gamers but I argue the shelf life on this system may only run for about 6 years, while other systems such as Playstation 3 have a lot more time due to people lacking the current top of the line technology that the other systems offer, ex. blue-ray HDTV etc.

Recommended as a system for group gaming, fans of Nintendo games, and for serious gamers as a second system.

author: KimberlyA
title: Replace in 6 Months: Ridiculous, Even for a Used System
content: Okay. We bought this because the seller was well-rated and a new WII was not in our budget. We probably should have just bit the bullet and bought it new with a warranty. First, the system came set in Spanish. This we found quite amusing, and with minimal detective work, we had the language set to English. No big deal. Life went on fine, until last week, when the WII suddenly stopped reading discs properly. It completely freezes with an error reading, and has to be unplugged to even get it to return to the main screen. We have tried cleaning the discs, and attempted to use several different games, all to the same end...a black error screen. Now I realize it is a refurb, but any system that has been professionally repaired and cleaned should last longer than that. Very irritated that we wasted the money on this.

author: Mark Potochnik
title: Five Stars
content: She uses it.....

author: GameraRocks
title: Extremely Over-Hyped
content:
The best thing that happened to me this year was actually finding a Wii and buying it, or so I thought when I bought. I brought it home and became bored pretty fast. This is what everybody is after? If it wasn't so cheap, it wouldn't be nearly as popular as it is. The Wii remote isn't as advanced as you see on the TV. I was hoping that the motion sensors would actually copy the player's movements, but it doesn't. It just knows when you move and does it's own thing. Not to mention, the graphics aren't as good as the PS3 or 360 and the Wii doesn't release nearly half the games the other two do.

Overall, this is great for families looking for fun with the kids or a cheap system to buy if they can find it. If, however, you are a serious gamer, then this will only be impressive for the first few days. Afterwards, it definitely just isn't that fun. The best game is Super Smash Brothers Brawl and you don't even use the motion sensor in that game. Needless to say, my Wii sits in the corner collecting dust

author: Britt
title: Best Gaming System Ever!
content: This gaming system is the best ever!  It is so fun and getting to actually interact is a great plus!  It is well worth the money!!  It's really awesome.  :]  The only con is that the battery in the control doesn't last long, and it's pricey.  But, you can buy something to charge the battery, and you don't have to use actual batteries.

author: TM
title: A System everyone can enjoy
content:
We have had our Wii for a couple years now and really enjoy it. While it is not the strongest system out there, it definetly is a lot of fun. Family and Friends who normally have no interest in gaming at all will pick up and play games with us for a bit on this system. NEVER happened with any other system.

We have also started picking up some of the workout games and I really enjoy that. Who need to watch tv while you work out when you can just interact with a work out game.

We had an original model that ended up being defective after about 7 months (all of the games started freezing up), the process to ship to Nintendo and get a new one was quick and painless.

The recent price cuts and deals make this system even more valuable. Yes, it does not have all of the top of the line graphics and some games, but you do not need that for every system you own. We are PC gamers who supplement with goofy fun on our wii. With games like Wii Sports, Zelda, Mario Party 8, EA Active and more, kids,  parents and even grandparents can find these games fun!

author: kim
title: so good
content: this is so good. it is low price. it works really well. but little bit of scraches. it is acceptable to use it. i could recommand to buy this product.

author: JJ
title: We LOVE it!!!
content:
We waited in line to pick up a Wii for my nephew for Christmas when they first came out. The whole family ended up playing it and we all loved it. My husband and I loved it so much, that our parents, and us included, all pitched in to buy one for our Anniversary. We have been playing it all weekend. The great thing about the Wii is that it is family oriented. Nintendo doesnt put out games that are violent in nature and laced with sex and profanity. Which is great because not all people are interested in games like that. I think the Wii has an excellent variety of games for any age group to enjoy. I love the accessories, and the fact that it comes with a game when you buy it. I have and XBOX360 and I like playing my high end games, like Madden and such on it. But I like the different games the Wii offers that the other consoles dont. This is a great unit, and so much addictive fun for ANYONE who owns one.

I can totally understand the high demand craze for this system. Granted, the graphics are not as good as the XBOX360 or the PS3, but what Nintendo has done is brought gaming back as it should be. No high dollar price to get extras like dvd playing, music, internet, etc. They focused on making this a GAME console. If you want a DVD option, get a DVD player. If you want music, buy an Ipod or a stereo. If you want the internet, buy a computer. Consoles are supposed to be for GAMES. These other high end units have taken that away, although they are great, they are overpriced because of these features.

I say Kudos for Nintendo for making such a fun system, and I am glad to see what a success that it is, and why it continues to be in high demand and sells out. People can appreciate getting a system for the WHOLE famly, and investing in an affordable GAMING console without all of the extra mumbo jumbo at a high priced cost that the competitors offer on their units.

author: AS
title: Very Satisfied
content: I bought this product for my son and he seems to be very happy with it.  He is constantly playing this game that I literally have to drive him out from it.

author: Jose
title: Five Stars
content: Excellent product. Thank you very much.

author: Mr. & Mrs. John
title: Great Family Console
content: The nintendo wii is a breath of fresh air to the video game industry. In a world saturated with first person shooters, games geared for adult crowd, and an abundance of blood and gore, it is refreshing to have a game experience that you can have and not worry about whose head will be chopped off or how many kills you have. I love that the wii causes you to actually get off the couch and do something. You can actually work out while playing video games. Nintendo took the first step. Now it's time for some good changes to the industry.

author: brenda
title: Love it
content: Very happy with this product and so was the recipient  Great gift and exactly what I expected it to be.

author: DonkaDoo
title: Cheaper than PS3/XBOX 360-but just as good.
content:
PLUSES

It's cheaper than PS3/XBOX 360. $[...] is WAY too much to spend on a freaking video game system...

The controller--it's weird at first but honestly, I can't stand all of those freaking buttons on the other consoles' controllers. You'll get used to it quickly enough-and it's fun to fling that thing around.

Can cheaply download old Nintendo/Sega games...

Great for multiple players

Will give you a work out

MINUSES

Will give you a work out

author: A. Ryes
title: Nintendo Wii
content: This is by far the best game system that we have EVER purchased.  My entire family gets involved and although the parts are pricey, it is well worth it.  I have already told my kids that this will be the last game system we will get as long as they live in my house, because there are still some things we want to buy like Mario Cart and extra controllers. But we all enjoy it and it keeps us moving.  The Wii Fit is the 2nd best purchase and I am glad that we were able to get both.  Amazon.com got some right before Christmas and I am glad that they were able to get it to us before Christmas Eve.  THANK YOU AMAZON and thank you JESUS that we have something that allows our family to game together instead of sending us in different parts of the house!

author: maxGamer
title: Great cartoon fun!
content:
There's a little video on the internet that shows two girls like in the PC vs Mac commercials. One's a Wii and the other is a Playstation 3. It's right on the money. The Wii is playful, cheap, and great cartoon fun whereas the PS3 is just a PC that you can't upgrade.

This little monster is so great at keeping my family and myself entertained that we actually have to have Wii time or we'd be on it all day.

If you get one, you won't be disappointed.

author: Shawn Gates
title: Just a LOT of fun
content: I stood in line at GameStop starting at 4:30 am (I was third in line) to get this today. This is the third line I've stood in since launch and it was so worth it. If you have young kids (mine are 7 and 8) this is the system for you. We've been enjoying playing the Wii Sports all morning and my kids picked up on how to use the Wiimote pretty fast. I heard stories of people dropping/throwing the Wiimote on accident but so far we have had no problems. I think my kids favorite is Rayman Raving Rabbids and mine is either Zelda or Avatar. If you can't get a Wii right away and want one...just wait it out for restocking at stores. Don't buy the auctions, etc. with the high prices. Eventually you will be able to get one at regular price if you are patient.

author: emalea
title: Not your typical gamer
content:
For the first time in my life I played video games for 8 straight hours.  I am a puzzle game person.  I love Tetris.  I loved Dr. Mario.  I like Super Mario Bros.  I like games that require strategy, timing and reflexes.

I am also a quitter.  I was left behind when games went to moving the camera, aiming, AND sneaking/running/walking...whew!  I was in the dust.  I want to be challenged; not frustrated.  I want to have fun; I am not romanced by dark shoot-'em up games.  There is also so much to be said for the difference in playing TOGETHER from watching someone else sneak/run/walk/aim/and look for an hour.

The controls are incredibly intuitive.  I didn't get frustrated.  The sports games are soo much fun.  And cute...I like cute too.  (Highly recommend Rayman also.)

This is so much more satisfying than what has been left for players like me...Bejeweled...Mahjong.  I was laughing out loud, for hours.  I LOVE IT.

...also, thank you Toys R Us for handing out tickets to those waiting in line; this is fair and it also saves those who would not be able to get one from prolonging disappointment.

author: MPG
title: Nintendo shows the competition how it's done
content:
I haven't been terribly impressed by the last few years of gaming machines. In recent times I've asked myself, "What ever happened to great videogame consoles like the Sega Saturn and the SNK Neo-Geo?" The last great system in my opinion was the Sega Dreamcast, which I thought was the best system of the last generation. While the PS2 and GameCube had both good libraries (the XBox was the most overrated console in the universe), they didn't strike a chord with me like the machines of yesteryear.

Nintendo understands what direction to take. They know that the future of gaming is about innovative entertainment, NOT processing power. After all, how much more upgrading in hardware specs can we stomach until we finally realize we've been playing the same kind of games for years? Everything about the Wii is NO JOKE. It's fresh and innovative. It's small. It's light. It's well-priced. It comes bundled with a game. It's accessible to all ages. It's about the fun, the interactivity, and the replay value.

At first, I thought everything about the Wii was all gimmick. I was wrong. Wii Sports, while not the most impressive graphically, has tremendous replay value (especially with the Mii feature). No longer will playing Nintendo, or games in general, be called a lazy couch potato hobby. The Remote, Nunchuk, and overall motion sensor capabilities more than impressed me. I can't imagine Sony even trying to market such hardware with their shoddy parts. As for other games? For starters, it's backwards compatible with GC games and has the Virtual Console to play classics. It has many exclusives that utilize the controller in unique ways such as Raving Rabbids, Twilight Princess, WarioWare, and Red Steel. Players have other games to look forward to such as Super Mario Galaxy, Resident Evil 4: Wii Edition, and Super Smash Brothers Brawl.

Nintendo struggled in the late 90's, but has slowly came back with the GC, GBA, DS, and now the Wii. I am downright convinced Nintendo now and will always stay true to real gaming, and am glad they are still around since SNK and Sega have backed out from the console wars years ago. I don't even care if the Wii doesn't win this generation's console wars (though it deserves it). Nintendo still created the best console of them all which I'd find myself still playing with.

author: eugene long
title: Five Stars
content: goood condition

author: K
title: So Happy I Finally Gave in and got the Wii!
content:
My grown children have been telling me for over a year that I needed to get a Wii with Wii Fit.  I finally gave in and purchased both and I love them! I have now become a Wii junkie am always looking for new games and fun stuff to go with my Wii.

On the surface, it seems like a pricey game, however, it is worth every penny and more.  I have not ever been a "gamer" so I didn't see the point and I also wouldn't know the difference between the Wii and Xbox or any other game system.  I just know that it gets us off our butts and playing something really fun as a family or alone.

It also has wireless internet capability.  If you have wireless internet, you can do a lot with that including downloading more games at reasonable cost.

I highly recommend the Wii along with Wii Fit.  You won't regret it!

author: David Bangs
title: Awesome with the Wii Play + Remote Bundle. Don't overlook Internet and Camera features.
content:
Wii is an absolutely awesome video game system. Kids and parents alike love it.  The kinematic "controllers" let us stand up and excercise while we play. The machine is so small that it can stand up vertically beside the TV even in a cramped cabinet.

I recommend purchasing it with along with the Wii Play bundle that includes a game and an extra controller. That way you end up with two great family game disks and two much-needed controllers.

If you have Wi-Fi internet in your home, don't forget to set up your Wii to connect to the internet.  It is easy! You can access News and Weather Channels for free. The Weather Channel is surprisingly like a game in which you can explore and even spin the globe. From the Wii Store, you can purchase compatible games designed for earlier Nintendo systems for good prices.  You can also download a free Opera based web browser.  The web browser isn't great, because the effective screen resolution is low. But, it is worth a try.

If you have SD cards for your digital camera, try putting the card into the Wii's SD slot and running the Photo Channel.  The Photo Channel design is very creative and fun for kids.  They can scribble on top of photos and videos and even make puzzles out of photos and videos.  The slide show feature is excellent because of the way photos automatically pan to background music.  Try it out!

author: Ric D.
title: Five Stars
content: Awesome!

author: liam
title: the wiis caplebility
content:
First things first if you are looking for a review on internet for the wii then i am not your person. If you are interested in its wide capability of game then you should read this review. I have played a lot of games on all most every game system that existed but this one is a nice wireless game system that is allowing you to play a game just by a flick in the wrist. The wii controller can die out on you if it is left on or miss used so i would only recommend it to parents and children 8 and up. If you have a child who is youger than eight he should probable not be using it. The wii has a little light on the top of it that tells you if it is on or not if it is red then it is off but if it is green then it is on.

  Now i am going to talk about how hard it is to set the wii system up. If you are able to set a TV up or any game system up than you will be done just as fast as you would with any thing else. In fact i did not need any help setting it up in the first place ,but occasionally the movement sense will fall or get lost because of a horrible sticky pad. If you do have trouble seting it up then the Nintendo company can help. I really have nothing else to say about setting it up because there is not much to it.

now i am going to tell you about what comes in it. The box contains the wii system, a wii controller, a wii sensing board, a wii game that is ever wii sports or wii play. It also comes with a exstention cord.

This was a Great system and i hope my preview helped you.

author: Laura L Nonemaker
title: Five Stars
content: great

author: sandypandy
title: I'm getting fit"
content: The Wii and the Wii fit are great!  I am loosing fat and inches and that makes me very happy.

author: Amazon Customer
title: One Star
content: IT DOESN'T EVEN WORK

author: LLR
title: Simple Excellence
content: The WII console is not what I would call fancy, which is not a negative comment.  It is simple - simple to connect and simple to use.  On the other hand, it is an amazing piece of technology.  This is the first game console I have experience that lets you actually be part of the game.

author: Mom2sweetp
title: WE LOVE THIS GAME SYSTEM!
content: I got this for Christmas since my husband has playstation and my son has a Nintendo DS so I wanted something we could all have fun with. WE LOVE THIS SYSTEM!! It is so much fun that we have a family wii night every night, for 30-45 minutes. Great for bringing family and friends together.

author: S. Peek
title: Great System
content:
My wife wanted to get our daughter a Wii for a gift.  I was very resistant as she has several gaming systems and I couldn't really see the point.

I lost and we got it.  As reluctant as I was to get this system, I must admit that it is great.  The games are very interactive and require quite a bit of movement.  It is much better than the typical 'couch potato' interaction of most video games.  That is not to say that playing Wii sports should be confused with exercise.  It is not that, but at least players must be somewhat active.  That is a big plus in and of itself.

In addition to the activity level required in some of the games, it is very fun for all ages.  I have only played the Wii sports games so far myself, but those are a lot of fun.  The games that come with the system include boxing, tennis, bowling, baseball, and golf.  I have played four of those so far and they are all quite fun.

I have noticed that the prices have gotten a bit crazy on these systems this season.  Although it is a lot of fun, I don't think it is worth some of the extreme prices that it is being sold for currently.  I would recommend watching and waiting for it at the normal prices, which is about $250.

author: R. Dorfman
title: Five Stars
content: Thanks!

author: Sugarfoot1936
title: Not Happy
content: Got it the middle of March, and it stopped working already.  Paid almost 100.00 dollars for it.  That's a lot of money for a few months of use.

author: doug y.
title: Five Stars
content: I bought this for myself even though I am a senior and it was a real bargain

author: Amazon Customer

content: Works great have had it for 2 years now with no complaints!

author: Barbara Terry
title: Fantastic Wii
content:
Wii system is very user friendly.  Easy setup, easy to use.  My husband and I are
fifty-something and we're having a ball with our Wii.

author: Gunner

The fact that you can truly be part of the action with the unique controllers....that you have a HUGE selection of family-oriented games to entertain the pickiest of users...that it makes you get up off the couch and actually work up a sweat makes this gaming system of choice.  It also holds up very well considering the intensity of game play AND is backwards compatible with the GameCube...besides bringing in older systems via download.  It rocks....it's the best....IT RULES!

author: patsy mora
title: Five Stars
content: I got it used & it's a good as a new one.

author: G'town dance teacher
title: Great fun for a Grandmother
content: Our grown son recommended we get the Wii for fun and fitness. We are in our mid fifties and found the game to be very user friendly. In talking with others our age, we have found that there are some closet "Wii-ers" out there or those that want to be. It is easy to install and you can start playing a game within 30 minutes. We would highly recommend it for older adults like us.

author: D. Walls
title: Wii is great!
content: Ok. I remember when they first announced the wii. I thought oh great another expensive game console. But when they announced it would be $250 I was sooo happy. I was happy because with all the excellent features it would be fun. So I tried to get one. It was always sold out. So this morning I was sleeping my Dad woke me up. Because a Target around my house got in 2 wii's. The closest one went sold out. So we went to a different one. At like 8:30 and they had some in! I was out of breath because I was running to the electronics department. And my parents bought it. They had 2 wii's in the nintendo section. They got one out for us. Then some other guy bought one. I was like we got lucky because they go fast. Then the brought out 4 more. This system is so fun! So get one while you can. Now I won't be so addicted to the Xbox 360 anymore.

author: Victor Ramos
title: everything works fine
content: everything works fine, if it's original console and controls the charger is European type, but I include the U.S. adapter.

author: paradiselost
title: One year of owning....and now it's sold.
content:
Let me start this off by saying I've always been a fan of Nintendo. I grew up playing the original NES, loved the SNES, had over 20 games for N64...and then Nintendo started to be a let down with the Gamecube. Yes the gamecube had some quality titles, but were the handful enough to justify owning the system? Not for me. When the Wii came out I was VERY skeptical and had a feeling I'd end of passing it up. Well after some more consideration I thought it might be something fun for me and my wife to play (before I sound too old here, note I'm in my 20's). After weeks of searching hard to track down the Wii I finally managed to buy one.

The system started out fun, I enjoyed playing Mario Galaxy, Smash Bros, etc. Basically the system had those typical quality first part Nintendo titles. Flash forward and Mario Kart was released and was definitely interesting to play, though personally I preferred the control precision offered with an analog stick and not the wheel. After about 6 months more of the system sitting around collecting dust I kept searching and searching for quality Wii games...they were no where to be found. Yes the system has some great titles, but once again just a small handful like the gamecube did. It seems 96% of what's released on the system are poorly thrown together mini games that score 4.0-6.0 ratings and just flat out suck. I can't tell you how many times I stopped to look at the Wii games in Electronics only to be disappointed time after time with what's available. Overall Nintendo is *STILL* lacking quality third party titles.

Graphics completely aside, all this time while the Wii was sitting I was getting tons of use out of the PS3 with many great titles. To me the Wii isn't quite the bargain everyone makes it out to be. Just because the initial system purchase seems small does *NOT* mean the overall cost of ownership is. I spent just as much money on the Wii as I did my PS3 once you factor in grabbing a couple controllers / other shells needed for games. That is the whole point of the system right...to play with other people and have fun? Nintendo makes a KILLING on remotes for this thing. Sure..$199 for the system with the price drop, plus $40 for another WiiMote + 20 dollars for another Nunchuck...oh but wait now there's "Wii motion plus" ok another 20 dollars for each controller you own. These costs add up very fast.

Nintendo also seems to enjoy crippling their own services. So they offer all those games via the Wii Shopping channel, the games that you can only put on a 512mb internal storage or 2gb SD card...are you kidding? In the day in age where you can get 8gb flash drives for $29, 4gb microsd cards the size of your pinky for $13...I think Nintendo could of offered a better means of giving us storage for the games. Personally to me, the Wii is NOT worth the $250 it was launched for and still isn't worth the $199 it's now selling for. When you look at what the console is capable of doing in comparison to it's competition it's nowhere even close and I don't mean just graphically. Both the 360 and the PS3 offer tremendously more features. Yes the Wii has the motion sensing controller but it seems very few developers make good use of it and even the games that do make interesting use of it..you still lose precision more often than not over a standard (and much more comfortable to hold for long gaming sessions) controller.

It also really annoys me that other than the games running at a max of 480p resolution, Nintendo offers no means of improving what old titles look like. Both the 360 and PS3 offer smoothing effects and also use anti aliasing to clean up the older titles and make them a lot clearer / more vivid. It amazes me that even the most poorly written emulators on the PC (sorry not illegal when I own the old systems / games) offer screen smoothing, anti aliasing, etc to make the games look SO much better, yet Nintendo doesn't do this!

I realize hardware isn't everything, but it is nice to feel immersed in a game with gorgeous graphics and detailed sound. Yes the Wii is selling good, it seems quite popular among families, that's great. For myself, I sold it and recently bought the Holiday Bundle Xbox 360 elite. It's already got more playtime than my Wii had in a year of owning it...sorry Nintendo but this was my last let down system from you!

author: AmazonBuyer
title: working as advertised
content: working as advertised

author: Online buyer
title: Good bet
content: I rate this product high. Playing wii game with family helps increase the bond between the members.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The Wii lives up to the hype..
content:
It's the Nintendo revolution of the orginal NES all over again...

I have not owned console in years and finally found a great deal right on this site.  If you do your reseach you will know that the Nintendo Wii is not the most powerful console but it is the top seller beating out the X-Box 360 and Playstaion 3 for a reason.  It's FUN!!!  The free disc the comes with the system lets you play various sporting games and gets you used to a new way of playing games. You dont have to worry about hitting ten different buttons while playing games like other systems.  If possible, you have to connect your Wii to the internet wirelessly.  I enjoy the PC but having access to all of my sites right before or after games is a blast.  Do yourself a favor and buy this system.  Have some fun...it's worth the price.

author: Abby Rife
title: One Star
content: Horrible, mine was in Chinese and did not have English.

author: DJ
title: Lots of fun!
content: I've had the wii for about a year and I still love it! For the price ($150 last year just before Christmas) it's a pretty great gaming system. I like that it does so much. I've always loved nintendo and in fact haven't owned any other system, so I can't compare it to xbox or ps3 or anything. It's great to be able to download games from online, and I can play my old gamecube games on it too. It's also nice to watch netflix vids on the wii. I will say that I'm not a big fan of the games where you just sit there and shake the remote or something, I prefer the games where you really move. I think the wii is great for what it is and worth the price. For instance the Wii Sports game rocks! I love the games and you really get into it, so much so that after playing for hours yesterday my arms are killing me. I'm a big fan of boxing, which is really fun to play. I have heard about xbox's new game with Kinect where, basically like the wii but without remotes, and it sounds fun. I'm hoping that eventually they develop something like that for the wii, but buying an xbox and kinect for $400 is way too much. Anyway, if you're a nintendo fan you'll probably like the wii, if you aren't, you may like it you may not. It's definitely great for families and such. My grandma even plays wii bowling at her senior center.

author: jbrum
title: Wiirific
content: I bought this for my husband after playing at a friends house at Thanksgiving.  We've had a great time with the system and can't wait for a new game.

author: S. Choi
title: Great!
content:
Long story short, the Wii is a great product.  It will make an awesome Christmas gift and its fun for the entire family.  Wii sports (the game included with the console) is quite addicting.

You should think about purchasing the console from retailers like Wal-mart, Bestbuy, or Gamestop since the prices there are considerably cheaper.

author: Darrell
title: Very Fun for kids
content: This is a great concole for kids. There are alot of cool games available for it and they are reasonably priced.

author: Michelle Sweet
title: if ports worked would have got 5 stars
content: The usb ports do not work but everything else so far seem to be working just fine

author: J. Mccoy
title: As promised and awesome customer care
content: Product came as promised, except addidional DVD was missing. Contacted the company and they gave me a rebate of a more than anticipated amount. Very satisfied.

author: G. Abraham
title: Good Active Play
content: We purchased the Wii as our Christmas gift this year (2009) and we love it.  We already have the PSP3, but wanted the Wii because it offers active play.  It has been great.  My husband and I play on this together and as our daughter gets older she will too.  It is great to have on those cold, rainy days we can't get outside to play actively.  The price was not bad and it was shipped very securely.  We did order it from Amazon and got free two day shipping.

author: LWR in TX
title: great for our grandkids
content: Our old WII stopped working after 5 years of use. We had many games invested in the old unit and two young grandkids who would play with them for several more years. After that we will upgrade the system.

author: Tripper
title: Five Stars
content: One of the greatest inventions of all time!!!

author: Atkinson Peter
title: Small machine, but big game and good deal
content:
I bought my own wii console system from AMAZON sevaral months ago, I like it very much.
  The console itself is downright tiny--easily the smallest and lightest of the new generation of game machines. At 1.75 inches high by 6.25 inches wide by 8.5 inches deep (when oriented horizontally). But with different kinds of wii games, you can do what you want to do.
  It is a season for giving gifts. Thanks to the EBay 30% cash back through Live.com for BIN items.
  I bought two wiis from Ebay and get $192 cash back from live.com, the final price is much cheaper than AMAZON.
  For those unfamiliar, you basically go to Live.com and do a search for an item like ipod, wii, etc. It will take you to a page with a 30% off link for EBay for the item. Once you click that, it will redirect you to EBay and show a 30% icon at the top of the EBay page which will apply to any BIN item on EBay (not just the item you searched for). You also can find a full instructions from the item page I bought.
  [...]
By the way, the composite cables don't support the Wii's top resolution of 480p, so HDTV owners will need to purchase a set of Wii component cables (sold separately).

author: Batool Saied
title: EXCELLENT!!!!
content: The Nintendo Wii is GREAT!!!! very cool new system. if you buy a Wii it comes with Wii Sports which is a great game! It really makes you feel like your actully playing the game. Bowling I think is the best! 5 STARS for the Wii!!!!!

author: jm1717
title: Great
content: I got this used, and it works great! No problems. It runs smoothly just like a new wii but was less expensive

author: Buster Matthews
title: Wonderful Wii
content: If you don't have a Wii, buy one! I ordered ours as a surprise Christmas gift for my wife. The price was right, and Amazon delivered it on time, just in time for Christmas day. Our family has thoroughly enjoyed having a Wii. The games are fun to play, and the interaction of playing together is just great. Family bowling night in our own living room. What could be better?

author: Robert Martinez
title: Wii and Wii Sports
content:
We recently purchase Wii for my 8 year old son and he loves it.
The part we like best is that he's not sitting in front of the
computer or TV.  He is obsessed with it, but it's active and it
get's him interested and excited about classic sports. Overall
it's a good thing and the whole family gets to be a part of it.

author: Satisfied
title: Disappointed in how this machine broke in a couple of years.
content: I liked the Wii; but it didn't last long compared to some of the game systems purchased for my son.

author: M. Hill
title: Everyone loves it!!!
content: We have been looking for a Wii for awhile and have not been disappointed.  All family members play it, the Toger Woods  golf is a excellent game for all but the youngest. Looks very good on 47" flat screen tv.  Make sure all players use straps and stand back from the tv we found that you tend to creep closer to the  tv as the game profresses.  Highly recommend, brings the whole family together.

author: Madeline
title: The Only Console a Family Needs
content:
I come from a gaming family and my new family is also big on video games. The Nintendo Wii is the only console I have ever seen that really and truly appeals to absolutely everyone I know in one way or another.

To give you a basic idea of the complete range of this system, the following people have played and enjoyed our Wii:
27 year old female (me), 28 year old male (hubby), 4 year old male (son), 22 year old male (brother, ended up buying himself one), 25 year old male (other brother), 52 year old female (mom), 58 year old male (dad), 25 year old female (sister in law), 26 year old female (friend), 31 year old male (friend), 27 year old female (friend), 30 year old male (friend), 15 year old female (cousin), 15 year old male (cousin, also got one for himself), 12 year old female (cousin), and many many many more.

Games like Super Mario Galaxy, Metroid Prime, and Mario Kart keep my video game fanatic of a husband intrigued and challenged. Wii Sports has had everyone I know at least TRY (and thoroughly enjoy) the system which does not happen. This is the first time I have ever seen my mother play any type of video game and we have had video games in our house for decades. I love games like Mario Party and My Sims and am currently really getting a kick out of my Wii Fit as well. My four year old son adores the Wii Sports and the Mario Kart. My almost 2 year old daughter doesn't really care what's going on as long as she's holding on to a WiiMote.

This is definitely fun for the entire family. This is entertainment at its best-- people getting together and having a great time OR enjoying some time to yourself to unwind.

This is NOT progression in video gaming technology as far as competing with the XBox 360 or PS3. I think it's completely ridiculous to try and compare these systems. I can understand debating between an X Box or a PS 3 but the Wii is completely separate. This is not about amazing graphics and smooth controls, compelling story lines, and innovative plot development. This is a completely new way to play and should be seen that way.

I don't believe it's too kiddy for anyone. There are plenty of titles out there to appeal to all types of players and more are coming. This is by far the most rewarding video game purchase we have made and I have no qualms of continuing investing into it with each new title (Mario Kart with a wheel!) or feature (have I mentioned how much I adore the new Wii Fit?).

Thank you so much Nintendo. Keep it coming!

author: Christopher Stewart
title: Fun for the whole family...
content: Was not sure how much of the hype about this system was creative license when I placed my order for the Wii for my daughter's birthday... but I am happy with what I got!  The controllers took some getting used to but in a matter of minutes the whole family was up and playing the games.  As a die hard XBOX 360 player I wasn't sure I would have any fun playing it, but the games are exactly what they are designed for.... fun.  Not only was it fun, but the ability to play Gamecube games as well as downloading the "ancient super mario brothers" (as my daughter put it) game from online.  The ports on top allow you to use the Gamecube controllers even the memory cards.  I dumped my N64 for an XBOX because of no reverse compatability, guess Nintendo got the point!  Overall, one of the best system purchases I've made.

author: Elle
title: Honest seller with a great product!
content: Really honest seller - I bought this for my teenage son ( who is quite particular) and he was beyond impressed with the quality.  Thanks so much?

author: Linda Pack
title: Fun for everyone
content: Ordering was simple, shipping was quick. The game that comes with the Wii provides hours of entertainment and has unlimited replayability. Extra controllers are a little expensive. Fun for the whole family!

author: Michael J. Gernold
title: Great Entertainment System
content: I've been wanting to get one of these for a while but all the stores i go to are normally sold out..Extremely fun especially with Metroid prime 3(huge fan). I also like that I can download all NES, SNES, N64 and Sega Genesis games..highly recommended that you get one of these if you don't have one..

author: Brenda
title: AMAZING :D
content: im brandon, im writing this from my mom's account! i jus have to say thank you so much ezcorp! you guys are truly amazing for having offered this product and at such a low cost! i received it perfectly. no scratches or dents to my eyesight...wiimote and nunchuck works great, wii console works great...played mario kart and new super mario bros for 6hrs straight, no power breaks...NO OVERHEATING :D i attached a usb fan to it so that's really why, but during the first 4hrs without the usb fan it was hardly even warm...i set up youtube, netflix, internet channel on the console and works flawlessly. ran an update for the system, passed smoothly. wii shop channel required me to do so. the sensor bar works great, the power cord and av cord also works great....no problems. i absolutely love this product. would definitely recommend this to my friends and anyone wanting to get a wii :D Thank you ezcorp...now i gotta buy me blackops and nfs the run XD

author: Sunrays
title: My son's b-day gift
content: I had one of the wii's before, but needed the money at the time. I used my amazon money and got a great deal on this unit. My son played it yesterday. It worked well. Thanks.

author: Eric L

content:
I know, it's been around for 2 years or so. At least I didn't pay the more than $200 prices that it was going for when it was first released. What more can I say which hadn't been said about this machine. It's superb and it's certainly the most revolutionary way of playing video games that one can imagine.

If you don't have one, buy one!

author: Yaxin

author: Honey Babe

author: Amy J. Dunton
title: Fun fun fun!
content: We got the WII for christmas and it has been one of the best purchases that we have made...It is fun and interactive so you get up off your butt and do something for a change.  High marks here!

author: LINDA
title: Four Stars
content: Thanks Amazon, yes it was exactly what I wanted...

author: T. Stevens
title: To put it simply, this thing is a blast!
content:
I'm going to keep this short and sweet.  I am 25, and bought all the last gen consoles, and have a 360 and this.  While I would recommend the 360 as your primary home gaming console, this thing is definately worth buying for the party games alone!

I got mine in on thursday, and only had wii sports at the time.  A bunch of friends were meeting at my place before we headed down to a wedding.  I fired this thing up, and we played bowling untill 3am!  Only reason we went to bed was cause we were going to be up all weekend.  Everybody had fun, game enthusiest and non.  Although you don't have to, we were actually going through the complete bowling motions, steps and all, and it felt right!  Trash talking ensued, and a good time was had by all.

This will be brought out for parties, and zelda is AMAZING!

author: tiny teacher
title: Fun for All
content: The Wii is a great system for the young and old. I bought mine a year ago and have thoroughly enjoyed it. I use it just about every day! I've even had Wii parties where friends come over and we play Wii games. I'd highly recommend this system to anyone with families, single people, couples, or people with disabilities!!

author: MightyIndian
title: Excellent Family Fun
content: This is a great investment in terms of family entertainment. There is everything for a family to enjoy together. While other games makes the players just sit down and play, Wii's interactive feature allows you to be part of the game and move, run with it. So children won't end-up being couch potatoes. The console features are so simple that everyone can figure out very easily. Once you get the feel of it you'll never leave the game. The only weakness I found is graphics. Perhaps this is good in a way that players can focus more on playing the game than viewing it. Overall, it's a worthwile investment.

author: VideoReborn
title: Innovative Hardware, Suitable for All Ages, Yet Lacking Convenience and Short Game Play so far.
content:
I'm sure a lot of people love Wii because of it's "revolutionary" motion sensing controller gaming experience.  So I am not going to mention how fun it is.

Instead, I would like to point out the pros and cons of Wii at the current 2.0U firmware. Things may change for future firmware updates.

The reason I give 3 Stars is because I average two major categories: Innovation and Technology.  I give Innovation for 5 stars, and technological achievement and convenience for 2 stars.

Motion Sensing technology is nothing new, it has been applied to cell phone gaming and vehicle air bags for quite a while.  The system is barely an upgrade from the Gamecube.  It is extremely inconvenient to share game save data compare to PS3 and even Gamecube.  The innovation point is how Nintendo has achieved to redesign the motion sensors for even better game play experience.

Pros:

- Parental Control

- Able to count amount of time user has spent to play different Wii channels. Best for parents tracking kids video game time.

- Motion Sensing Controller is extremely similar as Playstatoin 3's Six-Axis Controller.  This brings brand new intuitive gaming experience.

- Bluetooth wireless technology in Wii Remote prevents cord wind up hazzles and less wireless signal interference.

- AC Adaptor is separated from the console. This makes it the smallest Next Generation Console on the Market at this moment.

- Backward Compatibility to Gamecube and Virtual Consoles.

- White color in a very clean design.

- Built in WiFi for internet downloads.

- New Internet Browser is available for download in April 2007

- Cheapest amaong XBOX360 and PS3

- Suitable for all ages as long as you can hold the remote and know how to swing it.

- My 90 Year Old Grandpa was able to get a strike in bowling, hole in one in Golf, some tennis racket swing and boxing punches.

Cons:

- Games are not Region Free. Unlike Playstation3 and PSP, that are region free, user cannot play import games at all without modifying their Wii's hardware.  American gamers are going to miss out a lot of interesting Japanese games such as Gundam, Naruto, Super Robot War, and many many others, even those games that don't really require people to understand Japanese!

- Unable to count the amount of time the user playing Gamecube games.

- Cannot easily exchange the game save data from one Wii to another. Let me elaborate this problem.

  If you want to share your Zelda progress to another friend, you cannot simply store your game save in the SD card and bring to your friend's house to load in his Wii console.  Instead, you have to do the following

  1. overwrite his save file. Make sure you tell your friend to backup his own save data. Or,

  2. if he hasn't played the game yet, you have to create a save file by playing the game and save at the first save point.  After that, you have to overwrite the the save on the console with the one in the SD card.

- You must need a gamecube memory card and controller to play Gamecube games.  You cannot backup or save any data on the Wii console's internal 512MB memory nor SD card.  If you want to know how ripoff Nintendo is on Gamecube memory cards, please read my other reviews on "Gamecube memory card 1019 and 59 Blocks".

- The system resets itself even from minor configuration.

- Cannot use the Wii Remote to call up the system menu when playing Gamecube.  Therefore, you cannot even turn off the system with the remote.

- Lacking DVD movie support even Wii game disc has the memory and physical size of a DVD.

- The system gets warm during standby mode. Not sure the power consumption during Standby mode.  Anybody can clearify this?

- It does not have an option for automatic firmware update in standby mode.

- Somtetimes takes nearly 30 minutes or more to receive messages or Mii from other players.

- Virtual Console Account is depended on the system's serial number instead of an online account.  That means if you have purchased any games/software from Wii Shop and suddenly your Wii is malfunctioning, either for an exchange or brand new replacement, you CANNOT redownload the contents for free in any replacement system.  You might need to contact Nintendo regarding to giving you back the Wii Points for in-store exchange/manufacture warrenty to redownload the content to the replacement system.

- It creates a noise from the disc reader trying to read the disc even the slot is empty everytime the user resets or turn on the sytem.

- Currently, most games are party games, it is fun when you have a buch of friends sitting side by side to each other.  There is currently no online games available.

- The GPU and CPU is a lot inferior compare to XBOX360 and PS3; therefore, the graphics and controls are really bad especially for any kind of First Person Shooters. We'll see how well Metroid Prime perform in Wii soon.

author: jcher
title: WII
content: WII is amazing. It is so much fun but you have watch it because as you play time goes so fast that before you know it you are very sore. My family favorite is Bowling. We can play for hours. All the games that we have played are fun and addictive. It is great for family time.

author: H. Yi
title: Great fun for gatherings and for single players
content: Wii is simply awesome. It's a whole new experience and almost anyone can get into it and have fun. So far I've bought Wii play and extra nunchuck, but I'm thinking of purchasing more remotes for 4 player fun =)

author: Cesar Gonzalez Granados

content:
I was a little bit worried about buying anything on the web. But I decided to take the risk one month ago, and buy my Wii console. I've experience not a single problem with shipping or anything. It's as easy as a couple of clicks. I'm enjoying it a lot with all my family and close friends. Tons of fun!!

Even when amazon is a very secure site for buying,taking some extra measures to avoid internet phising or any other ciber problems its indeed a good thing to do.
Buy safe, enjoy and take care.

author: D. Drummey
title: Great fun
content: This is the video game concole that brings the family together. We packaged ours with the Wii Fit + and have nothing but fun.

author: Tanya
title: I love the Wii
content: My husband and I enjoy playing this game together with family and friends. I think the only downfall is the extras are expensive. Needless to say we play on the Wii everyday!

author: MICH
title: Five Stars
content: BOUGHT AS A GIFT

author: Cherylsleleld!sldsspdpdp
title: A kid again
content: At 40 something, I never thought I'd give a hoot about video games. But, I got this for my kids for Xmas & I tries it out, at their begging, & I think it's a blast.  Sol much more fun than sitting on the couch & pushing buttons!

author: bargin shopper
title: WII
content: This item was used. It it useable is useable but in black and white instead of color. I'm using it with a brand new TV so it has to be the WII that is not working properly. All the games I use on it are also new & have been played on a my other new new Wii system. On the new system they work fine & are in color. It will work for a 2nd game box but I'm not happy with it being in black and white instead of color. I was told the reason for the problem was it had probably got too hot at one time. Hopefully the seller didn't realize this when they sold it to me. I don't think it was really a bargain since it doesn't work properly.

author: Jennifer
title: So much fun!!!
content:
My husband and I picked this up for our kids.  We like it because it gets our kids up and moving.  We have long winters where we live, so being able to get the kids active is hard at times.
Oh, yea, FYI!  When you buy the game system, plan on spending a whole lot more money for all the extras.  We bought 3 extra sets of the remote and nanchuki-thing (about $80 per set), Mario Kart along with four steering wheels, Mario party is a must, the entire Rock Band set (love this, I play the drums while my 11 year old son rocks out on the guitar!).  You also need to splurge for the remote charger base in order to keep from replacing AA batteries. All in all, we ended up spending about $600 on the extra stuff. My next purchase will be the wii fit...at least when I can find it in stock somewhere.:)
Everything works just as it should from the hype we've heard. I highly recommend this game station, it's a big key in the fight against obesity!

author: Julie
title: Three Stars
content: has no sound, the remote isn't working correctly.

author: L. Stack
title: Awesome!
content: The Wii needs no explanation. This system is the best and most innovative out there! Nintendo has produced an exceptional game system that will provide hours of fun for people of all ages ( my Grandma played with me the other day and loved it). Controls and buttons are easy to understand and you don't have to be a game geek to do well. The first day I received my Wii, I played for several hours and was actually sore the next day! I highly recommend this!!!!

author: Connie McKenzie
title: We LOVE the Wii
content: Our son bought a Wii for his family, then my husband and I bought a Wii for our home for the grandchildren last year, this year we bought Wii consoles for our children's families. It is great for the WHOLE family no matter the age!

author: Michael B.
title: Five Stars
content: Was all I could expect in a wii. was shipped fast and came with what it said it would.

author: GrumpyCat
title: Wiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiii!!!
content:
Awesome console for an awesome price.  the console alone is almost fun by itself since you have access to downloadable games and can save them on SD cards and there's an upcoming service to download content to your DSi.  Sure the other systems have downloadable content, but here, you have Nintendo's classics, so this system is a great "museum" in a sense of gaming history, as corny as that sounds.  You will need a classic controller or Gamecube controller for SNES/N64 games so keep that in mind.  So far I've never had a problem using the motion controls, they are very reliable.  I will say the included Wii Sports is a bit dated with the release of Wii Sports Resort.  Wii Sports was a fun game but to me, there isn't enough motion control since you don't really aim your golfswings and bowling balls at all with the wii mote, rather it only gages strength, speed, and timing, which is a bit of a let down since aiming your pitches, swings etc, would've been way more interactive and that's what I think about when I think of motion controls.  Wii Sports Resort, the new sequel for sale, seems to rectify this, but that's sold separately.

Just to cover up a few concerns and negative stereotypes of this system

1.  Graphics to me are fine.  They are like a cleaned up high budget Gamecube game at worst case scenario.  Best case scenario it looks like an EARLY Xbox 360 game but in standard def and some games just released or about to be released in 2010 are pushing the system to what it can really do (google images from the upcoming game Monster Hunter Tri to see some impressive graphics)

2.  The game library to me is just fine.  I heard many people complain there wasn't enough games or there were only childish/simple games available.  While that USED to be the case, 2009 filled out the Wii's library with mature titles suitable for more serious gamers, so there's literally something for everyone, just go on a gaming site and check out the whole library of games.  I was gaging on which console to get, and believe it or not, I found the Wii's library to be the best in terms of variety and later this year to 2010 looks like it will be a HUGE year with many AAA titles coming.  IMO by Xmas of 2010 the Wii will have the deepest library if things hold up.  Hopefully I don't sound like a fanboy.

author: Y. Arazi
title: Addicted. _Everyone_ plays
content:
OK. So it doesn't have the same graphic quality as ps3 and xbox 360, but ...

Everyone plays with that. Kids, Women, Old people, young people, people with fancy evening clothes! etc...

Price is good, and the potential is great. Zelda is awesome. Have you ever tried to play a game where you actually holding a sword???

Fishing, throwing etc..  become realistic. That's where the revolution relies. You can do more money from enhancement experience than eye candy. At the end, that's what we want. We would like to be _in_ the game. Holding something that is closed to the reality. Wii sports is amazing.

It worth standing in line and getting the vary last one!

EA and other will start using that potential. Every _family_ that visit my living room is going to buy one. That's a fact. "I want one of these" is a common phrase.

Nintendo will probably take the profit and build there next gen to rule that market. Good for them.

And you out there, the games developers, we are waiting for you folks to build more games for the Wii.

author: Daniel Erlewine
title: Amazing, great gameplay, great graphics
content:
This is the best system out there. PS3, Xbox, it's all more of the same. If you like playing the same thing over and over and over again, go ahead and spend the crazy amount of cash on one of those.

For me? It's all about the Wii now. It's so much fun. Sports are kind of lame after about 90 min or so, but Zelda... Man. It's the most amazing gameplay. Call of Duty 3 is pretty great too.

I don't know what people are complaining about with the graphics. They look great to me.

author: Brian D. Adams
title: Had High Expectations; Was Still Blown Away
content:
Ever since I heard that Nintendo's newest console was going to play old Nintendo games (NES, SNES, etc) I started listening. When I saw the controller the first time, I was hooked.  Console gamers have been using the same old same old controller for years, and it never seemed like it was going to end, but then Nintendo said "No, we're going to do something really DIFFERENT."

But although the Wii is different, and in a good way, it can appeal to diehard gamers the same way Nintendo wants to bring in new gamers.  My brother, who is a big Xbox/Halo fan, said that the controller was "Dumb" when I first showed him pictures of it, but when he actually got it in his hand, and started to see what it could so, I started hearing something different from him: "This is so cool. This is the best system."

Nintendo has a winner on its hand, even if it doesn't seem like it at first. The DS was plaged with people (including me) not getting it at first, but now, it's destroyed the PSP in the marketplace.  I think we'll see something similar happen with the Wii in the coming months.  Sony, get ready to lose your top seat.

author: Mirrek Balderson
title: from fun to lame
content: at first the wii is a blast. here you have something completly new. motion sensored gaming, a fresh take on the gaming world. then after a while it just gets old and boring. unless your playing with a group of friends or family, or you are a little kid this system just becomes a lame system. the graphics are no better than anyhting weve seen a decade ago. the game library is limited, very limited. 90 % kiddie games. I can only hope the next wii will have updated graphics along with more adult oriented games, that way the system will have more to offer to us old school gamers. guess im just picky, or maybe its because im not 9, but i want my gaming system to try to be the best there is. superior graphics, games that you can play for hours and hours and not get bored.  the wii starts with a brilliant idea, but fall short in the long run when it comes to ultimate gaming.

author: D. Wolfe
title: Amazin!
content: Hi, the WII  is fantastic, too bad they did not have games like this years ago!

content: COOL

content: Works good after 5 years. A few times it has locked up but after powering off and letting it sit a few minutes  it works fine.

author: Amazon Customer

content: great

author: Jennifer Andrews

content: Works great, no problems!!

author: Erin
title: ... new I was buying a used console but was disappointed in the condition
content: I new I was buying a used console but was disappointed in the condition. The description said Very Good but it was missing the top panel and the opening for the games was bent and the felt was folding back.

author: Rafiq
title: Wii game Bowling.
content: In  fact I need two remotes for four players  comprising all necessary logistics such as one controller along with cables and usb cords..

author: Julian Traas
title: A Step in a Bold New Direction
content:
Hats off to Nintendo for this jewel. I ordered the Wii recently and it came in yesterday. After less than ten minutes of installation I put Wii Sports in and was immediately pleasantly surprised. I expected simple little games, with a little motion sensing finish, but I didn't expect them to be highly addictive and fun.

Wii Sports is like five games in one. For instance in Boxing you beat your first oponent and the next and they progressively become more difficult, challenging you a little bit more one after the other. I won't spoil anything else for you, but if your into fun, addictive, family games than the Nintendo Wii is for you. On the flipside, you've got the new games coming out, with a much darker finish.

In short, the Wii is a sure-thing to appeal to the hard-core gamer for its innovation, as well as the casual gamer who just wants to sit down every once and a while. (Like my mother, for instance. She never plays videogames, but there she was whacking those tennis-balls!)

BUY IT. IT'S REALLY, REALLY GOOD!

And did I mention the price advantage? It's totally worth it!

author: C. Hanson
title: The Wii is Awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
content: This console is with no dought the best of all the next gen consoles. I have played all 3 and the Wii is much funner to play with and the games are awesome. It never gets old. Despite the graphics being not as good as those of the PS3 And the XBox 360, this console really gets you into the game. You'll find that it is near impossible to put the remote down and quit playing. I highly recomend this console over the 360 and the PS3.

author: Angela M. Hooper
title: Wii
content:
Being of the older generation, I experienced the Wii for the first time in my life at my grandchildrens home.  I assure you, it was quite a challenge to get off of my bum and try to keep up with the kids while playing this game.

The very next day, my arm was so sore that I could barely raise it.  I enjoyed the game and the "family time" that the Wii gave us.  I held my grandchildrens attention and there was a lot of laughter as they laughed at their "Nana" in action.

I know some of you do not like the graphics of the Wii.  I agree, it could be a little better - but, I absolutely love this game.  I will also buy one for my home so that I can stay in fit without overdoing it.

author: Coredump
title: A game console for the non-gamers.
content:
This game console is for all the others who find game console play contrived and non-intuitive.  Having the game pad (wii-mote) sense the intensity, direction and rotational speed and translate into game play while so obvious in hind-sight is nothing short of revolutionary.

My 6 year old son who I play this with, absolutely loves it - so much so - we use it as the carrot for getting his school homework done.

As for the technical details, this is one very well made electronic device on which significant thought has been put into ease of everyday use.  Be it the upright positioning or the wireless network or the hideaway SD card slot or the connection to the Sensor bar on the Tv which allows this unit to be hidden away from sight or the ability to power it on/off with the remote or the user interface - every single detail has been carefully thought out.

Here's an example of the thoroughness of the design - the wireless network allows you to place it in a place where it can be hidden and no messy wires to connect. Also, the wireless network supports either B or G networks and has WPA2 security built in.  Allows for connection to routers where the SSID broadcast is intentionally off.  Or, if you have a default wireless network, the Wii allows for a DHCP connection from a list of available networks.  Or if your router is AOSS enabled, it allows for connection using AOSS.

While still technically quite good, the strength of this console stems from the fact that it was designed to make playing games easy and nothing detracts from this.

We have a couple of other game consoles that we have at home and apart from the initial play those consoles have received, they are pretty much gathering dust, just because game play was not intuitive and tough to get a hang off.

I don't consider myself a gamer by any stretch and am very happy that I bought this - Both my son and I play regularly on this and have to force ourselves to stop.  The included Wii Sports is hours of fun.

This is definitely something that I don't have buyer's remorse on.  My wife who is not keen on any electronics has actually said more than once that she thought the enjoyment that the both of us got from the console was definitely worth the price.

author: As is
title: Lack of great games!
content: I know no one will read this, since most people are reading 5/5 stars or 1/5, but i do want to say this anyhow. I feel that the ONLY reason this system is rated so high is because of its revolutionary point and shoot joystick. Its so different from every other console. This is more of a fitness than an action console . That being said, there are almost absolutely no games for 18-30 age group. Most are for either really young kids OR fitness for people who are too lazy to go and join a gym. The only thing thats giving this console some punch power is the Mario franchise. But seriously. Your 2nd top rated game of all time for wii is Kirby Yarn. This game looks like it was made for 5 year olds. I had 100 bucks to spend on wii games this holiday and after spending 30 min I couldnt find anything worth buying. That would have never happened for PS3.

author: Nightmare
title: Amazing system
content:
There's not much to say that others haven't already said, but I would like to offer my opinion to the masses already here.  I have been playing the Wii since it came out, and it's still going strong.  But for the record, let me point out that you should read this review with the understanding that I am a huge Nintendo fan.  Also, I am a 22 year old Male who's been playing video games since the original NES.

The Wii is truly awesome.  The motion controls, from swinging the remote as a sword to using it as a steering wheel, make for some very exciting experiences.  Although some games don't use this feature very well (sloppy motion to on-screen translation), the ones that apply it properly are gems.  Some examples are Madworld, Mario Party 8, Zelda: Twilight Princess, Mario Kart, and Wii Play.

The pointer is a huge plus.  It reads extremely well on every game I have played that utilizes this feature.  Metroid Prime 3, Super Mario Galaxy, Zelda, Wii Play, and Red Steel are great examples of how good this can work.  Shooters, like Metroid Prime 3, are greatly augmented by being able to point and shoot with such accuracy.  It adds a realistic layer of skill to shooters that I find very immersing.

There are plenty of games that can use the Gamecube controller or Classic controller attachment instead for those that don't like the Wii controller--Guilty Gear XX Accent Core, Super Smash Brothers Brawl, etc.  Virtual Console downloads are awesome, as well as some of the Wii Ware games that have emerged.  Having the opportunity to download great games from the NES, SNES, NeoGeo, Sega, Turbo Grafx, etc. adds some serious value to the Wii, in my opinion.  Backwards compatibility with all GCN games is cool as well.

The Wii has frozen a few times in the middle of a game, but it's very rare.  The overall performance of the Wii is excellent.  It doesn't over heat, the electric power usage is (understandably) less than the other major systems, and its nice compact size is very appealing.

The problem that a lot of people have with this system is the "lack" of "mature" games.  I will admit that if you are into hard core shooters, the Wii is not the best system (although the Conduit might change that).  RPGs aren't very common either.  However, there are plenty of great games that older gamers can enjoy on the Wii.  For example, Zelda, Metroid Prime 3, Mad World, No More Heroes, Medal of Honor: Heroes, Super Mario Galaxy, Battalion Wars 2, Okami (a PS2 port with Motion Controls added), Resident Evil 4 (what many people consider to be the best version), Excite Truck, and others.  There are also many more coming out in the future.

To summarize my points, the Wii's controller features can be very effective when used properly.  The pointer is very efficient for shooters, the motion controls add plenty of depth, and there are some really great games for the system.  It's not going to be everybody's favorite, but it's definitely mine.

author: Krista Burczyk
title: Item in Excellent Condition. Properly packed. Fast shipping!
content: My family is extremely happy with the wii purchase.  The item was correctly labeled as Used-Very Good condition.  All items came packed with bubble wrap and are working perfectly.  I would not hesitate to order from this seller again.  I have two very please little boys (and a husband) enjoying our new wii. Thanks!!!

author: Gabriel Choi
title: The Wii is amazing!
content: The Wii is amazing! The Wii remote and Nunchuck make playing easy for everyone! You can check the Weather, find the latest News, go on the internet, make your own self on the Mii Channel, and many other things!

author: Amazon User
title: I love my wii!!!
content: I love my weeed

author: A. Pull
title: get one
content:
It's great fun, but you have probably heard that already.  There are a ton of fun group games you can play with this thing: it's not a high definition gaming monster, but if you want to entertain your friends, there's no video gaming option like the Wii for finding games that they can just pick up a controller and play somewhat competently.

If you had any appreciation for Super Mario Bros, or SMB3, you'll need to pick up the New Super Mario Brothers Wii.  It's one of the most fun games you'll ever play with 2 or three others.

Cons:
* by the time you get done buying extra wiimotes and nunchucks and hd cables and batteries and balance boards and all that jazz, it's not too tough to have spent $400 or more.
* not high definition

Pros:
* great for parties
* fun controllers
* mario, zelda, and metroid
* ability to download and play "old-school" games
* just about everything else
* your old parents can play it and have fun
* your even older grandparents can play it and have fun
* you'll get a good laugh watching them do so
* option to buy fitness games that won't make you fat and dumb if you play them a lot

just buy one already.

author: Tammy Barnes
