title: I sent this to my granddaughter who lives out of ...
content: I sent this to my granddaughter who lives out of town.  It didn't work and she is only using the controls and the bar with her old Wii game.  will not purchase refurbished items again.

author: Cyrus-Pin
title: PS3 owner who has owned a Wii and a Xbox 360
content:
I owned a Nintendo Wii about 2 years ago right when i moved out of my parents.  Its fun and exciting even more so when you have more people playing 2 - 3 0r 4 player!

 I enjoyed that you could download Old Nintendo games and play with the optional controller and i bought the original Ninja turtles the day i bought my Wii.  My parents now own a system and my mom plays just about every day wtih my 3 year old son who loves playing too.

 When i originally bought the Wii there just wasnt enough out there for me and i ended up selling it for money but that doesnt mean i didnt enjoy the machine because i still missed it sometimes and have thought about purchasing another one.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Waste of
content: It doesn't work. I have tried new connections, different tabs and even paid someone to hook up and it won't even eject my DVD. Waste of money

author: Robert M. Merritt
title: A christmas gift that keeps on giving
content: Every one enjoyed this gift.  Too bad it went home with it's new owner.  There seems to be something for every one to have fun with.

author: M. Vogel
title: super fun
content: When looking for a good time- pull out the wii- Super fun with the big screen-you really feel like you are in the game! We got the game as soon as it came out- We play with friends and family. Our kids play it with their friends and by themselves. No one has gotten tired of it yet. I redommend to all. At any age there are games for everyone.

author: Kahlan
title: Wii-the review from someone who actually purchased the product!!!!
content: Nintendo... remember the days of Super Mario Brothers, sitting in front of the television for hours because of the excitement and total awe of the game, feeling like a child again- that is what the Wii is about. Capturing that feeling of gameplay, making it totally interactive, creative, something we've never seen before, we become part of the video game again. The system is smaller than i thought it would be - fits nicely in an entertainment system- very sleek. The controllers are so easy to use and after about 30 minutes you'll wonder how you ever played a game without them. The graphics are beautiful, smooth lines and rounded edges everywhere -no pixelated graphics here. The interface is simple to use, the instructions are self explanatory. If there were ever a system to wait 6 hours on line in Times Square in the cold, it was this one. The experience was not one I'll soon forget and owning the Wii is definitly something I won't regret. As for the price- it beats out the Xbox360 and PS3. It's affordable, innovative, fun for the whole family - kids will love the nunchuck controller and wii sports, swinging the controller around!!! I absolutely love Nintendo because they do a great job putting a high quality on the market that is affordable for everyone and innovative all at the same time. Enjoy your Wii - if you got one before they all sold out that is...

author: Wanda Sherin
title: It works great.
content: My grand daughter absolutely loves it. It works great.

author: Zombie_Burgerlord
title: Good for kids, but I didn't like it
content:
I've had a Wii since they came out back in '06 and I have to say, I haven't bought a game since.

I enjoyed it for the first couple of months and started to get bored with it. It was fun because I never played games in a manner of getting up and moving, but it got old, quick.

I haven't honestly turned it on in the past 6 months.

I grew up with SNES so I've grown accustomed to stagnant game playing (meaning I don't like moving around to play a game).

It's not a bad system, but it's not that great either. Maybe for kids and younger teenagers it is a good system, but I personally don't see any appeal in it.

If it weren't for the fact that the system belongs to both my brother and I, I would sell it so someone else could get enjoyment out of it.

There also aren't many games out for my tastes. Most games I see are directed towards kids, so I never see anything I would want to play.

So, to be straight forward, Wii is a good system for kids and younger teenagers (and even adults who don't normally play games), it just wasn't for me.

author: Comdet
title: Fun for adults
content:
I'm not much of a game fan - don't have an Xbox nor do I game using a PC. But this is fun! I use it mainly with the Wii Fit balance board attachment for exercise, and it provides a nice variation from the usual cardio machines or strength routines.

Easy to set up and use. The graphics are not what you'd call top-notch, but are usable. All in all, I'm very pleased with it - never would have thought I'd own a game deck, but the Wii changed that!

author: S. Lee
title: Worth a buy.
content: This was a great system with a good selection of games, though not all of the games in Wii's library utilize the Wii's unique controls as well as first party and the top third party titles do.

author: Alejandro Herrera
title: One Star

author: Shopping Bee
title: A console for the casual gamers
content: If you're a casual gamer, have busy work-life and need to find a balance now and then to have alone time - this console is for you.  As said before, this console is like comparing a motorcycle to a porsche.  You won't have it all, but it's fun to have around during the times you do feel the need to play a game but not with your typical xBox or Playstation controller or graphics.  Hard-core gamers will disagree, but this console is not targeted to them.

author: Brian P. Robinson
title: Wii IS AWESOME!
content: So my wife happened to be at a Gamestop when the UPS delivery arrived and scored one for me. Opened it up, synced our two Wiimotes, and started playing. The Wii Sports game is addicting... you can actually work up quite a sweat doing Boxing. Each of the games are a bit more indepth then you would assume considering they come with the system. Loaded up Zelda, and the gameplay is great! All in all, its a fantastic system. Even my wife (who has only ever played one game ever: BrainAge for the DS) likes it and plays with me. She even beat me in bowling bad. Its a great system! Fun for all.

author: Alejandra
title: Great console
content: Excellent game, my kids enjoy it a lot!!! and the best part is that they excersise at the same time

author: M. O. Shaughnessy
title: Wii love it!
content:
My wife and I had some reservations about introducing a video game console to our kids (ages 7 & 8) because we've always been opposed to traditional video games where kids just vegetate on the couch in front of the TV and only exercise their thumbs.  Well, I'm sure anyone reading this review by now knows that the Wii is an entirely different kind of gaming platform, and "Wii love it!"

The Wii Sports games that come with the console are all very fun, and will leave your muscles sore the next morning (that's a good sign!) The console comes with one Wii remote and one Wii nunchuck - you'll definitely want to buy a second Wii remote and second nunchuck (so you can play 2 player games.)  If you have plenty of room in front of your TV, you might want to have 4 Wii remotes so that 4 players could play tennis together, but 2 remotes have worked just fine for us so far.

The Wii console has Wifi capability, so you can connect it to the internet through your wireless router.  This enables a few other features such as: Wii Shop (you can buy and download other games directly off the internet), Weather (which has a very nice user interface) and News (again with a very nice UI for reading the latest news stories including viewing high quality photos that accompany some stories). The internet connection also enables the Nintendo channel which has videos of all the latest games as they are released, and a couple of other fun diversions (Check Mii Out channel and Wii Vote channel.)

Installation was very simple - we were up and running (literally) very quickly! Our whole family has enjoyed it, and now we have Wii nights with our neighbors (who also got a Wii for xmas).  If you haven't bought one yet, what are you waiting for?

One last thing... the Wii Fit (sold separately) is AWESOME!  That should be your very next purchase after the Wii console itself.  Check out those reviews too.  Enjoy!

author: B. Duguay
title: Seller Flexible, Wii Just Rules
content: We ended up cancelling our order with our seller but they were very flexible. I had found a better deal on Wii somewhere else and we have been enjoying it. The graphics aren't as good as PS3 but we play it more because it is FUN! It also can be a little more exercise which is refreshing.

author: Spartacusvir
title: Small boxes
content:
"Guitar Hero III: Legends of Rock Wireless BundleWii The Beatles: Rock Band - Software OnlyGuitar Hero World Tour

Small boxes

You ever have that feeling of complete bliss? We have those moments when your memories from the past have slipped within a secret compartment in your mind, a doorway that shows you a peaceful, wonderful place living inside your mind. This body creates sketches, pages, pictures, feelings, from our life and puts it all in a small little box, neatly stored away to see and flip thru like an old picture book. Well, if you have been in that state or in a convertible, driving along a highway and the wind in your hair, music swirls around you from the stereo and the road showing you no end in sight for it seems like the car has wings. It's great, isn't it? The way the music can take you and your past, blend them together like a beautiful sonnet and recite back to you the emotions of that time.

I am speaking of a small box, a wonder that can strangely, bring these feelings to the surface. You can sense them in your mind and body. It's called a Wii. The Nintendo Wii is a gaming console that is beyond just an ordinary game machine. I am sure most of you reading this are thinking, what's he is on about. I have just wanted to share the moments that I have had enjoying the Wii and perhaps to show you a different appreciation of something so simple.

Starting with the music, I mean the games that you're playing along with the notes, mostly with a guitar and just trying hard not to screw up the song. There's a line of games all under the banner of Guitar Hero and others named Rock Band as well. There are many versions of both games with a large variety of music that compares to you just sitting around and playing some old LP's. When you use to mix your CD's, records, anything really you could get your hands on and make some silly mix tape for a girl, thinking this will move the world for her. That time when you came home from work or school, popped in a tape in your car or walkman and just existed, enjoying the melodies of what is to come. I know, because of my age I will be speaking to a certain generation but most can understand and just rock out to plain, old, good, music. These games have created this for me and remind me of a time lost, placed in a small box, forgotten.

So now, you have the guitar strapped on, place that game in the machine and let it roll. The game boots up and suddenly, you're in this other world. Now, like most games, some take you immediately to that environment that they are trying to convey to you and others, leave you standing at the bus stop with no ride. You choose a band name, a look and feel for yourself and dive into this revisiting of thoughts. I use to love those afternoons with a childhood friend of mine, we would, always on Sunday, turn up the radio to listen to Casey Kasem's top 40. It was splendid. A tremendous variety of music and we would hear something, record it right away on our cheap tape decks, usually badly with his voice being part of the track and cutting it off a little too early so you don't have to hear his over powering grandeur again. Everything from Journey, AC/DC, Led Zeppelin, The Police, Johnny Cash, Bob Dylan, The Beatles, Hendrix, Steve Miller Band, Blondie, The Ramones, Wings, Elton John, Phil Collins, Blue Oyster Cult, Boston, Ted Nugent, Ray Charles, Bill Holiday, The Alarm, Queen, Bowie, Supertramp, Fleetwood Mac, and of course the endless saga of Hotel California blaring always in our ears were just some of the tunes playing over the airways and in our tape decks at the time. Truly bad hair styles but now thinking about it, a great and blessed experience to be part of this music at that time. You eyes open again; you have this guitar still on and had a little nap time while we were telling you a story. I string along with the tunes this game presents to me, it brings me to that moment and others. I could sit here and recant all the times or those times when I really thought I was a rock DJ or something, but not really going to torture you that way unless there's drinks involved. I just listen to the music, hear it like the first time and remember it but most importantly, feel the passion behind the stories they are singing about. There's a pain, happiness, truth, beauty, honesty in its notes and lyrics. Even the craziest rips by Ted Nugent or the screaming, screeching verbiage by Bob Dylan were at times, left you're wondering, is someone strangling him while he sings? Neil Young telling us of his endless searches and loves that I do adore. The Stones telling us what to do and what to drink, where and when to do it and with how many girls. AC/DC just truly trying to blow your mind and speakers so that your mother will throw your stereo so far out the window, it grows wings! Paul McCartney singing along with his wife with blissful melodies of a place he speaks of. Elton John, tugging away at every inch of your pain and your love's suffering, all in his musical enchanting voice for all to be heard. Freddy Mercury screaming and singing so softly at times with his sexy voice to explain why he likes fat bottom girls and that you should believe in yourself in some way. Steven Perry speaking to all the girls of the planet and telling all the lads that you will never be as cool as he is, never! Then there's Ozzy, ripping to shreds the notes on the paper, the bats in his mouth and the physical existence that is Ozzy.

These artists and many others can explain so many things to us. A changing of a time, in ourselves or in the place we live. All can come and go as we see it and change but for some reason, more than other memories or thoughts, these musical doors are always open.

So, don't wait. There's no need to ever surrender or give up on what is truly an inspiration to your own being. If you want to be something or do something, be that being. Just perhaps, maybe, a little time of just enjoying yourself in your home, with your Nintendo Wii and that Guitar Hero game, you can once visit a memory that you believe was lost or erased. It never was lost or gone, just had to feel it again, inside, flowing all around your body and mind. Your eyes will gleam with joy so put on that guitar and rock your neighbors into calling the cops. Enjoy the Wii, life needs a break.

author: Xavier Bustos
title: Five Stars
content: my kids love it

author: Vicki Lang
title: Wii Game
content: This product is so much fun.  The kids love it and quiet as its kept, the adults love it too.  Great for family time together. Great exercise is involved in playing this game so that can be a plussssss.  Easy to operate as well.

stay away.

author: C R Swanson
title: Just barely short of perfect.
content:
The Wii is a truly amazing system! The controller is very responsive and the whole thing is easy to use and to hook up.

So why not perfect? Well...

Here is "My Wii Adventure".

I put a reso down on a Wii at GameCrazy back a month or so ago, so I knew I was going to get one. I don't have high speed internet at home, so I went out and got a cable modem.

Well, I get the thing home yesterday, spend entirely too long getting my modem hooked up (that's another story, but not a fun one), and was finally ready go to online with my Wii!

That's when I learned that it's wireless only.

And the LAN adapter won't be out until next year.

Nooooooooooooooo!

But I rallied. My ISP doesn't provide wireless access, but eventually I get either get a Wii adapter or buy a wireless thingy for my cable modem, so that's good.

However!

The Wii had one last nasty surprise!

I went to my local Wal-Mart and bought a Classic Controller, having been told by many that it could be used to control GameCube games, and I wanted me a GameCube game! I then went and traded in a stack of DVDs at my local GameStop (I'm not very loyal to my retailers), and...

...

...

... found out the Classic Controller can't be used to play GameCube games on the Wii... *sigh*

So I instead bought a used GameCube controller and I'll have to deal with that. I returned the Classic Controller to Wal-Mart.

Despite those minor errors, and they are REALLY minor, the system is really excellent and I highly recommend it! :D

author: Amazon Customer
title: Family Fun!!!!!
content: We have had the Wii for about a month and couldn't be happier! Wii Sports is great for the whole family! Easy to operate(even for my 4 year old). The added bonus is, you can actually get a little exercise while playing! This is well worth the price! Don't hesitate to pick one up. Another thing that's nice is the games don't seem to be as expensive as some of the other systems. Most games are under $50.00 and there's alot of great games for less than $40.00.

author: Amanda
title: Love the system
content: Excellent game I had it over more than a year. My kids and I love it it was just like it said in excellent condition. I will be buying another one.

author: Jason Boucher
title: Worth Every Penny
content:
Ok, first I have to tell you the story that goes along with my new Wii. I was tipped off by a best buy employee that this past sunday they would be selling 42 Wii's. I asked when they opened, and they told me 9Am. So I decided to try and get there an hour early to be first in line. well I arrived at 8:05 to find a cop car out front of best buy for shopper protection, and Best Buy was ALREADY OPEN!!! I watched person after person walk out of the store with a new nintendo Wii as I dashed inside with hopes and prayers that there was any left!

I got to customer service, and waited in line behind one other person buying a Wii. As soon as I got to the counter and asked for a Wii, some guy comes running claiming that he was first in line, and that he had been waiting in line for an hour. Well come to find out that he was in that line until he left to get to a shorter line which actually took him longer. There was only 1 Wii left, so we argued our cases in front of the manager there, and the manager said that he can't make the decision for us, so he was just gona hold onto it and sell it later. So I suggested a coin toss, and the manager agreed. I picked heads, and WON THE TOSS!!!!

So I get the Wii home, and set it all up, and within minutes I was hooked. My wife who never played video games before was hooked too! I couldn't get her off of it! We thought that Wii sports was highly addictive, and although people claim that the motion sensing is not 100% accurate for force, I think its close enough to make any game played on the Wii amazing. I was praying that nintendo would redeeme themselves after the flop of the game cube, nintendo 64, and virtual boy. My god, they redeemed themselves a thousand times over. Rayman is a blast with the Wii, and I can't see playing that game with anything other than a motion sensing controller!

Before anyone goes bashing the accuracy of force with the Wii's controllers, you tell me what other game system has ever even attempted this? I played Need for Speed Carbon, and you turn the controller sideways and use it like a steering wheel! Forget tapping directional pads, this is amazing!

Still thinking if you should buy it? well consider this, I can walk into a game stop or walmart anywhere in a 25 mile radius of my house, and pick up an Xbox or a PS3, but the Wii continues to sell out within 10 minutes of a store opening. My friends, this is the system to have. Unless you want to pay an arm and a leg for a system with great graphics and no fun gameplay. I for one am all for the fun being put back into the game rather than having flashy graphics.

author: lajollabub
title: Amazing - I'm blown away by this . . . and I thought I would hate it.
content: I am a Playstation nut and I've been talking down Nintendo for years now, especially after Gamecube, but no longer . . . The Wii absolutely revolutionizes video games.  My wife can't stand video games . . . and then she played the Wii with me - fresh out of the box - she played it with me as she always used to do - out of a sense of obligation, just to spend time with me, but now she plays because she can't get enough of it herself!  Once I got the hang of the controller, it became like an extension of me and I love it!  The feeling of being "in the game" has been redefined by this game system.  I loved the N64 (in it's day), hated the Gamecube, and now, I think the Wii may actually make me forget about gaming on any other system.  I know people at a popular game company in California, and they are all telling me that they have twice as much fun with the Wii than they do with the PS3 - I will get a PS3 (of course!) but HD graphics and a Blueray DVD are NOT going to be enough to defeat the immersive gaming experience of the Nintendo Wii.  My wife and I invited friends over to play the Wii with us, and you should've seen their mouths hanging open!  It was awesome!  Everyone of them left saying they wanted one.  Nintendo . . . I'm yours again!

author: Natureluvr3
title: Fun!
content: I LOVE the nintendo Wii. I received one for christmas, and it works flawlessly. You may look at this and say, WOW, this is EXPENSIVE. It is worth EVERY PENNY. And, if you don't think there are enough games for this system, you can also use gamecube games. Also, you can download pictures on it from your camera or video camera..even your cellphone! Then, you can use your TV as an electronic picture frame! Besides, all the free programs available are what entertain me.

author: Michael Ciance
title: The Wii has changed gaming forever
content:
This is the most revolutionary and influential video game console since the Nintendo Entertainment System.  It will change the way you think about gaming, and open up entirely new experiences.

The controllers are extremely well-designed, and are modular to allow different attachments and expansions.  The motion controls allow for games to be controlled more precisely and more immersively than ever before

There are some true masterpieces on this system, but watch out for cheap imitations and low-budget titles.  "Rapidly shake the Wii Remote" has become the new "rapidly press the A button," and cheap titles will tell you about their motion controls when really they have little or no purpose.  Read up on games before you buy them, and make sure the developers have taken the time to truly take advantage of this amazing controller's capabilities.

If you want to see what this system does best get Metroid Prime Trilogy, Super Mario Galaxy, and Battalion Wars II.  For some expanded hardware and new experiences, get Wii Fit Plus and Wii Sports Resort.  Some other excellent games are Super Smash Bros. Brawl and The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess (although they don't use motion as much).

Some people criticize the Wii for being less powerful.  It has less graphical power than its competitors and doesn't support HD (although it does have widescreen and progressive scan).  But the gameplay is what really matters, and the Wii delivers an experience unlike any other.

author: Katrina K. Oberhelman
title: Absolutely love it.
content: It seemed like forever until we were finally able to purchase one of these, but I LOVE it. It's so much fun. I'm not big on sitting down and playing video games all day on my butt, but this thing really gets you moving, even in your typical RPG games you have to move a little. A lot of fun and highly recommended. I originally wanted a different system, but I'm SO GLAD I got this one. If you're not sure which system you want, GET THIS ONE!!!!

author: Terry Hashley
title: Waa....Waa...Waaa
content:
Alright people, you knew this was going to happen...it is a Nintendo System for you to play with.  Get over it, it will come out when it does and everyone that is whining about it, quit.  The e-mail from Amazon said that it would be available the MORNING of 11-19...that ranges from 5AM to 10AM for most stores and since it is Sunday, most do not open until 8-10 and mind you, THIS IS PST!

If you are so desperate, go to a local store and reserve a copy by complaining up the manager trail like you are here.  It is a cheaper unit that has a lot to offer but, I got home last night at 4AM from work...sat down on the computer, clicked on the Wii for Amazon, it said it wasn't available, so I left the computer and went to sleep until now.  Give it up and just wait until 8AM PST.  If they have it then, great, if not, get over it.

author: Kathy Ochenrider
title: Great Birthday Gift for my Daughter
content: My daughter and her fiancé love the Wii.  Her dog is even starting to enjoy it although she wasn't sure about it at first and kept stealing the remote!

author: Mariza
title: What's not to like?
content: Love the Wii. Bought this as a gift for my nieces and nephews. I hope that they enjoy it as our family has.

author: Eagle Vision
title: Best home system for your family
content:
If you are one of the few people lucky enough to find this item, then you are privileged enough to own one of the best video gaming systems, ever.

With 4 infrared remotes, the entire family or group of friends can compete in a fun atmosphere.  Although the graphics are not high definition, the interface for gaming is where this excels.

The accompanying game disk, Wii Sports, is by far the most thrilling of the games.  It includes Baseball, Tennis, Golf, Bowling, and Boxing.  The simple interface and lifelike interactions can keep you gaming for hours.  From bowling to Golf to boxing, you can simulate the actual actions of the sport.

In addition to gaming possibilities, I have hooked mine up to my wireless network, to quickly check weather and the news.

The set up of the system is rather easy for something with so many peripherals.  Extra controllers need to be synced with your system.

My minor gripe is the infrared detecting device has fallen off of the flatscreen TV, many times.

Internal memory allows many game saves without us having to resort to accessory memory.

I have considered other gaming systems such as the Playstation 3 and the XBOX 360 but so many games oriented towards my daughter (age appropriate), I feel like I made the best choice.

author: Clare Luzuriaga
title: fun+awesome+gamer+never bores of 1 thing=Happy Gamer with wii
content:
Even though the name is kind of anoying, This console is the best thing in the gamer's world. The wiimote is a little hard to use at first but once you get used to it, it becomes AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!! Think about all the possibilities, you can use it as a sword (twilight princess and red steel), a steering wheel (Excite tuck and other car games), tennis racket (wii sports), etc.

Do not buy the ps3 or xbox 360 because the ps3 copied the motion sensitve controller idea and microsoft's xbox 360 has nothing new in it and both companies don't specialize in gaming (microsoft/sony).

author: Andrew L. Davis
title: Wii Console
content: Love the games. You can get a good work-out. I broke a sweat bowling. Don't know why it took them so long to produce this type of video game. This is a game the whole family will enjoy.

content: great produc

author: Amy Paulette
title: a hoot!
content: The Nintendo Wii system is SO much fun. I bought it for my boyfriend for Christmas. We both LOVE it! You definitely must purchase the Mario Kart to go with it if you buy this item...it'll keep you entertained for hours! The best part about the Wii is that it keeps you moving, so you're not just sitting and moving your fingers. It's a great video game system for your kids since it keeps them active! I also recommend the Wii fit. :) GREAT product!! One of the best video game inventions out there!

author: B. Klein
title: Wii Fits Us
content: I'm not the typical video gamer. My wife and I get Senior discounts. She wanted the Wii Fit to get in shape. It turned out to be great for that. As a bonus, the basic Wii with it's assortment of sports- tennis, golf, bowling, etc is also a lot of fun, great exercise and easy to learn. Most things about it are highly intuitive and the activities feel very realistic. Virtually.

author: Charles H.
title: Good fun for a good price.
content:
I've had my Wii for about four years now. It was 250 when I bought it. It seemed a little steep at the time, but fortunately the price has fallen considerably. With that in mind, I'd recommend the Wii to anyone and everyone. It's good fun for the price.

As most surely know by now, the Wii makes use of motion controls. I won't beat around the bush: Waggling your remote around can be both tedious and annoying on some games. But fortunately, there are enough games that use normal control schemes. The Wii Remote is often flipped horizontally and implemented as if it was a NES controller. Also, they make a Classic Controller attachment for the Wii Remote (sold separately). With that add-on, you can play quite a few Wii games with SNES-styled dual analog controller.

There aren't many graphical masterpieces on the Wii. People often say that its graphics aren't very different from those present on the N64, but this isn't exactly true. The Wii's image quality really is a lot sharper than most of the games present on that system. But since we can make some comparisons with a system released almost seventeen years ago, the Wii obviously can't compete with graphically with its HD competition.

The Wii has some online functionality. It doesn't have a social network implemented in the same way the Xbox 360 and the PS3 do, but it does have a Wii Friend code system for playing with people you know. Many games implement online multiplayers. You can also download and purchase video games from Nintendo through the Wii Shop Channel. In additional to all that, you can even browse the web from your console. But unfortunately, the web browser is pretty terrible in terms of functionality.

That's pretty much all I can say about the Wii, except this one additional thing: You can get a Wii through Amazon for as little as 70 bucks now. If you don't have a game console and are looking for a good form of entertainment, why not pick up a Wii? Most of the second and third party games are really cheap now too. The Wii is probably worth 150 bucks new, and its a downright steal for the price you can get it at used.

author: Jane Lamour
title: Wanna Play Some Wii?
content:
If you get pass the weird name the "Wii" can be really a lot of fun. When it first came out in 2006, the Wii was very popular and with the demand of many gamers, the Wii was hard to find. After wishing for the Wii in Christmas of 06, my family finally found one at the local Wal-Mart.

The Wii was my to begin with but my brother couldn't resist playing it. Soon friends started coming over to the house to play Super Paper Mario,Cooking Mama: Cook Off, and Excite Truck. The Wii was the coolest thing in the world then, but later became easier to stock up on shelves. Now in 2010, the Wii can be found basically at every video game retail store. But that doesn't mean it still isn't as fun as in 2006.

The first thing about the Wii is that it is family friendly. If you want to buy a gaming system for the whole family to enjoy my first reaction would be to say "the Wii". But still the Wii might not be for every family because sometimes "a non-motion" controller is the best. The Wii is user friendly with games like the Wii Sports series that has simple controls like to swing a tennis ratchet or to roll a bowling ball.

The Wii has many functions that I probably can't all write about. But first the Wii can be hooked up to the internet. My Wii came with a wireless card and works pretty well but now I have it wired. The internet is now a big requirement in gaming, but I haven't experienced a lot with the "Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection". My first experience with the Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection was with Mario Kart Wii with Wii Wheel. The Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection works great and playing games with people around the world makes a rain day with video games a lot more rewarding and fun.

With internet connection, the Wii can do a lot of other things like buying games with Nintendo 2000 Points Card (DSi or Wii), checking the weather, and more. When having a Wii, I highly recommend hooking it up to the internet. You can experience more with the Wii.

The Wii's motion controller is very accurate for it capabilities. I have not had many problems with the remotes except for one case but I thing the reason for it was because of a game. I still have my very first Wii remote that came with my Wii and works perfectly fine and the only sigh of age is the dust and dirt that has collected. Wii remotes are surprisingly expensive charging usually $40-$50 per remote. But the Wii remote has an add on that makes the Wii remote more "sensitive' to you motions. Wii MotionPlus is an attachment to the Wii remote that can be attached to the base of the remote, where the Nunchuck attaches. The Wii Remote Plus - White is now out which has Wii Motion Plus built in.

The Nunchuck is quite strange looking but is comfortable when used to it. This part of the controller is used with games that are compatible.

The Wii does have a wide selection of games but the Wii doesn't stand out with realistic graphics like the Xbox 360 or Playstation 3 have. That doesn't mean that you can't enjoy the graphics on the Wii, games like New Super Mario Bros. Wii don't need realistic but excel in colorful artistic graphic that leave me entertained.

The Wii is a great system but may not be for everyone. The Wii appeals to me when I want to have fun and relax but can still entertain the gamer in me. But now with PlayStation Move Starter Bundle and Kinect Sensor with Kinect Adventures!, I wonder if the Wii is still going to be in the competition.

author: Dejabeemo
title: Awesome!!!
content: Thanks so much for sweet much needed addition to our home.  Now on to the next console we need to complete our collection. :D

author: W. Bennington
title: Family Fun
content:
This is actually the second Wii that I have bought, this one is for my parents for Christmas.  We love it for our family!  It has something to offer to all ages.  I have been a gamer for decades and love it.  My family is new to games and loves it.  We play Mario Kart, Guitar Hero, Wii Sports Resort.  My 4-yr-old can play at least some of any given game.  The multi-player functionality is what we like the most as it is easy to have up to 4 players on most games and everyone can play and have fun at the same time.

Overall, highly recommend for families with kids from 3 and up.  Very accessible for all ages with intuitive game-play.  Hardcore gamers may be disappointed as graphics and in-depth RPG games are lacking.

author: Stephen
title: which sucks.
content: Mine didn’t come with a controller, so sadly I wasn’t able to use it immediately as I had planned around. The product description didn’t seem to mention this, which sucks.

author: Debbie Love

content: Was just like described

author: C. Reynolds
title: Reviewing WII Fit
content: I enjoy this product because it keeps me mentally and physically active. The product was easy to set up and understand instantly. I would recommend the WII Fit to everyone that is interested in stimulating themselves through a game console.

author: Nanda SL
title: Wii review
content: This is the best game that I have ever played. The shipment was on time and I would score amazon service as 10 in a scale from 0 to 10. I'm satisfied! you guys are the best!

author: RaeSunshine
title: My first Wii
content:
I love the thought concept of the Wii console. Unlike PS3 and X360, the Wii was more so targeting to family friendly and group games. The Wii has a tons of games for the casual game audience and those who love social gaming, but it's also hard to find a game that's hard-core and solo because of it.

I love casual gaming, but there are also times where I want to kick some butt. Finding games that suit my need to blow up or smash some enemies is hard in Wii. They have few games that suit the hard-core gamers. (And Mario just don't cut it) The Wii doesn't cater to my RPG lover needs enough, forcing me back to my old PS2 for some action.

Another draw back is the fact that I need batteries for my consoles, which had to be the stupidest thing for the developers of Wii to do. Ever extra equipment I get for Wii needs a battery and I hate it.

Another draw back is the fact that I can't watch movies on my Wii. This is a huge drawback and just ridiculous. I like my Wii and I always wanted one. I was prepared for the lack of hard-core games they produced, but the fact that I can't watch movies, or would have to repeatedly by batteries for my controllers sucks.

author: CAGirl (San Jose, CA)
title: Fun for whole family
content: Still going strong after purchasing it more than 5 years ago. Fun to use for the whole family. Specially mario kart game.

author: TheChaz72

content: Ok the Wii was kicking butt until Microsoft came out with Kinect for the Xbox Which is the same only no remote its all body controlled so it forces you to exercise unlike the Wii where you can sit on the couch and just be worken the biceps.  In other words don't waste money on this product the Xbox for one hundred bucks more gives you more stuff and internal game storage.

author: LaCresha Lawson
title: Disappointed
content: It didn't work.

author: steve_oakland
title: Fun doesn't last
content: I didn't grow up playing video games, nor do I own another gaming system. While the Wii's wireless interface was originally appealing, it got boring fast. There still aren't too many games that really appeal to gaming newbies, and this is a rather expensive purchase to play "Wii Sports" and "Mario Kart" once a month. Bottom line: if you don't care for video games already, this won't make you like them much more. If you want to play tennis and bowling, you can spend less on a racket and the appropriate shoes and get out of the house.

author: Barack Obama
title: The Wii is awesome
content:
Like many have said, the Wii rules.  I love what Nintendo has done with this console; instead of just mashing buttons, the player becomes more involved in the game through motion-sensing technology.  But like any system, it has its good and bad points.

First, the good:

The technology itself.  I love the Wii Remote, and how it makes the player a part of the game.  This is a technology, that when used to the proper extent on games like Twilight Princess, is amazing and completely captivating.  Nintendo hits it out of the park on this one.

Second, I like the Mii channel, where you can create a video game sprite in your own image.  It's cool.

Third, the system is easy to set up.  I had this thing up and running in less than 15 minutes.  That's my idea of a well-designed console.

And finally, the Virtual Console.  For those who grew up on Mario, Zelda, Castlevania, Kid Icarus, Ninja Gaiden, etc., this is a godsend.  Being able to play all those old-school games is simply great.

But there is the bad...

First, Wii scalpers.  Seriously, you guys are dicks.  I live in a small town and it took me 18 months to find a Wii because of you people.  It would be nice if you'd let some ordinary gamers who only want one system buy a console at retail price.  You people suck.

Second, every now and then the remote and the sensor bar don't exactly cooperate with each other.  But this is rare, and not a big deal.

Finally, there are too many middling and unappealing games for the Wii.  Most of the best stuff has come from Nintendo itself.  It seems most companies haven't yet figured out how to best take advantage of the Wii technology.  I hope they figure this out, because this is a great system and I would like to see some better games for it.

But the Wii is fun and user-friendly.  And that's what matters.

author: B. Smith
title: Great for the casual gamer. Potential for the hardcore gamer.
content:
I've been playing video games since I was [..] Each generation has showed us amazing advancements in both graphics and gameplay. However with each advancement it seems like more and more casual gamers have been turned off. People just want to be able to play and not think about control schemes and complicated gameplay. The wii seems to be the remedy for people who are normally intimidated by video games.

I myself was very skeptical about the Wii. I always loved nintendo but the gamecube was not very impressive and it seemed like this was a radical new approach that could ultimately be the fall of nintendo. Fortunately I think it is the very opposite of what I thought it would be. It's possibly the most fun I've had playing video games since I can remember.

As for the games... the best games right now are all multiplayer type games. (Wario Ware, Rayman, wii sports etc.) None of these games are very long and even though I have a LOT of fun with them I rarely find myself playing for longer than an hour at a time.

For the hardcore gamer Zelda is really the only great game out right now. (I'd say it's on par with Ocarina of Time, arguably one of the best games ever.) Nintendo's line up does look promising though. Games like Mario galaxy and Super Smash Bros are something to look forward too. 3rd party developers also seem very interested so who knows what else we'll see on the wii.

So is the wii worth it? If you are a casual player or you just want some fun you should defiantly try it out. If your a hardcore gamer and you like the zelda series it's probably a good investment but if you are interested in FPS' online play and RPG's you should probably wait and stick with your PC/PS/XBOX until the wii develops some more.

author: BargainJunky
title: Best All Around Gaming Console
content:
I'll spare you the technical details about the Wii, but tell about my experience with it. I actually had the Wii over Thanksgiving weekend
and took it to my fiance's families' dinner parties and it was a huge hit! I hooked it up a few hours before the thanksgiving feast and her parents saw it. They were so impressed they were actually eager to try it. We played some Wii tennis, bowling, and a few holes of golf (golf was FUN can you believe it?).

At the actual dinner when the guests came, my fiance's mom actually asked me to show the guests the Wii--and then they all got into it too! It was crazy, never seen this many 50 yr-olds playing video games--probably because it's not like traditional video games. One of the guests said "This is incredible! This is too much fun!" and later he went to my fiance and told her that she has to take the Wii away from me otherwise she will never see me again.

Two days later, we tried it out at my fiance's aunt's house with her mother's side of the family. Again, her mom brought up the Wii and I hooked it up and everyone was watching or playing. Even her 9 yr-old cousin tried it and she wouldn't put it down when everyone was leaving--she was as good at the game as anyone else--Wii is this easy to use--only takes couple of tries to learn how to play. 4 player tennis and bowling action! Baseball was fun too, but only 2 players.

I mean I knew it was going to be fun for ME, but wasn't expecting it to be a huge hit across all ages. Making Miis is one of the most fun aspects of the Wii. You can make virtual avatars to use in Mii compatible games such as Wii Sports. I specialize in politicians and celebrities, including Dubya, Cheney, Hilary, Kerry, Saddam, Kim Jung Il, Michael Jackson, various Star Trek characters, etc. It's very amusing to use these fun avatars in your games: imagine tennis matches of Dubya and Cheney vs Saddam and Kim Jung Il.

[...].

author: Marilyn Bonebrake
title: WII Mario Bros. Bowling and Many more
content: This is a very fun game Everyone should have one. Can pass a lot of fun time with this game.It is great for young and old alike. We have passed a lot of idol time with these games. Wii Mario Bros. Bowling amd many more games that our super fun and provide lots of fun hours.

author: Ukuhata
title: It was as advertised
content: I received it fast. I liked it so far. Cooool. I recommend it to anyone who is looking for such a thing in good price.I received it fast

author: W. H. Herbert

author: B. Cleary
