author: dieharddmb
title: Waited in rain, cold and no sleep,  Totally worth it!!!
content: This is the best system Nintendo has come out with.  I never thought I would wait in line to see the sunrise for a video game system, but this is actually something new.  You aren't stuck mashing buttons and trying to remember a series of button clicks to do moves.  The play is very natural and easy to pick up.  Definately worth the price.

author: Ravi
title: Everything completely brought to life!
content: The Wii by Nintendo is a really good game system, Nintendo made a great job on it. I bought this for my 8 year old daughter about a year ago and started playing it with her. I have to say, it is absolutely amazing! Everything is made like you are really doing something. The Wii has a lot of good games, like Wii Sports(which i highly recommend), Wii Play, etc. One other great thing about the Wii is that they make games like Star Wars: Lightsaber Duels where you can actually make the Wii remote as your lightsaber. They make Tennis like your holding a Tennis racket. It is really amazing! But good things have to come to an end. The graphics on the Wii aren't great like the Playstation 3 (which is better in graphics). Nintendo spent so much time on the movements of the Wii, they did not do a good job with the graphics (the Wii graphics are not terrible, but they just not as good as the other game systems). If anyone has the 250, 300 bucks to buy this thing, get it! (you won't regret it!)

author: Raspberries
title: Wiitastic!
content:
We just got our Wii, had a lot of fun with it so far but we're still out if we're in love with it.

It took it forever to get here, which ticked me off seeing as I have a PO box not anything else. If your shippers don't deliver to PO boxes then don't let people ENTER one!

author: M. Vasquez
title: Great family console!
content: We bought this for "family nights" and it is tons of fun! This is definitely more of an all ages family console than the others. It is not as powerful or provides higher HD resolutions as others, but you don't need it to get the fullest entertainment value from it. If you're looking for a game console that the whole family can enjoy, this is it. It is very interactive and will get anyone off the couch for some fun. Even grandma loves the bowling!

author: William C. Yount
title: Very Glad I purchased this gaming system!
content: The wii is awesome!  Enjoy top game titles like Super Smash Bros. Brawl, Zelda, Guitar Hero, Rock Band, and so much more! This truly is a gaming system for every age. Go ahead and let yourself play! Enjoy!

author: Leola Lightell
title: Best buy ever
content: I have been wanting my own WII and finally bought one. At first i was worried as these consoles are not new. But the seller was great, checking on me. I have been so happy since! I have also purchased games and  accessories. I am beyond happy with this purchase.

author: Patsy Henderson
title: Fills all my entertainment needs. Great buy!!
content: Love it!!! I'm on it  everyday ,and it serves as my primary entertainment hub. I don't even watch my cable tv now lol. Netflix Netflix Netflix, mario mario mario mario, Netflix, Amazon video. Great purchase

author: Kim T.
title: Bought my Wii at Gamestop.com for retail
content: I bought my Wii a month ago at Gamestop.com.  I had to buy a bundle, but everything was sold at retail.  They kept me informed, emailed me when shipment (from manufacturer) was delayed, and Wii arrived unharmed.  Would definitely have preferred to buy here at Amazon (I did have to pay $35.00 to ship) but at least I have one to put under the tree this Christmas and don't feel I was robbed!

author: Lisa A. Harper
title: WII
content: Ordered this for my sister and she loves it. Very quick delivery for a hard to find product.

author: Ana Lewis
title: The whole family plays
content:
We purchased Wii last year for the kids (we have 5 of them), but to tell you the truth, my husband and I play it as much or more than they do! We have gotten addicted to the Wii Lego games -- Star Wars, Indiana Jones and now Batman.

At Thanksgiving we had bowling and golf tournaments.

And for our 7 year old's birthday, we did Wii Mario Cart -- with steering wheels for a really great racing themed party.

author: Likes to Hugs
title: LOVE It!!!
content: What more can I say, I bought it for me!  I'm 41, my son has his own Xbox 360, this if for me!!!  Fun for everyone.  The family get's together and has bowling tournaments......It's a blast.  Hopeing to use it everyday for a workout!

author: Morgan S. Condon
title: Wiisistance is futile
content:
The Nintendo Wii is of course Nintendo's newest system, being its 'entry' into the 'next-gen' console wars.  That being said, its difficult to not overhype this system, as it does not deliver on what many gamers believe to be next-gen  (this isn't a bad thing).

1.  Graphics:  True to Nintendo's history, the Wii does not deliver 'superior graphics capability' as its nemesi (Xbox 360 and PS3) claim, but thats never really been Nintendo's focus anyway.  The concentration is FUN, and that it is (we'll get back to this).
The Wii does not natively support HDTV.  It comes with 'dated' composite cables to plug into the TV (yellow for vid, red and white for sound).  You can order componoent video cables from online, but in my opinion its not really needed yet as not many games out now really need it yet.  Although through firmware updates later might change this.

2. Gameplay:  this is the Wii's strong point.  First off, the Wii is the first system to come packaged WITH a free game since.. the SNES years and years ago.  This game is 'Wii Sports', which as the title suggests, is a pack of sports games:  Bowling, tennis, golf, boxing, and baseball.  This is a great showcase for the innovative new controller for the system and they are great fun, even for people who dont like the real-life versions of these games (such as yours truly).  The catch is, the Wii only comes with ONE controller, so to make it a real 'play-with-your-friends' game, you have to shell out another bunch of money for additional controllers ([...] for the wii-remote, $20 for the 'num-chuck' attachment.. which is only needed for the boxing part of Wii-sports, so you could pass on that if necessary).
The system also accepts Gamecube games, and those games will require Gamecube controllers (which the system has 4 built-in ports for), along with the Gamecube memory cards (of which the Wii has slots for 2). -- and while i'm in that general area.. NOTE:  the Wii does NOT play DVDs.  Although Nintendo MAY decide to add this feature later on.  This is not too much an issue though as most people these days have at least one DVD player in the house already, if not more.

3.  Control
  The Wii-remote (Wiimote?) is probably one of the most notable 'differences' with this system.  It looks like a standard remote control, and has an 'optional' Num-Chuck attachment that connects to the bottom of it with a wire.  You pick options on the screen with a pointer, which you move about by pointing the wii-remote at the screen.  The wii-mote is equipped with motion sensors, and thus provides most of the Wii games to use a much more interactive way to play the game, such as actually swinging the Wiimote like a sword to slash the sword in the game.  This of course could be a hinderance to some game-players, and it does take some getting used to, but in the end it generally makes gaming quite a bit more fun, and in most cases more intuitive.  The controller uses 2 AA batteries, and the provided ones are standard, so if you want a 'rechargable' option you'll have to provide those yourself.
4. other stuff.
  Mii's:  one of the 'channels' in the Wii system is the 'Mii' channel.  A Mii is a graphical avatar that you create with a variety of options to make it look somewhat like you (or not).  This 'Mii' then will start showing up in games that support the Mii feature (such as Wii Sports), you can make quite alot of different Mii's, and you choose one within the game(s) to represent you.  If you're connect to the net and have the Mii's Mingle option turned on, they'll 'roam' onto your friend's Wii where they can save it to their system and it (your Mii) will start showing up in their game(s) too.  Upto 8 Mii's can also be downloaded to the Wii-remote and transferred to other systems that way too.
  like Internet:  the wii does NOT have a built-in network adaptor (wired), instead it has a wireless connection.  This has its pluses and minuses, that is, its fine and very easy to hook up IF you have a wireless router, if you dont have a wireless router, then you'll either have to get one, or get Nintendo's USB-WiFi adaptor that it orginally had marketed for the DS.  Once you are connected, you can befriend other friends' Wii's (once you exchange system friend codes) and such.  Later on when Nintendo gets the respective services going, you'll be able to check news and weather channels too.. and a web-browser (which is supposedly going to be free until Jun/jul '07).  The system DOES have optional parental controls for those who are concerned.  As far as 'what type of news' will show up in the news channel... no one can say at this point, we'll have to wait and see.
There is also the Virtual Console and the Wii Shop..
The Virtual Console (VC) is where users can download and play a variety of games from earlier systems, namely the orginal NES, the SNES, the Sega Genesis, and the TurboGrafx 16 systems.  They all cost from [...] in 'Wii points' (which are roughly 1 point=1 cent ) which can be purchased through the system or in-store via point-cards.  The Wii-shop is where you can buy these games, and/or more Wii-points, and eventually dl the browser and other utilities once Nintendo makes them available.

By and large, the system is ..GREAT, and at approx. [...] you can't go wrong...

author: Marc Paul Green
title: It's great, when people are around
content:
I was the guy who sat in front of a game store 230am on black friday to get the Nintendo Wii, so that should tell you how much I wanted this system.  Like most things, you play the system a lot and then you start to realize something.  When it's just you in front of the Wii, it's not all that fun.

The Nintendo Wii was made to show off at parties.  Let people stand around and watch you act stupid and have lots of fun, but when the parties over and it's just you then you'll find yourself playing VC games and wondering why you bought that part game that never gets played anymore.

There's a couple things to remember about the Wii.  It is the only system that actually makes money from each purchase.  Nintendo chose to charge an extra $40.00 for the system so that they could make real profit.  In doing so, they've made us spend $249.99 on a system that does not do anything in HD, and a system that has far too many DS game ports to the Wii.  No 3rd party company is taking the system seriously, so we find ourselves looking at games that quite frankly are terrible.

I hope that 2008 will be the year Nintendo actually shows us some great games for the Wii.  Until then I can endorse the system, but only if your not the only person playing it.  If you are one of those alone people, then perhaps you should either stick with your computer or spend the $249.99 on a number of nice dates.

author: Mikhael
title: My Wii buying experience
content: Though I have to return it for some power problem, Amazon's customer service handled it perfectly. They sent the replacement ASAP, no questions asked. Additionally, I was able to use my deferred payment credit card. Wii is a great game console!

author: JOANIE WOOD
title: Five Stars
content: Great

author: Alex R ☆
title: No problems
content: Works great but was used

author: Heather
title: Wouldn't buy
content: The controller was chewed up by a dog or something. Everything was DIRTY!! But I guess it works. Was fast shipping.

author: della
title: Does not work!!!!
content: Don't buy it, they didn't even give me my refund.

author: S. Vallieu
title: Fun, fun, fun!
content: Everything we expected.  Completely as advertised.  A family item that is getting used heavily.  The game included, Wii Sports, is easy enough for our six year old, and challenging enough for my gamer husband.  He can't beat her at bowling, and it is driving him nuts! :)  Highly recommend for families.

author: Randall Catalano
title: Great fun for a couple
content: The basic Wii sports games are fun for the beginner and especially for a couple who likes a little competition.  It's an excuse to do something active rather then sitting in front of the TV like a pair of drones.  Although there many helpful tips on the internet about the games, it would have been helpful to list the basic functions of the remote controller affecting each game.  For instance, I still havent figured out how an inside slider configured on the controller becomes a fast ball right down the middle of the plate for a home run.

author: dls
title: worked
content: I have 3, product  was as described.  have a daycare and needed more one system for the kids.  I use mine for exercise and didn't  want them use my best system.  works fine for them

author: C. Ziers
title: I love this console!!!
content: It's SO much fun. I adore playing with this... It is so interactive and gets you uup off of the couch to play a video game... Since I got it for free I got it at a GREAT price... lol... If you have any questions feel free to AIM me at : CCMZ12

author: Matt
title: Not your average  game console.
content:
I love my wii. I love it enough I purchased one for my parents. The game play varies from fun games to play with friends to entertaining enough to play alone. I do wish the console played DVDs.

The controls are a huge step forward versus analog sticks and d pads and my favorite games are the simple things like wii sports and Olympics.

Always fun.

author: V. racanelli
title: brings new dimension to gaming....
content:
When a frieind of mine loaned me his system about a year ago(2008), I thought it sucked and definitely not worth the $200.00plus.
I found the motion tracking to be awful! and could'nt get into it because of it. You might as well just push buttons instead, like classic controller games. I thought the idea was great but the technology was not up to par... at that time....
Recently however my girlfeind started bugging me into getting her one for xmas, but I was not so keen on it. But then I heard about the sports resort with the new motionplus, so, I decided to give it another try. My friend lent me his console once again but this time using motionplus/sports resort.....

WOW! now we're talking!
I no longer think of wii as a gimmick, but a taste of reality of future home entertainment!
NINTENDO--BRAVO !!!!!!!
of course ps3 and xbox will now be forced to get into the action, but I must declare a big thankyou to nintendo for taking a chance and opening the doors to a new world!!!

I have to admit as extra bonus I notice it brings family together having fun while at the same time actually making it feel like you had a workout to a certain degree(definitely more than just sitting on your couch pressing buttons)

Now, can't wait to get my hands on wii fit plus

author: momof2girls
title: Great fun for the whole family
content: This is our second Wii. We bought our first one second hand. This one works great and we can even watch our Netflix instant movies through it with a special CD from Netflix. The Wii remote is the tv remote, too! Many games from Harry Potter to Wii Fit Plus keep everyone entertained and some even keep you active! A great way to entertain and learn.

author: jamie jo
title: misleasing!
content: very misleading. only received a console with dirty scuffs,  and packing bubbles. no controller, no sensor bar, no cables... pretty miffed.

author: dariannie
title: Awesome product!!
content: I got a wii like 4 years ago there was period of time where me and my sisters lost interest of the thing but recently we began to play again and it still works great and I love it.

author: Bridget H. Shea
title: Best Gaming System
content: You simply can't go wrong with the Wii.  It is an interactive family fun experience.  From creating your own Mii character to compete with to playing with friends and family to playing solo - it's all a blast.  We have so much fun with every game we have purchased so far and even just with the Wii Sports disc that comes with the Wii.  You will have to purchase (at least) one additional controller and nunchuck to play most games with someone else, but it is well worth it!  This is by far the best gaming system out there and the best one I have ever played! :)

author: Master K
title: Wii Console
content: Fun for the whole family. Love all the Wii sports but also love playing Bully (not included) You can find most of the games available for other game systems adapted for Wii play.

author: C. Walton
title: Wii is the winner
content: Having played all 3 next gen systems, I honestly think Nintendo will win this generation. They have innovated like nothing I have played before. I have been playing games for over 20 years and to me the Wii is the biggest leap in the way we interact with games since the invention of the gamepad and the 8-bit NES. PS3 , X360...nice for what they are but not much new in the way you actually play the games...im not impressed. After all I have been playing games in high resolutions for many years on my PC and those 2 systems bring nothing to the table that my PC cant. But nintendo took a different approach , and its like a breath of fresh air. Incredibly fun, interactive , simple to use. In my opinion a homerun ...I cant wait to see what kind of games can be made in the hands of talented developers...

author: AZ Desert Rat
title: Didn't think I'd like it this much!
content:
Well I've had the Wii Console and Wii Fit for almost a month now.  I can't say enough good things about it.  First, let me say that I'm 67 years old.  I was tired of sitting around playing and surfing the web and wanted to get off my butt.  It is the summer here in AZ and the weather is not too conducive to long outdoor activities.  The Wii fills the bill for having fun while getting fit.  I enjoy the Wii Sports that came with the console and purchased the Wii fit and love doing it every day.  I have lost weight and seem to be getting more balanced (if you have the Wii Fit you know what that means).

I just received the Wii Sports Resort game a couple of days ago and played it today. Extremely entertaining.  When I stopped working out/playing today the system told be I had been playing for 3hrs and 37 minutes.  I got carried away. But I feel great and have felt good for the rest of the day, probably due to the fact I got some good exercise. This has been great fun for me.  Even for a friend that came over and we bowled together.  Highly recommend!

author: Nana
title: EXCELLENT FAMILY FUN
content: The best family fun since drive-in movies.  My family loves it and are finally off the couch and playing together.  My husband down to the 4 year old granddaughter.

author: Brian Koch
title: Not Anything Like the Other Games in Town
content:
I have had pretty much every major gaming system since the Atari and as a kid, Nintendo, the original Sega, Sega Genesis, Super Nintendo, and the original PlayStation took up most of my free time...then I went to college and the Xbox came out, so of course I got one of those too...maybe that has something to do with the fact that I have now been a computer programmer for over 6 years now.

Then along comes the Wii.  At first I was not really on board, growing up with a regular controller and making fun of the people that always used to turn the controller thinking it would somehow help them out.  But then I went to a friend's house and played some of the games and it was amazing.  I swing, my character swings, I turn the wheel, my car turns, I point at something on the screen and hit my button and things happen.  But probably the best part is that others that do not like having to learn all of the buttons and joysticks of the old style controls don't have to, for many of the games you just need to move the remote and hit one or two buttons and you are playing.

Basically if you want a system that non-gamer friends can come over and pick up very quickly that offers a multitude of party friendly, easy to pick up titles, you can't go wrong with the Wii.  It is also a better option if you are busy and don't have hours every day to master games, because many of the games don't require a huge time investment to learn and have fun playing, like Mario cart, Wii Sports, or Lego Star Wars all of which I was able to quickly pick up and actually do stuff before I really had any idea what it was I was suppose to be doing...the frustration level of the games I have played so far is much lower than the majority of the hundreds of games I have had in the past.

So if you are looking for a fun, easy to learn, multi-player friendly system that offers the newest adventures of some of the all time best characters ever created, look no further than the Wii.

author: Jose A. Rivera
title: Nintendo is great!
content: I changed from consoles to PC a long time ago, because I thought that everything was going to be possible in a PC, but this time I had to go back and buy a Nintendo again..hehe.  It's just amazing, it is so much fun that any other system.  Graphics are not all for me, I play even games from the first Nintendo, so I just look for fun.  Other thing is that you must have a Nintendo in order to play Zelda, my favorite.  I recommend this product, it is really amazing and nice for exercising too.  100% recommended.

author: J. Phillips
title: My 7-year old nephew loves his Wii
content: The wii is so much fun.  It allows everyone to participate.  I can play tennis with my nephew and we both are equals on the court.  I can work on my topspin and power serve and still play with him.  We have such a good time I actually got my 85-year old father to play. Although he wishes he was 10 years younger so he could enjoy it more.

author: Leon
title: Works great despite it being used!
content: Works beautifully. Im playing it right now. It plays games great and i have no problem with it. It had no issue syncing another remote. It has no problems.

author: Austin S
title: Way better than expected
content: I received the wii in amazing condition! It seems like it is new! I highly recommend it!

author: Psych Doc
title: Great Overall Entertainment System
content: We've come to buy this system after our adult children told us how much fun the games are to play.  They were right - great for all members of the family

author: Samantha Elder
title: Great fun for everyone, but does need a few improvements
content:
Right when I picked up the controller and began playing this game, I immediately started having fun. The only game I've played on it so far is Wii Sports, and I can't stop! I've had friends over and we play all of the games. Even golf (a sport I suck at) was fun for me! It's really a game for all ages. My 5 year old nephew has played everything and is actually doing better than most of the adults. He has also tried racing games and even my mom has bought a game for herself (that's an accomplishment since she's definitely not the video game type).

My only problems are with the controller. In golf, when you try to lightly tap the ball into the hole, it doesn't work. It just doesn't seem to pick up the movement until you move your hand backwards. That's also a problem (inverting the motion of the controller). Even if you start with your hand positioned exactly as the character's, it can invert the motion, or not even pick it up.

Also with boxing, it really can't seem to pick up the motion very well at all. We figured out the main problem is that we are punching too quickly, but even when slowing down, the controller doesn't always pick up the motion. Also, when trying to block, holding your hands completely together doesn't put your character's arms together. We realized that the only way for the characters to block is by crossing our arms. Nothing is in the way when this happens either, so it's pretty frustrating.

And in bowling, the ball will curve to the left, even when someone is holding their arm completely straight, or even try curving their hand towards the right.

Besides all those minor problems, the Wii really is fun. Everyone has really gotten into the game and made their own characters. (Which is also a fun process).

author: mandy morlan
title: Was better then i was expecting for refurbished
content: Great conditon

author: Mark my Words
title: Complements a gaming PC well
content:
I think this was the perfect gaming system for me.  I have a fairly high end SLI equipped gaming PC running a 30" Dell monitor. So, as far as top of the line graphics for action games, MMOs and whathaveyou, I don't need a console.

However, the Wii complements the gaming rig nicely given the controls and interface.  Naturally, the graphics are 2 generations behind in complexity, but this is more than made up for by the fun factor of the games.

Also, if you are trying to get someone that isn't into video games to start playing, this is your gateway drug.  It certainly isn't Crysis, WoW or Halo3 which probably would reinforce the negative aspects of video gaming to those that might be coming in with a negative vibe.  The reason is that the games are ridiculously simple.  Wii baseball, for example only has pitching and batting, you don't have to deal with all the 'usual' complexity of fielding, base-stealing, substitutions and so on.  You just swing the bat, that's it!  Trust me, put that controller in their hand, load up Wii sports and watch the addiction start :)

author: Thomas F. Heaney
title: Tons of Fun
content:
The Wii may not be for the hardcore gamer but the ability to play with friends/family make it more than just a videogame system.  While $249 is not necessarily cheap, the fun you will have in a few weeks more than makes up for it.

P.S. Buy Zack and Wiki

author: Yashi
title: Five Stars
content: In love with my WII still

author: Mark Mac
title: Greatest All-Around System So Far
content: I've had 3 Wiis so far and it always does exactly what I expect of it. Currently I am using the Wii for the Wii Fit Plus to help with my daily workout routine. The games are fun to play and the system easily works with all it's accessories (Wii Fit, Controllers, Sensor Bar). Honestly this system was made correctly and right now it's even priced very well. I know that the Wii U just game out but not sure if I really need to go there yet. I have a PS3 and a Wii and honestly in terms of controller oriented combat games, the PS3 is a little better because it has the network and players for online games, however the Wii has different controllers that you can use to play for controller intensive games.

author: C. D. Parham
title: Great fun!
content: The Wii is a ton of fun for the whole family!  Kids, parents, grandparents.....there's fun competition for each of the games and it gets the family up and moving around!

author: E.B.
title: Wicked-Awesome System
content: The Wii is an awesome system. It only lacks an arsenal of great games. Nintendo has created a lot of good games (Wii Play, Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess) but other game developers have yet to master the art of creating Wii games. The controls for some of the games are sloppy and the graphics are terrible for some of them. But there are a lot of good games coming out soon. The fun of the Wii Remote and Nunchuck definately make up for the lower quality graphics.

author: Tracy
title: AWESOME!!!
content: We all LOVE this gaming system!! I highly recommend it. My 3 year old even gets in on the action!!!

author: Aaron Felker
title: Perfect for EVERYBODY!
content:
The Wii is Nintendo's entry into the 7th Generation of video game consoles.  While it does not boast the graphical innovation of the Playstation 3 or Xbox 360, it does provide a refreshingly different style of gaming with it motion sensitive controller.  The Wii Remote, nicknamed the "Wiimote", allows the gamer to operate in 3D space.  Instead of simply hitting buttons, you can swing, shove, and twirl the remote to simulate a baseball bat, a sword, or anything else you can think of.

Also an interesting feature of the Wii is "Wii Channels".  Each channel has a specific function, such as a game channel, a forecast channel, and even an internet channel.  However, note that'll you'll need a USB adapter or Wireless Router for channels that require an internet connection.

WiiConnect24 is the name given to the service that puts the Wii in Standby mode, which allows it to receive updates and messages.  From personal experience, I don't recommend keeping the Wii in standby.  My Wii would heat up after leaving it in standby overnight.  After a little research, I found out this was common, but I'd rather not take the chance.  The main reason for this, I believe, is the lack of a running fan during Standby mode.

Wii is a great system for never-touched-a-video-game-before novices and more experienced gamers alike.  While I'm not a "hardcore" gamer, I do enjoy it and try to keep up with the latest advancements.  My mother and father on the other hand try to steer clear of most "technological" things.  It wasn't long, however, until they were up and playing with the Wii and having just as much fun as I was.

Overall, this is a great system with a fairly descent line up of games.  I would recommend "The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess" as a starting game, along with the packaged "Wii Sports".  I definitely give the Wii 5 starts and two thumbs way up.

author: HeatherBug
title: Everything
content: The system itself looks good, but it didnt even come with the game! It was supposed to come with wii sports, i would like to be sent the game. That is the entire reason i bought this specific wii.

author: Ronald E Bessey
title: Replaced my former WII which no longer worked but had ...
content:
Replaced my former WII which no longer worked but had seen years of service.
It arrived on time and family members are enjoying all the old games again.

author: M. G. Robertson
title: Five Stars
content: I was amazed to be the movements in my US home while in France.  Great products. Thank you.

author: D. McManus
title: great for families with disabilities
content: My family and I enjoy time together playing this. It is alsovery beneficial to my autistic daughter. It teaches her hand eye coordination, works on her digital dexterity, is great for breaks and behavior modification at home and at school. It also helps with her social skills

author: Stephen Sarrica
title: Wonderful product!
content:
The more I play the Nintendo Wii, the more impressed I am.  The lights on the remote to indicate which player you are, the speaker in the remote, and the force feedback are all nice touches.  There is some quirkiness with the remote's sensitivity at times -- especially with the infrared-based pointing function (that is the reason for the slight deduction).  A lot of thought went into the product and its design and it shows.  The price point is another delighter.

Wii Sports is much more entertaining than you'd think it would be.  The kids have also enjoyed a couple of rented games (Raving Rabbids and fighting game whose name escapes me at the moment).

The ability to play GameCube games and use GameCube controllers is also quite handy.

author: Cecelia McConkey
title: Bowling and Tennis Champ in Ballston Spa
content: My husband and I have enjoyed this so much.  Every day we have a bowling match.  He has not done the tennis yet.

author: KevBon
title: Nintendo is back on top!
content: Nintendo has scored big with the Wii.  It is a system that has gotten me, my 5 year old son and my wife to spend some good quality time together having fun.  Zelda is excellent and my son loves it!  Wii sports has gotten two 34 year old couch potatoes off the couch and into the action. Nintendo should have better third party support this time around. Buy this system and prepare to be entertained because that is what video games are about..entertainment, not just looking great.  Buy the component cables for this to improve clarity if you have a HD or ED tv.  I really don't think you can go wrong with this home run hit from the big N.

author: Tipster32
title: If you never played a video game - this is your console!
content:
Want Grandma to play a video game with you? Tired of flashy things like graphics, gameplay, story and sound? Tired of the common drinking games and need something new to play with the frat boys? Well - then the Wii is for you. Simply put - the hardware (i.e. the controller) is unique and offers a new feel to playing video games. From there - things go down hill. Almost every game is the same (how many people would REALLY buy bowling games for the fun of bowling and not the controller?) and revolves around showing off the great technology of the controller. However, the games are simple cookie cutters of each other (with some limited exceptions)and there isn't one that stands out on it's own merits.

I own all 3 consoles (PS3, Xbox 360, Wii) and have a 12 year old son. The Xbox 360 is playing 75% of the time, the PS3 about 20% and the Wii gets the last 5% when Grandma comes over and everyone is tired of playing cards. The Wii is a perfect example of hype and "keeping up with the Joneses" helps sell items. Like the Tickle Me Elmo of old - the Wii continues to sell becuase they are hard to get - thus fueling the "I want" feeding frenzie. If you want a 'game and media' console, get the 360 or even the PS3 (though I'd argue that the game selection and online offerings of the 360 should make it the first pick). If you want a cool tech demo that Grandma can play - then the Wii is for you.

author: Technoboy
title: Wii is the best of the three next gen consoles, period.
content:
Although the graphics are not as good as PS3 and XBOX360, the playability, useability and fun factor of Wii quite simply can't be touched by the competition.

When you play a Wii game like Zak & Wiki and experience first hand the fine 3-dimensional response of the system you know that you are dealing with something the others just cannot match in form, function and FUN.

PS3/X360 are interactive 2D systems with 3D graphics.  The Wii is a 3D interactive system with 3D graphics.  Makes good sense to me.  What's more is Wii is a breeze to use and play.  And the channels are terrific too!  Buy and enjoy one now for you and your family/friends.

Wii is a Wiinner.

author: exercise time
title: Bringing action to action games
content: I purchased this as a present for my spouse and quickly found myself addicted as well.  I love how the games make you a part of the action rather than just a passive member.  I'm looking forward to the next generation of this gaming system.

author: Robin
title: Cheap for a reason
content: Comes without cables and there was still other user info and a couple screws unscrewed...........

author: Edward Cullen
title: The truth
content: I recently got a wii for christmas (thanks mom) and was so happy since I wanted it since it was released to my surprise it wasn't what I was expecting the box itself is heavy but when you open it the wii system itself is very small,you get the adapter, the nunchuk as well as the cheap sensor bar and wii remote with jacket,and I swear it comes with a big ass instruction manuel its like they use the entire tree to make that one book alone.when i finally got everything together i started to play wii sports which you also get in the box, once you put on the wii you'll notice the graphics are just plain bad this was expected but I didn't know it look worst then expected, then I notice that you have to press the A button about a million times before you can actually start to play the game,the wii looks bad on hdtvs even with a 480p wired it looks like okay crap,but on a conventional tv's the system looks fine,Once again nintendo will cheat you out your money this is because of the all the accessories you'll gonna need first you need a charger for your wii remote  seeing that they give u two AA batteries, if u want to play gamecube games you'll in luck cuz the wii has it built in, but what they dont tell you is that you'll gonna need a gamecube remote as well as a memory card for the gamcube since the wii does not except gamcube saves,the wii itself is not that good to begin with, the menu is slow it does not play dvds or cds im sick of nintendo making cheap systems,if you want good gameing get a xbox or ps3 if you want oldschool gameing get a wii.when the wii system comes out with more games a built in cd dvd bluray player as well as hd games, i might buy one.

author: Ann Nonymous
title: The Wii is the next generation now
content: This station is the best station yet to come to the market, in my opinion. In the beginning, there was only one way to play games. Now, with the Wii, we have a whole new way to play games. The other new stations out, the PS3 and the XBOX 360 are okay enough, but how many kids can play them. Many of the games for these stations are more adult-oriented, and the Wii is more for everyone.

author: LFGD1978
title: The Wii is fun and Innovative to a point
content:
I pick up a couple of this consoles for my two nephews and after watching the entire family having fun (including my mother who never lay a hand on a video game console before) I decided to get one for myself. after trying the thing at home accompanied by my girl and some friends I have to admit, the Wii still was fun. But when I try to play by myself I realize that I look like a mental patient plus I get tire of swinging my arms just for the character hit a ball.

  So the way I see it the Wii is fun and innovative to a point because the technical specs are not worthy to be call next generation (looks like they just jam an improve version of the old Gamecube inside the Wii), for me it was fun to play with family and friends not when you are alone. In the contrary the way you play the games its really innovative, but to be honest it gets old really quickly.

  Maybe I'm to old for this console in fact if you look at the game list, its clear that Nintendo intended this console to be for kids. I keep my Wii as a novelty or party trick if you will since I don't use it very often.

Mean while I get my game on my xbox360 he understand that I just want to play High Definition, awesome graphics, online first person shooters and car racing games, all that while sitting in my lazyboy.

  This is a good choice as a family fun game or for small kids, but for true gamers or people ages 16 to 35 this console will be a waste of time and money.

author: Edward Rudolph
title: WOW, Indeed your moneys worth
content:
Ok, Where should I start.  Nintendo was the one to revolutionize every controller that Xbox and Sony ever picked up.  Who had the thumb sticks first???? NINTENDO.  So, with that being said.......you will more then likely see sony and xbox come out with something very similar to what you get when you buy the Wii.

I stood in line for 16 hours, slept 3 hours of it on a cold concrete walk out front of my local best buy. ( I really wanted to make sure I got a system). Came home after buying all the things to get the Wii running and hooked up so the whole family can play.(ie. Extra remotes, 2gb mem card, and 3 games). The wife was not fond of the money that was spent on the system and the games, until she played it for the first time.  On the games we have played the remote response has been great, the graphics are good, and the time the family spends together playing it each night is priceless.  I give the Wii system 2 thumbs up plus some.  I recommend this system to anyone that I talk to.  You will get your moneys worth plus out of the system.  Who cares if it does not play blu-ray dvd's.  Blu-Ray = problems.  Nintendo did a great job again on another awesome system.  Get this before blowing the money on the PS3 which is going to have nothing but problems, just read the reviews on it.

author: PURPLEGAL
title: WII
content: I BOUGHT THIS FOR MY DAUGHTER FOR CHRISTMAS AND IT DOSE NOT WORK,HAS NOT SINCE SHE GOT IT,MY DAUGHTER HAS NOT BEEN HAPPY AT ALL.BUT GUESS YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR,HUH

author: M. Pavlak
title: What happened?
content:
I noticed that my prior review of the system hasn't been posted.

I mean, I totally understand if it is all about the profit margin, Amazon.com, but seriously, the Wii is garbage.

Or rather, Nintendo is garbage. I was loyal to them ever since the original 8-bit NES came out. But now?

They won't even let me get into the Wii Shopping center, and they TOOK MY MONEY WITHOUT GIVING ANYTHING IN RETURN. You know, like the points I should have received. Or access to the Wii Shop at ALL.

I know that nowadays freedom of speech is a questionable thing at best in the USA, but as a United States Soldier, I find this just a little bit disappointing.

Seriously?

My comrades deserve better than this, and not all of us are stupid enough to not understand the concept of exchanging things considered to be of value for other things that are considered to be of value. Like money.

But to be fair, I'm just going to write this off as a loss. And I will never buy another Nintendo product as long as I live.

Luckily for Nintendo, I might get nailed by an IED in the next year or two, so I doubt they would care too much about me as a lost customer.

author: Beth D
title: just what I needed
content: I only need a new player, not the rest of the package. Reburbished game came quickly and as described. Saved myself $100 by buying a refurbished player rather than a new set.

author: nina kaganova
title: i love
content: i  love  it

author: Kayla smith
title: Five Stars
content: Loved it

author: Reader&Viewer
title: Good
content: My kids adore their new Wii. I was really on the fence about buying this or another console but I'm glad we went with this one. Works great, is easy to use (we also Netflix on it) and my kids love it. The only problem is them fighting over who gets to play it next. Was delivered quickly and in flawless condition.

author: Al
title: It did not work with super smash brothers at all
content: It did not work with super smash brothers at all!!!! worked with every other game. I had to go to game stop 4 times thinking that the used games were damaged until I went to a game stop in cross county mall and an amazing manager helped me to that point that she gave me a Great deal on another machine and tested it out to make sure that it worked with super smash brothers. IF YOU ARE BUYING THIS FOR SUPER SMASH BROTHERS MAKE SURE THAT IT IS THE BLACK WII OR A NEWER MODEL OF THE WII. Older models can not read the disk of super smash brothers

author: Steven Wevodau
title: Wii Review - Steven Wevodau - Little Disappointed
content:
I purchased the Wii for my children last Christmas.  They had a Playstation and I thought this would be a great upgrade and they'd enjoy the new features you can only get with the Wii.  Big Disappointment.  The Wii gets old very quickly.  The Wii game selection is only a fraction of what you can get with other gaming systems like the PS.  I think this console is more for teens/adults and social gatherings and not for everyday playing of sports, etc.  Therefore, looks like we'll be putting out [...] again this Christmas for the PS3....plus games - cha ching.  Lot's of hype over this console - it is pretty neat - but gets old very quickly.

Just my experience / opinion.

Steven Wevodau
[...]

author: namzaps
title: Wanted to sell on eBay - made the mistake of opening the box to test it out.  Made additional mistake of letting my wife try it.
content:
We got our Wii on the launch day after spending a few hours in line the previous week to reserve it.  Initially, I wanted to re-sell the unit on eBay and then pick one up for myself next year after the initial kinks get worked out.  I noted the box could be opened and the items removed without breaking any shrinkwrap, so I decided to briefly test out Wii sports and make sure everything was working.  I also invited my wife to try it our since she is not really an avid gamer (other than a few DS games and the Sims/Animal crossing on the Gamecube.)

Those 2 mistakes ended any idea of parting with the unit on eBay - at any price.

There are lots of good reviews of these systems on gamespot and IGN.  If you are trying to decide whether to get a console and which one that is largely a matter of taste.  For us - we like party games, both with sober family or the occasional inebriated friends.  I've tried playing golf with non-gamers before and it has never been much success - you know "push up then down then back up and press these buttons" etc falls on deaf ears.

There is nothing to "teach" on how to play the Wii.  My dad who, never plays videogames but likes to go bowling is a great example.  He normally scores around 220 in real life.  The first and only time he bowled on the Wii (it was a short visit) he scored a 217.  That was higher than any of the rest of us scored - and in real life hah hah that is about right.  So if that is any measure of how well the controller works, you have to conclude it works great.

If you are lucky enough to score a Wii - pick up Raymin Rabbids with it too.  The party games are awesome.  Can't really explain why they are so much fun since they are borderline ridiculous - never-the-less my wife can't stop playing and the rail-hunt shooting rabbits with toilet plungers has yet to grow old.

author: jack sparrow
title: Wii
content: This is a white nintendo wii.It has many fun games and more. But most of the games are also on ds. But it is still fun.See ya

author: Tyler Vantine
title: One Star
content: I ordered a backwards compatible Wii. The one i received was a standard Wii.

author: Emmy
title: Excellent Service
content: I bought this system thinking that something would be wrong with it since it was used but I was surprised when I received the product. It was packaged nicely and all the parts were in very good condition. I received my purchase in a timely manner and now I can enjoy playing Mario and Donkey Kong!!!

author: zen
title: ABSOLUTELY PERFECT
content: So...the last time I played Nintendo in my own home on my own console I was 12 years old I believe playing Super Mario Bros when it has first come out. I am now 31 and really wanted to connect to my girlfriend who was playing this stupid Farmville-like game... So to to interact with her -yes agreed it's sad,  I went to get this bundle. Let me just say, we opened it up yesterday and we had the best night! I know the WII U is out but really this is all I need. I have Hulu plus on here. It connects to your wifi...it is easy set-up and it was only 129.00 so I bought Mario and we played both. I also bought another controller (generic version but works perfect and is cooler than the one that comes with it) It is cool because you can "multiplay" so Mario and Luigi didn't have to wait for the other to finish. We really had a blast and I am ready to play again tonight. If you want to connect and get off your behind get this Wii. I do triathlons and I was sweating during boxing last night.  The wii even offers all the old games on the console to buy right there. It really is amazing and fun. I would HIGHLY recommend this as a gift for ANYONE! Oh, and when we were tired and wanted to keep playing it prompted us to take a break. A console that reminds you to live without it for a second is pretty darn awesome!

author: tina
title: My two boys love this came extra fast with NO issues they play ...
content: My two boys love this came extra fast with  NO issues they play it a lot. was half the price of most gaming systems would highly recommend this to anyone planning on buying one..

author: Liz
title: Disapointed
content: I thought that I bought the Wii with the sports included I was surprised that they had it at a very low price 130 well the thing was it wasn't as advertised on this page I bought from this location and it came down that the Wii did not had the sports game seriously I won't recommend it

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: Product worked and is perfect. The shipping was within estimated time and I would buy from again.

author: Scruffles01
title: The Perfect Addition to Family Game Night
content: The Wii gaming system is a perfect fit for the little or big kids in your family.  The Wii has an extensive collection of very kid friendly games as well as games for the adults in the house. It allows up to four players for a lot of the games to make it a center piece for family game nights!

author: Sonnel
title: VIdeo Console
content: Wii is fun and it can connect to the internet if you have wireless internet at home. Play remotely with other players, create your own profile.

author: Justin Bailey
title: Wii is frikin sweet, and if it's messed up your replacement is free and quick !!!
content: So, I've had my Wii for about 2 months now and it is an awesome experience. I've got Wii Sports, Zelda Twilight Princess, and Madden 2007 and the new control schemes used make for a fun experience. I can't really say much for the online elements since the wi-fi hardware on my Wii is working improperly, but I can say that Nintendo's customer service is A+. After reporting that hardware error to Nintendo a new system was sent out a couple of days ago and should be here today. That means I've still got my Wii to play now, I get a fixed one at no kind of charge, and all I have to do is stick my broken Wii back in the box the new one comes in and slap an included shipping label back on !!!! Wii rocks !!!!

author: Karol

content: The one thing I like most about this game is the exercise you get that you would not get from most games. I like the WII and would recommend it to anyone.

author: Andres Eloy Marquez Quintero

author: Aaron Dennis
title: I like the Wii
content: It's a Wii. It's great

author: Nathan Knotts
title: Worked like a new machine
content: Console was as advertised. Worked like a new machine. Only complaint would be the shipping box seemed to big.

author: S. Bray
title: Not just another cookie cutter game!!  Buy it!
content:
Disclaimer, I am not a hardcore gamer. I in no way consider myself an authority on game systems.  This is just my humble opinion (simply from a wife and mother's point of view).  :o)

What is most appealing to me is that the wii is starting a wave of new generation interactive game systems.  It is not just "yet another cookie cutter" game.  Don't get me wrong.  I have MUCH respect for all the other game systems.  But the wii finally broke out of the mold.  All game systems have pro's and con's including the wii, but this is a great little system for the money.

* Yes, the graphics won't knock you off your feet - but it's not horrible.
* Yes, the Wii doesn't come with a DVD player - it would be nice but come on, exactly how many DVD players does one household really need? It's a good bet almost every tv in your place already has a DVD player and I'm sure most people have another game system which can play DVD's.  - Not a deal breaker. (Don't quote me on this, but I heard the second generation wii should be able to play DVD's). ???????
* Yes, there should be a better bundle of accessories, at the very least a second remote and nun-chuck and some starter wii points so we can down load a couple of games online, out of the box. And why not have ankle sensors?? - But this keeps the price down a little and I do like the fact you can pick your own accessories and that you aren't stuck with unnecessary items you don't want or don't need.
* Yes, some of the games are pricey for the `game quality / game play' - I suggest reading reviews and maybe trying to rent any game you may question first and try it, before you decide to buy.  Always look for sales / good deals.  Sometimes you can find the game you want for $10 less if you take the time to shop around (especially online).  How good a game is, is in the eye of the beholder.  One person let's say a hard core gamer, may think a particular game sucks, but someone else may really like / love that same game. It all depends on your wants and needs.  Maybe you're a hard core gamer, maybe you're a child, maybe you're a person who loves video games, but didn't play much until now because the other game systems just kept getting more and more complicated, maybe you're an older person who can now play video games with their grandchildren instead of watching on the sidelines.  I'm sure ALL the game platforms have some excellent, good and very bad games. (And yes, we do have an `ok' size library of wii games already).
* Yes, there aren't a lot of dedicated wii games out yet - But they are coming, hang in there.
* Yes, some games are more fun / interesting while playing in a group, than by yourself. - It's also fun when the kids go to bed and the adults have the nerve to get really competitive and silly.  At times we have friends over and the testosterone between the men start flying. At times you can get so engrossed in the games you almost forget it's not an Xbox or PS3.
* Yes, it sucks that some of the games (designed for multi-players) you can only play in a one player mode until you beat a certain amount of levels to unlock a `code', then other players can join in. - OK --- yes this really does suck! If the game states more than one player can play, then I do expect to be able to play any game in any mode with more than one player. - But at least most of these games have a bunch of mini games included in the software which are multi-player.  This will help with impatient kids.  I do hope they don't make too many more games like that (but that's just me).

Will the wii ever measure up to the Xbox, Playstation and the other's? Most likely not, but the wii has its own niche, which at this point that is not duplicated by any of the other game system platforms.  That alone makes it a stand out game. It get you up off the couch or chair and before you know it, in some cases you've just gotten a nice little work out while actually having fun!!! Shhhhhhhh

It is a nice family game system.  I have a 5 year old daughter and a 6 year son. The whole family including aunts, cousins and grandparents have all joined in on the fun.  But the great thing is it's not just for families.

(Have your cake and eat it too!)  I didn't know this, but there these consoles out there (OK men and hard core gamers, I know you already know these consoles exist. My husband found one of these things online.  This is simply an fyi for out of touch people like myself.) They are system selectors. They are supposed to save you time and trouble. Instead of having to fool around with wires, disconnecting one game system to connect another one, you are supposed to be able to connect them all (depending how many the console supports, the number varies) through a system selector console and choose from any of gaming consoles by pressing a button.  I believe the platforms these consoles are able to support are the PS, PS 2 & 3, Nintendo Wii, Xbox & 360 and GameCube.

These are just my personal little pet peeves (everyone has their own).

- Because I have young children and have found some of the games which are rated "E" for everyone, you would `think' depending on the game content should be easy and fun for kids to play also, but this is not always the case.  Some of these games we have found to be frustrating for the kids.  You don't want any game to be too easy, but they should be fun and not bring kids to tears out of frustration if it received an "E" rating.
- They also have games which again you would think would be geared toward kids, but are rated "E 10+" (suggested for everyone 10 and above) - like Barnyard, Surf's Up, Ice Age 2 and Shrek The Third.  Again, not a big deal, just makes me wonder why themes like these would not be slightly more toned down. Maybe it's more of a `CYA' type of thing??
- I would have personally liked to have seen the Wii have gone one step further at launch with the interactive gear and have introduced / included ankle sensors too.  Since my upper body is already getting a work out by playing most of these games, why not the lower half too.  I would love be able to kick at the TV like I'm pretending to do a karate or soccer kick.  Maybe even some cool dance moves too. Hopefully if enough people inquire about adding a feature like this, they'll do it in the next couple of generations???

Bottom line is it's not an Xbox or Playstation, but you still can't go wrong with buying this unique Nintendo Wii System!  As everyone knows they are hard to find in stock, so grab one when you can.  We found ours just by chance.

I will admit that you shouldn't have to pay more than the $249.00 retail price. That is unless you can find a really great wii game bundle with accessories and games you'll actually use. Other wise just go for the core system and try not to pay more than $249.00 + tax.  Hang in there and just keep looking around, if you're patient and/or one of the lucky ones like us, you'll be able to find the core system for this price.

The only reason why I didn't give this system 5 stars is because even though it's a great system, as with almost anything there is room for improvement.  We'll see what the future brings.

author: DAVID M. PUSKAR
title: Awesome!
content: Thanks! "There is no fear where love exists. Rather, perfect love banishes fear, for fear involves punishment, and the person who lives in fear has not been perfected in love." 1 John 4:18
