Not everyone is a fan of the Wii. Some people have complained of inappropriate weight criteria for determining body mass index. Other claim the price of $250 is too expensive. Still others claim the Xbox 360 offers better game graphics etc.

Nintendo is a reputable company, dynamic in its social responsibility. They are active in the Boys and Girls Club and the United Way. They strongly adhere to copyright laws and the like, realizing the negative affect it has on all those involved.

Personally, the Wii is the best gaming console ever!!!!

R. Manning

author: Jeffrey Timpano
title: Best bang for your buck right now for a game machine
content: Very durable machine (had it almost since it was released).  The family has used it for countless hours and it still works fine.  Game titles made for this have been exceptional and attachments such as WiiFit board means everyone will get a lot of use from this product.  Nintendo is great for having titles the entire family can enjoy adjusted to everyone's ability - Even my niece at 2 years old could participate.  I also have a PS3 but find myself playing the Wii more.  Some great recommended titles for this machine over the years are:  WiiFit, WiiResort, Supermario Galaxy I & II, New Super Mario Bros., WiiKart, Zelda Twilight Princess, Zelda Skyward Sword, Super Mario Bros. Smash Brawl, and Donkey Kong Country Returns.

author: Victoria Tarrani
title: So much fun, and you don't have to walk an 18 hole course!
content:
.
I never dreamed that a TV game could be so much fun, or that I would want to have one to play.  I wish my dad had lived long enough to find that he could still bowl, even thought he couldn't walk any longer.

I'm trying to get my mom one.  There are so many sports games which exclude a handicapped person -- but not when they can play Wii.  It is like you are actually there.

It is, IMO, the best game to come along in years.  I've heard that it is so popular in rest homes you have to book your time and game.  Even the children love it, they can -- and do -- beat their parents and grandparents -- and are actually learning how to play the games that are just too expensive to do.

Bowling used to be affordable, but not now.  Golfing has always been on the high side, so you wouldn't start your little ones off on a dangerous court at that price.  It is great to teach them concentration and "to listen" to the instructions at the beginning of the games, and as you go on.

It is  perfect give for a family of four.  The wonderful bonding in the family is very special.  It is also something that children do not want to lose the ability to play due to bad behavior, so if they lose a day it's hard, but if they lose two in a row, it tends to straighten them up very fast.

The games which come with the game are fun, and there are so many others you can add.  Christmas should be easier this year -- just check out the new games.

Add Tiger Woods Golf to the mix, and have fun.

Victoria Tarrani

author: edward
title: Geme for all ages
content: My wife and I are recently retired. We both highly recommend the Wii game. It keep us physically in shape and mentally alert.

author: Paul Davis
title: AMAZING!
content:
Simply amazing!

This console combine anything you need to entertain yourself, your family, your kids of any age, your parents in law, the grandparents and even the cat.

Smart desing, smart selection of games, (i just got sports, play and zelda), the whole family enjoy fully, the photo applications, the internet, the music, the games, everything in such a high level. The impeccable work of Miyamoto is just a masterpiece.Genius!

Fully recomended. You will not be disappointed.

author: William A. Clay
title: Score one for the BIG-N
content:
I'll be brief: this is a fun machine.

  So far I've played Twilight Princess, Wario-Ware, Sonic and the Secret Rings, and Super Paper Mario (and Wii Sports, Duh).

-I've had a blast with all of them.

-There's so many great titles in the que that my biggest problem will be affording everything that looks cool.

-It's cheaper by a head than the other two competitors.

-It's got those great Nintendo titles, and its success hopes for good third party support.

-The virtual console--and other Wi-Fi internet features--are great too.

Those are a few of the pros.

The cons for the system:

-No Hi-Def Support and Sub-par graphics (would it have killed Nintendo to give the gpu some anti-aliasing??) 480p looks downright nasty sometimes.

-So far alot of the third party games are crap.

-And of course, you can't seem to find the dang thing anywhere; I had to jump through many a hoop to get mine.

Final verdict: If you can find one, get one. The Wii has already given me all the zany postmodern fun that videos games should provide.

Kudos to Nintendo for the clever R&D and marketing on this guy. Now they just need to fix the supply problem.

author: Eric Hwang
title: Inferior Chinese-made junk
content:
After only 8 hours of usage, the Wii died.  First was the remote not working.  After several attempts to resync the remotes, I turned off the console and now it shows a blank TV screen.  Attempts at troubleshooting with every conceivable combination of console, cables and televisions were unsuccessful.  The Nintendo web site was equally useless providing only the same basic information that any nerd would have tried. Is it plugged in?  Do the lights come on?  Really helpful...NOT!  After reading through all the useless recommendations, it finally just says I need to repair it.

But of course, when I enter in the serial number, the web site can't determine if my brand-new console is under warranty.  How lame is that?  Calling the 800 number they provide connects me to what sounds like a fax machine.  Nice bogus support phone number.  If this is the kind of support and quality product I can expect from Nintendo, then maybe I should just return this product.

author: A. Salazar
title: Wii will play wii together!
content: Wii is fantastic... I don't feel like writing much but I've been waiting for it to come out for years, and it has totally blown me away! It's a fantastic console a it really is a new way to play! Everything the Channels, the classic games, the gameplay-- just awesome!!

author: iLOVEit
title: Great for ANYONE!
content: I have recently bought the Wii and I am pretty impressed with the overall performance.  To me, it doesn't really matter about the graphics but it has great graphics for the people who are into that.  I really like the feature that you can move your controller to make you character do certain objects.  It really feels like you are in the game.  I really enjoy this system.  I highly recommend you to buy it.

author: Cathy E. Mayo
title: One Star
content: I finally got one that worked.

author: Ruthie
title: Bought this as a gift and it did not come with codes to get it set up
content: Came with no instructions no paperwork Bought this as a gift and it did not come with codes to get it set up

author: Vin Li
title: Nintendo is working hard to lower costs
content:
I will first start to say that I am a poor guy. Ok, not VERY VERY poor but I am extremely thrifty. I do not buy video game systems. I do not buy video games (I am convinced that I have video game ADD and can not finish a game). With that said, what do I do? I play games with my friends. What do I look for in a game then? Do I really care about HDTV capabiillities? Or if the lighting effect of System A is better than System B? No. I care about playing games with my friends, being able to learn quickly, and having fun. What many of you fail to realize is there are a lot of people just like me. The market of "extreme gamer" isn't that large (my personal speculation, no numbers to back this up; hey, i'm honest). And by "isn't that large," i mean there's no way most of you, who I would classify as "extreme gamers" take up even 40% of the video game market. This results in two very interesting results:

1) price is extremely important. I can't imagine having to drop $50 + tax for each game that i really want, let alone having game prices raise to ~$80 and more. Why will this raise so high? developers need to adapt to new technology, spend more time working, etc. Furthermore, I need HDTV to truly enjoy any of this so called super-duper-graphics-that-none-of-you-can-live-without. Suddenly, if I don't have an HDTV, which I don't, nothing really matters anymore does it? You can't compare graphics on the three systems when you're using a tv that takes the red, white, and yellow plug-ins.

Nintendo is working hard to lower costs. They anticipate a lower costing system and lower costing games.

author: Pookie
title: Wii
content: Fast shipping. Family oriented video game. Highly recommended specially with the current price cut to $ 199. However, you still will pay for additional wii mote, charger, wii balance board and expensive games.

author: unhappy customer
title: false advertisement
content: Products sold on this site should be shown accurately and I want a wii that can play gamecube games not a dumb boring new wii slim I have a gamecube controller memory card and games that is siting on the table waiting to play it on the wii because it's more revolution with gamecube compatible

author: Brad
title: Nintendo's newest gem... amazing.
content: Like most people who first saw the plans for the Wii, i was mad. I didnt like the idea of this controler that looked like a tv remote with no joystick and some corny motion detection. But, I LOVE zelda. So, like most of you I had to get get a Wii even if it were just for Zelda. Then I started watching the videos on [...], and the video about madden. Just watching the people play made me want one. If you think all the motion detection stuff is to good to be true... cast them aside because NINTENDO did it.. works pretty  much flawless. The remotes also have great range. They also put a power button on the remote so you can turn the system on and off with it... simply amazing and for the price.. unbeatable ( the graphics arnt awful either!)

author: Amazon Customer
title: Missing several parts
content: Had to return due to several missing parts

author: aaron stephen
title: Five Stars
content: Perfect gift

author: manhatcat
title: Great system!!!
content: This is a great system for family time-and actually requires your kids to MOVE instead of just sitting!!!

author: PlayboyBunny
title: great
content: I just got it, all the accesoires in the box, all new and great. I cant wait to play all those great sports game it has included in the package.Thank you

author: K. Bales
title: All we hoped it would be!
content: We hadn't actually played the Wii, but friends had told us about it and we loved the idea that you actually had to move around while you played.  The kids love it, and so do we, and I'm glad we get a little exercise out of it instead of only our thumbs moving!

author: Daniel Levitt
title: Perfect
content: What can I say.  The Wii is a revolutionary gaming console that my 6 year-old loves. We have owned this for over a year, and it is going strong.  Hopefully a new updated one will be out soon, as some of the initial quirks need to be worked out, such as the buzzing noise from the disc turning even if games are paused.  The buzzing didn't exist initially, but started after a few months.  The remote sensor bar also doesn't allow enough of a range, and doesn't recognize the remotes if you are more than about 10 feet away.  These are minor issues compared to the positives, so it still is a 5 star product without a doubt.  I think that for kids under 10, the Wii is the best console on the market, but older kids may be more attracted to the PS3.  Cheers.

author: ML
title: Fantastic
content: I bought this game last year. It is more fun than I imagined. Although the graphics are not life like(who needs graphics when you are having fun), this game makes you move and that is important! I guess the next step is really 3 D virtual reality gaming that we saw in movies! Anyways this is fun when you play with your family and friends too. I have given up my plans on Xbox  a long while ago!

author: Himar
title: The best console around
content:
This is the second Wii we buy. Is a great product, with outstaning interactive games. Thw Wii Fit is a must have complement which add more fun and real excersice experience.

One thing to improve: Internet web browser is poor, does not support many dinamic content.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great
content: Great

author: Cordula & Tim
title: Wii an interactive game system for the whole family
content: WOW, The Wii game system is amazing, it's the first game system that let's you get involved with the game's, you end up sweating from playing the sports games and this is a great fun way to spend time together as a family, me my wife and son all love the system and the games....A+++

author: Eddie Khoriaty
title: Wii Console
content: Well built and lots of fun. My son decided to trade it in for an X-box 360 and I actually miss playing the arcade games on it.  I'm thinking of buying another one for myself :)

author: Melanie Abel
title: Great fun!
content:
Get a 2nd controller, makes two player games much better.  Great fun to interact with the video game rather than just push buttons. Also interesting to see what movements trigger the action (e.g. on golf, bring the remote strait down).

Downside: Performing gentle movements don't always trigger the desired result (like gently putting 6 inches can send you into the bunker).

author: J.King
title: Not perfect yet but still a lot of fun
content:
All memebers of our family have been playing together, and that is the strength of this system.  Many of the games may be simple, but almost anyone can participate.  Granda played bowling with his 8 year old granddaughter.  They had a lot of fun so even a technically challenged senior citizen could compete with a more experienced video game playing child.  The 2 youngest, a 5 year old and a 7 year old played boxing.  The 14 year old teenager played all the games but was beaten in golf by his grandfather.  It makes everyone play a physical game and everyone was happy to cheer others while they were waiting their turn.

It will take time for the programmers to hit their stride and make better games.  Still even the simple games are fun and the more experienced players can spend time privately playing more complex ones.  I wouldn't regulate this unit to just the hardcore gamers.

author: Silverwolf Woman
title: I love my Wiii- Wii I am hav ing fun!!
content: I have not had a game system since the sega genisis. I thought It was time for an upgrade. Due to my health issues. I decided on the wii. The doctors told me to keep moving. I only have the game it came with thus far, but I love the boxing.I like beating people up in the game. My negboiri has as much fun as me. I made him a Mini Mii. He awent out and rented the fishing game for the system.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The equipment itself is good so far
content:
The equipment itself is good so far. What is disappointing and misleading are the two pictures of a game included with the rest of the pictures as if they are included...but are not :-(
No reason to show 2 pictures of a game that you are not getting with your order!!!

author: Gertrude L. Crossman
title: Wii
content: The Wii and the Wii Fit is the greatest exercise program I've ever experienced. It's easy to use and lots of fun! The graphics are so interesting and upbeat and the challenges are really good. I'm so glad I got it. Never boring and always something new to look forward to each time I use it.

author: Charlie in Irvine
title: What an Amazing Console.... Did I say That???? Guilty Pleasure
content:
So we unpacked the console that Amazon.com just sent us, with a mix of excitement and wondering whether our expectations (based on previous superlative reviews) would be met. I have to say, being an owner or every console under the sun, that all the reviews are true.

First I have to say on the downside, the graphics are a significant (large) step below the xbox360, but I really believe that Nintendo has hit a nerve on ease of use and changing the paradigm of what a gaming system can be. Why? I have never seen so many people involved in a console, right out of the box! My Wife and Daughter (14 Years) were hooked in about 10 minutes. The wireless remote is brainless.... it just works right out of the box. As an IT professional by career, when does something work out of the box??? In my career next to never.

So it works out of the box.... It's Easy to setup... Its games are fun... What's the downside???? Graphics... They are on the low-end. But Nintendo knew exactly what they were doing.... I'm a gamer, and though I'd never admit it I would buy this unit easily before all my other gaming systems... (which are all stunning in their abilities and output)This console puts the user in the action!

Have a Family? Don't think, just buy it.

Gamer amused by design and interface? Don't think just buy it.

Hardcore Gamer? Buy it after you have run through all the games on your PS3.

This is a guilty pleasure that you'll never tell your friends about. Thanks Nintendo! I say that with a smile on my face!

author: Mariah Smith
title: My review
content: I love the wii its great and fun to play and i recommend that alot of people should buy it

author: kblast523
title: Used by works
content: Great used device.  Had another one that died...this one works.

author: Bill Dover
title: Wii
content: Item was dirty. Packaged terrible.  Broken pieces in box

author: Gregory J. Hammel
title: Worth the wait!
content: Shipping took 3 weeks, but I really wasn’t in a hurry.  Found My old Wii and games and not the cables.  Went to just order cables and seen this console for similar price.  Works.  We are currently enjoying games we haven’t played in years!  Thumbs up!

author: Margaret T. Lamonica
title: Best Family Entertainment
content: I purchased this as a gift for my daughter and her family.  They love it.  It provides exercise that is fun for the whole family.  Highly recommend this product.

author: tony
title: the Wii works
content: the Wii and 5-In-1 Fitness Bundle  worked and is working as it was intended to do. the color is the same as when purchased.

author: Lone Star Penguin
title: The most fun game console
content: The Wii is definitely the most fun game console created to date. I have lived through and experienced every game console created and the Wii tops them all for sheer fun. While it certainly may not have as good graphics as the X360 or the PS3, the innovative gameplay and relatively easy to learn controls make this a game console that everybody wants to play. We have been able to get my mom to play quite a few games and she hates computers/video games (she's easily the loudest player when we play bowling).

author: Timothy P. Little
title: One giant leap for Nintendo
content: The Nintendo Wii is most certainly in a class of its own. It is the first console ever that makes the player move their arms, legs, and other parts of their body. This opens up a world of possibilities for present gaming and future gaming. The Wii is totally focused on allowing the player to freely interact with the game and even other people online. And as I said the possibilities are endless. You can choose to play a variety of sports on Wii Sports and/or the recently released Wii Sports Resort, you can play racing games with the steering wheel (sold separately), go fishing, play on game shows such as Press Your Luck, and much more. Of course, you can do much more than play Wii games. You are also able to play all your old Nintendo Gamecube games. In addition, if you have a wireless network in your area, you can connect the Wii to the Internet to access a wide variety of downloadable content, such as retro NES and N64 games. The web browser (available at the online Wii shopping channel for $5.00) allows you to actually browse through the Internet and is similar to PS3's web browser. If all this were not enough, you receive several Wii "channels" that are preloaded on the system, so even if you don't have web browser, you can still access news and weather from around the world, simply by pointing to virtually any part of the on screen globe. Another Wii channel is the Mii Channel, where you can upload your mii (wii characters that the player creates). If you are looking for the future in gaming and entertainment (or just an inexpensive video game system), consider Wii first.

author: rumba racal
title: fatand happy
content: Mildly competitive but without rancor!  My wife of 52 years and myself are ball room dancers but get very little exercise beyond the Friday night dances.  These games get us on our feet and moving while subtly trying to out perform each other.  The motivation is still there to improve our scores and simultaneously our over all conditioning.  Whether or not it will persist only time will tell.

author: Theresa Johnson
title: Fab!
content:
I'm as far as they come away from a video-game enthusiast, but my husband just turned 45 and LOVES them, so I knew what I had to do to make this the most memorable gift to date.

Wii did not disappoint! We LOVE this system and have averaged at least 4 hours of playtime EVERY day since it was purchased back in early February. I can't tell you what it's done for our social life or how much fun it is to compete against each other one-on-one... you'll just have to buy one and see for yourself. We have a 16 year old daughter with multiple disabilities and even SHE can join in the fun with some of the games like bowling.

I was one of those unfortunate souls who didn't fully appreciate what a game system can actually bring to family/personal relationships and failed to get one when they were first released, but I don't lament having paid twice the regular price for it in order to receive it in time for his birthday. It was WELL worth the difficulty of finding and procuring one; actually gave me quite a sense of accomplisment.

I purchased Resident Evil 4 for it as well as Wii Play and Wii Carnival for his system, in order to give him the well-rounded experience. He loves them all and is actually setting foot in Game-stop stores every week to peruse other titles!

He tells me this was the best birthday present ever (among those of the past which included: Flight time learning to fly a small plane, a high-quality metal detector and hour-long Swedish Massage sessions!) and I couldn't be happier.

author: E.S
title: Fun for all ages
content: Up to now I have never done gaming consoles.  I didn't get into any of the playstations or the Xbox, or anything else.  However the Wii has captured me with its different way of playing.  You can play games like you would for any other gaming console but you also have the interactive motion from the Wii remote.  Playing sports by actually acting them out for me makes video games a lot more fun.  I would recommend everyone to give this a try, even people who have never loved video games can find fun in this.  We have had friends over with children of all ages and everyone has had great fun playing against each other.  I love it and say go and play because wii all want to play!!

author: Anti MTV
title: Wii rules!
content:
I have been a nintendo and a mario fan since I was 7 and I must say this is the greatist nintendo console ever and it has alot of decent fun games. I mainly own a wii for mario games such as: mario kart wii, (it's more fun playing online) super mario galaxy, (can't wait for SMG 2) wario's shake it, super smash bros, super mario bros wii + more. my only complaint is that the physical control movements can sometimes make your wrists sore when you constantly shake the controller but other than that I have nothing else to complain about. I don't believe most people want a wii for all that excercising sport crap but the only sport game I love is the wii sports resorts that ones a fun worthy sport game, But I guess the wii is more appealing to alot of old school nintendo fans such as myself and alot of new or mostly older mario fans, but if your not one of those people who are old school nintendo gamers then you will probably not like the nintendo wii at all.

Anyway I love the wii and Im proud to be a nintendo veteran.

author: julie
title: shipped fast
content: I love the Wii! It works great.  It looked brand new. I've had no problems with it. My family and I play it and always have fun.

author: AV
title: Makes you work hard to win a game!!
content:
I think Wii has brought in a new wave for gaming - making you get off your rear and actually putting an effort into the video game! Very different from the usual "sit-in-front-of-the-TV-and-hit-some-buttons" kind of games. No doubt the graphics are not as exceptional but they are good enough for me. (I own a PSP too)
This is great fun for the whole family and all ages... I like it a lot and play a whole lot with my wife, who normally isnt into gaming.
Wii Fit is an amazing addition (if you can get your hands on it!!)

author: Douglas Ross Mckenzie
title: A system from Nintendo that brings back the old Nintendo gameing days.
content:
In 1985, Nintendo was a powerhouse giving us the orginal Nes , and in 1991 had another bang with SNES.Nintendo did make the N64 which revolutionized 3d graphics period and then came the Gamecube but ir wasnt until 2006 that Nintendo got it's mojo back with this state of the art system.They are now back on top simular to where they were in 1985, in fact Nintendo has beaten both its competetors XBox 360 and PS3 by a milestone why is this you as simple owning a Nintendo is fun again.With motion control and the you are expeirencing the game feel instead of paying it.Why play as Mario when you can be Mario or be Link from Zelda.

With its wi fi connection support built in you can play with people from all over the world, with wii wear you can get classic nintendo console games like Super Mario Bros.The controls at times get hard to get used to but the Wii has games to help you get used to the controls because right now they are unlike any video game system controls.These sports games will get you geared up for when you get and future games, if these controls the wii controller and the nunchuck are not your bag then you can get a regular controller or it as it gives you that option plus you can hook up a gamecube controller with 4 players at a time this system has the best multi player control.The graphics while not as close or superior to its competetors the graphics are beautiful for this system
rent Super Mario Galaxy and you will see very quickly just what these graphics are able to do as they are very impressive.It is not hi def or blue ray capable be in mind this is just a game system and not a cd or
hi def advanced entertainment machine if you want that you should look
at XBox 360 or PS3.The only complaint i would have is that nintendo just dosent get out games fast enough whereas you always see XBox and PS3 bringing out big titles every week,on Nintendo your wait will be more like monthly with is a big downside it was the same problem they seem to have in the past and still have it today.Other then that if you like a fun system that will entertain you and your hole family then this is the system for you.

author: J. Siperek
title: Unlike any other!!
content: The Nintendo Wii is unlike any other game station out there! My kids have had the most fun with it and the 10 assorted games they received for Christmas. It is nice knowing that they're not just sitting on their butts playing mindless games rather up and moving with it!!! As far as the recent stories go about losing the controller and it flying across the room, totally not happening! I don't see how it happens as my kids are as rough as they come and never have lost control of the wireless controllers!! My kids are ages 12, 8, and 7.

author: Robert
title: Arrived on time, with all parts
content: Description says it all. The Wii is fully functional, and cane with everything that it was supposed to.

author: Flam1ngo
title: Quick setup, excellent game!!!
content: This game arrived on time, was met with many OOH's and AAh's when opened and was quickly assembled and setup.  The thing has been "on" ever since.  No question where to find my kid.  Where there is the wii, there is the kid.

author: Miech
title: Great fun for the price.
content:
The Wii is definitely a different type of console. All sorts of people enjoy it and not just the typical gamer.

The only problems I encountered with my wii and that kept it from being a perfect 5 was the wifi. I had to research online for an hour to find out the wii has major issues with many home routers. In order to get the wii to even WORK on my router, I had to disable WPA and force it to use channel 11 which is overused in my apartment complex already. Even then I would get a random error code every now and then. Due to this I had to go out and buy a LAN adapter. I wish the wii included ethernet onboard instead of the ill-functioning wifi.

author: Ravikanth Natarajan
title: Love it
content:
Though I had to wait 14 days just to get a $8 off on free shipping from Amazon.com , But no regrets my son picked the games so easily, he loved the boxing golf baseball and tennis.
Very satisfied with Wii , First timer so so satisfied customer with Amazon with delivery delays.

author: Jennifer Lloyd
title: keeps you movin'
content: This game keeps you moving!It also works your muscles in your arms if you play Wii Sports.I have yet to buy other games,as I just bought it,but I look forward to playing this game for a long time!

author: Deborah Hagen
title: gaming happiness
content:
Very happy w/product. Wished the product description was better. I really
wasn't sure what was coming in that box. I might have ordered additional
pieces. Delivery took a bit longer than expected but then it was during the holiday season.

author: Carib
title: Five Stars
content: Came in Very Good Condition

author: mr mad
title: after getting an expert
content: after getting an expert we got it to work but one controle didn't work untill we call upon the gods and do a rain dance or something

author: Roxy
title: Wii
content: I was unable to find the Wii at any of my local retail stores so I decided to look on Amazon. It came shipped to us in perfect condition and we've had a lot of fun playing. We even got my mother in law playing (she's in her 50's and normally does not play video games) and she was hooked. The neat thing about the Wii is that even if you aren't normally a video gamer you can still play it because it's so different from normal video games. We've had a lot of fun with it and whenever we have people over they all want to play it, young and old alike. I highly recommend it! :)

author: Jason J
title: durable hardware without all silly stuff you don't need
content:
I'm very happy with the Wii.  I like how it stuck to focusing on the games.  Not like Sony and Microsoft that suddenly thinks your video game console needs to play DVD's, download music into your ipod, record the recent South Park episode, wash your car, and vaccuum your floor.  Ok so I made up the last two, but I think you get the point.

Quality titles are on the system.  Not many at this moment that will blow you away, but alot of fun to play.  With Nintendo coming out with the usual suspects soon aka Mario Kart, Metroid, Smash Bros, etc...  you will soon have plenty to play.  Gamers that like third party games may be a bit dissappointed with the system because they don't make many titles on the Wii.

The Wiimote is the best part of the system.  I have had many problems with the newer games as they have tried to put too many things into so few buttons.  You had to at times contort your fingers into positions that it hurt after long playing periods.  With the Wiimote its almost solely motioned control.  So a sword slash is a mere flick of the wrist.  Though watch out for others when playing.  Its very easy to backhand somebody else if you get too close to them.  Playing in a large room with plenty of space to move around is suggested.

author: R Radvon
title: WII
content: Works fine, replacement for original one I owned.

author: Tess O'Reilly
title: Shopping Thru Amazon
content: Product description very accurate. Price reasonable. Very satisfied with purchase and service. Would not hesitate to shop amazon.com again in the future.

author: JKB
title: Awesome buy!
content: No problems for me and runs smoothe!  I might update in a few months or so depending on if there are issues or not.

author: NineseveN
title: A great innovation to gaming
content:
Since there are already over 750 reviews for this product, there's not much I can say that hasn't already been said. The main thing I want to focus on here is that this system is FUN. People seem to complain a little about the graphics, but I'm not purchasing a virtual art gallery, I'm purchasing a gaming system.

I used to be hooked into the perpetual upgrade cycle of hardware that exists on the PC gaming front, but somewhere along the way over the last 7 or 8 years, the industry became more about eye candy and less about the actual game. If you look at most of the top 10, 20 or whatever number of all-time game lists, you'll see games that are often way behind the graphics curve. Most of them are lacking visually simply because they're older games (i.e. Diablo or Half-Life for the PC), but the main point is that they're fun and they leave the player with a memorable and entertaining experience. All the eye candy in the world simply cannot make up for a game that lacks that. There are plenty of gorgeous games with no content to them, and shelling out $400 or more for systems to play the latest in games with cutting edge polygon counts, textures or rendering is akin to throwing down hundreds of dollars on a mannequin that looks exactly like Jessica Alba in the flesh.

Not that there is anything wrong with the PS3 or the Xbox 360, but there's a reason why the Wii is outselling everything else; it comes down to fun (and price). Yes, there are crappy games on the Wii and a lot of really fun games on those other systems, but in my opinion, when the Wii developers get it right (i.e. Metroid Prime Corruption, Wii Sports, Resident Evil 4), the experience is far beyond what you can get from games on other consoles. If you're enjoying the gameplay to the fullest extent, most people don't even realize that the graphics aren't perfect.

The lower graphics tech is part of what keeps the system's price down, which puts it within reach of just about anyone with a job and the ability to save money. Personally, despite still having both a high end desktop and laptop PC suitable to run the latest whiz-bang games coming out, I haven't even looked at either of them for games since I purchased my Wii...I spend my time playing the Wii or looking at the release dates for the next Wii game that I can hardly wait to play. And coming from a former PC game and hardware-junkie, that says a lot.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Well worth it
content:
This is my first game system since Atari, way back when. I was never interested in sitting around playing games on the computer or TV, I would get too bored. The closest I would do are quick games like Tetris.

We had tried this at a couple friends' houses, and my husband absolutely loved it. I wasn't sure, but kept an eye on it and when I saw the Wii Fit Plus, I was very interested. I am pretty good about exercising but it's easy to get bored in a cold New England winter, and I hoped this would keep me motivated and interested. We got the Wii and the Fit Plus a week ago, and I LOVE it! My husband was very surprised at how much I use it each day. He has definitely been more willing to exercise also.

I have receommended it to everyone that doesn't already have one, from my kids to my mother. It was well worth the money and I'd recommend it to all ages.

author: Dario Reyes
title: Five Stars
content: Exelent

author: Pixie Power! ®
title: AWESOME FOR THE FAMILY!!
content:
We live in Maine (nasty weather so less active, more sedentary).  We bought this as a family gift to ourselves with monies from relatives who didn't know what to buy us (they sent the money instead).  Best $$ we ever spent!  You have to move to play ... big huge difference from other forms of entertainment indoors!  We noticed within a week increased general energy levels.

I recommend this to anyone.  Even our 4 yr old daughter can play the Wii Sports, and the Wii Mini games.  We got the gun control as well that came with a crossbow game, and she is already able to play that.  She isn't allowed to play more than 45 minutes per day (read the warnings for risks to your brain as to why when you get the system).  She has beaten the CPU at tennis already, and readily scores at most of the games (including the crossbow game).

Also, the ability to create Mii's is amazing (we made one of each of us, then made buddies for them).  For us, having a Mii that looks like we really do is fantastic ... but you can create anything you wish!

The other thing is, you can load your Mii into your remote ... head over to another house with a Wii, and actually use your Mii in games there as well!

You can buy points, and buy more games from Wii's internet access (Wii store).  And, your Mii's can travel (if you opt for it) out into the Wii universe and go to other Wii's to parade, or participate in teams, etc.

Overall, this is better than anything for PC in the activity level (requires more physical action than a PC or most game systems).  Having to actually swing your "club" in golf or baseball, for instance ... bowling ... that sort of thing.  It is fantastic... and better than the ordinary sedentary evenings we had been used to prior to it.

author: Gods Child
title: Excellent game!
content: I bought this game system for my kids and we love it. We watch Netflix on it. It syncs to the internet at home. I am very happy with my purchase.

author: MetalheadMissy and Jimmy
title: Wii Is Great
content: I have had mine for bout 2 weeks so far and can't put it down hardly. My favorite thing bout it is the virtual console all though I like the wii sports and stuff. I happen to be big into classic gaming and love the ability to go online and download classics from Nes , sega , snes etc. I also enjoy the fact with the sports it feels like your really doing it like your right there at a game or bowling alley having a great time . The invention of using a remote for a controller is really cool. I give this a high rating cause Its too fun to give it a lower one. I happen to of gotten mine from walmart but I was paitent calling for bout  a year i just happen to be at the right place at right time and got one .So far my fave game on the wii sports is the bowling game I think thats just bout everyone's fave actually ;). I like all the neat games and stuff you can get for it the backward compatiblity is great makes for this system will probably eventually have the largest selection of titles with the vc outta any . I also enjoy making and trading miis and the contests for them is fun. I like the voting channel, the internet channel that you purchase for extra wii points. The photo channel is fun for showing slide shows using my digital cam's sd card.  one of the most versatile systems i have owned to date and i enjoy it  . all i gotta say bout it .

author: Courtney
title: A+
content: Such a good throwback. Everything was exactly as described and working perfectly.

author: Peppi Fredo
title: Nothing wrong with it
content: Everything came as expected. No complaints whatsoever.

author: Rybs
title: Wii
content: works good, no problem.

author: ben_j
title: Something You Should Know
content:
This review is focused on the quality of customer service that you can expect from Nintendo.  Let me digress a moment just to say that the Wii was a great purchase for my family.  It provides something a little different for everyone who plays it, all of us finding something in particular that we can gravitate toward.  (Personally, though I really enjoy the movement sensitive controllers, the real joy for me has been discovering Gamecube titles like Residet Evil 0 - 1, and the Metroid games.)

Since few things are indestructable, however, what happens if your Wii goes kablam and gives up the ghost?  Recently, one of our remote controllers stopped functioning.  It continued to work on some movements, but was non-responsive on others, primarily swinging.  After replacing the batteries, and doing all of the basic diagnostic things you do when a piece of hardware is being stubborn, I took a visit to the Nintendo website to find out more.  The problem was documented there, and it did seem to point to a failure with the remote.  I visited some other websites and got the same feedback.  All that swinging around and shaking of the remote, can, in some cases, result in a damaged controller.  It's not common, but it can happen.  I went back to Nintendo.com and followed the links to the customer service section.  After filling out a brief form (which doesn't ask for any product info other than what's wrong with the device and the month/year it was purchased) I was told to wait for my UPS label to arrive within 4-6 days.  In three business days the label arrived, along with a statment saying that there would be no charge for the repair.  The device was mailed off and I am currently waiting for it to be returned.  The wait time is guaranteed not to exceed 4 to 6 weeks.  That may seem like a long time to do without a controller, but I'm a pretty cheap person, and I would gladly wait that long for a free repair.  Not to mention free shipping & handling.

Good customer service (or, "great" customer service in this case) goes a long way with me.  I can forgive a lot of things except for companies who refuse to stand behind their products.  In this case, I have to say that Nintendo just made me a lot happier with my Wii investment.

In short, if you do happen to buy a Wii - which, for my money, is undeniably the best system available - and you encounter a malfunction (other than throwing your remote through the television) rest assured that Nintendo will make the replacement a painless, albeit "inexpensive," experience.

author: CreateEnergy
title: Nintendo Wii
content: I bought this used a few years ago towards the end of the Wii's life and got a good price for it. The Wii system had a handful of games that I liked and enjoyed playing. The style of play was innovative for the time and was good for casual sports or workout type games(still good for an occasional workout). But the overall choice of games for me was a bit limited and many of the games released towards the end were largely forgettable. Still a fun system for families(or folks who aren't normally dedicated gamers) to enjoy together.

author: Hey Miss
title: Very fun
content: Although I don't have a lot of time to play it right now, I've really enjoyed this product. It's also a lot more fun when you have others playing with you. My dad never touched a video game in his life until I brought the Wii over. He really loved playing the Wii Sports. It was very fun being having my brother and him playing group games that they actually want to play. Now they both want one. XD

author: Alex T
title: Great
content: It came with absolutely everything necessary, works perfectly. Simply put, awesome. This is why I wait for technology to get cheaper, it feels more like a victory.

author: GKleck
title: FUN!
content: Great product! We have used it over and over and over! It is a classic because of the great technology and hours of fun it brings to all who play!

author: Maverick
title: Fun, fitness, news! More than just a video game...
content:
The Wii is a lot of fun for people of all ages. I won't go into the product specs because 100s of reviewers have already covered it. What differentiates the Wii from other gaming products is the physical activity it provides with the movement-sensing Wiimote, and the Internet connectivity that makes the News-reading experience more visual (you can look at the World map and drill down to read news in any part of the World). It's an essential add to any family room.

I have connected the Wii directly to my Epson projector (sans the sound until I buy a receiver) and the nearly 100" image makes playing Wii sports (a great source of exercise when it's too late at night to hit the gym or the weather is bad outside) very enjoyable, and I can read the news in Slide-show mode while talking on the phone with family and friends...

The set-up was a cinch! I was able to do it in minutes and hardly needed to read the instructions.

Wii
Wii Remote Controller

author: David
title: Still the 3rd best platform out there
content:
When it first came out, the Wii was intuitive, groundbreaking, critics-silencing, fun, and worked remarkably better than many expected. Now that it's been out a few years, it's still fun, but like the GameCube before it, the Wii is still the third best option out there for gamers.

The Wii is fun to play with groups of people. But there are some flaws. The controls lag noticeably. The graphics are inferior. And there aren't as many "serious" games for the Wii as there are for the PS3 and the XBox360.

If you have people over often, you're a casual gamer, or you're a serious gamer that has to have every console, you should get this. There are still lots of fun and innovative games for the Wii. But if you are only going to buy one gaming system, the Wii would be my third choice. Especially now that the PS3 has the Move and the Xbox360 has the Kinect, there's really no reason to get the Wii, unless you love Mario $300 much.

author: Darren Jaworski
title: Great!
content: Nintendo has gone and done it again. Reminding me that I was once a boy playing their original systems on my parents rugs. Not the fondest of memories, but among the countless hours spent with Nintendo controllers, I can say that this console is the closest to the original fun and excitement. The Wii will change gaming forever!

author: Giggles
title: Wii Nation
content:
I didn't buy my Wii from Amazon because I wasn't about to pay $309 for what I could get for $250 if I was patient for once in my life.  I was lucky enough to have gone into Wal-Mart at 5:30 and found one.  I had previously played one of my best friends Wiis and loved it.  I'm still getting used to not being able to sit down to play but that's what I like about this system is that you can't be a lazy a** playing it.  I haven't yet tried out the game I bought (Twilight Princess) but I'm sure I'm going to love that game as well as get frustrated with it.
I'd recommend this system to anyone no matter the age.  It's the least expensive of the gaming systems out there right now.  Yeah it's going to probably take a while to find one.  Me, it took me less than a week to find mine but I got very lucky.

author: Shanise
title: Excellent
content: Very pleased. Thank you very much! Game came with everything I am very pleased with the condition of the gaming console and the package was on time.

author: Ikey
title: One Star
content: I was very disappointed I thought I was getting everything that came with the game not just the console

author: Gloria
title: No game included, faked picture and describtion, even worse, based on Nintendo this model should be sold at Walmart !
content: There was no game included at all . Though it is claimed "sports game included"and picture provided showed game sticker on the box(in blue) The more wired thing is that when we hand-held the machine and called Nentindo to check bar codes,we were told that the product should be sold in Walmart, not for Amazon at all, so no game with it!! ....What a lier! It's terrible! ...We did contact the original seller, EverythingDeal, they were kind and MADE NO MISTAKE for selling the product.  The mistake should be made by Amazon warehouse.....  After struggling for 10 days of testing and phone calls,  i again carrieried the heavy box in NYC subway to find a UPS store to return....with sighs...spent another $2 for taping returning box... :((

author: Happy reviewer
title: An addictive gaming system
content: I seriously love this gaming system.  I'm a 29-year old woman who hasn't played Nintendo since the 80s and early 90s.  I recently had some great memories of playing Zelda, and found out that the Wii can download lots of old games (even from Sega and other gaming systems) for around $5-10 each.  I immediately got a Wii---I have seriously been hooked ever since.  The Wii Sports games (and Sports Resort) are very fun to get started, but then I got some of my first exercise titles (Wii Fit Plus and about 10 others), and it was over for me.  I look forward to working out with the Wii daily in ways that I could never feel about going to the gym, and I've lost weight, gotten pretty toned, and gotten some youthful 'zest' back in the process.  Most of my titles are exercise, singing, and dancing games...and now I'm really enjoying the time I do spend at home.  I am really glad I made this purchase.

author: Barry Briscoe
title: The most revolutionary game system in years
content: The Wii is so much more fun than I thought it would be.  And I thought it would be fun.  My neice got one for Christmas and the whole family loved it.  Even my 74 year old dad played and enjoyed it.  I'm getting married this spring and my fiancee and I will be getting one of these.  You actually get some excercise playing this game!  The system even comes with games!  It's been a long time since that happened for a launch.  There's baseball, boxing, bowling, tennis, and golf!  All with the system!  Super!

author: Kindle Customer
title: The most fun game ever
content: The Wii is one of the most fun game ever to be made. This is not just for the kids, everyone or anyone can play and have fun with this game. There is nothing complicated about learning how to use it. I love it and so does my kids enjoy it very much.

author: Rachel D
title: Wii is great and so is Amazon.com
content:
I ordered the Wii, Wii Fit Plus with balance board, an extra nunchuck, and extra controller on Monday Nov. 16th. The Wii Fit came on Wed. Nov. 18th, and the rest on Thurs Nov 19th! Talk about FAST shipping!! I was very satisfied with my purchase and also took advantage of the free Amazon.com $50 gift card offer, since I was already planning on buying both the Wii & Wii Fit Plus anyway. Another perk! Overall, very very satisfied with Amazon.com!

The Wii itself is very fun, and definitely a family gaming system. It gets you off the couch, and even people who have never used video games will find it easy to use after a short while. It's not really for a serious gamer, as there aren't many action/fantasy games out there for Wii. This is perfect for everyone else. I bought the WiiFit Plus for my mom and I to use and we just started, but already love it! Very cool stuff...I can't wait to use more of it!

Side note: My boyfriend just bought the game "Punch Out" for Wii, and it's quite fun and a work-out as well. Good game for everyone!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Wii love it!
content:
We love the Wii.  It's the perfect game system for families becuase it typically gets you up off your rear end and the majority of the games are family friendly in terms of graphics and thematic content.  Our 6 year old does a great job playing, but it's been a little tougher for the 4 and 3 year old to get the hang of it.

We also got the Wii EA Sports Active game so that my wife and I could work out together.  We break a sweat everytime.  We've done four workouts in the 30 day challenge thus far and we're both sore.  Which is impressive since we're both in decent shape to begin with.

author: Barbara Mitchell
title: WII is a winner
content: This product is every thing it is advertized to be.  It is fun, entertaining and yes, you can get a work out.  I highly recommend the WII for family entertainment.

author: R. Yip
title: Wow.
content: I've had the Wii for about two months now and it's the most captivating game console I've ever owned. The console itself is fun: I like making Miis, voting in the Wii Vote Channel, and watching YouTube videos via the Internet Channel. Best console I've ever bought, zero regrets, period.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Wii works great! My kids are young
content: Everything came quickly and all accessories were there as promised. Wii works great! My kids are young, so they don't know the difference between a brand new Wii and a used one. Glad I made this purchase!

author: Ally
title: Wii Love It! Wii Can't Get Enough!
content:
My family and I have been die-hard GameCubers for the past 7 years so we know what to expect from the quality of graphics and styles of games available. People must do their research. It does not have the "intense graphics" of the other systems but I think the innovative way of interacting with the games/system makes up for what the Wii isn't. Except for the fact that they all play games, the Wii cannot be compared equally to the PS3 or 360. It's wonderful for what it is.

Set up was a breeze. We were up and racing (Mario Kart - Great Game!!) within 30 minutes (and that included time to rearrange dvd player, etc. to create a space on entertainment center).

I don't have a flat screen HD TV so I was happy that the system came with the R/Y/W type jacks. Also people have "complained" about only one remote, but it should be expected that additional accessories need to be purchased if necessary. (My GameCube came with one controller and NO GAME!)

We are very happy with our decision to purchase a Wii. We knew what to expect BEFORE we purchased it (even tho it was a no-brainer for the Mario fanatics that we are!)

author: dancer
title: wii
content: great! it pays really good. i have had no problems. seller awesome. played many games. also the main reason was 4 netflix.

author: Amani2
title: Fun for hardcore gamers, casual gamers, and gamers of any age
content:
The Wii has been around for more than a year and the Wii's momentum doesn't show any sign of slowing down. If you are looking to buy a Wii, whether you call yourself a hardcore gamer or a newcomer, you are going to have a lot of fun.

I have loved video games from a young age and have played many video game systems. The Wii is a great product, and I highly recommend you pick one up.

The Wii really is a video game console for everyone. My six-year-old cousin has no problem playing Super Mario Galaxy, and it is easy for me to get my parents to play a racing game or Wii Sports. I've even gotten my grandparents to play Wii Sports. Meanwhile, I enjoy these games but I also play more challenging games like the Legend of Zelda or Metroid Prime 3.

The Wii has a clean, easy to use, interface. It has channels like a weather channel, news channel (you can read newspapers), internet channel for surfing the web, photo channel where you can upload digital photos and display them on your TV, and even a message board channel so you can leave messages for your friends or family. Internet access is free. You can also pay to download older games from previous consoles using the Wii shop channel. Channels keep being added. Many games support online multiplayer, too.

Unlike other current-gen video game consoles, the Wii truly is backwards compatible. You can play all last-gen Gamecube games on the Wii and use Gamecube controllers and memory cards. There are quite a few Wii games that allow you to use a Classic controller OR a Gamecube controller.

A lot of people have commented on how they think the Wii remote is "gimmicky." The Wii remote has really refreshed gaming for me, actually. I love the precision I have when playing games now. If a company takes the time to program their game effectively for the remote, it really pays off. First person shooters, such as Metroid Prime 3 and Medal of Honor: Heroes, are a joy to play. Many other Nintendo games also use the Wii remote wonderfully. These games use the controller the right way, and more companies need to follow suit.

Although Nintendo's console is not as advanced graphics-wise as the PS3 or Xbox 360, is more powerful than its predecessor, the Gamecube. The Wii and its games are in a lower price range so you aren't paying for high definition graphics. In all honesty, even though I appreciate higher quality graphics, I am very happy with my Wii.

With the Wii, Nintendo has opened up a totally new consumer market: casual gamers. Contrary to what some people are saying, there are more "hardcore" games for the system than you might think. The Wii does have some quality "Teen" and "Mature" rated games that are more serious/violent, but many of the great games on the system are games anyone can play. If you are under the impression that many Wii games are "childish" because they are not violent and can be colorful, you are missing out on some amazing games. Games like Super Mario Galaxy, Metroid Prime 3, and the Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess, are just pure fun, and they are extremely well made. If you want a fun console with quality games that all ages can enjoy, get yourself a Wii. The other consoles do not even compare when it comes to having QUALITY games for ALL ages.

So many people are buying a Wii, I think it has HUGE potential. Unfortunately, right now very few companies besides Nintendo are taking full advantage of the Wii's capabilities. Nintendo has upped the graphics for some of its recent games, but many other games look last-generation. The Wii is ideal for first person shooters because of its unique remote, but not many shooters are being made for it. Since there are so many casual gamers buying the Wii, many companies are either porting games (some of which are great games, like Resident Evil 4 and Okami, so I don't mind those so much, but I do wish they would create good new games), or trying to make a bundle off of mediocre casual games. Many of the video game newcomers are gobbling up mediocre games up like crazy, and they are hesitant to try more of the challenging, quality games. So, if you are a newcomer to video games, I implore you, please try out different games! I started out as a casual gamer, too. Yes, you will probably be terrible when you first start playing more difficult games, but once you practice and get better, you might find something you really enjoy. So don't just get a Wii to play Wii Fit or Wii Sports. Get the most out of your console and rent or buy other games that are rated highly. If more people buy these quality games, then more quality games will be made because companies will consider them to be profitable. Websites like IGN and Gamespot have reviews and ratings from critics and regular people, so you'll know if a game is worth buying or not. If you get stuck on a game, buy a strategy guide or use a website like Gamefaqs for free walkthroughs. And if you don't want to spend 40-50 bucks on a game, just wait until the price drops.

Even though the Wii has some wasted potential, I really enjoy mine. The Wii is a very unique gaming system, and I hope you consider buying one. If you do, I encourage you to explore different genres of games and take full advantage of your Wii. The Wii is already a good gaming system but it has even more potential that needs to be unlocked by consumers like you.

Update: One year later and still the same problems as I stated above. I've been playing my Xbox 360 more than my Wii. But there are some more mature games out (such as the Conduit and Madworld), and Wii Motion-Plus is also available, which should mean games with even more wii-mote precision. There are some great Nintendo games coming out over the next year or so. We know that Metroid: Other M, Pikmin 3, Mario Galaxy 2, and a new Zelda are in the works.

Overall: 8.7/10. A great system, but not amazing.

author: S. Chao
title: Got boring!
content: It was fun at first and then it got boring.  This system have been collecting dust.  I am waiting for their new system.

author: Gage Lemmon
title: Disappointed
content: This product does not work. It was a really disappointing buy.

author: M. Pham
title: AWESOME
content:
At around 10:25 A.M. Pacific time, Amazon sold the Wii at 250.

I GOT ONE. <3 MUAHHAAH

At around 10:27 A.M. ish, sold out. Idk how many they had, but it literally sold out in 2 minutes.

author: AED
title: Wii Rescue
content: It was abot ten days  before Christmas and I had checked just about every store in the Gulf Coast looking for this Wii. Best Buy had this great  beautiful neon-lighted display rising in electronics like a plexigass skyscraper, I was drawn to it like a moth, but the kid-employee just laughed when I asked him what aisle had all the Wii's for sale. He said 4 might be coming in Sunday, but that I'd probably have to get in line around 8 (store opens at 12), I got so desperate I tried to bribe a stocker at Walmart. I tried a hundred places on-line and everyone was either out, or exploiting guys like me, by charging an extra [..]or so....but Amazon.com saved the day. Had them, and at the going price, and got it to me in 3 days, free shipping. The Wii is great,  Amazon.com is great!

author: Anthony Ducksworth
title: DEFECTIVE!!!!
content: Wish I would have known that the product I was buying was defective and would never be able to connect to the internet. Call Nintendo and the tect team did a full diagnostic and let me know the device should have never been advertised as something in any good shape but as a DEFECTIVE device.

author: Min
title: Great price
content: I love this wii console! It was very cheap and the condition was in a good shape. It also came with the remote and the nunchuck, so that's a plus.

author: greatnana
title: Great Fun!!
content: Had a hard time getting the Wii Fit balance board I wanted for Wii Fit excersice program. Finally got one!! Enjoy the programs and am on the "weigh down" with my weight.  Very enjoyable using all the programs that I am able to do now, looking forward to adding more exercise forms for advanced as I progress. Been using it almost every day.

author: Kim
title: Great graphics, exercise and family fun
content:
I originally (and selfishly) bought this system just for the new Zelda game.  I quickly realized that here was a console I could let my kids loose on and they'd get plenty of exercise with the included Wii Sports.  The entire family bowls, golfs and plays tennis together.  It's a hoot.

You can also play your Gamecube games on this system and, surprisingly, the graphics are much better and you can use your Gamecube controllers and memory cards.

I've recommended the Wii to numerous parents at my child's school for the exercise and coordination benefits.  There's no feeling guilty about letting your kids play the Wii.  I've even gotten some badly needed exercise from it.

author: Sher
title: Great Entertainment
content: I recently purchased a WII because I thought I would get great value for my money and I was right! I love the interactive feature of this  console! You really feel as if u are in the game! Gotta love it! And while buying online does come with the worry that something may not be working or maybe broken I could definitely say Amazon is a site that offers great products. I am happy that I made this purchase.

author: Abby O'B
title: Loving playing it!
content: We have really loved our wii.  It is a great way for the family to play together.  We just played wii music tonight and it was so much fun.

author: K. Clark
title: Fun for everyone!
content: We have a 3 year old and a 5 1/2 year old, and we all enjoy the Wii.  We love the Wii Sports that comes with it--especially the bowling.  We also purchased Mario Kart and love that we can play online with my niece and nephew who live 70 miles away.

author: Tech Details
title: Shown in ultimate controller collection
content: I had this wii in the ultimate controller collection the console was painted some parts in red and normal white

author: C. Robinson
title: I love this game system
content: I got this for my 8-year-old son for his birthday after saying I would never get him a game system. We both love it. I can't wait to get more games for him and me.

author: Robert Nicholas
title: my nintendo wii
content: My wife and I enjoy this game console so much we just bowl ourselves to sleep and then wake up wanting to play another three to four hours of excitement . Thank you Nintendo for this game it brought back joy into our lives . I'm 56 and my wife is 50 and wii still going...

author: Dee and Dum
title: This is a great invention!
content: I am not good at sports and I guess this is the only way I can enjoy playing tennis. I can always hit the ball which is not happening in reality. Thanks Wii! The movement looks mild but is actually not that mild. I highly recommend it!

author: Deb
title: Wii Fun for Seniors
content: Wii is great fun for seniors.  It is challenging and entertaining.  It is user friendly, even for the technology challenged!  Enjoy it alone or even more with family and friends.

author: francisco e reyes
title: Five Stars
content: exelent

author: A. R.
title: Wii is fun!
content:
Wii is very easy and fun to learn. It is an excellent choice for beginners and families.
I was a little hooked up to it for its amazing motion sensing technologies that make playing games almost real.
However, I like to watch games in higher resolution and great attention to the details when it comes to graphics.
I hope nintendo comes up with a better version in that regard.
I wish someone comes up with a video gaming system that has great visuals and ease of playing.
For me, the next time its gonna be either a PS or Xbox for sure.

author: Amy Lane
title: Family friendly system
content: Got this because my wife wants to get a Wii Fit to get back in shape after our newest baby.  However, the entire family has had a blast playing this.  My 4.5 year old up to my in-laws have been playing Wii Sports that comes with it and everyone has had a ton of fun.  I can't wait to start purchasing other games.  I found the system incredibly easy to set up and after 5mins of entering basic information we were up and playing.  Highly recommended.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Second Fiddle to the PS3
content:
There just aren't enough games that I enjoy being produced for the WII system.  I love the Zelda/Link games and Super Mario adventure games, but Super Metroid was a disappointment due to frustrating controller use, as was  Nights.  Resident Evil: The Umbrella Chronicles featured disappointing graphics, music and, once again, frustrating game play.  That was the final straw for us:  No more spending good money on bad games for the WII!  So we recently got a PS3 and are loving it as well as the games (5) that we have bought for the PS3.

I suppose the WII is fine for sports games, but for role-playing/adventure games, there just aren't enough titles available.

The WII is still in the house, but collecting dust until they come out with a new Zelda or Mario title.

author: J. Greenway
title: Best console in the history of mankind!!!
content:
The wii is the gaming experiance in the history of mankind. I've had my wii since it first came out in 2006. The style of control is great for first person shooters and racing games. I've had no problems with my wii and it is very easy to setup, update, and connect to the internet. The shop channel is great so I can play my favorite games from older consoles. Who needs graphics when you have really good interface, people say the wii sucks because of graphics. The only reason I am considering getting a second console from this generation, the ps3, is because there are some games from the playstation series that I like. Nintendo always releases their well known games on thier new consoles then there's all of the new games that you can get for it. Sometimes you have to look around a little bit to find a game you like. Some people say there are no good games, so far, I've seen at least five to ten good games for wii from each genre.

Overall, don't fall for the bad reviews for the wii because they are all lies.

author: liz
title: Wii ok
content: We bought a Wii for our family for Christmas. It looks like a lot of fun in the commercials, with the people jumping around and really getting into their games. I think I may be too old school for this kind of gaming. I love to play all kind of games (I am 38) but I have not found the Wii to be so wonderful just yet. I like to sit and be comfortable while I play. We have the sports games, Sonic vs. Mario, and boxing. I just rented Thrillsville and am curious to find out more about that game. It has interesting use of the controller, where you tilt it to tilt the track you are adding on to your roller coaster. Sonic is an olympic competetion and involves a lot of the same action as the sports one. They are fun and my kids, 8, 6 and 3, really like them. I enjoy the graphics. I think it may take some time for me to see the value of the extra cost of the Wii. I would have put off buying a Wii another year but then we could not play any of the new games and I don't like putting my money towards a game when a better version of it is already available (though you can get most Gamecube games at great prices now, for obvious reasons). I think the Wii games are a lot of fun and the Mii characters you make yourself are wonderful. Once I get used to all the movement and extras like internet connection, I may feel it was worth the extra money for the Wii.

author: AJ
title: Excellent Product! No complaints
content: Everything you mentioned was all in the box, it came with everything that was needed. Everything works great! It was here at my house in just a few days and i was impressed. Seems like a pretty honest seller to me, keep it up!

author: Yessie FR
title: Excellent
content: My kds have playing since we received it and the console is in good conditions. By the way, the seller was so punctual with the delivery. I thought it would include the game WII Sports, maybe I misunderstand, so that disappointed me a litter because I didn't buy.

author: S. Rasmussen
title: Wii
content: Thank goodness I purchased this online since you can't find it anywhere in the stores!  The additional cost was well worth it since my kids and their friends, and our family who come to visit, and anyone else who's around plays this constantly.  I no longer can watch t.v. in my living room because the Wii is in constant use- Totally Worth It!

author: greg
title: It's a wii!
content: Backward compatible ftw. The wii is one of the easiest consoles out there to put custom firmware on. It will literally take you less than 5 minutes. Very nice to be backing up gamecube saves and playing import titles!

author: BikeRider168
title: WARNING: NOT BACKWARDS COMPATIBLE
content: I am outraged. My old Wii system broke and no longer reads my game discs, so I set out to replace it. I went through a lot of headache at the store accidentally buying the newer model that does not play Gamecube discs or allow the plug-in of Gamecube controllers, so I made sure I ordered an original model online so I could play my Gamecube cames (90% of my Wii usage). This product was advertised as BEING BACKWARDS COMPATIBLE, but it IS DEFINITELY NOT. This is the same newer model that I furiously returned to the store after the salesman had assured me it worked with Gamecube discs. I will be returning this letdown also and I hope none of you make the same mistake of being deceived by the seller here. DO NOT ORDER IF YOU WANT TO PLAY GAMECUBE GAMES OR USE GAMECUBE CONTROLLERS. IT IS NOT ACTUALLY BACKWARDS COMPATIBLE. Never ordering from this seller again.

author: Gardengirl
title: WII
content: This was a gift for our 21 years old daughter who lives in downtown Seattle in a small apt.  She LOVES her Wii and is using it all the time.  Besides being fun, it also is helping her with balance and skills with her body.  She also got the WII Fit and does the Yoga quite often.  This WII was hard to find at Christmas but Amazon helped so much and my daughter was delighted and her friends want one too.

author: Aggy Tha
title: A Video System Worth Owning
content:
If you want a video game system that will not encourage "sitting" this is the one. At first the games appeared a bit corny until you play them and realize you can really have fun with this thing and best of all..YOU HAVE TO MOVE AROUND!!

This is a system for all ages, young & old, a real family thing to do. Enjoy it, we do!

author: Debbie
title: Five Stars
content: The system came in perfect form wih no issues.

author: J. C. Amos
title: After two years, the novelty has worn off
content:
And now that I think about it, that's pretty much what I enjoyed most about this system, was the novelty of it.  I was one of the people that went to the mall before it opened on the day that they started the preorders and I was so excited when I got mine on the first day it came out whereas so many others had to wait.  The Wii Sports was (and still is of course) just a blast.  My friends and I had a great time setting up our Miis and playing bowling and tennis...  but the fun went on a downward spiral from there.  Never did I find a game that my friends and I enjoyed as much as we did the sports, and that's the game that the system comes with for free!  Did I spend 250.00 for Wii Sports?  Perhaps I wouldn't go that far, but after leaving the system collecting dust for the last six months, I'm starting to wonder what I really did buy the system for.

I'll start with the games.  The Wii has some gems, but most of these were released early in the system's lifespan and the sheer amount of junk overwhelms the great.  When I go to Best Buy or any other game retailer, I'm overwhelmed by the amount of games clogging the shelves, and 99% of them are ones I'd never play.  The actual Nintendo franchise games, which are the only ones I'm really interested in, are few and far between.  The last one of those that I bought was Smash Brothers, and my friends and I lost interest in that in less than a month.  Before that was Mario Kart Wii, and I have to say, that was a serious disappointment.  It didn't add anything new like Double Dash did and it just wasn't very fun.  Twilight Princess of course is a great game and Mario Galaxy is a triumph.  Aside from Wii Sports (and a few of the games on Wii Play) these are about the only games I've continually enjoyed on the Wii.  The games are mostly oriented toward casual gamers and kids.

The main hook for me on the system was the backwards compatibility and that's still what I enjoy most about it.  I play Gamecube games on there more than I play Wii games (Ikaruga ftw!)  As far as the Virtual Console goes, I've downloaded and enjoyed a few games and eventually wanted to own more, but I really started to feel like I was being ripped off after a while.  The prices for these old games, some of them 25 years old, really are way too high and you don't get to download a trial of anything.  Even a 64 game isn't worth ten dollars.  And most of these are games that I already spent 50.00 on years and years ago.  Should we be cut some slack?  So I download these games, thinking that I'm going to have a blast like back in the day... it doesn't always work like that.  Some games definitely stand the test of time, but some of them just aren't as fun the second time around and would've been better left happily in my memories.  There is the Wiiware, but I haven't been interested in any of those games, and of course I can't test them to see if I'm speniding my money wisely.  I'd rather spend the same prices on my XBOX 360 for a Live Arcade game that has entirely new content and I can actually play with friends online.

This brings me into my next topic which is multiplayer.  This is one of my favorite aspects of gaming and I rarely buy a game that I can't play with friends.  Now don't get me wrong, Wii has no shortage of multiplayer, but what it has is severely lacking.  I've had 360 for almost a year now (this review isn't a 360 fanboy bash on Nintendo, I promise!) and the multiplayer experience is far better in every aspect than it is on the Wii.  Sure with the Wii, you can get some friends and bundle up on the couch and have some laughs.  But anything online is very indirect and impersonal.  Like in Mario Kart or Smash Brothers for example, you have no idea who you're playing, you can't talk to them... you might as well not be playing online at all.  With 360, you see when your friends are online, you see what they're playing, you can compare achievements to see what you've accomplished versus what they've accomplished, you can talk to them at any time, even while playing separate games... the list goes on.  With 360 I feel connected to all of my friends whereas on Wii, unless they're in the room with me, I'm pretty much playing by myself.

Graphics... I know there are a lot of gamers who don't care about them and if a game is fun, I really don't either, but when I spend 50.00 on a next generation console game, I don't expect that the graphics will look as good (or in some cases much worse!) than it did on Gamecube.  My wife bought Harvest Moon and it looks close to something you find on the Nintendo DS, just on a very enlarged screen.  I have a high def TV and even the component cables for enhanced definition can't make some of these games look good.

Now of course there are some good things about the Wii.  For one, since it's Nintendo hardware, you can expect it to be durable.  I haven't personally tested the Wii's durability, but you know by the density of it, it could probably survive a few tumbles down the stairs, whereas plenty of brand new 360s crap out without the aid of any external damage at all.  The motion controls are fun in some games, even if they do get a but gimmicky after a while.  There are some fun things to do in the menu, like make various Miis that look like celebrities (there's nothing quite like playing a game of tennis with Ray Charles facing off against Admiral Ackbar), the voting channel, the worldwide news, the weather and so on.

I do appreciate that Nintendo has made a system that's accessible to "everyone," and that's great for "everyone" else, but the system is definitely lacking for the non-casual gamer like me.  The novelty of the motion controls wears off pretty fast, the truly fun games are few, the graphics are weak and the multiplayer is just depressing.  But hey, my six year-old loves it (although even he's also playing more 360 nowadays.)  I'd love for Nintendo to eventually start making their games for other consoles that have a better community based system where I can enjoy them more, but with the success of the Wii, why would they want to?  So take my review into advisement if you're trying to decide on a console to buy.

author: Jennifer Barthe
title: Best thing since the SNES for sure!
content:
I have been a die-hard Nintendo fan my whole life, starting with the classic NES. When I was a kid, I got the SNES for Christmas and still play most of the games today. Nothing beats playing Super Castlevania 4 or Super Mario Land.

Before I played with the Wii, I was not sure if it would be as great as the PS3 because of it'sgraphics. But because the PS3 has more violent games, I turned to the Wii because I wanted something family friendly.
