I got a PS2 when it first came out and played mostly racing games, the violent games did not appeal to me much.

Anyway, playing the Wii really blew my breath away! True the graphics don't compare to the PS3, but the games are much more fun and interactive. Plus the Nintendo store in New York City is a great place to hang out and connect with other Nintendo fans. I'm dying to try the new sports pack game and play the basketball games. Also I'm digging the new Tiger Woods game and the awesome Grand Slam Tennis. I'm so excited :)

author: Brian
title: Nintendo Wii is Great!
content: The Nintendo Wii, in my opinion, is the best gaming console that has come along.  It is amazing how involved you are in the games, and finally you are up off of the couch a little bit when you are playing.  It also makes gaming a group thing instead of just sitting in the dark by yourself.  I highly recommend any considering purchasing one to go ahead and get one, you will not regret it.

author: Patrick Barton
title: A great game consel
content: I love the wii.I think its even think better than a ps2.Well,i think its a hair better.Theirs better fishing games like fishing master world tour,but i dont know if their is a game like that for the ps2.The fishing games are fun!Like fishing master[not regular fishing master,the other one]is the best because of the fake  fish.Best.So,the wii is the best to me.

author: Ed
title: The perfect system for the new guy
content: I haven't owned a system since the original NES.  I've played other systems along the way, of course, but nothing really struck me for purchase until the wii came out.  This system is a blast - nothing but fun for hours on end, and for people of all ages.  Great motion control, awesome interactivity, cool features from wi-fi.  I feel like a kid again. The only thing that needs to improve over time is the game selection - I'd say there's only a good 5 or so games out there that people are really rating as high quality, but they are keeping my time occupied, so no complaints here.

author: Tammie Madill
title: Quality Family time
content: My granchildren love to come to Nanas house to games with and it brings families closer together.

author: Cindi
title: They should get these for gym class
content:
This doesn't have the hi-res graphics you'll find in XBox or PS2, nothing out there will touch the action and reality of the Wii.

I'm confident I'm either going to lose weight or I'm going to pull a muscle. After about 30 minutes of playing my grandson was sweating so much we had to take a break.  I really do think they could put these in schools and parents would be ok with it.

author: Hector Ruiz
title: Great Item
content: Couldn't believe I got the WII in time for X-Mas thanks sooo much for the promptness in shipping. Great item!!!

author: jason a dukes
title: Wonderful deal
content: Our wii finally broke after several years of hard use.  We already had  controllers and all we needed was the actual console. I was very pleased with the price as well as the condition of the unit. The seller did a great job in shipping quickly. Wonderful experience!

author: k.smith
title: What can I say that others have not...
content:
Disclaimer: I am not a "gamer." (Hey, that rhymes!) In fact, I would have been fine if our original Atari and Space Invaders were all the gaming I ever had.

Until the Wii.  Not only is this thing seriously fun and useable without super-human thumb dexterity and the ability to remember finger dance routines worth of the best Blackberry user I've ever known, but it's simplicity is an engineering marvel.

The Wii has gotten into my daily life away from the device - as an example, I now now have a new "vocabularii" that provides hours of laughter "biitwiin mii" and my friends.  Even when I'm not playing a game, I enjoy going to the weather channel and spinning the globe around.

And my triceps!  Boxing, games where you have to pump your arms to run, tennis, Wii fitness in general - finally, a way to "work out" AND have fun.  Kidding aside, you CAN be winded and sore after playing a game, which is a refreshing change to the couch potato feeling you can get playing other systems.

Mii likeii :)

author: MWP71467
title: It's a wii. So cool
content: Very good gaming console.

author: Skipper McFearson
title: Played the Wii today at home and
content: The most amazing thing about this console is the accuracy of the sensor bar.  Played only Wii sports so far but the sensitivity and realism of motion throughout all of the sports games was amazing.  I especially enjoyed the accuracy of the golf game.  Just hope that many games are made that take advantage of the motion sensor function. By the way, boxing game is a great workout.

author: Jay P. Shultz
title: sports
content: all the exercise games are great a great work out. The wii sport vacation is fabulous. you play and get exercise while doing so. I lost about five pounds and have only had it for three weeks.

author: Wes Thompson
title: Loved this purchase!
content: Loved this purchase and many years later we still use the WII.  It is the best indoor entertainment for Minnesota winters!

author: Bryon B.
title: No controller included.
content: Product did not come with a controller as shown.

author: Corey Kidwell
title: proof is in the HOURS lost...
content: I haven't had a video game system since high school (now in late 20s).  So going from complete disinterest and disillusionment with video games to going to cocktail parties promoting this toy demonstrates how universally fun (and nostalgic) this thing really is.  While I wouldn't care about someone calling me a hardcore gamer, I'm proud to say that owning and loving a Nintendo Wii with its only above average graphics but out of this world playability defeats any such insult.

author: Kelsey Foster
title: fun games for the entire family!
content:
I purchased this for my son.  As expected, he enjoys it.  What I didn't expect is how much I enjoy it!

As a 36-year-old, I'm not the gaming type.  Too technical, too violent, etc.  The games on the Wii, at least the ones I have seen, are easy to learn and an unique experience.  When you play tennis, it's more like actually playing tennis then a game.  When you drive a car, it's like driving a car.

The best thing about this is that it's something me and my son can do together!

author: Ann
title: I bought it for my niece as a Christmas gift and I can't explain how disappointed I am that it's not working
content: Product does not work. I bought it  for my niece as a Christmas gift and I can't explain how disappointed I am that it's not working. It does not read the cds and keeps spitting them out!

author: Jaygyver
title: Great console for kids and adults
content:
Easy to set up. Network connection was easy.
 The Remotes and Nunchucks are a bit spendy when you have to buy three more of each. The Wii usually only comes with one set. Altho, you can hold off on the Nunchucks as there aren't very many multipayer games where you can use three or more people that need the Nunchucks. Usually just two people need it. And then you'll have to buy the Game Pad to play the older games if you are used to using it. But then some of the Wii's are now coming with the rubber "protectors" already on the Remotes so that's great.

 A blast when playing with more then one person on some of the games. We haven't really bought many games for it as the grand kids are just getting to the point of being able to play now. The attention span just isn't there yet. The games we do have are great to play.

author: Margaret Floyd
title: Three Stars
content: Liked

author: Pablo
title: We are very happy with our purchase
content: Purchased used - no problems at all. We are very happy with our purchase.

author: AMueller
title: Wii Review
content: We bought the Wii for our 15 and 11 year old sons for Christmas.  The Wii has been so much fun for the entire family.  The contols are very sensitive and take some getting use to.  Mario Kart was highly recommended and really took a while to get the hang of the controls.  It's a lot of fun.

author: AmazonEnthusiast
title: GREAT CONSOLE!
content: I bought a used one. It works perfectly. We had the Miis from the last players still on it, and we had to spend 5-10 minutes deleting them. Back to the product. This console is amazing! The games are fun for the whole family, and the remote is so well thought through. I could play this for days and it would never get old. My favorite games that I recommend you buying are MarioKart Wii, New! Super Mario Bros, Wii Sports Resort, and Family Game Night 3. 10/10!

author: Samantha M. Culbertson
title: WOW!
content: This is the best gaming system for someone who wants interactive gaming. Gets you up and moving. We love it!

author: B. Watson
title: Internet connection difficult
content: Instructions loop around but don't resolve the problem with connecting to the internet.  Can waste way too much time on this.  Don't even want to try doing this all again with tech support.  Much more fruitful to bag it and do more constructive things.

author: Jolene A. Fitzpatrick
title: Almost, but not quite, too much fun!
content: This is the best anniversary gift I have EVER received.  Better even than diamonds.  I am a 31 year old woman in the military, and quite physically fit.  My husband went all out and bought several games so I had a variety from the very beginning.  I have never had so much fun working up a sweat in my entire life.  I have played this gaming system with my 4 year old son, as well as my 19 year old step daughter and her friends.  The only warning I can give is be careful and use the straps on the controlers.  They are there for a reason!

author: Timothy L. Wagner
title: Fun, Yet Get Your Credit Card Ready....
content:
For Christmas we purchased three Wii's for our family members (some of who are married and have kids of their own). We also own Xbox360 and PS3 (we're a gaming family!).
The Good:  From a family perspective this is the ultimate 'play together' opportunity. Get the Wii that comes with Wii Sports, as we've found that the bowling, tennis, baseball, and golfing are the best of all the sports emulation games for the Wii. On the Sports disc they are all together! The Mario Kart racing game is also fun. The ability to go online and play with others, a common feature now, is expanded and made more entertaining by the creation of 'Mii's'. This is the 'you' character you can use for many of the games. You can create it to look just like you, or make it as crazy as you want. Even more fun is that there is no limit to the number of Mii's you can create, and all those you have end up being spectators or characters in the games you play. A few websites even have instructions on how to make lookalike Mii's for famous people. We have all the staff from the Office, the Simpsons, etc.
While the Wii is a great family system, it loses some of it's luster when used as a stand alone. Face it, bowling by yourself is not that exciting at the bowling alley, let alone in front of your TV. For non-family play, the game is focused on tweeners and below (<12). This is not a system to get your teenager, for them get the Xbox360 or PS3.
The Bad: The basic system comes with one controller and one numchuck (another type of controller).  You'll need two or more to effectively play family games, otherwise you're constantly handing off controllers, or you'll be unable to play against someone (like tennis). In addition, if you want to avoid using hundreds of batteries, you need a recharge method, the most viable being the plug in recharge stations you can buy. Get one that has at least 4 places to recharge, as you'll soon be collecting controllers like crazy. While most of the games can be played with the controller as is, almost all games have available (for purchase of course) controllers to give you that special 'feel'. These include sports ones that hook onto the controller (i.e., a bat, a hockey stick, a ping pong paddle) or shooting/slashing games (i.e., various guns and swords). While it adds to the fun, it decreases the pocketbook.
Overall: A fun system for family and friend gaming. Lots of potential to be nickled and dimed on all the accessories, much more so they the other big video game systems out there. For single play, not the first choice to get for older gamers, this one is for younger players. We've had fun using it, and it definitley brings the family/friends together in good humor, so it's been worth it.

author: J. Broniak
title: Wii is for the whole family
content:
It is rare when a family of 4 generations can play a game together.  My family enjoyed the bowling at our family Christmas and I have a request to bring it to an addtional family holiday party.  I just loved seeing my Dad using todays technology to play a games he enjoyed in his younger days like baseball and bowling.

One additional comment that set up/install is a snap.  The wii packaging and instructions were very complete.  What I thought might take at least one hour to get started only took 20 minutes.

author: Alice M. Roberts
title: My Wii Christmas
content: My Grand daughter was fortunate enough to have Santa bring her this Wii. She said "it is the bestest fun yet". The smile on her face and the gleam in her eyes are enough for me. Thank you.

author: Noelle
title: Love it
content: I bought this and the Wii fit plus w/balance board and I am amazed at its capabilities....It is great fun and who even knows you are excercising at the same time...I would highly recommend it to all ages !!!!

author: J. Bellman
title: My wife and I love this game.
content: My wife never wanted anything to do with video games until we went to our sons home and tried his Wii. We tried the bowling and found it gave you the feel of being at a bowling ally in your own home. After we got home from his house we ordered one and found when we got it we enjoyed it even more. My wife who never liked to watch baseball found she loved to play it on the Wii. We are 63 and 68 and find we are much more active since we got it. We have now added the Wii fit and use it every day. I would recommend it for anyone.

author: bbuuddyy1967
title: Five Stars
content: Thank you Wii!

author: Pen Name
title: Malfunctioned out of box
content: Every time a Gamecube controller is plugged in, something with the circuitry causes the Wii to shut down. It will not start up again until all Gamecube controllers are unplugged. Which is upsetting, since the whole reason I purchased the older model was BECAUSE it still supported Gamecube games, and gamecube controller support for such games as Super Smash Brothers.

author: Deltareviewer
title: Fun for the Entire Family
content:
The Wii is an innovative gaming system that brings the gaming experience to the entire family.  In the past the game system where mine.  On the rare occasion that someone in the house wanted to play they felt obligated to ask me.  Well with the Wii it is a system for the entire family.  My wife and kids enjoy it as much as I do.  The games that came with the system are fun and easy to play.  My wife enjoys the fact that groundbreaking cordless controllers incorporate physical movement into the game playing experience.  The Wii is designed to get you moving.  One of the biggest complaints about gaming is that kids are no longer exercising because they are playing video games.  This is not the case with the Wii.

One of the most exciting features of the Wii is the Wii remote or Wii-mote.  You can control your players in the game by pushing the buttons on the Wii remote but you also might have to swing your arms or move the controller through the air and the Wii console translates those movements into movements on the screen.  The Wii remote is the primary aspect that distinguishes the Wii system from all others.

The Wii easily connects to the internet.  This feature allows old school gamers to down load retro arcade and home video games onto their Wii console at a relatively inexpensive cost.  Most games range from 500 to 200 will points ($5.00-$20.00).  All of the Donkey Kong series, tecmo bowl, Mario franchise and about a hundred others have been included.  Some of the systems that have lent their most popular games to the Wii library include, the original NES (Nintendo Entertainment System), the SNES (Super Nintendo Entertainment System), N64,  (Nintendo 64), TurboGrafx16, Sega Genesis, NEOGEO and several arcade games.  More titles are being added every month.  You can also surf the world wide web, store photos, check the weather and I understand that soon you will be able to download music.  One of the most used aspects of the Wii's internet capabilities is online play.  Interacting and doing battle with other gamers all over the world is far from new, but it is still an intriguing aspect of gaming.

A drawback to the Wii is that you have to purchase additional controllers and accessories to get everything out of the most games.  Many of the games you can download require a "classic" controller.  The Wii Fit board costs quite a bit but it is a way to get a pretty good workout for those of us who could are not world-class athletes.  There have been reports of significant weight loss based on some Wii and Wii Fit games.  Most of the additional purchases that I have made have been well worth the cost.

To me I can see the Wii as more than just a gaming system.  It is a way to have family time, a social networking device, it is a news and weather outlet as well as a way to get some exercise and have a pretty good time playing video games.  The Wii is pretty close to being a lifestyle.  I would recommend this to anyone.

BKOOL - Real Game Player!

author: Christian Gonzalez
title: The Best!!
content: Well this has to be the best video game console nintendo has made so far. It is sold out everywhere!! Your best bet is e-bay or wait until the hipe is over to finally find one. I am so impressed. I actually sold all my old consoles just to have this one. I got it a few days ago and it is just loads of fun. This console seems to be the only console that has changed the world of gaming in a very big way. It's all people talk about and play. Everyone from all walks of life and ages say they enjoy every bit of it. People have also lost lots weight from all the swing motion and getting so into the game. This has been a life changing console for everyone. Nintendo has always made history to have very historic consoles but this console is probrobly the most talked about since the 1980's console Regular Nintendo which also made history. If you do lay your hands on this precious make sure you enjoy every bit of it!!

author: Gama
title: Excellent Game
content: I bought this game as a gift for my father (on Father's day), and the quality is excellent. We very much enjoy it as a family. It is definitely worth buying as a gift. The price is not too expensive, and it ships very fast because I also paid extra fee in order for it to be shipped to my home by 2 days, and it did. Once again, it was in excellent shape and conditions. Undoubtedly a 5 out 5 rating.

author: Joseph Halabi
title: Entertaining but Poor Graphics
content:
The nice about this system is that it makes you workout if you play the sports game and gives you the feeling of a fighter when it comes to fighting games etc...
the thing that I didn't care for are the graphics which are not that good compared to the PS3 and the 360.
all in all it is a high tech attractive system but not for harcore gamers.

author: SP Mommy
title: Great Game and Seller
content: Super fast shipment and the game is the best for family game night.  Thanks

author: Chris
title: GramGram
content: Bought this for grand kids they love it.  Games are much cheaper then their old xbox.  What can I say its a wi.

author: FeatherFire
title: Great for everyone
content: I bought the Wii for myself and my parents and left it at my parent's place.  To my great delight, my parents both enjoy playing the Wii possibly even more than I do!  It's a great game for both young adults (like myself) and the older generation (like my parents).  It's very user-friendly and anyone can pick it up and play.  Helps get people moving and active again in fun ways.

author: Carlos Vasquez
title: Wii Review
content: I bought this product for my little daughter. We have enjoyed it a lot. We have had so much fun paying it.

author: April M. Dively
title: Simply the BEST
content:
This system is beyond all my expectations, and they were high, believe me.  The wii-mote is so intuitive and works so well, you are immersed in the game like never before.  I personally like the fitness challenge on Wii Sports, it is nice to see your progress.  Also, Zelda is pretty awesome.

I haven't taken advantage of the Wii channel yet, but I definitely will when the games I want become available.

On a side bar....you people who pay inflated prices to get these systems realize that you're taking a HUGE chance and could be shooting yourself in the foot....right?  Case in point:  While I was attempting to get a Wii for my Brother-in-Law's family, I spoke to clerks in Gamestop and Best Buy about all the new systems.  BOTH places had their BRAND NEW Playstation 3 break down within one hour and one week respectively.  Now, lets pretend you bought a PS3 at a retailer...your money would be refunded, or they would replace the system.  NOW lets say you paid some ridiculous amount on E-Bay or Amazon, guess how much money you will be refunded???  (the cost of the system new, IF you're lucky because the person selling the system couldn't be held responsible for manufacturing flaws).  Simple economics, unless you have the money to just throw away, why don't you just wait to get it from a retailer?  As wonderful as the Wii is, I wouldn't justify paying more than the MSRP.

author: Kindle Customer
title: good
content:
It is good but some times doesn't except discs and a few scratches
😀😀😀

author: Tuesdae Staude
title: console
content: The system was in OK condition for not what I expected for what I paid. I had to replace the wireless bar that receives the remotes commands because the wire had been cut, and for that cost I could have just paid the extra 20.00 for a new system instead of 20 less for the used one. I am not real happy about this.

author: Lauren
title: Not bad for $40
content: Held up for a few years, until my bunny chewed the strings! Not bad for $40!

author: Rudy
title: Nintendo's best since the SNES!
content:
Nintendo really struck gold when they released the wii.
excellent graphics, easy to navigate menu's online connectivity..what more could you ask for?
When i was a kid i had the nes and snes. I thought the snes was the most fun to play, and i played it for many years, then i sort of got out of gaming until the wii came out. at first, i was hesitant to get one. but i played one at a family members house and i was hooked! after searching high and low for 9+ months, i finally found one and got it.
brought it home and fired it  up. great system. i also purchased a wireless linksys router so i could get online with my wii.
that opened another world of great games thanks to nintendo's virtual console that is included with the wii. (you have to buy wii points card at retail stores or put your credit card # in to get points.) the points are then used to buy classic games like mario bros, super mario world, mario kart 64, starfox 64, megaman etc.)
If you plan on playing the classic games, you will have to buy the 19.99 classic controller. this is like a snes controller and allows you to play the retro games on the wii. new titles for the virtual console are being released all the time.
if your fighting the choice of to buy or not to buy a wii, trust me, get one! you will be suprised how much fun it is!

the only thing i don't like about the wii is that it CANNOT play cd's or dvds. don't know what nintendo was thinking there.

author: Marce B.
title: Issues with the actual unit and had a remote die ...
content: Issues with the actual unit and had a remote die within the first 45 days of having it. Luckily we have spare parts from an old unit that we're able to use.

author: Grammy K
title: Wii
content: Bought this for my 53 yr old husband for Christmas.  He loves it, and so do I!  Not just for kids... :)

author: April Record
title: could have been cleaned better... but oh well
content: Product works great. Only complaint I have is the controller was kind of sticky with something.. Quick fix with some minor cleaning..

author: Ctati
title: Wonderful. Thank you. Enjoy it. Great
content: Wonderful. Thank you. Enjoy it. Great

author: Joe
title: Be wary
content: Was missing a few parts, but luckily I had some spare parts. It was pretty beat up and scratched.

author: Jordan J
title: Expensive Netflix Console
content: I got a Wii a few years ago and I have never really had any interest in playing games. I have played MarioKart and it was fun but none  of the games have really fulfilled my game-playing needs. The games are also really expensive. I mainly use the Wii Console for watching Netflix and Hulu. Overall, it has been entertaining at parties and with friends, but I would not pursue buying the console again...

author: Lola Laslo
title: Wheee!!!!!!  Wii is wonderful.
content: Let me start by saying I think most video games are a waste of time and contribute to individuals becoming overweight. I was first introduced to Wii by my nephew and his girlfriend Christmas of 2009 and I was very impressed!  This gets a person up and moving and can contribute to over all fitness.  I especially like Wii fit plus and the accountability of weigh-ins as well as gentle reminders.  I bought a used version of this game and there were no instructions.  My husand could not figure it out, but the Amazon store that I bought from was very good about us returning it.  We have a new game and I am soooo pleased with it.  I am usually a real cheapskate, but this was well worth the investment.

author: The Lynnster
title: The best video game system ever!
content: My husband and daughters play this all the time. It's a party every time they play this together. I'd happily spend the money again. Great investment if you're going to buy a console.

author: Cathy, Ohio
title: Fun game
content: Shipping is pretty quick, and the game is fun. I rate for overall 4 star because you have to buy different control for different game , lots more extra investment if you want try more fun games.

author: irukandji
title: Wii vs PS3
content:
Not going to bother with a complete Wii review, but rather highlights and comparison with PS3, the other major console besides XBOX360, which I haven't played before.

Low down on the PS3:
Blu Ray reader
*Demos available
*Add-ons available
40GB to 80GB hard drive
Better graphics than Wii
More expensive

*Internet connection required

The advantages the Wii has are mainly its innovative motion controls and games. Wii is fun. Wii is definitely more family oriented, however their are normal and adult titles, just far fewer.

Amazon Playstation 3 games by rating:
Everyone(111)  34%
Teen(123)  38%
Mature(90)  28%
Total: 324

Amazon Wii games by rating:
Everyone(422) 74%
Teen(119) 21%
Mature(27) 5%
Total: 568

It depends on which types of games you like and how you prefer to play them. Different genres play better on different systems. For instance, racing and light gun (rail shooters) play better on the Wii, because of the Wii Wheel and precise Wii aim motion controls respectively. A lot of Playstation 3 games are 1st person shooter, which are the best on the PC with mouse and keyboard. Fighting games like Mortal Kombat are best on consoles with controllers etc.

Playstation is the most normal console out of the big 3, the joystick-controller feels similar to the old consoles of SNES, Genesis, Saturn, etc. Also the Playstation brand has been around awhile.

Price-wise
$500.00 PS3
$250.00 Wii
$250.00 Xbox 360

The prices above vary depend on the model or whether USED or NEW. But you could get an Xbox 360 and a Wii for the price of a PS3. I've never tried Xbox before but the controller is awkward and weird looking, unfamiliar. A lot of people get the PS3 just for the Blu Ray. But for mainly gamers, the games are most expensive on the PS3.

For me I would prefer the PS3 over Microsoft's Xbox 360, because of the more familiar controller and the fact it has been around longer and for me personally, beat out my Sega Saturn along time ago. However the Blu Ray addition seems to make everything PS3 way more expensive... Now I got to pay more for every game than the Wii and Xbox360's versions!?

So why get a PS3 over an Xbox 360 and a Wii (combined)? Blu-ray, controller, dependable.

My recommendation is get an Xbox 360 and Wii over the PS3. Xbox360 games used and new are a lot cheaper than PS3 counterparts. And Wii is one of a kind.

For the money, you should also consider upgrading your PC. Especially if you are into First Person Shooter or Real Time Strategy games, since they're the best on the PC. The PC has tons of games (16,950 listed on Amazon). And it never goes out of date, as opposed to consoles that get dated. Another boon is the vast amount of demos. However, some games make you connect to the internet; software and hardware compatibly may be an issue. But you use your PC for other things, not just gaming.

author: Mike Loskot
title: The Wii Rocks!
content: The Wii is awsome. Lets start with its price. It costs only $250 at any store while the XBOX360 and PS3 are putting their price over the limit for their so called revolutionized graphics. The Wii dosent have the best graphics, but it also dosent have the worst. The graphics are by ATI  which makes the picture very nice and more than decent. The Wii is also very well known for their newest approuch to gaming.  The Wii's controller development makes gaming more fun and gives you a felling like you are in the game! The Wii's small size is very unique compared to the gigantic X360 and PS3, and makes it very easy to store in many places. Also dont forget about the games; there will be new games that appear non Nintendoish with blood and gore like in Manhunt2. Other great releases will be out like SuperSmashBrotherBrawl, Zelda: Twilight Princess, and many many more! Therefore, this is why the Wii... ROCKS!

author: Jj
title: It works YAY
content: It came in the mail in a few days. It was just as described. Slightly scratched and dirty but works perfect. Our original got fried when a transformer blew. Super happy for the price and timeframe.

author: Roxy
title: Disc Drive Quit on Me
content: The disc drive quit after little use. I had to disassemble it and try to fix the drive.

author: Leslie Eilers
title: The entire family loves the wii!
content: I feel like we are the last people in the US to get a wii, but now that we have, the entire family is loving it.  It is a great game to play together, and I really like how you can play entire games in short periods of time (as compared to most gaming systems where a person can get lost for hours playing a game).  We bought the basic console with wii sports, and we are just really having fun with it.

author: Patrticia A. Gaudet
title: Five Stars
content: WE LOVE THIS GAME SYSTEM

author: Hernan David Morillo
title: Five Stars
content: fine

author: E. Sobel
title: Great gaming system
content: this is fun for the whole family.  all levels can play and have fun with the different games and activities with the wii.

author: Mr. James
title: Wii Madness
content: First of all, I agree with Andrew Eshleman of Oregon when he mentioned people selling the Wii for 2-4X the original price on E-bay and other sites. That is one reason people like myself can't find a Wii. I have a job and don't have the time to camp out at stores that carry the Wii. These folksthat camp out probably don't have a job or are businessman looking for some unfortunatefool to pay ridiculous prices for a video game console. Enough of that, the Wii is onefine piece of gaminghardware. It may not have the graphics of the PS3 or X-Box 360, but who cares?If the game is fun, addictive, it does not matter. Gamers like myself grew up on the NES because the games are fun, period. The Wii willplay all the Gamecube games and most peripherals as well. That's why most people want it.I'm sure when all the madness dies down, all the peopleout there will be able to get one.

author: Jwmw92
title: Excellent, 5 stars.
content: I purchased this system on luanch night, and nintend, I say kudos. The graphics are not as well as I'd hoped, but the innovative gameplay makes up for it. the Wiimote feels very natural in your palm, and all the actions are simple and intuitive. I bought Zelda along with this game, and felt as if I actually had the sword in my living room! Again, the grpahics are not the best, but do graphics honestly matter? I say, If you are looking for a great console with awesome gamplay, go for the Wii. If you want HD and good grpahics, go for the PS3 or XBox 360.

author: GoMavs37
title: Great fun!
content: I bought my Wii the first day it came out and I still play it constantly. More and more great games are coming out through Nintendo and the Virtual Console. I highly recommend buying one if you like having fun.

author: Sissah
title: Good Service
content: Wii received as indicated in listing and on time.

author: J & D Bradshaw
title: The Wii
content: does it really need a review? if you have any hand eye coordination at all this console is a great buy. It's new, different, and has a ton of games that suit its motion sensor really well. The concept of being able to swing a bat or your fist and have the game know this is wonderful!

author: hottiescientist
title: Nintendo beats Sony
content:
I had my reservations about the Wii but the more I read about, the more I realized I would end up praising Nintendo's ability to create a GREAT gaming experiences than overloading their graphics ability.  It's a great system to have groups of people playing together, creating a fantastic environment for social gaming, and at least Twilight Prinecss has just wowed this Zelda fan to even more loyalty.

The remotes do take some getting used to and it often feels the gyroscopes are a little off, but overall a novel idea.  The batteries die very quickly though so it might be best to invest in some good rechargable sets.

author: Rusty O. Long
title: Great for older people too
content:
My wife is 64 and I am 58.  We have a lot of fun with this and plan to get the
wii fitness pad.  It is not only fun but great exercise.  I would give this a 5 star rating for all ages. Rusty & Dotty

author: J. L. Garrell
title: Still fun to play.
content: This console is going to be out of date very soon and lets face it, it never really lived up to it's potential. But for some of the games it really nailed, this system is still incredibly fun to play. The idea that your motions become the actions on screen has been the dream of ever gamer for years. Although it still has it's bugs, this system really showed it could work. I've had years of enjoyed from this Wii, but with the advancement of so many other systems, I'd say you're going to need to look elsewhere if you're not getting this for a great price.

author: Jiren
title: Greatest System Evvvvvver
content: I believe Nintendo has hit the nail in the head qith the Wii. My friends and I have spent countless hours playing Wii Sports, and let me tell you it is well worth it. If you want an experience unlike any other(and want to shed some pounds) then pick up a Wii this holiday season!

author: Adam Stivala
title: Great system
content: I was raised on Nintendo, switched to Xbox for Halo, and now I'm back with Nintendo. I undoubtedly loved Halo and Xbox, but I'm not really a hard core gamer, I have a life outside of videos games. The Wii is awesome for bringing people together (even my parents play with us) with easy and fun games. It's the best system on the market.

author: Nick Grizzle
title: it fulfilled the desire we had in buying it so we are pleased.
content: Everything worked right out of the box. However, the description said its condition was marked down simply because it wasn't in the original box. There was a top plate on the consoledge missing and there are signs of yellowing on the controller due to use/age. However, it fulfilled the desire we had in buying it so we are pleased.

author: Marcus D. Moore

content:
Nintendo hit the ball out of the park with this unit.  It's perfect for the whole family, young and old.

It's one of the best purchases I have ever made!

author: C. Canter
title: Wii System
content: The Wii was in perfect condition and works great!! We play for hours and it's so much fun. I definitely recommend this product and seller! A+++++++

author: LindaFus
title: Got one at ToyRus at the store
content: After staying up all night long and hitting F5 on Amazon? At 7:30 a.m. a family member went down to the local ToysRus and got in what was a very small line. Around 8:00 someone came out and handed the first 30 people tickets. She was 25th in line. She is now waiting for the store to open to purchase it. This was for the Wii ONLY not a bundle deal. She chose the shortest of three lines, Best Buy, Target, Toysrus (smallest line)

author: yowza3
title: Fantastic console! Great for all types of gamers.
content:
We have had our Wii for about a year and a half now and it is fantastic. This is the 2nd console we've owned (first was the PlayStation One), and we have enjoyed using it since the day we got it.

Out of the box you'll get one Nunchuk and Wii Remote, plus Wii Sports. I suggest you promptly buy at least one additional set of controllers to take advantage of the party/group games, as well as getting rechargeable batteries of the controls. That way you won't have to worry about replacing them so often; just charge them up and you're set.

In terms of games, this system is marketed as a family-oriented, party/group gaming-centric console and as of late, a way of getting your daily exercise. This is certainly true. When family and friends come over, those of whom don't play video games whatsoever enjoy playing the Wii. Wii Sports is always a fun game to start out with, but other good group games are Mario Kart, Wii Sports Resort, and Big Brain Academy (for my family at least). It is certainly a good console if you have more "casual" gamers in your family/group of friends. There are TONS of games out there that cater to that type of gamer, so you'll be able to find the game you're looking for. As far as an exercise system, there are also many, many great Wii games for exercise, including Wii Fit and EA Sports Active. It really depends on what you use the Wii for, though. I don't consider myself a hardcore gamer, nor is my demographic the majority (18 year-old female), but I do enjoy a challenging game every now and then, as well as the more casual ones I could play for a couple of minutes. The Wii fits the bill for me, as far as gaming consoles. Some of the more mature titles for Wii that I've played are Resident Evil 4, No More Heroes, and Red Steel, all which I thought were great games. But some of my other favorites on the Wii are Cooking Mama and Wii Sports Resort. The Wii really offers a lot, and there are some great, more mature titles out there.

As far as controls, I enjoy the Wii Remote & Nunchuk combination. It is comfortable to use with most games and easy to get used to. At times I do miss the traditional controllers, like what the PS1 had, but even my family and friends find the Wii Remote/Nunchuk easy to use. You'll be surprised at how fluid the controllers work for first person shooters, action games, and casual games, depending on how well implemented they are into the gameplay.

All in all, the Wii is great! We don't get to use it much during the school year, but when my family/friends have some time to spare, the Wii definitely keeps us entertained.

Game suggestions: New Super Mario Bros., Mario Kart, Wario Ware: Smooth Moves, Wii Sports Resort, Cooking Mama, Big Brain Academy, Resident Evil 4, No More Heroes, Just Dance

author: Terry M. Melichar
title: Birthday wii
content: I bought the wii for my retired husband.  He was very surprised and loves the game.  He has been saving the world in air battles daily.

author: blender
title: Four Stars
content: ok

author: KDMask
title: Going Back to Basics--It's Great!
content:
Sure, the graphics are primative--but you know what? The gaming interaction with the wii is just priceless. Reminds me of the old days of "Tetris" and being absolutely psyched with our Atari! The entire family played the sports package...very, very fun. My 14 year old loves the Zelda Game and Red Steel.

A few of the things to know: The package comes with a controller and a Nunchuck. You need both for most games. Using these is a breeze, btw... there's a trigger button that is very easy to learn. (I even started bowling like a pro on this!) It is better to have 2 sets of controllers to play things like golf so you don't have to keep passing them back and forth.

Set up was so simple. 2 plugs, and you're done. It's a good looking little console as well. Another feature is the ability to "make" your character your own. Give yourself a name and you are good to go. (it's called making your "mii" --get it!?)

Something I didn't know was that if you have wireless you can hook directly to the net and store pictures and game with other players. Your characters can take part in wii "parades".

Best system yet. Love it.It will also get your little gamer (or yourself) off the couch for a bit!

author: Amazon Customer
title: One Star
content: Bad quality stuff

author: Sritz
title: Pretty good, for all ages...
content: i am not sure how professional video game players feel abt it... but i am having lot of fun... though the graphics are not really great (for the games i have), i dont need to know lot of controls & stuff... i play the games as if i am really playing the actual games, atleast for tennis, bowling, baseball etc... overall, loved it..

author: Jen Harkema
title: Great Wii!
content: This Wii came shipped promptly and well packaged. It was in excellent condition: clean, in perfect working order, and ready to use. I am very pleased with my purchase. :) My children feel it is their best Christmas present ever!

author: Kevin Sparenberg
title: Wii is just too much fun
content:
I first played the Wii at a friend's house just about a year ago now.  The system just cracked us up.  Although the interface was new, it was easy to pick up.  It has been the most used "video game" purchase that I have made in the last three years.
I'm a 29 year old man who grew up with my Nintendo.  The ability to play those games on which I wasted hours in my youth was one of the key to making this decision as a game system instead of the xBox 360 or the PS3.  I may be supplementing my gaming systems with the PS3 or xBox 360 in the next year or so, but right now, the Wii is more than enough to keep me happy.

author: Minsanity
title: Wii need more quality games!
content:
First off, I like to play sports titles so my opinion may be different than most gamers.

Don't get me wrong, I love my Wii console.  It's sleek, stylish and you can do so many different things on it besides playing games (voting, going online, etc).  But give us some games that are fun, please!  I can't wait for Smash Bros. and Mario Party 8 but what am I to play for now?  The console was made for both casual and hardcore gamers.  I suppose I am more of a casual player.  I never really got into Zelda: TP, TH Downhill Jam, Super Monkey Ball, or Wii Play.

I'd say Wii Sports is pretty good, but you can only play that so long.  I would no doubt buy a Wii Sports 2 if they sold it.  And they don't even have to add different games to it.  Just improve on the ones already there.  I'd gladly shell out $30 or $40.

author: Pat
title: Five Stars
content: this made a wonderful gift!

author: A. Frings
title: Awesome
content: How could you not love this system.  It is very fun for everyone.  My whole family loves playing Wii Sports and Super Mario Galaxy is one of the greatest games I've played in a while.

author: Kyra
title: Three Stars
content: I got no av cables :(

author: S. Carlson
title: All kinds of low-resolution fun
content: I already owned a PS3, but until PlayStation Move it was more of a solo system. I bought a Wii because I had heard about all of it's motion sensing capability and how much fun it could be in multiplayer. It did not disappoint. The Wii Sports game alone (included) has already generated hours and hours of fun at home get-togethers. Don't be expecting HD output, this console was not designed for it...but you can expect to get a lot of enjoyment out of it nonetheless.

author: D. Bleess
title: Keep it cool
content: VERY entertaining system.  Look it over and find both vent holes.  Keep them clear to fresh air flow or you will overheat the system.  The vertical mount tray wants to let one of the vents sit flush on the ground so it is BLOCKED.  Do not allow this.  Shim it off the ground or lay the system flat so both vents are unblocked.  The system will shut itself off if it overheats.  Good games we found are Wii sports (came with ours), golf - Tiger Woods 2009 ($60) is great, and the nephew likes Lego BatMan and StarWars.  The minicopter ($30) game stinks.  You'll probably want at least one extra controller/nunchuk ($40+$20).  We couldn't get wireless internet to work (Linksys WRT router) so we wired it with an add on USB network adapter ($35).

author: Carole l Reich
title: Five Stars
content: works great

author: H. W. Fitzgerald, Jr.
title: My exercise machine
content: I purchased this and the surf board just to have fun exercising. Both it and I are still going strong.  It makes exercising fun.

author: Michael M.
title: Super Mario Galaxy 1 and 2 along with Super Mario ...
content: This brings back so much Nostalgia i.e. Super Mario Galaxy 1 and 2 along with Super Mario Sunshine. My old one died, but I got a new one, and I Iove it.

author: Marc G.
title: Home Run!
content: Nintendo gets it. They've kept the graphics just "very good" instead of totally lifelike, and they have created a totally immersive gaming experience. Wii is wonderful.

author: Morley Dotes
title: Beats every system I have!
content:
You probably have read a ton of reviews already, so I am going to write this a little differently, from a different perspective.

I grew up playing a lot of family games, board games, card games, etc. It was a great way for the family to interact and get together and bond. It seems those days are few and far between....almost gone. My kids play some games, but most of there friends just play video games. We got this with the thought that the kids would be able to play more with their friends. We have found that many of the games are geared towards the family and are a lot of fun. Wii Sport is a game we play most often. Wii Fit is probably second. Just these two games are worth buying this system. Also, the fact that you can browse the internet, etc., makes this a no brainer. If you are looking for the hottest graphics, etc., then an XBOX or PS3 is probably better, but if you have you kids, and/or you are looking for fun things to play, this is the system for you. There are plenty of interactive, sports, non-violent, educational, etc., games that should satisfy everyone. I would recommend getting rechargeable batteries, or else you will go through a ton of batteries very quickly. It will save you a bundle!

author: S. Robinson
title: The Nintendo Wii is awesome!
content: Nintendo did a great job when they made the Wii.  It is a ton of fun and you never want to stop playing.  My 3 year old enjoys boxing on the sports games and he does great.  It goes to show that no matter how young or old you are you can enjoy playing video games on the Nintendo Wii.

author: Mary Schilz
title: 5 stars
content: worked like brandnew!! its perfect

author: Kelly Mercer
title: The best ever...
content:
Sure the selection of games is sparse at the moment but I can hear those wheels a turning!  3rd party developers are chomping at the bit as I type.

I have about 20 games to date and my whole family enjoys each and every one of them (ok, I like the first person shooters and they like Wii Sports) in one way or another.  Watching this system in action keeps us all entertained!

The WIImote is revolutionary!  No wires to tie you down!

The graphics are perfectly fine because once you get into the gaming experience they take a back seat to the controller.

My parents are in their 60's and were up till 3AM playing the WII!!!

Does anybody else's gaming system entice grandparents to stay up till 3AM?  Doubtful...

The hardcore gamer who is accustomed to his 700 dollar graphics card/cards in his gaming hotbox will scoff at the WII.  Rightly so!

As for me and my family, we prefer to have the whole family enjoy the system even if it keeps us up till 3AM!

author: GradGirl13
title: Wii Game Console
content: It was a little bit yellow in some places and needed a good cleaning, but overall it was great. It shipped to me much quicker than expected and I really appreciated that. For the price that I paid for it, it was perfect. All pieces were included with a few bonuses that I didn't expect (SD Card and Wii points), so it was absolutely worth the purchase!!

author: Just JR
title: Fun for the whole family
content: I purchased this for my kids as a christmas gift this year. After we have tried it out it is a lot of fun for my kids and my husband and I even enjoy playing it.  Its just not the typical sit down and play games type of gaming unit and that is why I really like it.

author: Mac4Life
title: Innovative and Fun System
content: Talk about a deal in video games! The Wii sets the tone for the "next generation" of games without really changing their graphical output. Instead Nintendo used innovation in the controller to take the same image quality to the next level. They filled a niche with this system that many didn't know existed. The Wii Sports game that came with the system is a lot of fun, although grows repetitive over time. I was quickly able to bring my Wii Fitness Age (a feature of the game) down below my actual age. The boxing, tennis and bowling are all excellently done. The baseball and the golf are inferior in my opinion, but they were free with the system so I won't complain. If you can find one, pick a Wii up, even if you have any of the other next-gen systems. This will only compliment it.

author: Anonymous
title: Wii
content: We love it.  We are not very tech saavy and usually have difficulty setting up things like this.  The instructions were easy to follow as far as hooking up to the TV but we did have some difficulty trying to figure out how to get it to work with the satellite dish connection on the TV.  Our satellite company help desk couldn't help us but we finally found a friend who knew what we needed to do to program the satellite remote control to get it to work.  So our problem was not with Wii but with the dish company.  The games are fun for adults and for kids and we are addicted.

author: A. Madrid
title: Wii Can all Have fun!
content:
I took the Wii with my family down to visit relatives for thanksgiving and everyone was hooked!  From the youngsters to the older folks, everyone found wii sports entertaining and fun if not close to cardio!

We also have Rayman and NFL2k7(that ones for dear old dad) both which make great use of the controllers.

My oldest daughters 9 and 6 really like the bowling and tennis and want me to now buy them Ant Bully.

If the software companies continue to put out innovative gaming experiences for the Wii I can see how this can be the beginning of change in how we play video games.

author: Anonymous
title: try it to believe it
content:
As many other reviews have provide perspectives from gamer's perspective. I'll just relate how my kids (and some of mine) responded to Wii.  One word: FUN. Kids loves it. The very first game they played was the Wii Sport boxing. You won't belive how they were "in" the game. They were boxing each other with an extra set of Remote and the Nunchuck, and they kept getting closer and closer to the TV, I was afraid they were going to punch the TV itself. First I put down some seat cushions on the floor and told them not to cross the "line of death." Didn't work. They kept punching and walking closer to the TV. Finally I had to laid myself down on the floor (not to block the sensor) to keep them from approaching the TV. Kids loved the play, using their arms with the remote, and unconsicously with their feet, too. It gave a good physical work out for the kids as well - big plus for me.

The remote opened a new dimension in game play. Don't be fooled by the saying the Wii is for the casual gamers, girls, or senior citizens.  Wii Sport and early games are just a beginning slavo - for people to get used to the new controls. IMHO, Nintendo's strategy is to hook the "casual" gamers first, and then push for the serious gamer later. Given the motion-sensitive Remote and the Nunc, you CAN create very sophisciated  games targeted for hardcore gamers. If the strategy work out well, Sony and Microsoft will have to come out with their motion-sensitive controls and follow suit - late in the game. Yes, graphics from PS3 and XBox are stunning, but game-play is/will be the King. Currently Wii may seem to target the "casual/young/senior/female" players. However, the Wii Remote technology CAN be used for games with game-play targeting the hardcore gamers. PS3 and XBox focus too much on technology and visual, Wii focues on human aspects of fun.  PS3 and XBox better have a strategy to counter Wii. There will always more people who will go for "Fun" than "Tech."

BTW, my 7 yr-old killed me in boxing. KO in 2nd round. I will switch the Remote I was using with hers. I think the 2nd Remote is somehow biased. Make sure you have a lot of rooms for the kids during play. They almost punched each other's fists.

author: Robert Pape
title: Wii

author: K.
title: Awesome!!!!!!
content: I never had so much fun in playing a video game console until I played the Wii. It is such a blast to play. My mother was even playing the Wii, and she doesn't play video games at all.  I highly suggest getting yourself one of these, you won't be upset nor will anyone else around you for that matter.

author: Peter A. Butzin
title: Great fun, although used less than I had anticipated.
content:
I bought this last Christmas for my wife, who I thought had hinted that she wanted one.

Well, it turns out that it was more for me than for her (although she loves bowling).

Set up is easy, and the unit is well designed. It fits in unobtrusively next to our large screen High Definition TV. The sound is also excellent with my high end, add-on TV sound system. I bought several accessories, including the Tiger Woods game (for my wife the golfer, albeit before his fall from grace. She refuses to play it for reasons of infidelity. Go figure!). I also bought the balance board and a couple of extra Wii controllers.

This is great fun, but I find that I don't use it very much. If I were younger (I'm 66.) and had a young family, or my grandchildren lived closer, I'd probably use it much more.

I also installed the free Netflix add-on (which requires a Netflix account to view movies via the Wii.) Although this works fine, be forewarned that the Wii is not HD. The picture quality is certainly good, but not High Definition. If you are interested in this use for the product, I'd stick with the HD Roku box. But then again, you're not buying the Wii to view movies:  that's just an additional benefit.

I've read positive reviews of the Microsoft product that has recently come out. It appears to take the Wii to the next level and may be the next big computer game hit.

Wii Sports and Wii Fit (that comes with the balance board) are fun, challenging and loaded with a variety of experiences.

author: Jaguar 90
title: Wii, the best thing since Sliced Bread
content: This thing is a wonder. I can see why everyone wants one. I can also see why everyone needs one. Has helped me lose 15 lbs and not even think I was doing any exercise to do it.

author: J. Woda
title: Who doesn't like a Wii?
content: My kids sure do.. I do. The dog would play it  if she could - hey is that the next generation ? So your dog can play along with you ??

author: James Pine
title: Still waiting for more killer games
content: I'm certainly not a hardcore gamer and by "killer games" I'm not talking about more Mario/Zelda/Metroid games. I'm looking for the next Wii Sports, though not necessarly a sports game. I've had a Wii for seven months now and Wii Sports is still by far the best game I've played. For example, Smooth Moves certainly utilizes the various motion sensors, but not in a "natural" way. Twighlight Princess is beautiful and complex, but I feel silly moving the the nunchuk left/right to do a spin attack and I wish the angle and movement of Link's sword was much more closely tied to that of the Wiimote. Games like Trauma Center and Cooking Mama seem to make good attempts at really using the capabilities of the Wiimote and nunchuk to provide a "new" gaming experience. I hope there are more to follow.

author: MPT
title: Great for family - don't hesitate
content: Great for my kids who are 8 and 10.  They sweat from all the jumping around during game play.  Graphics not near the xbox or ps3, but you are uying it to experience the game play, not just sit there.  I highly recommend this - but do keep in mind... there will be less family battles and injury if your room is big enough for the players to stand at arm lenght from each other.  Yes, we have had a few knocks to the head and each others arms during a fantastic game of tennis (with four players).  Buy it well before any big holiday - cause it will sell out.  Have fun.

author: kindred spirit
title: WOW~Amazing System. I was blown away how realistic this game is.
content:
I got to play Wii for the first time last night. We played tennis and bowling. Then Mario Kart. It is so realistic. I have never played tennis in real life but I caught on quick on wii.

I will say I actually worked up a sweat after and hour or so of playing the sports.

The Mario kart was a blast. Was just like driving a real car. I love the moo moo track. I did hit 2 cows but ended the last game in first place.

All I can say is this is just amazing and tons of fun. I cannot wait to play again.

author: Me
title: Great console at a great price
content: I haven't owned a console since Sega Genesis.  I heard a lot about the Wii and decided on faith to buy one, having never played before.  I definitely have been completely satisfied with the purchase.  I like being able to just turn on and start playing.  The price is also great, especially compared to the others.  I would definitely recommend a Wii to anyone.

author: Tommy
title: Best Christmas Present~~~
content: This was our family gift.  Our son who is in kindergarten wanted a game system since he's been playing at other households.  We've researched and found out that Nintendo is most kid's friendly system so Wii was the way to go.  It's very easy to set up on our tv and easy start up.  So far, we are having a blast as a family.  At first we thought that vibration on remote was annoying and found out there is an option function that we could turn that off. Everything is smooth and lovely and we are spending hours each night after dinner as a family game and excercise.  If you have little kids, Wii is the way to go.  Even my parents who are retired enjoy the games together with my son.  The whole family, regardless of the age could enjoy and have fun together.

author: Alfred Bourdelais
title: Buy a Wii
content: This product exceeded our expectations.  We are senior citizens, and had heard that the Wii was a good exercise platform.  We have mastered the bowling; are working on Golf; and Tennis comes next.  The game does what it advertises and gets you up and moving.  We bought a used one, and the seller was terrific, everything was as promised, and we saved a lot of money.  We have now purchased the Balance Board, and this too has exceeded our expectations, we can set goals, and can keep track of our progress.  I do not like to read instructions, and found the game to be sufficiently intuitive that I was able to set it up and use it with only minor consultation with the instruction manual.  If you are thinking about buying one go for it, you wont regret the decision, especially if you can find a good used one.

author: Dave R
title: Had my mind set on an Xbox 360, but the Wii has changed my mind
content:
For the longest time I've had my heart set on an Xbox 360. But when my girlfriend and I got a tip from a work friend that a local Target was receiving a shipment of Wiis, we decided to just go for it and see if we could get one. We got there only about half an hour early. There were only a total of three of us waiting for four Wiis so we had a fun time chatting and it was a very pleasant experience. When we were able to purchase our Wii, we also decided to get an extra remote + nunchuck.

It took very minimal time to set up. The only difficult part was getting the Wii to connect to my wireless network which is secured with WPA2 security. After a quick adjustment in my router's settings it was able to connect.

The unit is amazing. It is friendly (as the girlfriend often describes it,  'cute'), the controls take a little getting used to but it has been more fun than I could have ever imagined. Wii Sports is a blast and tennis is my personal favorite. My girlfriend loves boxing because frankly, she's gotten the hang of it and I haven't, yet. You can really have a workout just playing Wii Sports!

Now we've started to expand into the Virtual Console titles, Super Mario Bros, Mario Kart 64, Donkey Kong Country, which cost about $5-10 USD each. Of course you have to buy either the classic controllers or Gamecube controllers to play most of these games, but we're definitely getting our money's worth.

The Wii has been one of the best and most rewarding investments we've made in a while. It's a console to above all, have fun. And we do!

author: sofa king
title: Actual review
content:
Judging from the reviews I've just read I may be the first person to actually review the item (as opposed to the buying process).  So here we go:

I had a few concerns going into the purchase, but I loved the idea behind the wiimote so much that I was willing to buy one anyway.  Am I ever glad I did.  My two major concerns were (a) would the remote be responsive enough and (b) would I be able to play it with my projector- because I wouldn't be able to stand right in front of the screen- and play as well as a person with a traditional style television.  It turns out that the remote is incredibly responsive.  The games I've played so far have been great, and wii sports (which is just a simple little free demo) is great.  It's fun and it really makes you feel like you're part of the game.  The projector hasn't been a problem- the system can detect me at various places in the room.  Also, I think I should make a comment on the overall design; the console is small, sleek, and pretty enough to leave out on a shelf, and the remote is perfectly sized, weighted, and designed (the layout of the buttons).  I was surprised it fit my hand so well given that I'm over 6'2" and have fairly large hands, but it worked as well for me as it did for my 13 year old brother-in-law.

Which brings me to my final comment- my brother-in-law.  He went with me to pick up my system (because my wife didn't want to stay up late for the midnight release), but he made it very clear that he was a Sony guy.  He even argued with the people in the store when we were grabbing our wii.  Then something amazing happened- he actually played some of the games.  By the time he left a few hours ago he was saying "I gotta get this for Christmas."  If that doesn't tell you that this system is good, then I don't know what will.  Get one for yourself, you won't be disappointed.

author: Chris Thornton
title: Buy one
content: Love the wii

author: Blitz Patel
title: Best system of its generation
content:
Others say there isn't anything groundbreaking about it; I say that's completely wrong. The Wii is the only major system with motion-sensing technology. It's true, some games (mostly continuations of older series), don't take advantage of the new technology and can be played with a regular gamecube controller, but many are so unique to the system that X-Box 360 and PS3 games just seem like old news. The addition of the "nunchuck" also gives the Wii a new touch that makes it unique from the other systems. The fact that you have a wiimote in one hand and a nunchuck in the other gives all kinds of new opportunities for unique gaming experiences. The system can be set up in 5 minutes, it's so easy; wireless internet is a plus, but isn't required to play; a charger for the wiimotes is a good idea if you're buying this as a gift because they run on 2 AA batteries; another wiimote is a must (plus another nunchuck because it's tough to play with just one); the WiiSports game that's included is fun, but buying a game is a good idea, such as:
Super Smash Bros. Brawl
The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess
Super Mario Galaxy
which are games that any Wii-owner should have. As for the graphics, the games so far haven't boasted the best graphics but Nintendo is currently working on that, planning great visual effects in games in the near future. There is so much to come for this system, they're constantly coming up with new and unique games and accessories for it!

author: Metbull
title: We love the Wii!!!!!!
content: The Nintendo Wii does not disappoint.  In addition to the super fun motion Wii remote control, you also get a game (Wii Sports).  Plus, the Wii has a full Web browser and you can connect to the Internet for free.  I just downloaded Super Mario Brothers 3 for the original NES.  This thing rocks!

author: Joey Rivera
title: LOADS of FUN!!!
content:
We got this system in dec. 07 for our family. by march 08 just a few months later we had to send the wii in for repair because it was scratching our discs--and super mario galaxy now wont play at all. nintendo is very good at repairing the systems etc. so we sent it in and 6 days later we have our wii back. now the only problem i had with this is that the game was sent back with the scratches and still wont play. i am a bit upset about it, as its my kids favorite game. ok so here are the pros to the wii

pros: inexpensive gaming console
loads of fun to play
the sports game it comes with can keep you busy for hours, a few months later and we still play it together as a family.
good customer service

cons: the controller takes a while to get used to--but when you do get used to it, it is no longer a con but a pro--because this is the best setup ever.
games are a bit pricey but thats how all game systems are when they come out, make sure you try games before you buy or at least read many reviews as it really sucks to put out 50 bucks on a game that isnt good.
the batteries in the wii mote run out and you will have to have spare aa batteries on hand, to overcome this it is easier to get rechargeable batteries or the wiis charger and stand.
pay an extra 40 bucks per controller and 20 for nunchucks x3.

overall we love our wii, even though we had to send it in. but since we got it back, the games load tons faster than they did before.

if you register your wii on nintendo.com they extend your warranty by 3 months so instead of 1 year you will get 15 months. nintendo has excellent customer service but i highly recommend anyone who has a wii to register it so they will have their warranty in place just in case. also check your game discs often to make sure the system isnt messing up your games ie circular scratches. i am sending my game back in again to nintendo, and hopefully they will return it fixed or replaced. will update when this happens.

author: Maximum Verbosity
title: Pretty much the best thing we've ever bought
content: This is hands-down the coolest thing we've ever owned!  EVERYONE loves playing with the Wii, from our 4 year old all the way up to Mom & Dad.  I personally am amazed at the workout I get from playing tennis and boxing.  It was easy to set up and we were playing within minutes of taking it out of the box.  There is a learning curve for some of the games that mostly has to do with learning how to use the controllers.  But if you have a young kid in your house, just ask them because I guarantee they've already figured it out and will stand behind you while you're playing to tell you what you're doing wrong :P  We can't wait to add more games (we only have Wii Sports, which came with it, Mario vs Sonic Olympics which is a MAJOR workout and Ninjabread Man).  The box included the Wii console, one Wii Remote, one Wii Nunchuk, an adaptor to plug the console in to the power outlet, and some other important electronic stuff that I can't think of the names of right now.  It also included Wii Sports, which we all think is lots of fun as we can play tennis, golf, baseball, boxing, bowling, do a fitness challenge and there's even an area to practice the skills of all of those sports.  Each person can create their own "Mii" which is an entire separate review.  I'm now trying to figure out how to play "real time" with other friends who have Wii's that live across the country and in Europe.  We were able to snag one of these on amazon for the regular price (through some creative but perfectly legal and ethical methods), so even though we LOVE our Wii, I'd hold off on paying the over-inflated prices that resellers are offering to sell the Wii. And another cool thing?  If you have a gamecube, all of your gamecube games and the controllers work with the wii too!  We've even found that some of the games that wouldn't play on the gamecube any longer (because maybe someone wasn't CAREFUL about putting them away and they got roughed up a little) now work in the Wii.

author: Puppy Bunny
title: Wii is Golden
content:
I was eager, as so many others, to try out the Wiimote and Nunchuck in gameplay, but I questioned its effectiveness and its role in games. So far, the Wii has easily gone far beyond my expectations. Within hours of obtaining my Wii, I knew Nintendo had really struck gold here. Its one thing to say, "This game looks real," and quite another to state, "this feels real."

Wii Sports, which comes with the Wii, is the perfect way to introduce people to the Wii. This simplistic looking game can be overlooked, but I'm positive I, along with many others, will remember the first time they played Wii Sports, and that's really saying something. From the time you first swing your tennis racket (wiimote), to the time you throw your first jab or uppercut, you will be hooked, and you will comeback for more. I could go on and on about the Wii, but you truly have to experience it yourself. Whether you're playing Wii Sports, Madden, or Zelda, your experience will never be the same again.

However, Wii is meant to be enjoyed by multiple players. Pick up an extra Wiimote and Nunchuck when you purchase your Wii. Furthermore, make sure you have plenty of space to play and get ready for a workout.

title: Good for friends and family get together - When it works !!!
content:
Played for just 2 days and the Wii Game CD does not want to come out. When i searched teh internet i found so many people had the same issue. Since we liked the Wii, we decided to get a replacement unit. The replacement also had same issues as teh first one. But unlike the first one the second ejected the CDs after couple of tries.

Returning back for refund now.

Other things you might want to consider.

#1
By default you will get only composite output cable (1 Video + 2 Audio). The new LED TV i bought Sharp 46LE810UN just have only one composite input and i have also noticed that the 2010 model TVs are reducing their composite input and increasing the HDMI input. Though you can buy the Wii component cable (3 Video + 2 Audio) from the market, it is very disappointing to see that Wii does not have HDMI out by default.

#2
Would be better if the Wii has a hard power off switch. Not sure whether this is teh cause of the Game CDs get struck when left it in the console for a long time. Also, the weird thing is that if you do not completely shut off the Wii, the Game CD input CD blinks occasionally.

#3
Wish we could have a remote recharge option available from the console or as additional accessory.
