author: Matt
title: Great family console, short-lived fun
content:
Unlike all other gaming consoles, Nintendo Wii is made to be shared with family and friends.  And while most of the games are arcade-ish, they're entertaining for anybody who does not call himself a hardcore gamer.  If you're looking for realistic, movie-like graphics, get an Xbox 360 or a PS3.  But if you want a system that people of all ages will enjoy, get a Wii.

That said, there is also a downside to the Wii.

While the games are fun, many of them get old in a hurry.  With the exception of Mario Kart, which I'm pretty much up for playing at any time, the games I've purchased at the store have all been at least decent and I enjoy them for a week after purchase, but then they collect dust for months until I have interest in playing them again.  It would be acceptable if the games were less expensive, but dropping $40 on a game that grows old quickly is not a mistake a Wii gamer will make too many times.  I feel like I need a couple dozen games to keep me playing Wii every day.  And for that to happen, I would need to see most games at $15-20 and premium games like Madden NFL 10 at $30.

Many of the games you'd like to play online, such as Wii Sports (we all think we're the best at power bowling), are not available for online play.  There are hundreds of games to purchase online inexpensively (including classics like Super Mario Bros and Tecmo Bowl), but unfortunately there is no option to try before you buy and I've regretted buying every title except the classics mentioned above and Tetris Party (you can play Tetris online).

There are many benefits to having your Wii connected to the Internet (I use my wireless signal).  In addition to being able to play and buy many games online, you can also download: Nintendo Channel, which has video clips and lots of other valuable information if you're looking to buy Wii or DS games; the Everybody Votes Channel, where you pick an answer and predict the most popular answer (i.e., "Would you rather do dishes or laundry?"); Internet Channel, which allows you to browse the Internet; and you can check the news and your local weather forecast.

The Wii also seems to have the least negative feedback regarding console durability and performance of any gaming console on the market.  I'm knocking on wood with one hand while I type that I've had my console for nearly one year and I've had zero freezes or other issues.

While the Wii has its share of short-comings, the Wii is a great buy if you're looking for a family console.

author: Kaitlyn
title: Broken
content: This Wii doesn’t read discs

author: Ham on Wry
title: Soooo much fun!
content: I'm not a gamer; the last console I owned was an Intellivision. But, add me to the legions that are sold on the Wii. The controls just seem to make sense, even with very little practice. The games are fun, and it's a great alternative to watching writer-less TV. The Girlfriend and I realised quite soon after installing it that a second Wiimote and nunchuck are musts, even with the included Wii Sports. It gets tiresome to swap the Wiimote back and forth on games like Bowling, which moves pretty quickly. Graphics quality is quite good, if not up to the HD par of the PS3. I've had a few friends come over to play, one a father and not at all a gamer, and the other a gamer, PS2 and PS3 owner, and they both loved it. If you can find one, get it!

author: Lynn Doughty
title: Wii
content: Bowling is very good, tennis is tough, golf is ok, boxing is not very tough, but overall is very entertaining.

author: M. Cueto
title: Wii is the really next generation Console
content: I got today my Wii, and the controls are really amazing. Easy to use, and let you inmerse in the game in a new way. That is all what you need in a next Gen console...SOMETHING NEW, and is a good bet from Nintendo. This is my first Nintendo (except from a Gameboy). I do not have a xbox 360 or a PS3 (I have a xbox with more that 100 games and a Hi tec PC with similar number of games), but the other consoels is just better graphics. The Wii will have in short time, better and better new way of playing games, the future in gamming is comming, and it will be more near to a Wii, than near to the other systems. The wii come with other nice features like the Miis and the picture editor/visor.

author: G. Serra
title: Wii console
content:
I bought this console 6 days ago and I am really exited about it, along with two games to start playing with it, I already know system configurations and how this console works overall, I will focus my review on only the limitations I could notice so far:

*Channel switching: If you are reviewing games on the Wii Shop channel, you probably want to see a video review of the games you are interested in, you will have to go back to Home Menu and enter the Nintendo Channel (which is free for download). So switching back and forth from channels is slow, and you can't have more than one channel open (the one you are in). Including Wii games (which it is a channel itself) you can't suspend your games to quick check the weather update (for example), only games you can do that is on NES games which is obvious as it is the only way to save your progress.

*Wii Shop channel and Everybody's votes channel availability): If you live in a country currently not supported for these channels, prepare yourself for major disappointment. Even wii points card are for sell in my country, I must set the Wii in USA in order to enjoy all benefits of wii shop.

*Wi-Fi reach: I find this console to have a short range of wireless reception signal, my laptop is very close to where I have the console right now and it gets the wireless-g signal from my wireless router upstairs very good, I get a lot of connection problems with my Wii, sadly I can't help it because I can't move the TV from its current location, only solution is to move the router closer to the Wii, which I will try anytime soon.

Other than that, I am really exited about my shop and plan to buy more games and more controls as I become able to afford it.

author: K. O'Connor
title: Not another mom review!
content:
Yep, I am yet another mom who bought the Wii to get my son up off the couch.  And I am so glad that I did!  My 6 year old son loves the video game console, and there are plenty of games that he is able to navigate more or less on his own.

I read reviews of EVERYTHING before I buy and am more than grateful to the Amazon community for providing endless reviews on anything I might want.  BUT, I am so tired of reading "gamers" reviews of the Wii and criticizing the moms of Amazon for buying our kids the Wii.  I am thankful that we live in a world where video games are designed for KIDS too!

We love to play Wii sports together!  My son is sometimes physically tired before the game is even over, but always comes back for more!  I've even been playing tennis and boxing after he's in bed at night!  The workout is no exchange for riding bikes at the park or playing an actual game of baseball, and it certainly holds no candle to a trip to the gym.  But it does have that video game feel to it that keeps us coming back for more!

We have other games too.  We love the Wii-mote sensor controls!  It's so much more fun to swing the remote as a sword or flick it up to throw a ball than to simply press a button.  Well, for a mom and kid anyway.  Maybe not those hard core gamers out there!  ;)

An added bonus is that the Wii is compatible with GameCube games.  You just have to buy the gamecube controller.  We were able to purchase many used games at a much cheaper rate than any Wii game out there.

The Wii is a great addition to any family friendly home!

author: Mercedes
title: Not as described. Not all the pieces in the ...
content: Not as described.  Not all the  pieces in the set functioned. I had to replace the game disc and the nunchuck.  Oh well you get what you pay for.

author: ss3growntrunks
title: I love Nintendo
content:
I personally like Nintendo over its competition. Because of the franchises, and the fact that the failure rate for theirs systems are basically non existant.
I still have my NES, SNES, N64 and Gamecube in working condition. I know friend who are on their 2nd or 3rd PS3, and a friend in particular who has had 5 XBOX 360s.

I love nintendo franchises, especially Zelda, Mario and Metroid. But almost every Nintendo franchise it great and fun.

The wii is great, and I love it. I wouldn't trade it for the other systems combined.

author: Summer blessing
title: Five Stars
content: Super fast shipping!  Just as described. Thanks so much!

author: Amazon Customer
title: It was claimed to be in very good shape and I have to admit it has no ...
content: I'm very impressed with the wii console I purchased. It was claimed to be in very good shape and I have to admit it has no signs of being used at all.

author: myboy
title: good purchase
content: This was a replacement for my son. His baby brother. Broke original didn't want to pay full price for another Wii, works perfectly my son loves it as much as his first. Great deal for good price.

author: debbie amaral
title: wii works like new.
content:
This was an order that I was really hoping was good because it was for my grandkids, it came fast and was in excellent
working condition, the only thing I wish it had was the instructions, but I downloaded them.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Best system every
content: I got my Wii last night and I love it. My parents never let me have a nintendo when I was a kid, so I like video games but I'm not good at all the complicated button combinations for regular games. But the Wii was soooo much better! I actually beat my boyfriend at a game! I love it and I would recommend it to anyone I know, no matter how old or young. I can't wait to take it home over thanksgiving and see my parents play.

author: Jenna Heller
title: Five Stars
content: I gotta start using it

author: squallz
title: thank u
content:
fast shipping..*thumb up*
worked great..
smells good too X)
yet it needed some cleaning..after i did some it turned back like new ;)

but thanks alot RetroGames

author: Liza
title: Wii Fun
content:
What I like about the Wii console as mentioned by previous users is that there are a wide variety of games to choose from. It's best feature in my eyes is the fact that many of the games expect you to be more interactive, than your standard game where you sit and do nothing but become involved in a game.

I can see why hard core gamers may criticize the console, because they have high expectations from the other two systems out on the market. What makes the Wii unique is that it caters to both hard core games and those wanting a quick diversion. There are games to meet both type of users.

The different remotes and the physical interaction make this possibly one of the most unique systems out there. I know gamers may expect the high resolution pictures and intense gaming experiences, but if you're looking for something new, a console that allows for group players, or wish to experience the physical games such as Wii Sports and Wii Fit Plus, you will not be disappointed.

author: T. Whit
title: You gotta get a Wii!!!
content: We love our Wii!!!  I love it because our whole family can use it. You have to get off the couch and get active which is great.  I would not have even considered buying a gaming system before we tried the Wii. I like working out with the Wii fit.  My kids and Hubby like playing the  Wii sports. Warning!!! You will be sore the next day from the workout you didn't realize you were getting because its so much fun!

author: Gabrielle Perrottet
title: poor quality from the seller
content: I am astonished by how terrible this is!!! I ordered this wii for my senior community and after two months it stopped working!! We also only used it 5 times TOTAL!!!!

author: Andrew
title: Bringing the fun back
content:
After Nintendo's lukewarm Gamecube, they are back with the Wii. Gaming has become fun again. The Nintendo 64 was tagged "the fun machine," and it was the last truly fun system I owned until now. I don't need a DVD player, I have one. I don't need Blu Ray. I want a gaming system that I don't have to be a "hardcore gamer" to enjoy.

The Wii incorporates everything I loved about their previous systems into the Wii. Easy controls, good graphics (slightly better than the PS2 & Xbox), and unique features like the Miis, the weather channel, the virtual console, and last but not least the stunning "Wiimote" controller.

Dodge the gaming snobs who diss Nintendo and the overpriced, underperforming competitors and choose a system that will deliver the fun!

author: N. Edwards
title: i love it!
content: i love it because we can actually be active with the game instead of sitting on our butts playing a game were actually being active and having fun.. i will be buying alot of games for this game for christmas!

author: TheDragonInTheCenter
title: Five Stars
content: Works perfectly, came as described, and even had a couple of games downloaded on it.

author: I. D. Anderson
title: Nintendo Wii
content: I only gave it four stars because I haven't had enough time to play it. What I have done so far has been a blast. And the grandkids can't wait to come over now.

author: Tiffany
title: You know by now....
content: Of course, most of you know by now, that the Wii is great!! Sometimes, hard to come by but a great console. I made my purchase during the Christmas season and the order arrived on Christmas Eve, whew! My kids (12 and 2)absolutely love the interaction the game provides.

author: Colleen and Lonnie
title: We {heart} our Wii
content:
We are a family of four and everyone loves the Wii.  The 5 year old loves all the mini games.  The 11 year old enjoys that there are so many party games to play with her friends.  Daddy loves Tiger Woods and is looking forward to Madden!  Mommy loves the Virtual Console to play all the games I played as a kid!

The only drawback is the lack of sports games available.  If you are a sports game fanatic you are better off with an xbox 360.

author: sw
title: Family friendly
content: Yeah, yeah, yeah. Wii is the best! I do not think so. Let me say this, if you are a hardcore gamer then this system probably won't feel right. I have one and after 1 year am compeletly sick of it. The motion controls (let's be honest now) are not all that great. And the greatest dissapointment is Nintendo's inability to come out with quality games. They're fine for families and younger kids but when you want something a little more mature feeling Wii doesn't cut it. With over 50% of the games for Wii rated "E" this is really obvious. I just wish Nintendo could make it more appealing to older gamers.

author: Yan Bai
title: Gift just in time
content:
I was trying to find a Wii game console for my 11 year old for Christmas. I could not find the product in stock from several name brand store. One of my friends told me that they bought it from Amazon.com, indeed, I found it and purchased it without any problem and the product was deliveried to my house 2 days later.  I am very satistified with the service from Amzon.

Thanks!

author: Olozbal
title: Addictive
content:
I've got both an Xbox 360 and a Nintendo Wii and wanted to give some insight into the differences.

The Xbox is a professional deal, no doubt.  You can do all sorts of things like download movies (HD ones too), games, all sorts of things like that.  The graphics are insane and the games hard core.  So when I got a Wii recently it felt a lot like going back in time to the days when I owned a Nintendo 64.  The sophistication of this thing is that old.  They really put out a no frills model with the Wii.

On the other hand, they got it right.  When my brother and his two kids visited we found ourselves having a blast playing games. My brother worked  up a major sweat doing the boxing.  This is a great family console.  All I've played is the sports games on the demo disk but that's enough of a novelty that I'm satisfied.  The controller is a cool idea, it's not 100% precision but neither are the games.

Recommend getting this.  I had to get one on Ebay for 315 because they were sold out everywhere else.

author: artfairchild
title: Wii
content: Just what I wanted. Shipping was fast. ordering was simple. I recommend buying used equipment. I use the Wii to watch Net Flex and play games.

author: Miss Judy
title: NINTENDO WII
content: I received my order much sooner than expected and it was in perfect condition. I was so happy to be able to get this game as I had tried every store in the area with no luck. everything was there and we have had no problems at all. thank you so very much for being so reliable. I would order again with no hesitation.

author: Evan S. Nelson
title: Fun for the whole family and great controls
content:
The Nintendo Wii is great! While the graphics are not as good as the Xbox 360 or the PS3, game play and controls more than make up for it.  In my family, we cover the spectrum of gaming: from my brother and I, who have owned and/or played on almost every system since the original Nintendo, to my wife's grandmother and my in-laws who had never played a video game.  Everyone loved it!

The best feature is the sensitivity of the controls to movement, especially in games like Madden '08 Wii Sports.  A slight twist of the wrist, or a shake of the Wii remote or the nunchuck and the games respond like real life.  Beware though, you may have sore muscles you didn't know you had!

A few favorite games:

Madden '08 - Classic Madden game play combined with the controls of the Wii make this one hard to stay away from.  My brother had a hard time going back to the 360, in spite of better graphics because of the realism the controls add to the game.

Zelda - As opposed to some RPGs (role-playing games), Zelda seems to stretch on for a long time.  Even with a walkthrough guide, I would guess you would need to put in 30 hours minimum to beat the game. More realistically, it will take closer to 40-50 hours.  A dollar an hour seems well worth it to me.  Zelda combines the usual "fight the bad guy" stuff with some riddle-type puzzles throughout the game.  There are also hidden items throughout the map (bugs, treasure chests, secret caves, etc).

Super Mario Galaxy - This is the next great game in the Mario series.  It is the new, improved Super Mario 64.  As the name indicates, this one takes place in space (different planets are different levels).  It doesn't seem quite as difficult as the N64 version, but you will still put in a lot of time on this one.

author: Cody Jett
title: No Controllers or Cables
content: I got the Wii but no cables to plug it into th e Tv no cables for the Power and no sensor bar. Also no controller. How am I suposed to play it without power or a controller?

author: Xzavyr Rimpson
title: Wii is great
content: Wii works very well! Does what it was made for. I recommend buying if you’re into retro games from 2006 - 2010!

author: Anonymous
title: Cannot turn on
content: The wii itself is good quality, as stated by the seller. Only a few tiny scratches on the front, otherwise it looks good as new. However, the controller I received had the wrist strap broken off and when I plugged in the whole system it turns on but then I cannot click anything on the remote. I’m not sure if the remote or the sensor is defective. The remote lights up when batteries are put in so it doesn’t seem to be the remote...most likely will be returning for a refund

author: Nikki66RQS
title: Met Expectations and More!
content: This definitely met my high expectations and more!  I am so amazed at all the games that can be purchased with it and what they accomplish.  It's for a range of ages - which is very helpful for parents with small children and for adults.  This gets my kids off the couch and they want to play!

author: James A. Nichols
title: Wii Rocks
content: I recieved this as a Christmas present and feel in love instantly with it.  I know the graphics arent upto what the 360 or PS3 are but they are still great.  What you get this for is the wireless play of the games.  I love the sports game(has 5 games boxing, tennis, baseball, golf, and bowling)that comes with this and it is easy to learn.  It makes you really think you are playin the game.  I also like the controller and nunchuk they are both user friendly. This is a real family friendly device and has great family games whereas the other two devices (360 and PS3). You get a great workout from the sports games they require some movement and really get the heart pumping(especially the boxing).

author: S. Bidwell
title: Simply Amazing
content: My friends and i waited for one on Sunday morning for hours in the bitter cold. we were so tired waiting and when we finally got the system we were so excited and no longer tire. we rushed home with it and three games; redsteel, excite truck, and call of duty 3. we popped in wii sports. all i can say simply amazing, it is truly next-gen. the controller takes time to get used to but its so much fun after you get the hang of it. We didn't sleep till 5 Sunday night after being up for more then 30 hours. its hours of entertainment that get everybody involved even my mom tried to play it. great system for everybody. cant wait to try the other games today.

author: Trurl
title: Not Impressed with Wii Remote
content:
Nintendo has made a mistake on not improving the graphics and processing capability in the Wii. However we haven't seen any groundbreaking games that change the game play experience in any of the new, next generation systems. Nintendo is betting that the change won't be graphical but instead based on new peripherals such as the motion sensing Wii remote.

This remote shows ingenuity, but is not as impressive as one would think. It doesn't seem that the Wii Remote senses true 3d motion. What is meant by that (Check my Amazon profile because I discuss it on my website.) is when you swing it doesn't record the 3d position of your arm, instead it just records the swing as a slash motion in most games. That is so that when you swing you sword in Zelda: Twilight Princess the character (Link) just swings his sword. It is not like you are involved in a 3d sword battle. FPS shooters are another area where a standard controller is needed. It is too difficult to navigate the area.

The system does has its strengths. It is the best system for kids. It is the cheapest system. And Nintendo is known for making some of the best games. But for sports, online, and FPS games the X-box 360 is the better choice.

author: Min. P
title: Family Entertainment
content: If you are looking for something to have a good time with your children with then this is the game to have.  My 6 yr old grandson loves the boxing and bowling from the game that comes with the wii.  Lots of family entertainment.

author: Jerry H
title: Pretty good system
content: When the wii first came out I thought it was a piece of crap. After my sister got one this past christmas I began to play hers and that made me want to get one. I only have two games for it right now (mario galaxy and star wars the force unleashed) I would highly recommend this system for casual and hardcore gamers alike. But what I like most is that you can download classic games from previous nintendo systems all the way to the nes.

author: Amazon Customer
title: ... - Buyer refunded me but to say I was disappointed was an understatement
content: Game got stuck and I couldn't get it  - Buyer refunded me but to say I was disappointed was an understatement

author: Enulka
title: packed nicely, on time
content:
We bought it to exchange our bricked wii. It was clean, packed nicely, on time.
Still working well and kids are happy.

author: Cole Smith
title: One Star
content: $749 for a Nintendo Wii. are you retarded?

author: Jason Bru
title: Five Stars
content: good deal

author: F. Rose
title: Awesome Wiiiiiiiiiiii
content: My family is really enjoying the Wii. They play it just about everyday. I broke my leg just a couple days after I ordered it, so I haven't played it as much as I'd like, but as soon as I can move around more, I definitely will.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The WII console will not work. I have only ...
content: The WII console will not work.  I have only used it a few times and today it won't turn on.  Is there a warranty?

author: Southern Food Junkie
title: Kids love it. This is a great console for kids
content: Kids love it. This is a great console for kids. We love having family bowling night. Was packaged very nice.

author: B. Parker
title: Great Group System
content:
Not to really deviate off the main opinion of the system, I must say that my family really has a blast playing the Wii.  The more people, the merrier.  The best games I've played so far have been group/party games (Wii Sports, Party Games) and driving games (Need for Speed).  I've not been overly thrilled with the games available, though.  I'm pretty dissapointed most every time I rent a game.  Seems only 1 out of 4 are fun.

The system also povides good excercise.  Really helps prevent the normal lazy gaming style (lounging around on the couch all day).  I actually work up a sweat every time I play tennis!

Fun system, average games.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Worth Every Penny...But I Wish the Remote Worked Better
content:
I'm a PC gamer and the Wii is the first game console I've ever owned.  It's an awesome machine.  When I first started it up I plopped on the couch, expecting to be all comfy and lazy while I played.  Well, that didn't last long!  Nearly every game I have for the Wii requires me to stand up and move.

The only bad thing to say about it is that the remote doesn't detect movement in REAL 3d space.  I figured out that I could pitch a ball by swinging my arm backwards instead of forwards.  There's several other games with similiar little glitches like that.

Overall, however, the Wii is great fun.  Even if the sensor bar confuses my motions, the fact that the Wii forces me to move makes me love it.

author: D P Cerrito
title: The Great Wii
content:
Wii has got the be the most fun party system. Whenever we have guests over to the house it is in constant use. From Wii Sports, to Wii Play, to Mario Party, to Bomberman downloaded from the Virtual Console.

It's great for birthday parties, Thanksgiving, and other times you get together with friends. It just kind of draws a crowd.

There are also a lot of fun single player games as well such as Zelda, Paper Mario, Metroid, etc.

If you want a system for Group fun. We have both a Wii and a XBOX 360. The perfect combo for all range of games.

If I were to just have one though, it would be the Wii due to the fact I do not have the time to play a lot of video games and I usually play with friends when they come over. Though online play with friends is great with the XBOX 360, I'm more of the type of guy who enjoys seeing the face of the person I am beating at tennis.

author: buying4fun
title: Love the Wii!!!!!
content: Just have to say that I finally broke down and bought a Wii.  I bought one of the original XBox consoles about 9 years ago and it was great but I haven't updated to anything new until now.  I am so happy that I purchased the Wii instead of the XBox 360.  The Wii is very family oriented and my 7 year old loves it.  It's a great game system for the 2 of us to play together.  I love the fact that every game is so interactive.  You don't just sit on the couch and play mindlessly.  You are actually involved in every game.  I just love getting up and moving and being part of everything.  I would definitely recommend this game system to anybody who is looking for fun and great graphics.

author: Suzanne A. Matheson
title: Lots of Fun
content: I purchased this game for my 26 year-old-son and he opened it like a kid in a candy store with great excitement.  Later we took it to our family Christmas gathering and everyone took turns bowling and playing tennis and it was wonderful.  Everyone laughed and took turns playing.  It was a great gift and enjoyed by all - no matter what age.  Adults and children will love to interact alone or together with this game.  Highly recommend.

author: Marilyn Monclova
title: necessary for Just Dance
content: I do not play video games but needed this for Just Dance game that I enjoyed at my son"s house with the grandchildren.

author: Dale W. Rogers
title: Two Words...Simply Awesome!!!!
content: I got our Wii as a Christmas Present for the whole family, I had seen the commercials and read the reviews. Niether of which do this System any justice whatsoever. From the first game we played on Christmas morning my family has been in love with the Wii!!! I hadn't been interested in even touching a video game since I had a Sega Genesis many years ago. Yesterday I spent about three hours playing Wii Sports by myself. The kids have played all the other systems and we do own a PS2 and an Xbox, but my wife and I, and even my Dad(who's in his 60's)have had a blast playing the Wii. The controllers are super simple, for example, to play Tennis on Wii Sports all you have to do is swing the remote. Can it get any easier to play a video game? For the more adventurous, you can learn how to move the controller to change the way you swing, or learn to serve an Ace by hitting the ball just right. We also purchased several other games to go with our system. All of them just as fun, and all unique in their style of play. The Wii is simply unlike any other video game ever made. I do feel that having a full complement of 4 Wii Remotes and 4 Nunchuks, while expensive, is a must for a family to fully enjoy this wonder. Every game we have played has filled our living room with infectious laughter and absolute excitement. I recommend this system for anyone who longs to have that old fashioned "Family Game Night" with a 21st Century twist. Our family hasn't hung out together like this EVER!! No matter what the kids say, skip the expensive Xbox 360 and PS3 and Go Wii. Connecting the Wii to the Internet is wireless, all you need is a wireless router and follow the connection instructions, and unlike Xbox and PS3 the internet on the Wii is free. I could go on and on, but I'm sure you probably want to get on with purchasing your own Wii at this point. Happy gaming!!!!

author: Edward Balen
title: Nintendo Wii -- Nintendo platform for the new millennium and beyond
content:
I've had and played with both Nintendo Entertainment System and Super NES, but neither of them compare to the excitement and functionality of the Wii.

I have about ten titles for the Nintendo Wii, including Rock Band and Guitar Hero III.  I landed Guitar Hero for Easter, and landed Rock Band for my 39th Birthday.

I feel that the Wii is simply amazing and fun.  The arcade quality graphics and sound are incomparable to earlier Nintendo platforms.  Goodbye plastic cartridges, hello CD-ROM disks.

If you have the money and the hunger to move ahead into the world of the Wii, buy one.  We all need a Wii somewhere in our lives.

author: R. Tadlock
title: Wii Sports
content: I am extremely pleased with the game console and the game.  I bought this product for my daughter who had a stroke two years ago which left her mostly paralized on her left side.  I saw the commercials for this product and thought it might be something she could enjoy.  Boy, was I right!  The one-handed controller is wonderful.  I only wish there were more games which only require the remote rather than a combination of the remote and the nunchuck.  This product is a great therapy for depression.

author: Kurupt
title: Alll video game no filler
content: I love the playstation and the xbox but I think Nintendo is a little better because they focus on the issue at hand, THE VIDEO GAME.  Nintendo will make sure that you get a great system, awesome graphics, and most importantly it is affordable. Due to the fact the system is just a video game and doesn't have a dvd player, or the other fancy things the other systems have, helps to keep the system affordable to those that can't drop $600 to $800 for one of the other systems. There are a few good titles that the wii has now, like Zelda, and Red steel. Once more games are released this system is going to be even better. It is kind of weird getting used to the new controllers, but once you do the games are a blast.

author: Nikhil R. Bhandari
title: Amazing Game
content: I am loving it. It is truly an amazing gaming expereince. It also helps you to move your body around and feels like you are on the field and playing the game.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: Worked perfectly

author: J. C.
title: excellent game console
content: This is the easiest game console to operate.  We love Guitar Hero and play practically every day.  We also have the Wii Fit Plus and I even have to throw my grandparents out of my room at night so I can get some sleep. We have ordered the Mariocart game and 3 wheels so we can all play at the same time.  We have had it for 2 months and we are nowhere near tired of it!!

author: I. J. Harrison
title: Wii, in a league of its own.
content:
1: Yes the graphics are not as great as a 360 or PS3, but they never claimed to be.

2:  Fully functioning interaction.  Just play Tiger Woods 07 or Madden 07 and you will see what I am talking about.

3:  For everyone.  This system is good for everyone.  My wife hates video games, but surprisingly she loves Wii-sports bowling.

4:  Games are cheaper and the console itself is a bargain.

5.  The Virtual Console is packed full of awesome old time favorites.  I just downloaded Bonk's Adventure, Kirby, and Shockman the other day from the Wii shopping channel.  (you have to pay for them)

5:  If you are a hardcore gamer get a PS3 or 360.  If you are looking from something imaginative and fun for everyone one to play and your on a budget get a Wii.

I love mine, but I also have a 360 for those hard core titles like Gears of War.  Both together still cost me less than a PS3.

6.  Lastly, if you get a Wii, go a head and at least purchase the virtual console controller and the wireless connection thumb drive.  You definitely need to go on line with it to get all the channels and updates.

author: Stephen Curran
title: Innovative and priced to move!!!
content:
For [...], it is the best buy out there. You are not going to be disappointed. If you were an Avid PS2 or Xbox player, and your picky about graphics ,frame rate and how realistic it looks when something  blows up...then you might want to consider the Wii as a second system.
I own 19 games for the Wii... and so far have played only a handful ( I am a addict...I have to buy the latest titles...its stupid, but then its a lot cheeper than some of the toys my peers are buying, so my wife puts up with it...)
I am being honest with you, few games are as good as they could be...but I know that the best games are always the last 2 years of the systems life..
The Wii controls are great, but it really depends on how well the game developer incorperates them into the game.  Zelda is very nice...Blazing Angels is good...Excite Truck is very cool!
If you are upset because you cannot find a Wii yet...don't worry...the best games have not even hit the shelves.
I am not going to go over how fun it is and all the hype, because, its been said before...Yes, its a new experience and Non-Games Love it...but the truth is, I am still playing my GameCube more that my Wii...
And the reason is because the greatest games for the gamecube are selling for 1/3rd the price that they originally were..and these games are the best that the game cube can handle... Once there are some more mature games on the market, I am sure that I'll be useing the Wii more than my Gamecube.

Warnings:
Cooking Momma for the Wii-- Don't bother -They did not bother to get someone to translate effectively...the result? If you do something that Cooking Momma likes...she says "Good, not mine!" What does that mean????
MY wife is Japanese and a translator...she even admits that they should not have released it without a proper translation.
VVVONDERfool!

Marvel Aliance -I would pass, its not really good or bad, but nothing is amazing as far as using the Wii controls...etc.

SuperMonkey Ball..Not a bad game ..but not as good as the gamecube version...

Wear your safety Straps....its not an option to play without it!

Titles to watch for this year:
Mario Party 8
Metroid Prime
Super Smash Brawl
Resident Evil 4

author: Lavon Owens
title: Open before your special day
content: There was no power cord or controllers very sad to open the box this morning and have missing things

author: David Goodman
title: Good Product
content: We were using This product almost every day and it is working without any problem. Thank you very much and have nice day.

author: Philip Perry
title: Really a Great System for the whole family !!
content: I was skeptical about purchasing a Wii at first , but after it arrived and we hooked it up and tried a few of the games i found the experience to be really fun . The Wii controllers are awesome , and easy to use for anyone . If you have children , they will love playing this system . It is a Great System for the whole family . I am an adult , and i enjoy playing it with my kids . Awesome system for a Good price !

author: A. Ness
title: I love the Wii!!!
content: Okay, I looked long and hard for this game system and it was so worth it!  I'm not a video game fan, but our whole family has a blast with this.  I love that it has internal memory, and that it makes you get off your butt to play!  I can justify letting my boys play by saying that they are at least being active!  The wii is totally worth the money and the effort put in to getting your hands on one!  The only thing I do not like is that the remotes are pretty pricey and you only get one with the game system.  AND rechargable batteries are a must!!!

author: D. nieto
title: Atari  2600 repeating itself???
content: I'll try to keep this short.  If Nintendo would clamp down and prevent bad games from being published I would have more respect for this console.  I own a Wii and a PS3.  The novelty of the motion controller wears off and both 360 and ps3 have one coming.  A game doesn't have to have the best graphics (Zelda) to be good and it is way too far between a Galaxy or Zelda.  I barely touch the Wii and even though I don't own one, I would recommend someone by an Xbox 360 over a Wii if they want to get more value for their money. A lot of people weren't around when the 2600 came out.... and left.  Look up rhe wiki entry of shovelware. Nintendo needs to learn from Atari.  We study history so we don't repeat it.

author: R. Horsley
title: I am a Wii Convert!!!
content:
Wasn't really interested when the Wii first came out, kind of thought it was going to be like GameCube and only for kids.  Let's face it, after Playstation 1 came out, I never thought I'd own a video game console made by any other company except Sony.  But then, Sony had to go and turn its back on people who have been supporting it for so long,focusing more on keeping up with its competiton (Microsoft)than it did on making its loyal customers happy. First by charging the rediculous price for its PS3 console, and second by not realizing that people who had PS1's all those years ago have grown up, gotten jobs, had families, and now play games mostly for recreation. We do not have the time to get killed 55 times while trying to complete a single level, nor do many of us have the inclination to play on-line with a bunch of kids who have nothing else to do in their day than play Resistance Fall of man, and who obliterate us the second we come on-line. Not to mention that when my three year-old is awake I don't like to him to see the ultra-realistic violence possible on newer systems. What ever happened to all the fun games, with quick levels that were not so easy as to be childish but were definitely achievable?  Oh, wait.... I know...they are on the Nintendo Wii!! Just got mine last night and also got Wii Play and Bust a Move and they are a blast!!  No, the graphics may not be as pretty as XBox 360 or PS3, but the cost is far more reasonable and the games are very fun.  Some of the games on Wii Play are a little strange, but they all demonstrate the capabilities of the WiiMote and most of all Wii brings the fun back into video games!
  Although I completely agree the WiiMote is VERY strange at first, it doesn't take long to get used to it.  The Wii provides helpful hints to get you started playing right away.  I am already hooked on Wii Tennis. And I even worked up a sweat, which was a unique experience whilst playing video games.  I can see that at least my right arm will be super-buff after about 6 weeks of Wii Tennis. :)
  Overall, if your entire life revolves around video games, the Wii may not be exactly what you're looking for.  But if you just play games to have a little fun and unwind after a long day, or have a family that likes to spend time playing together, the Wii may be just what you're looking for! Highly reccommended!!!

author: Bobs sis
title: Monopoly
content: We purchased Wii two years ago. We use it so much that it just finally wouldn't play anymore. That's when we ordered another one from Amazon. Couldn't let a day pass without Wii!!. We had been playing the "sports" cd, but thought we'd try something different. We got the game of Monopoly. Mindless.Needing only a hand to play. We were skeptical, but pressed on. What the game lacks phyically, it makes up for emotionally. I have to have Boardwalk. Oh, oh, my opponent just put houses on his property. And then, there's this little man who runs around the board letting all the players know what's happening and ad-libing about the actions of the players. Like, if you want to trade with another player, he states how exciting that is for him. It's a fun, addictive game. A game for the family. I admit it doesn't take alot to keep me amused, but remember the word "mindless". For me. 4 out of 5 stars.

author: Bookmarked055
title: Great Deal!
content: Great price and sturdy packaging! Works Fantastic!!

author: shauna crossman
title: Four Stars
content: great

author: Susan K. Schoonover
title: Lives Up To The Hype
content: As a middle aged mom I have to admit to being very impressed with the Wii. It allows the player to be much more physically and mentally active than any other system to date.  If you can only buy one gaming system Wii is the best choice for your family and well worth both the price and the effort you may have to put in to locating one.

author: S. Arrieta
title: Greatest Gift for my Grandkids
content:
This is the best family interactive game.  We celebrated our Christmas last night with all family members participating and the game cost $$ but the time, fun. excitement and memories were PRICELESS.

Good Quality Family Time.

author: Christian Reader
title: Best Console Player!
content: It has been a while since I have owned a game system, I can say the Wii was pleasure to play. I love it so does my wife. Grace and Peace.

author: Susie
title: Sports Maniac
content:
Before I was diagnosed with M.S. in 1977 I was an all around athlete. I pitched a mean fast ball in softball, was a rover in basketball (girl's); played tennis at least once a week and bowled for fun.  Well, now I can do the sports I loved thanks to my wii.  I am now healthier and happier.  Can't wait to buy more games.

The other cool thing?  I can watch instant play Netflix movies on my T.V.  Woo Hoo!

author: Christine Pagels
title: Lives up to the hype
content:
My husband and I have a 2-year-old, a 4-year-old, and an 8-year-old.

Three days ago we were in (insert retail store name here) and we saw it...The gleaming white box behind the glass...It was...WII!!!

Like so many others, we had been scouring the aisles of every store that carries it since last November and finally we reaped our reward. I think that's the only way to get it; just randomly.

Anyway, we happily took it home, brimming with the highest of expectations, and the Wii delivered!!

The Wii is truly a console for the whole family. Even our (VERY) easily frustrated four-year-old was bowling and pitching baseballs like a pro within minutes of hooking it up. That's not to say it isn't fun and challenging for parents, too. It is. In fact, I don't think the thing has been off for longer than 10 or so hours since we brought it home! We only have the Wii Sports and the one remote at the moment, but we have a second remote and a few games on order now.

author: Michelle S. Ballard
title: Love the wii Game
content: I love the wii game system.  It is easy to use and fun.  I bought it especially for the wii Fit and wii Fit Plus and love it.  Having fun while exercising in the comfort of my home.  I also love the wii Sports Resort.

author: N. Jennings
title: This is soooo much fun!
content: I searched and searched for a Wii (at retail price) for months before landing one from Amazon. This is so much fun! I tend to get fatigued when playing traditional controller systems, but the Wii-mote and the different games are so addicting, my Wii keeps telling me which button to push to take a break :) Ok, so my arm is a little sore today after a marathon session yesterday, but it is a GOOD sore. I like how I am up off the couch!

author: B. Landers
title: Easy to setup
content: I think by now everyone understands the concept of Wii and if you are the type of person to enjoy this gaming system or not. My family and I are very active so this is an excellent product and a good way to stay active in the winter. I really like how easy this product was to setup! Very easy to follow step by step instructions with pictures and information on what to avoid to increase the accuracy of how your system communicates to the remote controls. I'm not always technologically savy and tend to get frustrated easily when products don't work right away but this system set up quickly and easily and worked the first time!!

author: Michael West
title: Fun for all ages
content: With over 1900 reviews there isn't much more to be said.  Lots of fun for the whole family.  Be sure to order a least one more remote as the Wii only comes with one.  Easy to set up.  Has wireless capability so you can access thee Internet from your wii.

author: A. Keyser
title: The Wii is fun for everyone.
content: Most of my friends and I are not "gamers," but we've all been able to find something fun about the Wii.  That what I like about it so much, I'm not wasting my time trying to memorize which buttons do what, I just just play some fun games.  It's quite intuitive.

author: marsha davis
title: Noo!
content: Why did wii have to stop I think Nintendo is making a HUGE mistake a lot of people still play wii and they arent even making it anymore i play games on their that I can get on any other device people are not going to buy a hole new console like the wii u just to be replaced by who knows what!

author: Pablo
title: Five Stars
content: Excellent!!

author: Bargin huntr
title: All that.....and more!
content: This game truly captures everyone from toddler to adult/senior...Got the whole family testing their fitness levels in the training of the Sports game that was packaged with the Wii.  Makes getting some exercise fun for the whole family.  Also played some trivia games with pre-teens and 40 somethings. Played as competitors and as teams. What a blast!  Not sure who was more intense, the younger or older set.  Been quite a while since I've seen friends/family this excited about a game or an exercise program.  Looks like Nintendo hit this one out of the park!

author: Ilisa Da Silva
title: Five Stars
content: Excellent

author: BG
title: works but condition was over stated
content:
Product worked as advertised it seems that the product was in a smokers house as most of the white was stained and it appears the product
only received a quick cleaning.  It was advertised as used - very good but at best I'd rate it as acceptable

author: Tracy
title: Not just a "gaming system"
content:
Wow!  This is probably the best purchase I ever made.
  For the last two years on new years eve, I watched my boyfriend and my brother play on my brother's Wii system.  I thought it was a nice game system.  He brought some fun kids games and some interesting sports games. It was so funny watching them sweat while playing games against eachother.  I used to play tennis, so I tried it for a while.  I really felt like I was on the tennis court, my arms were sore within an hour.  Then I realized this game unit had the capability to be used as an exercise machine.
  I asked my brother to borrow the Wii again for a week, but this time with the Fit Board.  I decided to try working out before bedtime three times per week for 30 minutes.  I really felt the exercise in all of my muscles as if I had been to the gym or had been working out with a personal trainer.  I decided right then and there I just had to have my own Wii.
  I purchased it and have been using it for the first two months of this year at least 6 days per week for 30 minutes to an hour.  Because it feels like a game, and not exercise, it was much easier for me to get motivated to work out.  Then I started working out right after work before dinner.  So far I have lost... 16 pounds in two months.  This motivated me to start eating right again and I haven't felt this good since I was 18 and didn't need to exercise.  At 37 years old, I never thought I could touch my toes again and feel this flexible.
  Again... This is the best purchase I ever made.  I would recommend this to anyone who wants to feel fit and doesn't think they can exercise.  I had a back injury a few years ago and didn't think I would ever be able to exercise again.  There was no way I could do sit-ups.  I have been amazed that a "game console" could help me.

** As for the people who gave this system negative ratings because the Wii told them they were obese... get over it.  We all know we need to lose weight.  There are exercises for beginers and advanced users alike.  I am looking forward to using this everyday.  When I see my weight going down, it makes me feel so good.  Soon I will be able to fit into the clothes in the back of my closet.  I love this!!!

author: Ken Obi
title: Five Stars
content: Bought as a replacement console for the kids, it has operated smoothly and reliably since it's acquisition.
